name: PP7435_Chr1-0001
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: XUT5
description: Putative xylose transporter, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis XUT5

name: PP7435_Chr1-0003
description: Protein with low similarity to phytanoyl- dioxygenases

name: PP7435_Chr1-0004
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0005
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0006
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: GAL4-like Zn2Cys6 binuclear cluster DNA-binding domain and fungal_TF_MHR (fungal transcription factor regulatory middle homology region))

name: GTH1
description: Pichia pastoris high affinity glucose transporter, similar to Kluyveromyces lactis HGT1, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-0008
description: Protein with low similarity to isochorismatase family hydrolase, enriched in cytosol

name: FMO1-1
description: Flavin-containing monooxygenase, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cytosolic side of the ER membrane, catalyzes oxidation of biological thiols to maintain the ER redox buffer ratio for correct folding of disulfide-bonded proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0010
description: Protein with low similarity to putative transcriptional regulatory proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0011
description: Protein with low similarity to short-chain dehydrogenase dehydrogenases

name: YCT1
description: High-affinity cysteine-specific transporter with similarity to the Dal5p family of transporters, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER and YCT1 is not an essential gene

name: PP7435_Chr1-0013
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Zn2Cys6 binuclear cluster DNA-binding domain)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0014
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0015
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: KAP104
description: Transportin or cytosolic karyopherin beta 2, functions in the rg-nuclear localization signal-mediated nuclear import/reimport of mRNA-binding proteins Nab2p and Hrp1p, regulates asymmetric protein synthesis in daughter cells during mitosis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: DAL1
description: Allantoinase, converts allantoin to allantoate in the first step of allantoin degradation, expression in S. cerevisiae sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression

name: UGA2
description: Succinate semialdehyde dehydrogenase involved in the utilization of gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA) as a nitrogen source, part of the 4-aminobutyrate and glutamate degradation pathways, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, localized in S. cerevisiae to the cytoplasm

name: RAD57
description: Protein that stimulates strand exchange by stabilizing the binding of Rad51p to single-stranded DNA, involved in the recombinational repair of double-strand breaks in DNA during vegetative growth and meiosis, forms heterodimer with Rad55p

name: MAF1
description: Highly conserved negative regulator of RNA polymerase III, binds to the N-terminal domain of the Rpc160p subunit of Pol III to prevent closed-complex formation, localization and activity in S. cerevisiae are regulated by phosphorylation, mediated by TORC1, protein kinase A, and Sch9p, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein during vegetative growth which translocates to the nucleus and nucleolus under stress conditions

name: PHM7
description: Protein of unknown function, expression is regulated by phosphate levels, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery and vacuole and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: IPP1
description: Cytoplasmic inorganic pyrophosphatase (PPase), homodimer that catalyzes the rapid exchange of oxygens from Pi with water, enriched in cytosol, highly expressed and essential in S. cerevisiae for viability, active-site residues show identity to those from E. coli Ppase

name: TRP1
description: Phosphoribosylanthranilate isomerase that catalyzes the third step in tryptophan biosynthesis, in 2004, the sequence of TRP1 from strain S228C was updated by changing the previously annotated internal STOP (TAA) to serine (TCA)

name: RFC4
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C), which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: VPS52
description: Component of the GARP (Golgi-associated retrograde protein) complex, Vps51p-Vps52p-Vps53p-Vps54p, which is required for the recycling of proteins from endosomes to the late Golgi, involved in localization of actin and chitin

name: TAX4
description: EH domain-containing protein, involved in regulating phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate levels and autophagy, Irs4p and Tax4p bind and activate the PtdIns phosphatase Inp51p, Irs4p and Tax4p are involved in localizing Atg17p to the PAS, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog IRS4

name: HMT1
description: SAM-dependent mono- and asymmetric arginine dimethylating methyltransferase, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that modifies hnRNPs, including Npl3p and Hrp1p, affecting their activity and nuclear export, methylates U1 snRNP protein Snp1p and ribosomal protein Rps2p, interacts genetically with genes encoding components of Rpd3(L) and this interaction is important for Rpd3 recruitment to the subtelomeric region

name: RPL4A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L4A, N-terminally acetylated, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L4 and bacterial L4, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL4B

name: GLC3
description: Glycogen branching enzyme, involved in glycogen accumulation, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern and relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: GSM1
description: Putative zinc cluster protein of unknown function, proposed to be involved in the regulation of energy metabolism, based on patterns of expression in S. cerevisiae and sequence analysis

name: SET3
description: Defining member of the SET3 histone deacetylase complex which is a meiosis-specific repressor of sporulation genes, necessary for efficient transcription by RNAPII, one of two yeast proteins that contains both SET and PHD domains, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SET4

name: PAM16
description: Subunit of the import motor (PAM complex), the PAM complex is a component of the Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex), forms a 1:1 subcomplex with Pam18p and inhibits its cochaperone activity, contains a J-like domain, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-0033
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Zinc finger and cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor, YTH1)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0034
description: Protein with similarity to YKR023W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: IME2
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase involved in activation of meiosis, associates with Ime1p and mediates its stability, activates Ndt80p, IME2 expression in S. cerevisiae is positively regulated by Ime1p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0036
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: PRM10-2
description: Pheromone-regulated protein, proposed to be involved in mating, predicted to have 5 transmembrane segments, induced in S. cerevisiae by treatment with 8-methoxypsoralen and UVA irradiation

name: PRM10-1
description: Pheromone-regulated protein, proposed to be involved in mating, predicted to have 5 transmembrane segments, induced in S. cerevisiae by treatment with 8-methoxypsoralen and UVA irradiation

name: SCP160
description: RNA-binding G protein effector of mating response pathway, enriched in cytosol, essential in S. cerevisiae where it is mainly associated with nuclear envelope and ER, interacts in mRNA-dependent manner with translating ribosomes via multiple KH domains, similar to vertebrate vigilins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0040
description: Protein with similarity to YFR016C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and bud, interacts with Spa2p and YFL016C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0041
description: Protein with low similarity to DnaJ subfamily C proteins

name: CDC34
description: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme (E2), catalytic subunit of SCF ubiquitin-protein ligase complex (together with Skp1p, Rbx1p, Cdc53p, and an F-box protein) that regulates cell cycle progression by targeting key substrates for degradation, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0043
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: DBF4
description: Regulatory subunit of Cdc7p-Dbf4p kinase complex, required for Cdc7p kinase activity and initiation of DNA replication, phosphorylates the Mcm2-7 family of proteins, cell cycle regulated, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0045
description: Protein with low similarity to C6 transcription factors

name: BIO2
description: Biotin synthase, catalyzes the conversion of dethiobiotin to biotin, which is the last step of the biotin biosynthesis pathway, the S. cerevisiae protein complements E. coli bioB mutant

name: PP7435_Chr1-0047
description: Putative transfer RNA for Tyrosine (tRNA-Tyr)

name: PNG1
description: Conserved peptide N-glycanase required for deglycosylation of misfolded glycoproteins during proteasome-dependent degradation, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic and nuclear protein, activity is enhanced by interaction with Rad23p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0049
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PRK12704 phosphodiesterase, provisional)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0050
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: ubiquitin domain of MoaD-like protein involved in biosynthesis of molybdenum cofactor)

name: TPS2
description: Phosphatase subunit of the trehalose-6-P synthase/phosphatase complex, involved in synthesis of the storage carbohydrate trehalose, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae expression is induced by stress conditions, repressed by the Ras-cAMP pathway and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: APN2
description: Class II abasic (AP) endonuclease involved in repair of DNA damage, homolog of human HAP1 and E. coli exoIII

name: CGR1
description: Protein involved in nucleolar integrity and processing of pre-rRNA, has a role in processing rRNA for the 60S ribosome subunit, transcript is induced in response to cytotoxic stress but not genotoxic stress, known in S. cerevisiae as protein that relocalizes from nucleus to nucleolus upon DNA replication stress

name: SEC13
description: Structural component of 3 distinct complexes, subunit of Nup84 nuclear pore sub-complex (NPC), COPII vesicle coat, and Seh1-associated (SEA) complex, COPII vesicle coat is required for ER to Golgi transport, the Nup84 subcomplex contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport, NPC biogenesis and processes that may require localization of chromosomes at the nuclear periphery, including transcription, homologous to human SEC13, abundance increases under DNA replication stress, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0055
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3074)

name: FUR4
description: Uracil permease, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, whose expression is tightly regulated by uracil levels and environmental cues, conformational alterations induced by unfolding or substrate binding result in Rsp5p-mediated ubiquitination and degradation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0057
description: Protein with similarity to YIL067C (Uncharacterized protein of unknown function)

name: PTP3
description: Phosphotyrosine-specific protein phosphatase involved in the inactivation of mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) during osmolarity sensing, dephosporylates Hog1p MAPK and regulates its localization, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein

name: LHS1
description: Molecular chaperone of the ER lumen, involved in polypeptide translocation and folding, nucleotide exchange factor for the ER lumenal Hsp70 chaperone Kar2p, regulated by the unfolded protein response pathway, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0060
description: Protein with low similarity to splicing factor U2AF, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: BUB2
description: Mitotic exit network regulator, forms GTPase-activating Bfa1p-Bub2p complex that binds Tem1p and spindle pole bodies, blocks in S. cerevisiae cell cycle progression before anaphase in response to spindle and kinetochore damage

name: STV1
description: Subunit a of the vacuolar-ATPase V0 domain, one of two isoforms (Stv1p and Vph1p), enriched in Golgi, those complexes are known in S. cerevisiae to be also present at the endosomes, while Vph1p is located in V-ATPase complexes of the vacuole

name: RGP1
description: Subunit of a membrane exchange factor (Ric1p-Rgp1p) that catalyzes nucleotide exchange on Ypt6p, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein

name: RPP0
description: Conserved ribosomal protein P0 of the ribosomal stalk, involved in interaction between translational elongation factors and the ribosome, phosphorylated on serine 302, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein LP0 and bacterial L10, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RSN1
description: Membrane protein of unknown function, enriched in microsome, in S. cerevisiae localizes to the plasma membrane, overexpression in S. cerevisiae suppresses NaCl sensitivity of sro7 mutant cells by restoring sodium pump (Ena1p),

name: PPA2
description: Inorganic pyrophosphatase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein required for mitochondrial function and possibly involved in energy generation from inorganic pyrophosphate

name: NUP188
description: Subunit of the inner ring of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes to NPC organization and nucleocytoplasmic transport, homologous to human NUP188

name: PRP24
description: Splicing factor that reanneals U4 and U6 snRNPs during spliceosome recycling

name: TMA23
description: Protein implicated in ribosome biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar whose deletion extends chronological lifespan

name: PP7435_Chr1-0070
description: Putative transfer RNA for Lysine (tRNA-Lys)

name: DBP5
description: Cytoplasmic ATP-dependent RNA helicase of the DEAD-box family, involved in mRNA export from the nucleus, involved in translation termination, ATP/ADP cycling is regulated by Gle1p and Nup159p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: TMC1
description: AN1-type zinc finger protein, effector of proteotoxic stress response; stress-inducible transcriptional target of Rpn4p; in S. cerevisiae induced by nitrogen limitation, weak acid, misfolded proteins; short-lived protein, degraded by proteasome; may protect cells from trivalent metalloid induced proteotoxicity; contains PACE promoter element; ortholog of human AIRAP, which stimulates proteasome activity in response to arsenic; protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases under DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0073
description: Protein with similarity to YKR070W, enriched in mitochondria (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0074
description: Putative transfer RNA for Alanine (tRNA-Ala)

name: MET1
description: S-adenosyl-L-methionine uroporphyrinogen III transmethylase, involved in the biosynthesis of siroheme, a prosthetic group used by sulfite reductase, required for sulfate assimilation and methionine biosynthesis

name: ETT1
description: Protein that inhibits replication of Brome mosaic virus in S. cerevisiae, which is a model system for studying replication of positive-strand RNA viruses in their natural hosts, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein which deletion increases stop codon readthrough

name: BET3
description: Core component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complexes I-III, TRAPP complexes are related multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factors for the GTPase Ypt1, regulating ER-Golgi traffic (TRAPPI), intra-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII), endosome-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII and III) and autophagy (TRAPPIII), hydrophilic homodimeric protein that acts in conjunction with SNARE proteins in targeting and fusion of ER to Golgi transport vesicles, enriched in Golgi

name: GPT2
description: Glycerol-3-phosphate/dihydroxyacetone phosphate dual substrate-specific sn-1 acyltransferase located the ER, enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein localized also at lipid particles, involved in the stepwise acylation of glycerol-3-phosphate and dihydroxyacetone in lipid biosynthesis, the most conserved motifs and functionally relevant residues are oriented towards the ER lumen

name: YIF1
description: Integral membrane protein required for the fusion of ER-derived COPII transport vesicles with the Golgi, interacts with Yip1p and Yos1p, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of Golgi, ER, and COPII vesicles, homolog of human YIPF3

name: PP7435_Chr1-0080
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: POL2
description: Catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase (II) epsilon, a chromosomal DNA replication polymerase that exhibits processivity and proofreading exonuclease activity, also involved in DNA synthesis during DNA repair, interacts extensively with Mrc1p

name: ORC5
description: Subunit of the origin recognition complex, which directs DNA replication by binding to replication origins and is also involved in transcriptional silencing

name: LTO1
description: Essential protein that forms a complex with Rli1p and Yae1p, ortholog of human ORAOV1, which is overexpressed in solid tumors, inviability of S. cerevisiae null mutant under standard conditions is complemented by overexpression of ORAOV1, essential for growth under standard (aerobic) conditions but not under anaerobic conditions, may have a role in protection of ribosomal assembly and function from damage due to reactive oxygen species

name: LIN1
description: Non-essential component in S. cerevisiae of U5 snRNP, nuclear protein, physically interacts with Irr1p of cohesin complex, may link together proteins involved in chromosome segregation, mRNA splicing and DNA replication

name: PP7435_Chr1-0085
description: Protein with low similarity to Scheffersomyces stipitis mitotic spindle checkpoint protein BUB3

name: ATX1
description: Copper metallochaperone that transports copper to the secretory vesicle copper transporter Ccc2p for eventual insertion into Fet3p, which is a multicopper oxidase required for high-affinity iron upTake, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: DSL1
description: Peripheral membrane protein needed for Golgi-to-ER retrograde traffic, forms a complex with Sec39p and Tip20p that interacts with ER SNAREs Sec20p and Use1p, component of the ER target site that interacts with coatomer, interacts with Cin5p, similar to the fly and human ZW10 gene, enriched in microsome

name: PP7435_Chr1-0088
description: Protein with low similarity to DnaJ-domain-containing proteins

name: ARD1
description: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA, NatA is comprised of Nat1p, Ard1p, and Nat5p, acetylates many proteins and thus affects telomeric silencing, cell cycle, heat-shock resistance, mating, and sporulation, human Ard1p levels are elevated in cancer cells, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0091
description: Protein with low similarity to AHC1, subunit of the Ada histone acetyltransferase complex which is required for structural integrity of the complex

name: SFM1
description: SPOUT methyltransferase, catalyzes omega-monomethylation of Rps3p on Arg-146, in S. cerevisiae YOR021C is not an essential gene, predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis and in biopolymer catabolism

name: DDL1
description: DDHD domain-containing phospholipase A1, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix enzyme with sn-1-specific activity, hydrolyzing cardiolipin, PE, PC, PG and PA, implicated in remodeling of mitochondrial phospholipids, antagonistically regulated by Aft1p and Aft2p, in humans, mutations in DDHD1 and DDHD2 genes cause specific types of hereditary spastic paraplegia, while DDL1-defective yeast share similar phenotypes such as mitochondrial dysfunction and defects in lipid metabolism

name: RCF1
description: Cytochrome c oxidase subunit, required for assembly of the Complex III-Complex IV supercomplex, and for assembly of Cox13p and Rcf2p into cytochrome c oxidase, similar to Rcf2p, and either Rcf1p or Rcf2p is required for late-stage assembly of the Cox12p and Cox13p subunits and for cytochrome c oxidase activity, required for growth under hypoxic conditions, member of the hypoxia induced gene family, C. elegans and human orthologs are functional in yeast

name: KGD2
description: Dihydrolipoyl transsuccinylase, component of the mitochondrial alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase complex, which catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of alpha-ketoglutarate to succinyl-CoA in the TCA cycle, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-0096
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: HVSL, uncharacterized conserved protein)

name: IGO2
description: Protein required for initiation of G0 program, prevents degradation of nutrient-regulated mRNAs via the 5'-3' mRNA decay pathway, phosphorylated by Rim15p, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog IGO1

name: NSG2
description: Protein involved in regulation of sterol biosynthesis, specifically stabilizes Hmg2p, one of two HMG-CoA isoenzymes that catalyze the rate-limiting step in sterol biosynthesis, homolog of mammalian INSIG proteins, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NSG1

name: SWI4
description: DNA binding component of the SBF complex (Swi4p-Swi6p), a transcriptional activator that in concert with MBF (Mbp1-Swi6p) regulates late G1-specific transcription of targets including cyclins and genes required for DNA synthesis and repair, Slt2p-independent regulator of cold growth, acetylation at two sites, K1016 and K1066, regulates interaction with Swi6p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0100
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SWI5
description: Transcription factor that recruits Mediator and Swi/Snf complexes, activates transcription of genes expressed at the M/G1 phase boundary and in G1 phase, required for expression of the HO gene controlling mating type switching, localization in S. cerevisiae to nucleus occurs during G1 and appears to be regulated by phosphorylation by Cdc28p kinase, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ACE2

name: STT4
description: Phosphatidylinositol-4-kinase that functions in the Pkc1p protein kinase pathway, required for normal vacuole morphology, cell wall integrity, and actin cytoskeleton organization, enriched among several compartments

name: TIF6
description: Constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, has similarity to human translation initiation factor 6 (eIF6), may be involved in the biogenesis and or stability of 60S ribosomal subunits

name: HSP104
description: Disaggregase, heat shock protein that cooperates with Ydj1p (Hsp40) and Ssa1p (Hsp70) to refold and reactivate previously denatured, aggregated proteins, responsive to stresses including: heat, ethanol, and sodium arsenite, involved in [PSI+] propagation, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae protein becomes more abundant and forms cytoplasmic foci in S. cerevisiae in response to DNA replication stress

name: ACO1
description: Aconitase, required for the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and also independently required for mitochondrial genome maintenance, phosphorylated, component of the mitochondrial nucleoid, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, mutation in S. cerevisiae leads to glutamate auxotrophy

name: RIM4
description: Putative RNA-binding protein required for the expression of early and middle sporulation genes

name: RRI1
description: Catalytic subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex that acts as an isopeptidase in cleaving the ubiquitin-like protein Nedd8 from SCF ubiquitin ligases, metalloendopeptidase involved in the adaptation to pheromone signaling

name: NPR1
description: Protein kinase, stabilizes several plasma membrane amino acid transporters by antagonizing their ubiquitin-mediated degradation, phosphorylates Aly2p, negatively regulates Ldb19p-mediated endocytosis through phosphorylation of Ldb19p, which prevents its association with the plasma membrane, Npr1p activity is negatively regulated via phosphorylation by the TOR complex, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PRR2

name: MRPL19
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: UBP10
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease, deubiquitinates Ub-protein moieties, interacts with proteins that function in rRNA production and ribosome biogenesis, stabilizes Rpa190p, the largest subunit of RNAP I, by mediating its deubiquitination, may regulate silencing by acting on Sir4p, involved in posttranscriptionally regulating Gap1p and possibly other transporters, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleolus, human USP36 is a functional analog of Ubp10p

name: PBR1
description: Putative oxidoreductase, required for cell viability in S. cerevisiae, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: IPI3
description: Component of the Rix1 complex (Rix1p-Ipi1p-Ipi3p) and pre-replicative complexes (pre-RCs), required for processing of ITS2 sequences from 35S pre-rRNA, component of the pre-60S ribosomal particle with the dynein-related AAA-type ATPase Mdn1p, required for pre-RC formation and maintenance during DNA replication licensing, highly conserved protein which contains several WD40 motifs, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae IPI3 is an essential gene

name: PP7435_Chr1-0113
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1777)

name: NOP6
description: rRNA-binding protein required for 40S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, contains an RNA recognition motif (RRM), hydrophilin essential to overcome the stress of the desiccation-rehydration process, NOP6 may be a fungal-specific gene as no homologs have been yet identified in higher eukaryotes

name: RHO5
description: Non-essential small GTPase of the Rho/Rac family of Ras-like proteins, RAC1 ortholog, regulated by phosphorylation and ubiquitination, likely involved in protein kinase C (Pkc1p)-dependent signal transduction pathway that controls cell integrity

name: PP7435_Chr1-0116
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: KRE5-2
description: Protein required for beta-1,6 glucan biosynthesis, mutations in S. cerevisiae result in aberrant morphology and severe growth defects

name: RPS3
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, has apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) endonuclease activity, enriched among several compartments, essential in S. cerevisiae for viability, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S3 and bacterial S3

name: SHR3
description: Packaging chaperone, required for incorporation of amino acid permeases into COPII coated vesicles for transport to the cell surface, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein

name: NI9M
description: NI9M (B9) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells

name: MRPL22
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria

name: MOH1-2
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae essential for stationary phase survival, not required for growth on nonfermentable carbon sources, possibly linked with vacuolar transport

name: PP7435_Chr1-0123
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NOP13
description: Protein found in preribosomal complexes, contains an RNA recognition motif (RRM), enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, relative distribution to the nucleolus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: UGP1
description: UDP-glucose pyrophosphorylase (UGPase), catalyses the reversible formation of UDP-Glc from glucose 1-phosphate and UTP, involved in a wide variety of metabolic pathways, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae modulated by Pho85p through Pho4p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YHL012W

name: RRP36
description: Component of 90S preribosomes, involved in early cleavages of the 35S pre-rRNA and in production of the 40S ribosomal subunit

name: MRPL44
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MPD1
description: Member of the protein disulfide isomerase (PDI) family, interacts with and inhibits the chaperone activity of Cne1p, MPD1 overexpression in a pdi1 S. cerevisiae null mutant suppresses defects in Pdi1p functions such as carboxypeptidase Y maturation, enriched among several compartments

name: GLN3
description: Transcriptional activator of genes regulated by nitrogen catabolite repression (NCR), localization and activity in S. cerevisiae regulated by quality of nitrogen source

name: PP7435_Chr1-0130
description: Protein with low similarity to CDC33 (putative CDC33-2), mRNA cap binding protein and translation initiation factor eIF4E, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: DUG1
description: Cys-Gly metallo-di-peptidase, forms a complex with Dug2p and Dug3p to degrade glutathione (GSH) and other peptides containing a gamma-glu-X bond in an alternative pathway to GSH degradation by gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase (Ecm38p), enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-0132
description: Protein with low similarity to peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase-like protein

name: SDT1
description: Pyrimidine nucleotidase, overexpression in S. cerevisiae suppresses the 6-AU sensitivity of transcription elongation factor S-II, as well as resistance to other pyrimidine derivatives, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PHM8

name: PP7435_Chr1-0134
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: COX5A
description: Subunit Va of cytochrome c oxidase, cytochrome c oxidase is the terminal member of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, Cox5Ap is predominantly expressed in S. cerevisiae during aerobic growth while its isoform Vb (Cox5Bp) is expressed during anaerobic growth, Pichia pastoris has the paralog COX5B

name: ERJ5
description: Type I membrane protein with a J domain is required to preserve the folding capacity of the ER, enriched among several compartments, loss in S. cerevisiae of the non-essential ERJ5 gene leads to a constitutively induced unfolded protein response

name: SAP185
description: Protein that forms a complex with the Sit4p protein phosphatase, required for Sit4p function, member of a family of similar proteins including Sap4p, Sap155p, and Sap190p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SAP190

name: PP7435_Chr1-0138
description: Protein with low similarity to SHE10, protein involved in outer spore wall assembly, enriched among several compartments

name: ATP11
description: Molecular chaperone, required for the assembly of alpha and beta subunits into the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: KTR3
description: Putative alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase, involved in O- and N-linked protein glycosylation, member of the KRE2/MNT1 mannosyltransferase family, Svp26p mediates upTake of Ktr3p into COPII vesicles, known in S. cerevisiae as protein that relocalizes from nucleus to vacuole upon DNA replication stress

name: APS1
description: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-1, which is involved in protein sorting at the trans-Golgi network, homolog of the sigma subunit of the mammalian clathrin AP-1 complex

name: PP7435_Chr1-0142
description: Putative transfer RNA for Tryptophan (tRNA-Trp)

name: TMN3
description: Protein with a role in cellular adhesion and filamentous growth, similar to Emp70p and Tmn2p, member of Transmembrane Nine family with 9 transmembrane segments, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to Golgi and induced by 8-methoxypsoralen plus UVA irradiation

name: LSM4
description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein, part of heteroheptameric complexes (Lsm2p-7p and either Lsm1p or 8p): cytoplasmic Lsm1p complex involved in mRNA decay, nuclear Lsm8p complex part of U6 snRNP and possibly involved in processing tRNA, snoRNA, and rRNA, enriched in cytosol, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: TEL1
description: Protein kinase primarily involved in telomere length regulation, contributes cell cycle checkpoint control in response to DNA damage, functionally redundant with Mec1p, regulates P-body formation induced by replication stress, homolog of human ataxia-telangiectasia mutated (ATM) gene, the gene responsible for ataxia telangiectasia (AT) (OMIM 607585), enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: RPL23A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L23A, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L23 and bacterial L14, enriched in plasma membrane, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL23B

name: PP7435_Chr1-0147
description: Protein with low similarity to SLX8, subunit of Slx5-Slx8 SUMO-targeted ubiquitin ligase (STUbL) complex

name: PP7435_Chr1-0148
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0149
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: BOI2
description: Protein implicated in polar growth, functionally redundant with Boi1p, interacts with bud-emergence protein Bem1p, contains an SH3 (src homology 3) domain and a PH (pleckstrin homology) domain, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog BOI1

name: CDC27
description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C), which is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition

name: SHO1
description: Transmembrane osmosensor involved in activation of the Cdc42p- and MAP kinase-dependent filamentous growth pathway and the high-osmolarity glycerol response pathway, phosphorylated by Hog1p, interacts with Pbs2p, Msb2p, Hkr1p, and Ste11p

name: UBR1
description: E3 ubiquitin ligase (N-recognin), forms heterodimer with Rad6p to ubiquitinate substrates in the N-end rule pathway, regulates peptide transport via Cup9p ubiquitination, plays a major role in targeting cytosolic misfolded proteins for degradation, mutation in human UBR1 causes Johansson-Blizzard Syndrome (JBS)

name: URB2
description: Protein required for normal metabolism of the rRNA primary transcript, nucleolar protein, proposed to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: UIP4
description: Protein that interacts with Ulp1p, a Ubl (ubiquitin-like protein)-specific protease for Smt3p protein conjugates, detected in a phosphorylated state in the mitochondrial outer membrane, also detected in ER and nuclear envelope

name: TPN1
description: Pyridoxine (vitamin B6) transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, member of the purine-cytosine permease subfamily within the major facilitator superfamily, proton symporter with similarity to Fcy21p, Fcy2p, and Fcy22p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0157
description: Protein with low similarity to ARO genes

name: MRN1
description: RNA-binding protein that may be involved in translational regulation, binds specific categories of mRNAs, including those that contain upstream open reading frames (uORFs) and internal ribosome entry sites (IRES), interacts genetically with chromatin remodelers and splicing factors, linking chromatin state, splicing and as a result mRNA maturation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0159
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SLC1
description: 1-acyl-sn-glycerol-3-phosphate acyltransferase, catalyzes the acylation of lysophosphatidic acid to form phosphatidic acid, a key intermediate in lipid metabolism, enzymatic activity detected in lipid particles and microsomes, enriched among several compartments

name: DCP1
description: Subunit of the Dcp1p-Dcp2p decapping enzyme complex, decapping complex removes the 5' cap structure from mRNAs prior to their degradation, enhances the activity of catalytic subunit Dcp2p, regulated by DEAD box protein Dhh1p, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: RGA1
description: GTPase-activating protein for polarity-establishment protein Cdc42p, implicated in control of septin organization, pheromone response, and haploid invasive growth, known in S. cerevisiae as bud neck protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RGA2

name: FMP40
description: Putative protein of unknown function, proposed to be involved in responding to environmental stresses, in S. cerevisiae the authentic non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: BET1
description: Type II membrane protein required for vesicular transport between the ER and Golgi complex, v-SNARE with similarity to synaptobrevins

name: CFD1
description: Highly conserved, iron-sulfur cluster binding protein known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein which forms a complex with Nbp35p that is involved in iron-sulfur protein assembly in the cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-0166
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YEA4
description: Uridine diphosphate-N-acetylglucosamine (UDP-GlcNAc) transporter required for cell wall chitin synthesis, enriched in Golgi, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein

name: ANY1
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae null allele suppresses the lethality of neo1 and dop1 null alleles, as well as the growth defect of a mon2 null allele, and the cold sensitivity of a drs2 null, proposed function as a phospholipid scramblase that reduces membrane asymmetry, PQ loop family member, in S. cerevisiae localizes to the cytoplasm and ER in high throughput studies and is a non-essential gene

name: ROF1
description: Putative transcription factor containing a WOPR domain, binds DNA in vitro, similar to Candida albicans Wor1p transcription factor that regulates white-opaque switching, overexpression in S. cerevisiae causes a cell cycle delay or arrest

name: PP7435_Chr1-0170
description: Protein with low similarity to putative AP-1 transcriptional activator (C. maltosa)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0172
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: MET32
description: Zinc-finger DNA-binding transcription factor, involved in transcriptional regulation of the methionine biosynthetic genes, targets strong transcriptional activator Met4p to promoters of sulfur metabolic genes, feedforward loop exists in the regulation of genes controlled by Met4p and Met32p, lack of such a loop for MET31 may account for the differential actions of Met32p and Met31p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MET31

name: SVL3
description: Protein of unknown function, mutant phenotype suggests a potential role in vacuolar function, enriched in plasma membrane and microsome, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery, cytoplasm, bud, and bud neck and relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PAP2

name: SCJ1
description: One of several homologs of bacterial chaperone DnaJ, located in the ER lumen where it cooperates with Kar2p to mediate maturation of proteins, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: DML1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in mtDNA inheritance, may also function in the partitioning of the mitochondrial organelle or in the segregation of chromosomes, exhibits regions similar to members of a GTPase family

name: PP7435_Chr1-0178
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TMA16
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes

name: PP7435_Chr1-0180
description: Protein with low similarity to CAF20, phosphoprotein of the mRNA cap-binding complex, involved in translational control

name: PP7435_Chr1-0181
description: Protein with low similarity to EFR3, protein required for Stt4-containing PI kinase complex localization which is required for Stt4-containing phosphoinositide (PI) kinase patch assembly at the plasma membrane, enriched among several compartments

name: IML1
description: GTPase-activating protein (GAP) subunit of the Iml1p/SEACIT complex, SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) is a subcomplex of the SEA complex, a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole, Iml1p functions in the SEACIT complex as a GAP for the Rag family GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit), resulting in the inhibition of TORC1 signaling in response to amino acid deprivation, the Iml1p/SEACIT complex is required for non-nitrogen-starvation (NNS)-induced autophagy

name: CEF1
description: Essential splicing factor in S. cerevisiae, associated with Prp19p and the spliceosome, contains an N-terminal c-Myb DNA binding motif necessary for cell viability but not for Prp19p association, evolutionarily conserved and homologous to S. pombe Cdc5

name: CFT1
description: RNA-binding subunit of the mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation factor, involved in poly(A) site recognition and required for both pre-mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation, 51% sequence similarity with mammalian AAUAA-binding subunit of CPSF

name: RIM20
description: Protein involved in S. cerevisiae in proteolytic activation of Rim101p in response to alkaline pH, PalA/AIP1/Alix family member, interaction with the ESCRT-III subunit Snf7p suggests a relationship between pH response and multivesicular body formation

name: MOD5
description: Delta 2-isopentenyl pyrophosphate:tRNA isopentenyl transferase, required for biosynthesis of the modified base isopentenyladenosine in mitochondrial and cytoplasmic tRNAs, gene is nuclear and encodes two isozymic forms, converts to a prion form, and prion conversion contributes to azole antifungal resistance by upregulating ergosterol biosynthesis

name: FSF1
description: Putative protein, predicted to be an alpha-isopropylmalate carrier, belongs to the sideroblastic-associated protein family, enriched in mitochondria, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria, likely to play a role in iron homeostasis

name: ERG12
description: Mevalonate kinase, acts in the biosynthesis of isoprenoids and sterols, including ergosterol, from mevalonate, enriched in cytosol

name: YTM1
description: Constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, forms a complex with Nop7p and Erb1p that is required for maturation of the large ribosomal subunit, has seven C-terminal WD repeats, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: GUA1
description: GMP synthase, highly conserved enzyme that catalyzes the second step in the biosynthesis of GMP from inosine 5'-phosphate (IMP), enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae transcription is not subject to regulation by guanine but is negatively regulated by nutrient starvation and reduction-of-function mutation gua1-G388D causes changes in cellular guanine nucleotide pools, defects in general protein synthesis, and impaired translation of GCN4 mRNA, higher similarity to Candida albicans GUA1

name: RAM2
description: Alpha subunit of both the farnesyltransferase and type I geranylgeranyltransferase that catalyze prenylation of proteins containing a CAAX consensus motif, essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for membrane localization of Ras proteins and a-factor

name: YVH1
description: Dual specificity protein phosphatase, regulates growth, sporulation, and glycogen accumulation in a cAMP-dependent protein kinase cascade dependent manner, S. cerevisiae mutants are defective in 60S ribosome assembly, positively regulates pre-autophagosomal structure (PAS) formation upon nitrogen starvation or rapamycin treatment

name: PP7435_Chr1-0194
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Apc15p protein)

name: COX10
description: Heme A:farnesyltransferase, catalyzes the first step in the conversion of protoheme to the heme A prosthetic group required for cytochrome c oxidase activity, human ortholog is associated with mitochondrial disorders

name: RPN8
description: Essential in S. cerevisiae, non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome, has similarity to the human p40 proteasomal subunit and to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn11p, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-0197
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0198
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: GPN2
description: Putative GTPase with a role in biogenesis of RNA pol II and polIII, may be involved in assembly of RNA polymerases II and III and in their transport into the nucleus, contains a Gly-Pro-Asn motif in the G domain, similar to Npa3p and Gpn3p, highly conserved across species and homologous to human gene GPN2/ATPBD1B, required for establishment of sister chromatid cohesion

name: PP7435_Chr1-0200
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3835)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0201
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0202
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: RNA-binding domain)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0203
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF4451)

name: SEC61
description: Conserved ER protein translocation channel, essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of Sec61 complex (Sec61p, Sbh1p, and Sss1p), forms channel for SRP-dependent protein import, with Sec63 complex allows SRP-independent protein import into ER, enriched in microsome, Golgi and mitochondria, involved in posttranslational soluble protein import into the ER, ERAD of soluble substrates, and misfolded soluble protein export from the ER

name: PP7435_Chr1-0205
description: Protein with similarity to YDL177C (Putative protein of unknown function, similar to the mouse IMPACT gene, in S. cerevisiae YDL177C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0206
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0207
description: Protein with similarity to YNL040W (Putative protein of unknown function with strong similarity to alanyl-tRNA synthases from Eubacteria, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and YNL040W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0208
description: Protein with similarity to YBR138C (Cytoplasmic protein of unknown function, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p, in S. cerevisiae YBR138C is not an essential gene)

name: VBA1-1
description: Permease of basic amino acids in the vacuolar membrane

name: CIA1
description: Component of cytosolic iron-sulfur protein assembly (CIA) machinery, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosoplasmic protein, acts at a late step of Fe-S cluster assembly, forms the CIA targeting complex with Cia2p and Met18p that directs Fe-S cluster incorporation into a subset of proteins involved in methionine biosynthesis, DNA replication and repair, transcription, and telomere maintenance, contains WD40 repeats, ortholog of human Ciao1 protein

name: CYC2
description: Mitochondrial peripheral inner membrane protein, contains a FAD cofactor in a domain exposed in the intermembrane space, exhibits redox activity in vitro, likely participates in ligation of heme to acytochromes c and c1 (Cyc1p and Cyt1p), enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PEP12
description: Target membrane receptor (t-SNARE) for vesicular intermediates traveling between the Golgi apparatus and the vacuole, controls entry of biosynthetic, endocytic, and retrograde traffic into the prevacuolar compartment, syntaxin, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0213
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamine acid (tRNA-Gln)

name: N7BM
description: N7BM (B17.2) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: DYS1
description: Deoxyhypusine synthase, catalyzes formation of deoxyhypusine, the first step in hypusine biosynthesis, triggers posttranslational hypusination of translation elongation factor eIF-5A and regulates its intracellular levels, tetrameric, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: CYP559
description: Putative cytochrome P450 similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis CYP559

name: PP7435_Chr1-0217
description: Protein with low similarity to Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinases

name: TPO2
description: Polyamine transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family, specific for spermine, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells and in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to the plasma membrane, transcription of TPO2 is regulated by Haa1p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog TPO3

name: ECM21
description: Protein involved in regulating endocytosis of plasma membrane proteins, identified as a substrate for ubiquitination by Rsp5p and deubiquitination by Ubp2p, promoter contains several Gcn4p binding elements, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CSR2

name: MBA1
description: Membrane-associated mitochondrial ribosome receptor, forms a complex with Mdm38p that may facilitate recruitment of mRNA-specific translational activators to ribosomes, possible role in protein export from the matrix to inner membrane, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: CSH1
description: Mannosylinositol phosphorylceramide (MIPC) synthase catalytic subunit, forms a complex with regulatory subunit Csg2p, function in sphingolipid biosynthesis is overlapping with that of Sur1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SUR1

name: GYP1
description: GTPase-activating protein (GAP) for the Rab family members Ypt1p (in vivo) and for Ypt1p, Sec4p, Ypt7p, and Ypt51p (in vitro), known in S. cerevisiae as cis-Golgi protein, involved in vesicle docking and fusion

name: MTD1
description: NAD-dependent 5,10-methylenetetrahydrafolate dehydrogenase, plays a catalytic role in oxidation of cytoplasmic one-carbon units, in S. cerevisiae expression is regulated by Bas1p and Bas2p, repressed by adenine, and may be induced by inositol and choline, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-0224
description: Putative transfer RNA for Proline (tRNA-Pro)

name: SAC3
description: mRNA export factor, required for biogenesis of the small ribosomal subunit, component of TREX-2 complex (Sac3p-Thp1p-Sus1p-Cdc31p) involved in transcription elongation and mRNA export from the nucleus, involved in post-transcriptional tethering of active genes to the nuclear periphery and to non-nascent mRNP, similar to the human germinal center-associated nuclear protein (GANP)

name: MTC5
description: Subunit of the SEA (Seh1-associated) complex, SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole, has N-terminal WD-40 repeats and a C-terminal RING motif, mtc5 is synthetically sick with cdc13-1, relative distribution to vacuolar membrane punctae decreases upon DNA replication stress

name: CDC20
description: Activator of anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C), APC/C is required for metaphase/anaphase transition, directs ubiquitination of mitotic cyclins, Pds1p, and other anaphase inhibitors, cell-cycle regulated, potential Cdc28p substrate, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: FKS3
description: Protein involved in spore wall assembly, has similarity to 1,3-beta-D-glucan synthase catalytic subunits Fks1p and Gsc2p, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: GAS1-1
description: Beta-1,3-glucanosyltransferase, required for cell wall assembly and also has a role in transcriptional silencing, enriched in plasma membrane, microsome and mitochondria, known in S. cerevisiae to localize to the cell surface via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor, and to be also found at the nuclear periphery

name: GAS1-2
description: Beta-1,3-glucanosyltransferase, required for cell wall assembly and also has a role in transcriptional silencing, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae to localize to the cell surface via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor, and to be also found at the nuclear periphery

name: PXR1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in rRNA and snoRNA maturation, competes with TLC1 RNA for binding to Est2p, suggesting a role in negative regulation of telomerase, human homolog inhibits telomerase, contains a G-patch RNA interacting domain

name: SCW10
description: Cell wall protein with similarity to glucanases, may play a role in conjugation during mating based on S. cerevisiae mutant phenotype and its regulation by Ste12p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SCW4

name: PP7435_Chr1-0234
description: Putative transfer RNA for Proline (tRNA-Pro)

name: RTN1
description: Reticulon protein, stabilizes membrane curvature, involved in nuclear pore assembly and maintenance of tubular ER morphology, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutant overexpressing RTN1 shows increase in tubular ER, interacts with exocyst subunit Sec6p, Yip3p, and Sbh1p, more abundant than Rtn2p, member of the RTNLA subfamily and have reduced phosphatidylserine transfer between the ER and mitochondria, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RTN2

name: PP7435_Chr1-0236
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DBL homology domain)

name: PEP5
description: Histone E3 ligase, component of CORVET tethering complex, known in S. cerevisiae as peripheral vacuolar membrane protein required for protein trafficking and vacuole biogenesis, interacts with Pep7p, involved in ubiquitylation and degradation of excess histones

name: HOG1
description: Mitogen-activated protein kinase involved in osmoregulation, controls global reallocation of RNA Pol II in response to osmotic shock, acts via three independent osmosensors, mitophagy-specific regulator, mediates the recruitment and activation of RNA Pol II at Hot1p-dependent promoters, enriched in cytosol, localization in S. cerevisiae regulated by Ptp2p and Ptp3p and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RGT1
description: Glucose-responsive transcription factor, regulates in S. cerevisiae expression of several glucose transporter (HXT) genes in response to glucose, binds to promoters and acts both as a transcriptional activator and repressor, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EDS1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0240
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: vacuolar sorting protein 9, VPS9)

name: INP54
description: Phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase with a role in secretion, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, localized to ER via the C-terminal tail, lacks the Sac1 domain and proline-rich region found in the other 3 INP proteins

name: RER1
description: Protein involved in retention of membrane proteins, including Sec12p, in the ER, enriched in Golgi, functions as a retrieval receptor in returning membrane proteins to the ER

name: PSE1
description: Karyopherin/importin that interacts with the nuclear pore complex, acts as the nuclear import receptor for specific proteins, including Pdr1p, Yap1p, Ste12p, and Aft1p, enriched in cytosol

name: PGS1
description: Phosphatidylglycerolphosphate synthase, catalyzes the synthesis of phosphatidylglycerolphosphate from CDP-diacylglycerol and sn-glycerol 3-phosphate in the first committed and rate-limiting step of cardiolipin biosynthesis

name: RIB2
description: Bifunctional DRAP deaminase tRNA:pseudouridine synthase, the deaminase catalyzes the third step in riboflavin biosynthesis and the synthase catalyzes formation of pseudouridine at position 32 in cytoplasmic tRNAs, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PUS9

name: FAD1
description: Flavin adenine dinucleotide (FAD) synthetase, performs the second step in synthesis of FAD from riboflavin

name: PRP11
description: Subunit of the SF3a splicing factor complex, required for spliceosome assembly

name: NUF2
description: Component of the evolutionarily conserved kinetochore-associated Ndc80 complex (Ndc80p-Nuf2p-Spc24p-Spc25p), involved in chromosome segregation, spindle checkpoint activity and kinetochore clustering

name: SLX1
description: Endonuclease involved in DNA recombination and repair, subunit of a complex, with Slx4p, that hydrolyzes 5' branches from duplex DNA in response to stalled or converging replication forks, function overlaps with that of Sgs1p-Top3p

name: HTS1
description: Histidine tRNA synthetase, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as both cytoplasmic and mitochondrial alanyl-tRNA synthetase, whose efficient mitochondrial localization in S. cerevisiae requires both a presequence and an amino-terminal sequence, mutations in human ortholog HARS2 are associated with Perrault syndrome

name: FAR1
description: CDK inhibitor and nuclear anchor, during the cell cycle Far1p sequesters the GEF Cdc24p in the nucleus, phosphorylation by Cdc28p-Cln results in SCFCdc4 complex-mediated ubiquitin-dependent degradation, releasing Cdc24p for export and activation of GTPase Cdc42p, phosphorylation in S. cerevisiae of Far1p by MAPK Fus3p in response to pheromone, results in association with, and inhibition of Cdc28p-Cln, as well as Msn5p mediated nuclear export of Far1p-Cdc24p, targeting Cdc24p to polarity sites

name: PP7435_Chr1-0252
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: LUC7
description: Essential protein associated with the U1 snRNP complex, splicing factor involved in recognition of 5' splice site, contains two zinc finger motifs, N-terminal zinc finger binds pre-mRNA, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: IMP1
description: Catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial inner membrane peptidase complex, required for maturation of mitochondrial proteins of the intermembrane space, complex contains Imp1p and Imp2p (both catalytic subunits), and Som1p, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: SWP1
description: Delta subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase glycoprotein complex, which is required for N-linked glycosylation of proteins in the ER, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-0256
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: LEU5
description: Carrier protein, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, involved in the accumulation of CoA in the mitochondrial matrix, homolog of human Graves disease protein, does not encode an isozyme of Leu4p, as first hypothesized

name: OCH1
description: Mannosyltransferase of the cis-Golgi apparatus, initiates the polymannose outer chain elongation of N-linked oligosaccharides of glycoproteins, responsible in Pichia pastoris hyper-mannosylation of the recombinant protein, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: RAP1
description: Essential DNA-binding transcription regulator that binds many loci, involved in transcription activation and repression, chromatin silencing, and telomere length maintenance, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytosol in response to hypoxia, conserved protein with an N-terminal BRCT domain, a central region with homology to the Myb DNA binding domain, and a C-terminal Rap1-specific protein-interaction domain (RCT domain)

name: PPN2
description: Putative protein of unknown function, weak sequence similarity to bis (5'-nucleotidyl)-tetraphosphatases, enriched in vacuole, in S. cerevisiae the(GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole and the null mutant is highly sensitive to azaserine and resistant to sodium-O-vandate

name: GYP7
description: GTPase-activating protein for yeast Rab family members including: Ypt7p (most effective), Ypt1p, Ypt31p, and Ypt32p (in vitro), involved in vesicle mediated protein trafficking

name: PAA1
description: Polyamine acetyltransferase, acetylates polyamines (e.g. putrescine, spermidine, spermine) and also aralkylamines (e.g. tryptamine, phenylethylamine), may be involved in transcription and/or DNA replication, enriched in cytosol

name: LSM5
description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein, part of heteroheptameric complexes (Lsm2p-7p and either Lsm1p or 8p): cytoplasmic Lsm1p complex involved in mRNA decay, nuclear Lsm8p complex part of U6 snRNP and possibly involved in processing tRNA, snoRNA, and rRNA

name: MAG1
description: 3-methyl-adenine DNA glycosylase, involved in protecting DNA against alkylating agents, initiates base excision repair by removing damaged bases to create abasic sites that are subsequently repaired, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: DDI1
description: DNA damage-inducible v-SNARE binding protein with a role in suppression of protein secretion, may play a role in S-phase checkpoint control, has ubiquitin-associated (UBA), ubiquitin-like (UBL), and retroviral-like proteinase (RVP) domains

name: PP7435_Chr1-0266
description: Protein with low similarity to DOS2, protein of unknown function

name: DOA4
description: Ubiquitin isopeptidase, required for recycling ubiquitin from proteasome-bound ubiquitinated intermediates, acts at the late endosome/prevacuolar compartment to recover ubiquitin from ubiquitinated membrane proteins en route to the vacuole, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog UBP5 and does not have UBP4 and UBP6

name: SLS1
description: Protein that coordinates expression of mitochondrially-encoded genes, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial membrane protein, may facilitate delivery of mRNA to membrane-bound translation machinery

name: CPR1
description: Cytoplasmic peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin), catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues, binds the drug cyclosporin A, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ENT5
description: Protein containing an N-terminal epsin-like domain involved in clathrin recruitment and traffic between the Golgi and endosomes, associates with the clathrin adaptor Gga2p, clathrin adaptor complex AP-1, and clathrin

name: GIR2
description: Highly-acidic RWD domain-containing cytoplasmic protein, forms a highly conserved complex with Rbg2p that is responsible for efficient cell growth under amino acid starvation and binds translational activator Gcn1p in dose-dependent manner according to stress level, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosoplasmic protein, associates with translating ribosomes, intrinsically unstructured protein whose stability is enhanced upon binding Rbg2p

name: ACL4
description: Specific assembly chaperone for ribosomal protein Rpl4p, binds to an evolutionarily conserved surface extension of nascent Rpl4p and chaperones Rpl4p until its assembly into the pre-ribosome, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae transcriptionally co-regulated with rRNA and ribosome biosynthesis genes

name: NBP2
description: Protein involved in the HOG (high osmolarity glycerol) pathway, negatively regulates Hog1p by recruitment of phosphatase Ptc1p the Pbs2p-Hog1p complex, interacts with Bck1p and down regulates the cell wall integrity pathway, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear and cytosolic protein, contains an SH3 domain and a Ptc1p binding domain (PBM)

name: CWC15
description: Non-essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in pre-mRNA splicing, component of a complex containing Cef1p, has similarity to S. pombe Cwf15p

name: PUT1
description: Proline oxidase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein nuclear-encoded, involved in utilization of proline as sole nitrogen source, PUT1 transcription is induced in S. cerevisiae by Put3p in the presence of proline and the absence of a preferred nitrogen source

name: YRB30
description: RanGTP-binding protein, inhibits RanGAP1 (Rna1p)-mediated GTP hydrolysis of RanGTP (Gsp1p), shares similarity to proteins in other fungi but not in higher eukaryotes

name: DEG1
description: tRNA:pseudouridine synthase, introduces pseudouridines at position 38 or 39 in tRNA, important for maintenance of translation efficiency and normal cell growth, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear and cytoplasmic protein and non-essential for viability

name: PP7435_Chr1-0278
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SPB4
description: Putative ATP-dependent RNA helicase, nucleolar protein required for synthesis of 60S ribosomal subunits at a late step in the pathway, sediments with 66S pre-ribosomes in sucrose gradients

name: MCY1-1
description: Putative cysteine synthase, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mitochondrial outer membrane

name: PP7435_Chr1-0281
description: Protein with similarity to YJL206C (Putative protein of unknown function, similar to transcriptional regulators from the Zn[2]-Cys[6] binuclear cluster protein family)

name: SNU71
description: Component of U1 snRNP required for mRNA splicing via spliceosome, yeast specific, no metazoan counterpart

name: MSB2
description: Mucin family member involved in signaling, functions in the Cdc42p- and MAP kinase-dependent filamentous growth signaling pathway, is processed into secreted and cell-associated forms by the aspartyl protease, Yps1p, also functions as an osmosensor in parallel to the Sho1p-mediated pathway, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: PP7435_Chr1-0284
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0285
description: Protein with low similarity to riboflavin aldehyde-forming enzyme

name: TIF34
description: eIF3i subunit of the core complex of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3), enriched among several compartments, essential in S. cerevisiae for translation, stimulates rate of ribosomal scanning during translation reinitiation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0287
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: OSH2
description: Member of an oxysterol-binding protein family with seven members, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae family members have overlapping, redundant functions in sterol metabolism and collectively perform a function essential for viability, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SWH1

name: HSM3
description: Evolutionarily conserved 19S regulatory particle assembly-chaperone, involved in the assembly of the base subcomplex of the 19S proteasomal regulatory particle (RP), involved in DNA mismatch repair during slow growth, weak similarity to Msh1p, structural study suggests Hsm3p is a scaffold protein for Rpt1p-Rpt2p complex formation, ortholog of human 19S subunit S5b

name: CHM7
description: Yeast homolog of human CHMP7, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein presumably as part of an ESCRT-III like complex, the null mutant has growth defect at 37 C in an apq12 deletion background and is a non-essential gene

name: UBX7
description: UBX (ubiquitin regulatory X) domain-containing protein, interacts with Cdc48p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog UBX6

name: PMA1
description: Plasma membrane H+-ATPase, pumps protons out of the cell, major regulator of cytoplasmic pH and plasma membrane potential, P2-type ATPase, Hsp30p plays a role in Pma1p regulation, interactions with Std1p appear to propagate [GAR+], enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments

name: SEO1-2
description: Putative permease, member of the allantoate transporter subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily, mutation in S. cerevisiae confers resistance to ethionine sulfoxide

name: VAM6
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor for the GTPase Gtr1p, subunit of the HOPS endocytic tethering complex, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar membrane protein, functions as a Rab GTPase effector, interacting with both GTP- and GDP-bound conformations of Ypt7p, facilitates tethering and promotes membrane fusion events at the late endosome and vacuole, required for both membrane and protein trafficking, component of vacuole-mitochondrion contacts (vCLAMPs) important for lipid transfer between organelles

name: UTP21
description: Subunit of U3-containing 90S preribosome and Small Subunit (SSU) processome complexes involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit, synthetic defect with STI1 Hsp90 cochaperone, human homolog linked to glaucoma

name: VIP1
description: Inositol hexakisphosphate (IP6) and inositol heptakisphosphate (IP7) kinase, IP7 production is important for phosphate signaling, involved in cortical actin cytoskeleton function, and invasive pseudohyphal growth analogous to S. pombe asp1, enriched in cytosol

name: PRS1
description: 5-phospho-ribosyl-1(alpha)-pyrophosphate synthetase, synthesizes PRPP, which is required for nucleotide, histidine, and tryptophan biosynthesis, one of five related enzymes, which are active as heteromultimeric complexes, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: BER1
description: Protein involved in microtubule-related processes, N-acetylation, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS, YLR412W is not an essential gene, similar to Arabidopsis SRR1 gene

name: FAS1
description: Beta subunit of fatty acid synthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of long-chain saturated fatty acids, contains acetyltransacylase, dehydratase, enoyl reductase, malonyl transacylase, and palmitoyl transacylase activities, enriched among several compartments

name: NTE1
description: Serine esterase, homolog of human neuropathy target esterase (NTE), Nte1p-mediated phosphatidylcholine turnover influences transcription factor Opi1p localization, affecting transcriptional regulation of phospholipid biosynthesis genes, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0302
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: ULP2
description: Peptidase that deconjugates Smt3/SUMO-1 peptides from proteins, plays a role in chromosome cohesion at centromeric regions and recovery from checkpoint arrest induced by DNA damage or DNA replication defects, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: ERO1
description: Thiol oxidase required for oxidative protein folding in the ER, essential in S. cerevisiae for maintaining proper redox balance in ER, feedback regulation of Ero1p occurs via reduction and oxidation of Ero1p regulatory bonds, reduced Pdi1p activates Ero1p by direct reduction of Ero1p regulatory bonds, depletion of thiol substrates and accumulation of oxidized Pdi1p results in inactivation of Ero1p by both Pdi1p-mediated oxidation and autonomous oxidation of Ero1p regulatory bonds, enriched in microsome and Golgi

name: TAF13
description: TFIID subunit (19 kDa), involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation, similar to histone H4 with atypical histone fold motif of Spt3-like transcription factors

name: SLD1
description: Delta 8 fatty acid desaturase, similar to Candida albicans SLD1

name: LSM3
description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein, part of heteroheptameric complexes (Lsm2p-7p and either Lsm1p or 8p): cytoplasmic Lsm1p complex involved in mRNA decay, nuclear Lsm8p complex part of U6 snRNP and possibly involved in processing tRNA, snoRNA, and rRNA, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose abundance increases and get relocalized to cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: YSH1
description: Endoribonuclease, subunit of the mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation specificity complex, required for 3' processing, splicing, and transcriptional termination of mRNAs and snoRNAs, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SYC1

name: ZCF2
description: Fungal zinc cluster transcription factor similar to Candida albicans ZCF2

name: PP7435_Chr1-0310
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: POB3
description: Subunit of the heterodimeric FACT complex (Spt16p-Pob3p), FACT associates with chromatin via interaction with Nhp6Ap and Nhp6Bp, and reorganizes nucleosomes to facilitate access to DNA by RNA and DNA polymerases, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SUB2
description: Component of the TREX complex required for nuclear mRNA export, member of the DEAD-box RNA helicase superfamily and is involved in early and late steps of spliceosome assembly, homolog of the human splicing factor hUAP56, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: ARP6
description: Actin-related protein that binds nucleosomes, a component of the SWR1 complex, which exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A

name: VTC5
description: Novel subunit of the vacuolar transporter chaperone complex, vacuolar transmembrane protein that regulates biosynthesis of polyphosphate, enriched in vacuole, in S. cerevisiae deletion reduces and overexpression increases polyP accumulation, SPX domain (Syg1, Pho81, Xpr1)-containing protein involved in phosphate homeostasis, relocalizes in S. cerevisiae from vacuole to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: SLU7
description: RNA splicing factor, required for ATP-independent portion of 2nd catalytic step of spliceosomal RNA splicing, interacts with Prp18p, contains zinc knuckle domain

name: RRP1
description: Essential evolutionarily conserved nucleolar protein in S. cerevisiae necessary for biogenesis of 60S ribosomal subunits and processing of pre-rRNAs to mature rRNAs, associated with several distinct 66S pre-ribosomal particles

name: SPT2
description: Protein involved in negative regulation of transcription, required for RNA polyadenylation, exhibits regulated interactions with both histones and SWI-SNF components, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, similar to mammalian HMG1 proteins

name: RAD4
description: Protein that recognizes and binds damaged DNA (with Rad23p) during nucleotide excision repair, subunit of Nuclear Excision Repair Factor 2 (NEF2), also involved, with Rad23p, in turnover of ubiquitylated proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0319
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: ARM repeat)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0320
description: Protein with similarity to YDR090C (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: STL1-1
description: Glycerol transporter of the plasma membrane, deletion in Pichia pastoris allow costitutive expression of Aox1 in glycerol medium, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein which is subject to glucose-induced inactivation, strongly but transiently induced when cells are subjected to osmotic shock, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GT1

name: DER1
description: Membrane protein that promotes export of misfolded polypeptides, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein, required for ER-associated protein degradation of misfolded or unassembled proteins, initiates export of aberrant polypeptides from ER lumen by threading them into ER membrane and routing them to Hrd1p for ubiquitination, function normally requires N-terminal acetylation by NatB, N- and C- termini protrude into cytoplasm, similar to Dfm1p, homolog of mammalian derlin-1

name: GCG1
description: Gamma-glutamyl cyclotransferase, cleaves the gamma-glutamyl bond of glutathione to yield 5-oxoproline and a Cys-Gly dipeptide, similar to mammalian pro-apoptotic protein ChaC1, expression of mouse ChaC1 in yeast increases apoptosis, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus, periodically expressed during the metabolic cycle

name: GAP1
description: General amino acid permease; involved in uptake of all L-amino acids, some D-amino acids, related compounds, toxic analogs and polyamines; regulated by nitrogen source, enriched in Golgi and, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae targeted to vacuole for degradation under preferential nitrogen source, and essential for invasive growth

name: PP7435_Chr1-0325
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ATG15
description: Lipase required for intravacuolar lysis of autophagic bodies and Cvt bodies, targeted to intravacuolar vesicles during autophagy via the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway

name: REI1
description: Pre-60S factor, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein required for the correct recycling of shuttling factors Alb1, Arx1 and Tif6 at the end of the ribosomal large subunit biogenesis, involved in bud growth in the mitotic signaling network

name: PP7435_Chr1-0328
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: mjaI restriction endonuclease)

name: TIM54
description: Component of the mitochondrial TIM22 complex involved in insertion of polytopic proteins into the inner membrane, enriched in mitochondria

name: TRM82
description: Catalytic subunit of a tRNA methyltransferase complex, Trm8p and Trm82p comprise an enzyme that catalyzes a methyl-transfer from S-adenosyl-l-methionine to the N(7) atom of guanine at position 46 in tRNA, Trm8 lacks catalytic activity if not bound to Trm82p, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: OPI1
