description: Transcriptional regulator of a variety of genes, phosphorylation by protein kinase A stimulates Opi1p function in negative regulation of phospholipid biosynthetic genes, involved in telomere maintenance, S. cerevisiae null exhibits disrupted mitochondrial metabolism and low cardiolipin content, strongly correlated with overproduction of inositol

name: VPS24
description: One of four subunits of the endosomal sorting complex required for transport III (ESCRT-III), forms an ESCRT-III subcomplex with Did4p, involved in the sorting of transmembrane proteins into the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway, enriched in vacuole

name: RET2
description: Delta subunit of the coatomer complex (COPI), enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein which coats Golgi-derived transport vesicles, involved in retrograde transport between Golgi and ER

name: PP7435_Chr1-0334
description: Putative transfer RNA for Tryptophan (tRNA-Trp)

name: SSZ1
description: Hsp70 protein that interacts with Zuo1p (a DnaJ homolog) to form a ribosome-associated complex that binds the ribosome via the Zuo1p subunit, also involved in pleiotropic drug resistance via sequential activation of PDR1 and PDR5, binds ATP, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-0336
description: Protein with low similarity to FAD dependent oxidoreductase superfamily proteins

name: DIA2
description: Origin-binding F-box protein, forms an SCF ubiquitin ligase complex with Skp1p and Cdc53p, plays a role in DNA replication, plays a role in transcription, required for correct assembly of RSC complex, correct RSC-mediated transcription regulation, and correct nucleosome positioning, involved in invasive and pseudohyphal growth, required to target Cdc6p for ubiquitin-mediated destruction during G1 phase

name: BAS1
description: Myb-related transcription factor involved in regulating basal and induced expression of genes of the purine and histidine biosynthesis pathways, also involved in regulation of meiotic recombination at specific genes

name: UBP11
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease, cleaves ubiquitin from ubiquitinated proteins, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog UBP7

name: ATG35
description: Component of the autophagic machinery in Pichia pastoris required for micropexophagy but not macropexophagy

name: GPB2
description: Multistep regulator of cAMP-PKA signaling, inhibits PKA downstream of Gpa2p and Cyr1p, thereby increasing cAMP dependency, inhibits Ras activity through direct interactions with Ira1p/2p, regulated by G-alpha protein Gpa2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GPB1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0342
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: mitochondrial ATPase expression, ATP13)

name: GPI12
description: ER membrane protein involved in the second step of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor assembly, the de-N-acetylation of the N-acetylglucosaminylphosphatidylinositol intermediate, functional homolog of human PIG-Lp, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: TFC3
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex, part of the TauB domain of TFIIIC that binds DNA at the BoxB promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes, cooperates with Tfc6p in DNA binding, largest of six subunits of the RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC)

name: IMP4
description: Component of the SSU processome, which is required for pre-18S rRNA processing, interacts with Mpp10p, member of a superfamily of proteins that contain a sigma(70)-like motif and associate with RNAs, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: MSK1
description: Lysine-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, required for import of both aminoacylated and deacylated forms of tRNA(Lys) into mitochondria and for aminoacylation of mitochondrially encoded tRNA(Lys)

name: SHL23
description: Non-essential SEC23 homolog in Pichia pastoris which is not present in S. cerevisiae, known to be localized at tER sites together with Sec23, Sec24 and Lst1, Shl23 deletion does not disrupt tER morphology, Shl23 associate selectively with Lst1

name: RNH201
description: Ribonuclease H2 catalytic subunit, removes RNA primers during Okazaki fragment synthesis and errant ribonucleotides misincorporated during DNA replication, homolog of RNAse HI, related to human AGS4 which causes Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome

name: LAT1
description: Dihydrolipoamide acetyltransferase component (E2) of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex, which catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: KNS1
description: Protein kinase involved in negative regulation of PolIII transcription, effector kinase of the TOR signaling pathway and phosphorylates Rpc53p to regulate ribosome and tRNA biosynthesis, member of the LAMMER family of protein kinases, which are serine/threonine kinases also capable of phosphorylating tyrosine residues, capable of autophosphorylation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0351
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TIF4632
description: Translation initiation factor eIF4G, subunit of the mRNA cap-binding protein complex (eIF4F) that also contains eIF4E (Cdc33p), associates with the poly(A)-binding protein Pab1p, also interacts with eIF4A (Tif1p), enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TIF4631

name: RPT6
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of six ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in the degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, bound by ubiquitin-protein ligases Ubr1p and Ufd4p, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein throughout the cell cycle, whose protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0354
description: Protein with low similarity to UFD1, substrate-recruiting cofactor of the Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p segregase, polyubiquitin binding protein that assists in the dislocation of misfolded ERAD substrates

name: ZAP1
description: Zinc-regulated transcription factor, binds to zinc-responsive promoters to induce transcription of certain genes in presence of zinc, represses other genes in low zinc, regulates its own transcription, contains seven zinc-finger domains

name: SPS1-2
description: Putative protein serine/threonine kinase expressed at the end of meiosis and known in S. cerevisiae as prospore membrane protein, required for correct localization of enzymes involved in spore wall synthesis

name: NUG1
description: GTPase that associates with nuclear 60S pre-ribosomes, required for export of 60S ribosomal subunits from the nucleus, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol

name: SUA7
description: Transcription factor TFIIB, a general transcription factor required for transcription initiation and start site selection by RNA polymerase II

name: PP7435_Chr1-0359
description: Protein with low similarity to pre-mRNA branch site p14-like protein of Ogataea parapolymorpha

name: HAS1
description: ATP-dependent RNA helicase, enriched in microsome and Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nuclear periphery and nucleolus, highly enriched in nuclear pore complex fractions, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles

name: FOL2
description: GTP-cyclohydrolase I, catalyzes the first step in the folic acid biosynthetic pathway, enriched among several compartments

name: YND1-1
description: Apyrase with wide substrate specificity, helps prevent inhibition of glycosylation by hydrolyzing nucleoside tri- and diphosphates that inhibit glycotransferases, partially redundant with Gda1p, mediates adenovirus E4orf4-induced toxicity, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: TMA20
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes, has a putative RNA binding domain, interacts with Tma22p, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant exhibits translation defects and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, has homology to human oncogene MCT-1

name: IST3
description: Component of the U2 snRNP, required for the first catalytic step of splicing and for spliceosomal assembly, interacts with Rds3p and is required for Mer1p-activated splicing

name: PP7435_Chr1-0365
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamine acid (tRNA-Gln)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0366
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamine acid (tRNA-Gln)

name: UTP8
description: Protein required for export of tRNAs from the nucleus, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, also copurifies with the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA

name: PP7435_Chr1-0368
description: Protein with similarity to YFR006W, enriched in cytosol (Putative X-Pro aminopeptidase, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and YFR006W is not an essential gene)

name: PCM1
description: Essential N-acetylglucosamine-phosphate mutase in S. cerevisiae, converts GlcNAc-6-P to GlcNAc-1-P, which is a precursor for the biosynthesis of chitin and for the formation of N-glycosylated mannoproteins and glycosylphosphatidylinositol anchors

name: LCL3
description: Putative protein of unknown function, has homology to Staphylococcus aureus nuclease, S. cerevisiae mutant has long chronological lifespan and the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to mitochondria, is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

name: GUP1
description: Protein involved in remodeling GPI anchors, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, member of the MBOAT family of putative membrane-bound O-acyltransferases, proposed to be involved in glycerol transport, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GUP2

name: EEP100
description: Putative endonuclease/exonuclease/phosphatase similar to Candida albicans EEP1, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: FBA1-1
description: Fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase, required for glycolysis and gluconeogenesis, catalyzes conversion of fructose 1,6 bisphosphate to glyceraldehyde-3-P and dihydroxyacetone-P, enriched in cytosol, locates in S. cerevisiae to mitochondrial outer surface upon oxidative stress

name: TIM12
description: Essential protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane, known in S. cerevisiae as peripheral protein, component of the TIM22 complex, which is a twin-pore translocase that mediates insertion of numerous multispanning inner membrane proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0377
description: Protein with low similarity to BTB domain and ankyrin repeat proteins

name: RPS22A
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S15A and bacterial S8, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPS22B

name: TTI1
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling, telomere length regulator involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1, similar to S. pombe Tti1p, in S. cerevisiae detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: REG1
description: Regulatory subunit of type 1 protein phosphatase Glc7p, involved in negative regulation of glucose-repressible genes, involved in regulation of the nucleocytoplasmic shuttling of Hxk2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog REG2

name: RPN9
description: Non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome, similar to putative proteasomal subunits in other species, S. cerevisiae null mutant is temperature sensitive and exhibits cell cycle and proteasome assembly defects, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: MUB1
description: MYND domain-containing protein required for ubiquitination and turnover of Rpn4p, interacts with Ubr2p (E3) and indirectly with Rad6p (E2), short-lived protein degraded in a Ubr2p/Rad6p dependent manner, similar to the A. nidulans samB gene

name: NPL3
description: RNA-binding protein, promotes elongation, regulates termination, and carries poly(A) mRNA from nucleus to cytoplasm, has a role in repressing translation initiation by binding eIF4G, required for pre-mRNA splicing, dissociation from mRNAs promoted by Mtr10p, phosphorylated by Sky1p in the cytoplasm, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: KIP3-3
description: Kinesin-related motor protein involved in mitotic spindle positioning

name: UBX2
description: Bridging factor involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), bridges the cytosolic Cdc48p-Npl1p-Ufd1p ATPase complex and the membrane associated Ssm4p and Hrd1p ubiquitin ligase complexes, contains a UBX (ubiquitin regulatory X) domain and a ubiquitin-associated (UBA) domain, in S. cerevisiae redistributes from the ER to lipid droplets during the diauxic shift and stationary phase, required for the maintenance of lipid homeostasis

name: PP7435_Chr1-0387
description: Protein with similarity to YDL218W, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae YDL218W transcription is regulated by Azf1p and induced by starvation and aerobic conditions and expression also induced in cells treated with the mycotoxin patulin)

name: HLJ1
description: Co-chaperone for Hsp40p, anchored in the ER membrane, with its homolog Ydj1p promotes ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD) of integral membrane substrates, similar to E. coli DnaJ, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: INO80
description: ATPase and nucleosome spacing factor, subunit of complex containing actin and actin-related proteins that has chromatin remodeling activity and 3' to 5' DNA helicase activity in vitro, has a role in modulating stress gene transcription

name: RRS1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae that binds ribosomal protein L11, required for nuclear export of the 60S pre-ribosomal subunit during ribosome biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleolus and in foci along nuclear periphery, cooperates with Ebp2p and Mps3p to mediate telomere clustering by binding Sir4p, but is not involved in telomere tethering, mouse homolog shows altered expression in Huntington's disease model mice

name: PP7435_Chr1-0391
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: SWIB/MDM2 domain)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0392
description: Protein with similarity to YOR296W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, is expressed during copper starvation and YOR296W is not an essential gene)

name: LAM5
description: Putative sterol transfer protein, one of six StART-like domain-containing proteins in yeast that may be involved in sterol transfer between intracellular membranes, conserved across eukaryotes, has both GRAM and StART-like (VASt) domains, known in S. cerevisiae as protein present at membrane contact sites throughout the cell, including nucleus-vacuole junctions and ER-mitochondrial contact sites, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog LAM6

name: PP7435_Chr1-0394
description: Protein with low similarity to magnesium transport protein corA

name: PP7435_Chr1-0395
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: ORF6N)

name: TAF6
description: Subunit (60 kDa) of TFIID and SAGA complexes, involved in transcription initiation of RNA polymerase II and in chromatin modification, similar to histone H4, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RMD9
description: Mitochondrial protein required for respiratory growth, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutant phenotype and genetic interactions suggest a role in delivering mt mRNAs to ribosomes, located in S. cerevisiae on matrix face of the inner membrane and loosely associated with mitoribosome

name: GPA1
description: Subunit of the G protein involved in pheromone response, GTP-binding alpha subunit of the heterotrimeric G protein, negatively regulates the mating pathway by sequestering G(beta)gamma and by triggering an adaptive response, activates Vps34p at the endosome, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PCL5
description: Cyclin, interacts with and phosphorylated by Pho85p cyclin-dependent kinase (Cdk), induced in S. cerevisiae by Gcn4p at level of transcription, specifically required for Gcn4p degradation, may be sensor of cellular protein biosynthetic capacity

name: RSM7
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, has similarity to E. coli S7 ribosomal protein, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: COR1
description: Core subunit of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (bc1 complex), which is a component of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-0403
description: Protein with low similarity to ART10, protein of unknown function that contains 2 PY motifs

name: SET2-2
description: Histone methyltransferase with a role in transcriptional elongation, methylates H3 lysine 36, which suppresses incorporation of acetylated histones and signals for the deacetylation of these histones within transcribed genes, associates with the C-terminal domain of Rpo21p, histone methylation activity is regulated by phosphorylation status of Rpo21p, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: CDA2
description: Chitin deacetylase, together with Cda1p involved in the biosynthesis ascospore wall component, chitosan, required for proper rigidity of the ascospore wall

name: PP7435_Chr1-0406
description: Protein with similarity to YJL055W, enriched in cytosol (Putative protein of unknown function, proposed to be involved in the metabolism of purine and pyrimidine base analogues, S. cerevisiae deletion mutants are sensitive to HAP and AHA and the overexpression confers resistance to 5-FOA and 5-FU)

name: PBS2
description: MAP kinase kinase of the HOG signaling pathway, activated under severe osmotic stress, mitophagy-specific regulator, plays a role in regulating Ty1 transposition, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: SIN4
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, contributes to both postive and negative transcriptional regulation, dispensible for basal transcription

name: GDH3
description: NADP(+)-dependent glutamate dehydrogenase, synthesizes glutamate from ammonia and alpha-ketoglutarate, rate of alpha-ketoglutarate utilization differs from Gdh1p, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by nitrogen and carbon sources, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GDH1

name: POX18
description: Protein similar to peroxisomal protein POX18 of C. tropicalis, induced by oleate, enriched in peroxisome in glucose-grown cells

name: SOD600
description: Putative Cu/Zn superoxide dismutase, similar to Candida albicans SOD6

name: ISA1
description: Protein required for maturation of mitochondrial [4Fe-4S] proteins, functions in a complex with Isa2p and possibly Iba57p, in S. cerevisiae isa1 deletion causes loss of mitochondrial DNA and respiratory deficiency, depletion reduces growth on nonfermentable carbon sources, functional ortholog of bacterial A-type ISC proteins

name: FRA1-1
description: Protein involved in negative regulation of transcription of iron regulon, forms an iron independent complex with Fra2p, Grx3p, and Grx4p, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae known as cytosolic protein, whose mutant fails to repress transcription of iron regulon and is defective in spore formation

name: KAP122

description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: FUN14 family), enriched in Golgi and mitochondria

description: Member of the DRG family of GTP-binding proteins, associates with translating ribosomes, interacts with Tma46p, Ygr250cp, Gir2p and Yap1p via two-hybrid, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: FUN12

name: THO2
description: Subunit of the THO complex, which is required for efficient transcription elongation and involved in transcriptional elongation-associated recombination, required for LacZ RNA expression from certain plasmids

name: YSF3
description: Component of the SF3b subcomplex of the U2 snRNP, essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for for splicing and for assembly of SF3b

name: PP7435_Chr1-0569
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1774), enriched in mitochondria

name: INN1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae that associates with contractile actomyosin ring, required for ingression of the plasma membrane into the bud neck during cytokinesis, C2 domain, a membrane targeting module, is required for function, activates chitin synthase activity of Chs2p during cytokinesis, enriched in plasma membrane

name: RPC31
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C31

name: PGA2
description: Essential protein required for maturation of Gas1p and Pho8p, involved in protein trafficking, enriched in microsome, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the ER and YFP-fusion protein to the nuclear envelope-ER network, S. cerevisiae null mutants have a cell separation defect

name: ALF1
description: Alpha-tubulin folding protein, similar to mammalian cofactor B, Alf1p-GFP localizes in S. cerevisiae to cytoplasmic microtubules, required for the folding of alpha-tubulin and may play an additional role in microtubule maintenance

name: LSM7

name: FUR1
description: Uracil phosphoribosyltransferase, synthesizes UMP from uracil, involved in the pyrimidine salvage pathway, enriched in cytosol

name: ARP1
description: Actin-related protein of the dynactin complex, required for spindle orientation and nuclear migration, putative ortholog of mammalian centractin

name: PP7435_Chr1-0577
description: Putative transfer RNA for Tyrosine (tRNA-Tyr)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0578
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Interferon-related developmental regulator)

name: PHO4-1
description: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factor of the myc-family, activates in S. cerevisiae transcription cooperatively with Pho2p in response to phosphate limitation, binding to 'CACGTG' motif is regulated by chromatin restriction, competitive binding of Cbf1p to the same DNA binding motif and cooperation with Pho2p,, function is regulated by phosphorylation at multiple sites and by phosphate availability

name: PP7435_Chr1-0580
description: Protein with similarity to YGR125W, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae deletion mutant has decreased rapamycin resistance but normal wormannin resistance and the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole)

name: CPR5
description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin) of the ER, catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues, enriched in microsome and among several compartments, transcriptionally induced in S. cerevisiae in response to unfolded proteins in the ER, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog CPR2

name: JNM1
description: Component of the yeast dynactin complex, consisting of Nip100p, Jnm1p, and Arp1p, required for proper nuclear migration and spindle partitioning during mitotic anaphase B

name: SLH1
description: Putative RNA helicase related to Ski2p, involved in translation inhibition of non-poly(A) mRNAs, required for repressing propagation of dsRNA viruses

name: EFG1
description: Essential protein required for maturation of 18S rRNA, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant is sensitive to hydroxyurea and is delayed in recovering from alpha-factor arrest and the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleolus

name: GOT1
description: Homodimeric protein that is packaged into COPII vesicles and cycles between the ER and Golgi, involved in secretory transport but not directly required for aspects of transport assayed in vitro, may influence membrane composition

name: PP7435_Chr1-0586
description: Protein with low similarity to HUA1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0587
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MIH1
description: Protein tyrosine phosphatase involved in cell cycle control, regulates the phosphorylation state of Cdc28p, homolog of S. pombe cdc25

name: IMP2
description: Catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial inner membrane peptidase complex, required for maturation of mitochondrial proteins of the intermembrane space, complex contains Imp1p and Imp2p (both catalytic subunits), and Som1p, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: CCS1
description: Copper chaperone for superoxide dismutase Sod1p, involved in oxidative stress protection, Met-X-Cys-X2-Cys motif within the N-terminal portion is involved in insertion of copper into Sod1p under conditions of copper deprivation, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0591
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YET1
description: ER transmembrane protein, enriched in microsome and Golgi, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, homolog of human BAP31 protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YET2

name: PP7435_Chr1-0593
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PI31 proteasome regulator)

name: SOL1
description: Protein with a possible role in tRNA export, shows similarity to 6-phosphogluconolactonase non-catalytic domains but does not exhibit this enzymatic activity, homologous to Sol3p and Sol4p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SOL2, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0595
description: Protein with low similarity to lmbr1-like conserved region containing proteins, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PTC6
description: Type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C) with similarity to mammalian PP1Ks, involved in mitophagy, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, the null mutant is sensitive to rapamycin and has decreased phosphorylation of the Pda1 subunit of pyruvate dehydrogenase

name: SOR1
description: Unique sorbitol dehydrogenase in Pichia pastoris whose promoter has activity similar to GAP promoter using different carbon souces, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced in the presence of sorbitol or xylose

name: XKS1
description: Xylulokinase, converts D-xylulose and ATP to xylulose 5-phosphate and ADP, rate limiting step in fermentation of xylulose, required for xylose fermentation by recombinant S. cerevisiae strains

name: ARR3
description: Metalloid/H+ antiporter, transports arsenite and antimonite, required for resistance to arsenic compounds, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein which transcription is activated by Arr1p in the presence of arsenite

name: RNR1
description: Major isoform of large subunit of ribonucleotide-diphosphate reductase, the RNR complex catalyzes rate-limiting step in dNTP synthesis, regulated by DNA replication and DNA damage checkpoint pathways via localization of small subunits, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RNR3

name: RPS27A
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S27, no bacterial homolog, enriched in plasma membrane, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPS27B

name: THI73
description: Putative plasma membrane permease, proposed to be involved in carboxylic acid upTake and repressed in S. cerevisiae by thiamine, substrate of Dbf2p/Mob1p kinase, transcription is altered if mitochondrial dysfunction occurs

name: PP7435_Chr1-0603
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: prefoldin chaperonin cofactor (also called GimC), is a complex in Archaea and Eukaryota, that works with group II chaperonins)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0604
description: Protein with similarity to YDR306C (F-box protein of unknown function, interacts with Sgt1p via a Leucine-Rich Repeat (LRR) domain)

name: PMT5
description: Protein O-mannosyltransferase, transfers mannose residues from dolichyl phosphate-D-mannose to protein serine/threonine residues, acts in S. cerevisiae in a complex with Pmt3p, can instead interact with Pmt2p in some conditions, target for new antifungals, enriched among several compartments

name: DAL5-1
description: Allantoate permease, ureidosuccinate permease, also transports dipeptides, though with lower affinity than for allantoate and ureidosuccinate, expression in S. cerevisiae is constitutive but sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression

name: SRB7

name: VMA22
description: Protein that is required for vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase) function, peripheral membrane protein, not an actual component of the V-ATPase complex, functions in the assembly of the V-ATPase, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein

name: PP7435_Chr1-0609
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SSF2
description: Protein required for ribosomal large subunit maturation, functionally redundant with Ssf1p, member of the Brix family, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSF1

name: RRP3
description: Protein involved in rRNA processing, required for maturation of the 35S primary transcript of pre-rRNA and for cleavage leading to mature 18S rRNA, homologous to eIF-4a, which is a DEAD box RNA-dependent ATPase with helicase activity, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: UTR2
description: Chitin transglycosylase that functions in the transfer of chitin to beta(1-6) and beta(1-3) glucans in the cell wall, similar to and functionally redundant with Crh1, enriched in plasma membrane, glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI)-anchored protein localized to bud neck

name: COP1
description: Alpha subunit of COPI vesicle coatomer complex, which surrounds transport vesicles in the early secretory pathway, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: JHD1
description: JmjC domain family histone demethylase specific for H3-K36, similar to proteins found in human, mouse, drosophila, X. laevis, C. elegans, and S. pombe

name: RSM18
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, has similarity to E. coli S18 ribosomal protein, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PKP1-1
description: Protein kinase involved in negative regulation of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex activity by phosphorylating the ser-133 residue of the Pda1p subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, acts in concert with kinase Pkp2p and phosphatases Ptc5p and Ptc6p

name: LDB17
description: Protein involved in the pre-rRNA processing, transiently recruited to actin cortical patches in a SLA1-dependent manner after late coat component assembly, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the periphery, cytoplasm, bud, and bud neck

name: PP7435_Chr1-0618
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: MIT)

name: RPN5
description: Subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) and non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome lid, similar to mammalian p55 subunit and to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn7p, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Rpn5p is an essential protein

name: SNF3
description: Low glucose sensor, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, regulates glucose transport, high affinity sensor that contains 12 predicted transmembrane segments and a long C-terminal tail required for induction of hexose transporters, also senses fructose and mannose, unique S. cerevisiae SNF3/RGT2 ortholog in Pichia pastoris which might plays an important role in autophagic degradation of peroxisomes and glucose catabolite repression, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RGT2, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSS1

name: NUS1
description: Forms dehydrodolichyl diphosphate syntase complex with RER2 or SRT1, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae tet-repressible mutant shows accumulation of hypoglycosylated forms of CPY, suggesting that Nus1p may be involved in protein trafficking, mutations in human homolog NUS1 have been implicated in congenital scoliosis, neurological impairment, refractory epilepsy, hearing deficit, and visual impairment, human cis-prenyltransferase complex complements yeast null mutant

name: RPL35B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L35B, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L35 and bacterial L29, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL35A

name: UFD2

name: RBS1
description: Protein involved in assembly of the RNA polymerase III (Pol III) complex, in S. cerevisiae high copy suppressor of Pol III assembly mutation and psk1 psk2 mutations that confer temperature-sensitivity for galactose utilization, physically interacts with Pol III, proposed to bind single-stranded nucleic acids via its R3H domain

name: RDI1
description: Rho GDP dissociation inhibitor, involved in the localization and regulation of Cdc42p and Rho1p, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0626
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0627
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: OHCU decarboxylase involved in purine catabolism)

name: PPH22
description: Catalytic subunit of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), functionally redundant with Pph21p, methylated at C terminus, forms alternate complexes with several regulatory subunits, involved in signal transduction and regulation of mitosis, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PPH21

name: PP7435_Chr1-0629
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: VMA1
description: Subunit A of the eight-subunit V1 peripheral membrane domain of the vacuolar H+-ATPase, enriched in cytosol, protein precursor undergoes self-catalyzed splicing to yield the extein Tfp1p and the intein Vde (PI-SceI), which is a site-specific endonuclease

name: PP7435_Chr1-0631
description: Protein with similarity to YDL183C (Protein, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, thought to be involved in the formation of an active mitochondrial K+/H+ exchanger (KHE) system, in S. cerevisiae YDL183C is a non-essential gene)

name: SRF1
description: Regulator of phospholipase D (Spo14p), interacts with Spo14p and regulates its catalytic activity, capable of buffering the toxicity of C16:0 platelet activating factor, a lipid that accumulates intraneuronally in Alzheimer's patients

name: CDC53
description: Cullin, structural protein of SCF complexes (which also contain Skp1p, Cdc34p, Hrt1p and an F-box protein) involved in ubiquitination, SCF promotes the G1-S transition by targeting G1 cyclins and the Cln-CDK inhibitor Sic1p for degradation, enriched in cytosol

name: LYS21

name: VPS54
description: Component of the GARP (Golgi-associated retrograde protein) complex, Vps51p-Vps52p-Vps53p-Vps54p, which is required for the recycling of proteins from endosomes to the late Golgi, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: INH1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0637
description: Protein with low similarity to U5 snRNP complex subunit (Aspergillus sp)

name: RAD15
description: Putative DNA-dependent ATPase of the nucleotide excision repair factor 4 complex, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis RAD15

name: FBA1-2
description: Fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase with essential role in the xylulose-5-phosphate cycle for methanol assimilation, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-0640
description: Protein with similarity to YNL144C, enriched in mitochondria (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, contains a PH domain and binds phosphatidylinositols and phosphatidylethanolamine in a large-scale study, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YHR131C)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0641
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: QCR7
description: Subunit 7 of the ubiquinol cytochrome-c reductase complex, which is a component of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, oriented facing the mitochondrial matrix, N-terminus appears to play a role in complex assembly, enriched in mitochondria

name: APA1
description: AP4A phosphorylase, bifunctional diadenosine 5',5'''-P1,P4-tetraphosphate phosphorylase and ADP sulfurylase involved in catabolism of bis(5'-nucleosidyl) tetraphosphates, catalyzes phosphorolysis of dinucleoside oligophosphates, cleaving substrates' alpha/beta-anhydride bond and introducing Pi into the beta-position of the corresponding NDP formed, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases under DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog APA2

name: CAB1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0645
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: chromosome_partition_protein_Smc)

name: PEX36
description: Proteins of Pichia pastoris, known as peroxisomal protein, functionally redundant to Pex25, involved in peroxisome biogenesis and ER to peroxisome traffic of peroxisomal membrane proteins

name: PRD1
description: Zinc metalloendopeptidase, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae also as mitochondrial intermembrane space protein, with Cym1p, involved in degradation of mitochondrial proteins and of presequence peptides cleaved from imported proteins, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0648
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0649
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MRC1
description: S-phase checkpoint protein required for DNA replication, interacts with and stabilizes Pol2p at stalled replication forks during stress, where it forms a pausing complex with Tof1p and is phosphorylated by Mec1p, protects uncapped telomeres

name: MIC10
description: Conserved component of the MICOS complex, MICOS (formerly MINOS or MitOS) is a mitochondrial inner membrane complex that extends into the intermembrane space and has a role in the maintenance of crista junctions, inner membrane architecture, and formation of contact sites to the outer membrane, forms a subcomplex with Mic12p and Mic27p whose assembly and stability requires cardiolipin, homo-oligomers cause membrane bending, ortholog of human MINOS1, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PP7435_Chr1-0652
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF644)

name: KRR1
description: Protein required for rRNA synthesis and ribosomal assembly, required for the synthesis of 18S rRNA and for the assembly of 40S ribosomal subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as essential nucleolar protein

name: PRM1
description: Pheromone-regulated multispanning membrane protein involved in membrane fusion during mating, predicted to have 5 transmembrane segments and a coiled coil domain, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the shmoo tip and regulated by Ste12p, not related to the transcription factor Trm1 of Pichia pastoris

name: PP7435_Chr1-0655
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: EMG1
description: Methyltransferase for rRNA, catalyzes methylation of the pseudouridine residue 1191 of 18S rRNA, member of the SPOUT methyltransferase family, required for maturation of 18S rRNA and for 40S ribosomal subunit production independently of methyltransferase activity, forms homodimers, human ortholog is mutated in Bowen-Conradi syndrome, and the equivalent mutation in yeast affects Emg1p dimerization and localization but not its methyltransferase activity, enriched in cytosol

name: LCD1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for the DNA integrity checkpoint pathways, interacts physically with Mec1p, putative homolog of S. pombe Rad26 and human ATRIP, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: RPL37A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L37A, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L37, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL37B

name: KCC4
