name: LYP1
description: Lysine permease, one of three amino acid permeases (Alp1p, Can1p, Lyp1p) responsible for upTake of cationic amino acids, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: RPL5
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L5, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L5 and bacterial L18, binds 5S rRNA and is required for 60S subunit assembly, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: HER1
description: Protein of unknown function required for proliferation or remodeling of the ER that is caused by overexpression of Hmg2p, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GIP3

name: PP7435_Chr1-0664
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF3169)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0665
description: Putative transfer RNA for Proline (tRNA-Pro)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0666
description: Putative transfer RNA for Proline (tRNA-Pro)

name: STE50
description: Adaptor protein for various signaling pathways, involved in mating response, invasive/filamentous growth, osmotolerance, acts as an adaptor that links G protein-associated Cdc42p-Ste20p complex to the effector Ste11p to modulate signal transduction

name: SRO9
description: RNA-binding protein, associates with translating ribosomes, involved in heme regulation of Hap1p as a component of the HMC complex, also involved in the organization of actin filaments, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein, contains a La motif, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SLF1

name: PMP4
description: Putative peroxisomal protein, similar to Candida albicans PMP4

name: ATG22
description: Membrane protein required for efflux of amino acids during autophagic body breakdown in the vacuole, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar integral membrane protein, where the null mutation causes a gradual loss of viability during starvation

name: DAL5-2
description: Allantoate permease, ureidosuccinate permease, also transports dipeptides, though with lower affinity than for allantoate and ureidosuccinate, expression in S. cerevisiae is constitutive but sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression

name: PP7435_Chr1-0673
description: Protein with low similarity to glycosyl hydrolase family 88

name: LRA41
description: Dihydrodipicolinate synthase similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis LRA41

name: ADH7
description: NADPH-dependent medium chain alcohol dehydrogenase with broad substrate specificity, member of the cinnamyl family of alcohol dehydrogenases, may be involved in fusel alcohol synthesis or in aldehyde tolerance

name: LAG1
description: Ceramide synthase component, involved in synthesis of ceramide from C26(acyl)-coenzyme A and dihydrosphingosine or phytosphingosine, functionally equivalent to Lac1p, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae forms ER foci upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog LAC1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0677
description: Protein with low similarity to ribonuclease H1 small subunits

name: PP7435_Chr1-0678
description: Protein with similarity to YGR111W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus)

name: YPR1
description: NADPH-dependent aldo-keto reductase, reduces multiple substrates including 2-methylbutyraldehyde and D,L-glyceraldehyde, in S. cerevisiae expression is induced by osmotic and oxidative stress, is functionally redundant with other aldo-keto reductases and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GCY1

name: SDD4-1
description: Putative transcription factor, as suggested by computational analysis, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS, in S. cerevisiae overproduction of a truncation allele suppresses lethality due to expression of the dominant PET9 allele AAC2-A128P

name: UFD4
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase (E3), interacts with Rpt4p and Rpt6p, two subunits of the 19S particle of the 26S proteasome, cytoplasmic E3 involved in the degradation of ubiquitin fusion proteins, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: MRT4
description: Protein involved in mRNA turnover and ribosome assembly, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleolus

name: MIF2
description: Protein required for structural integrity of elongating spindles, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of to the kinetochore, interacts with histones H2A, H2B, and H4, phosphorylated by Ipl1p, orthologous to human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-C and fission yeast cnp3

name: SPS1-1
description: Putative protein serine/threonine kinase expressed at the end of meiosis and known in S. cerevisiae as prospore membrane protein, required for correct localization in S. cerevisiae of enzymes involved in spore wall synthesis

name: PP7435_Chr1-0685
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0686
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: RNH1
description: Ribonuclease H1, able to bind double-stranded RNAs and RNA-DNA hybrids, associates with RNAse polymerase I, the homolog of mammalian RNAse HII (the S. cerevisiae homolog of mammalian RNAse HI is RNH201)

name: UFD1
description: Substrate-recruiting cofactor of the Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p segregase, polyubiquitin binding protein that assists in the dislocation of misfolded, ERAD substrates that are subsequently delivered to the proteasome for degradation, involved in regulated destruction of ER membrane proteins such as HMG-CoA reductase (Hmg1/2p) and cytoplasmic proteins (Fbp1p), involved in mobilizing membrane bound transaction factors by regulated Ub/proteasome-dependent processing (RUP)

name: TFC4
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex, one of six subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC), part of the TauA domain of TFIIIC that binds BoxA DNA promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes, has TPR motifs, human homolog is TFIIIC-102

name: IST1
description: Protein with a positive role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway, functions and forms a complex with Did2p, recruitment to endosomes is mediated by the Vps2p-Vps24p subcomplex of ESCRT-III, also interacts with Vps4p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0691
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RTG1
description: Transcription factor required for the utilization of glutamate as the sole carbon source, in P. pastoris required also for the metabolism of methanol, ethanol, acetate, and oleic acid but not of glucose and glycerol, P. pastoris Rtg1 does not heterodimerize with Rtg3 like in S. cerevisiae, P. pastoris Rtg1 can functionally complement S. cerevisiae Rtg1, but not viceversa

name: SFT2-1
description: Tetra-spanning membrane protein known in S. cerevisiae as protein mainly of the late Golgi, in S. cerevisiae non-essential, can suppress some sed5 alleles, may be part of the transport machinery, but precise function is unknown, similar to mammalian syntaxin 5

name: NAT1
description: Subunit of the N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA (Nat1p, Ard1p, Nat5p), N-terminally acetylates many proteins, which influences multiple processes such as the cell cycle, heat-shock resistance, mating, sporulation, and telomeric silencing, enriched in cytosol

name: SIR2
description: Conserved NAD+ dependent histone deacetylase of the Sirtuin family, involved in regulation of lifespan, plays roles in silencing at HML, HMR, telomeres, and the rDNA locus, negatively regulates initiation of DNA replication, functions as a regulator of autophagy like mammalian homolog SIRT1, and also of mitophagy, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HST1

name: ADY2-4
description: Acetate transporter required for normal sporulation, phosphorylated in mitochondria, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ATO2 and three additional copies of ADY2

name: MKC7
description: GPI-anchored aspartyl protease, member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance, in S. cerevisiae shares functions with Yap3p and Kex2p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YPS1

name: HAC1
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor (ATF/CREB1 homolog), regulates the unfolded protein response, via UPRE binding, and membrane biogenesis, ER stress-induced splicing pathway facilitates efficient Hac1p synthesis, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RPL9B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L9B, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L9 and bacterial L6, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPL9A

name: SNU23
description: Component of U4/U6.U5 snRNP involved in mRNA splicing via spliceosome

name: AIM36
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant displays reduced respiratory growth and elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss and the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: MRPS8
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: TPP1
description: DNA 3'-phosphatase, functions in repair of endogenous damage of double-stranded DNA, activity is specific for removal of 3' phosphates at strand breaks, similar to the l-2-haloacid dehalogenase superfamily, homolog of human polynucleotide kinase/3'-phosphatase

name: PP7435_Chr1-0706
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0707
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ARG4
description: Argininosuccinate lyase, catalyzes the final step in the arginine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in cytosol

name: DED81
description: Cytosolic asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase, required for protein synthesis, catalyzes the specific attachment of asparagine to its cognate tRNA, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0710
description: Protein with similarity to YHR020W, enriched in cytosol (Prolyl-tRNA synthetase, N-terminal domain shows weak homology to prokaryotic posttransfer editing domain, but does not possess posttransfer editing activity, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments)

name: SLM5
description: Asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: CHS1
description: Chitin synthase I, requires activation from zymogenic form in order to catalyze the transfer of N-acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc) to chitin, required for repairing the chitin septum during cytokinesis, enriched in Golgi, in S. cerevisiae transcription is activated by mating factor

name: PXP1
description: Protein well-conserved in fungi, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal matrix protein, contains tripartite homology domain of thiamine pyrophosphate (TPP) enzymes, in S. cerevisiae targeted to peroxisomes by Pex5p, contains low sequence identity with Pdc1p, mRNA identified as translated by ribosome profiling data

name: NPP1
description: Nucleotide pyrophosphatase/phosphodiesterase, mediates extracellular nucleotide phosphate hydrolysis along with Npp2p and Pho5p, activity and expression in S. cerevisiae enhanced during conditions of phosphate starvation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NPP2

name: PP7435_Chr1-0715
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: HIS2
description: Histidinolphosphatase, catalyzes the eighth step in histidine biosynthesis, in S. cerevisiae mutations cause histidine auxotrophy and sensitivity to Cu, Co, and Ni salts and transcription is regulated by general amino acid control

name: PDR5
description: Plasma membrane ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, multidrug transporter actively regulated by Pdr1p, also involved in steroid transport, cation resistance, and cellular detoxification during exponential growth, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PDR15

name: PP7435_Chr1-0718
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Zinc finger, C3HC4 type (RING finger)), not conserved in S. cerevisiae, predicted peroxisomal

name: PP7435_Chr1-0719
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Sad1 / UNC-like C-terminal)

name: YMC1-2
description: Secondary glycine transporter known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, required with HEM25 for the transport of glycine into mitochondria for the initiation of heme biosynthesis, proposed role in oleate metabolism and glutamate biosynthesis, member of the mitochondrial carrier (MCF) family, in S. cerevisiae localizes to the vacuole in response to H2O2, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YMC2

name: PP7435_Chr1-0721
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0722
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0723
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Mysoin-binding motif of peroxisomes, peroxisome transmembrane receptor)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0725
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DDE superfamily endonuclease)

name: RGI2
description: Protein of unknown function, involved in energy metabolism under respiratory conditions, in S. cerevisiae expression induced under carbon limitation and repressed under high glucose, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RGI1

name: FMO1-3
description: Flavin-containing monooxygenase, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cytoplasmic face of the ER membrane, catalyzes oxidation of biological thiols to maintain the ER redox buffer ratio for correct folding of disulfide-bonded proteins

name: KAP123
description: Karyopherin beta, mediates nuclear import of ribosomal proteins prior to assembly into ribosomes and import of histones H3 and H4, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nuclear pore, nucleus, and cytoplasm, exhibits genetic interactions with RAI1

name: VMA21
description: Integral membrane protein that is required for vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase) function, although not an actual component of the V-ATPase complex, functions in the assembly of the V-ATPase, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein

name: ERG24
description: C-14 sterol reductase, acts in ergosterol biosynthesis,, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutants accumulate the abnormal sterol ignosterol (ergosta-8,14 dienol), and are viable under anaerobic growth conditions but inviable on rich medium under aerobic conditions

name: VOA1
description: Protein that functions in assembly of the V0 sector of V-ATPase, functions with other assembly factors, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, where the null mutation enhances the vacuolar ATPase (V-ATPase) deficiency of a vma21 mutant impaired in ER retrieval

name: PP7435_Chr1-0732
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ECM2
description: Pre-mRNA splicing factor, facilitates the cooperative formation of U2/U6 helix II in association with stem II in the spliceosome, function may be regulated by Slu7p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0735
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: EVE superfamily)

name: ADY2-2
description: Acetate transporter required for normal sporulation, phosphorylated in mitochondria, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ATO2 and three isoforms of ADY2

name: ADY2-3
description: Acetate transporter required for normal sporulation, phosphorylated in mitochondria, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ATO2 and three isoforms of ADY2

name: EHT1
description: Acyl-coenzymeA:ethanol O-acyltransferase, plays a minor role in medium-chain fatty acid ethyl ester biosynthesis, possesses short-chain esterase activity, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to lipid particles and the mitochondrial outer membrane, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EEB1

name: CHO1
description: Phosphatidylserine synthase, functions in phospholipid biosynthesis, catalyzes the reaction CDP-diaclyglycerol + L-serine -> CMP + L-1-phosphatidylserine, transcriptionally repressed in S. cerevisiae by myo-inositol and choline

name: SHY1
description: Protein required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, associates with complex IV assembly intermediates and complex III/complex IV supercomplexes, similar to human SURF1 involved in Leigh Syndrome

name: PP7435_Chr1-0741
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0742
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Myb/SANT-like DNA-binding domain)

name: SRT1
description: Cis-prenyltransferase involved in synthesis of long-chain dolichols (19-22 isoprene units, as opposed to Rer2p which synthesizes shorter-chain dolichols), known in S. cerevisiae as lipid bodies protein where its transcription is induced during stationary phase, long-chain dolichols are synthesized in Pichia pastoris cells grown in the presence of methanol or oleic acid

name: MUG70
description: Meiotically up-regulated gene 70 protein similar to S. pombe MUG70, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: MRPL13
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, not essential in S. cerevisiae for mitochondrial translation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0746
description: Protein with similarity to YOR283W (Phosphatase with a broad substrate specificity and some similarity to GPM1/YKL152C, a phosphoglycerate mutase, in S. cerevisiae YOR283W is not an essential gene)

name: ENA2
description: P-type ATPase sodium pump, involved in Na+ efflux to allow salt tolerance, likely not involved in Li+ efflux, enriched among several compartments

name: ADE4
description: Phosphoribosylpyrophosphate amidotransferase (PRPPAT), catalyzes first step of the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway, also known as amidophosphoribosyltransferase, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0749
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ILV5
description: Acetohydroxyacid reductoisomerase and mtDNA binding protein, involved in branched-chain amino acid biosynthesis and maintenance of wild-type mitochondrial DNA, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, found in S. cerevisiae in mitochondrial nucleoids

name: PRX1-2
description: Peroxiredoxin with thioredoxin peroxidase activity, has a role in reduction of hydroperoxides, reactivation requires Trr2p and glutathione, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, induced during respiratory growth and oxidative stress, phosphorylated, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RME1
description: Zinc finger protein involved in control of meiosis, prevents meiosis by repressing IME1 expression and promotes mitosis by activating CLN2 expression, directly repressed by a1-alpha2 regulator, mediates cell type control of sporulation, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0753
description: Putative transfer RNA for Histidine (tRNA-His)

name: UBP13
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease that cleaves Ub-protein fusions, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog UBP9

name: PRS4
description: 5-phospho-ribosyl-1(alpha)-pyrophosphate synthetase, synthesizes PRPP, which is required for nucleotide, histidine, and tryptophan biosynthesis, one of five related enzymes, which are active as heteromultimeric complexes, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PRS2

name: UBC6
description: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme involved in ER-associated protein degradation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cytosolic side of the ER membrane, tail region contains a transmembrane segment at the C-terminus, substrate of the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway

name: RPS8A
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S8, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS8B

name: PP7435_Chr1-0758
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-0759
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: FMN-binding split barrel)

name: NHP10
description: In S. cerevisiae non-essential INO80 chromatin remodeling complex subunit, preferentially binds DNA ends, protecting them from exonucleatic cleavage, deletion affects telomere maintenance via recombination, related to mammalian high mobility group proteins

name: UTP20
description: Component of the small-subunit (SSU) processome, which is involved in the biogenesis of the 18S rRNA

name: RMD1
description: Protein required for sporulation, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in microsome and Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: ECM15
description: Non-essential protein of unknown function in S. cerevisiae, likely exists as tetramer, may be regulated by the binding of small-molecule ligands (possibly sulfate ions), may have a role in yeast cell-wall biogenesis

name: PP7435_Chr1-0764
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: MAK11
description: Protein involved in an early, nucleolar step of 60S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, enriched in cytosol, essential in S. cerevisiae for cell growth and replication of killer M1 dsRNA virus, contains four beta-transducin repeats

name: LYS1
description: Saccharopine dehydrogenase (NAD+, L-lysine-forming), catalyzes the conversion of saccharopine to L-lysine, which is the final step in the lysine biosynthesis pathway, also has mRNA binding activity, enriched in cytosol

name: PDX3
description: Pyridoxine (pyridoxamine) phosphate oxidase, has homologs in E. coli and Myxococcus xanthus, transcription is under the general control of nitrogen metabolism, enriched in cytosol

name: PST2
description: Protein with similarity to a family of flavodoxin-like proteins, induced by oxidative stress in a Yap1p dependent manner, enriched in mitochondria, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RFS1

name: DCC1
description: Subunit of a complex with Ctf8p and Ctf18p that shares some components with Replication Factor C, required for sister chromatid cohesion and telomere length maintenance

name: PP7435_Chr1-0770
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: HRB1
description: Poly(A+) RNA-binding protein, involved in the export of mRNAs from the nucleus to the cytoplasm, similar to Npl3p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GBP2

name: SGF29
description: Component of the HAT/Core module of the SAGA, SLIK, and ADA complexes, HAT/Core module also contains Gcn5p, Ngg1p, and Ada2p, binds methylated histone H3K4, involved in transcriptional regulation through SAGA and TBP recruitment to target promoters and H3 acetylation

name: MRP7
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-0774
description: Protein with low similarity to molybdopterin synthase catalytic subunit-like protein

name: MSS4
description: Phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate 5-kinase, involved in actin cytoskeleton organization and cell morphogenesis, multicopy suppressor in S. cerevisiae of stt4 mutation

name: CSM1
description: Protein that forms a complex with Lrs4p and then Mam1p at kinetochores during meiosis I to mediate accurate homolog segregation, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein required for condensin recruitment to the replication fork barrier site and rDNA repeat segregation

name: FMO6
description: Putative flavin-containing monooxygenase similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis FMO6

name: DHH1
description: Cytoplasmic DExD/H-box helicase, stimulates mRNA decapping, coordinates distinct steps in mRNA function and decay, interacts with both the decapping and deadenylase complexes, may have a role in mRNA export and translation, C-terminus of Dhh1p interacts with Ngr1p and promotes POR1, but not EDC1 mRNA decay, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: STE7
description: Signal transducing MAP kinase kinase involved in pheromone response, where it phosphorylates Fus3p, and in the pseudohyphal/invasive growth pathway, through phosphorylation of Kss1p, phosphorylated by Ste11p, degraded by ubiquitin pathway

name: FOL3
description: Dihydrofolate synthetase, involved in folic acid biosynthesis, catalyzes conversion of dihydropteroate to dihydrofolate in folate coenzyme biosynthesis, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RMA1

name: APL2
description: Beta-adaptin subunit of the clathrin-associated protein (AP-1) complex, binds clathrin, involved in clathrin-dependent Golgi protein sorting, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: CMR1
description: Protein with a role in protein quality control, known in S. cerevisiae to localize at the intranuclear quality control compartment (INQ) in response to proteasome inhibition or DNA replication stress, INQ likely sequesters proteins involved in DNA metabolism for degradation or re-folding, DNA-binding protein with preference for UV-damaged DNA, contains three WD domains (WD-40 repeat), human ortholog WDR76 also exhibits perinuclear localization under similar stress conditions

name: PP7435_Chr1-0785
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:Dynein light intermediate chain)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0786
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TAF1
description: TFIID subunit, involved in RNA pol II transcription initiation, possesses in vitro histone acetyltransferase activity but its role in vivo appears to be minor, involved in promoter binding and G1/S progression, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PRC1
description: Vacuolar carboxypeptidase Y (proteinase C, CPY), broad-specificity C-terminal exopeptidase involved in non-specific protein degradation in the vacuole, member of the serine carboxypeptidase family

name: CHS7
description: Protein of unknown function, may be involved in chitin biosynthesis by regulation of Chs3p export from the ER, known in S. cerevisiae as bud neck protein that relocalizes to ER upon DNA replication stress

name: RIA1
description: Cytoplasmic GTPase/eEF2-like factor involved in ribosomal biogenesis, with Sdo1p, promotes release of Tif6p from 60S ribosomal subunits in the cytoplasm so that they can assemble with 40S subunits to generate mature ribosomes, required for quality control check of newly made large ribosomal subunits before they are released into the pool of translating ribosomes, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0791
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PPN1
description: Dual endo- and exopolyphosphatase with a role in phosphate metabolism, acts as both an endopolyphosphatase cleaving long chains of polyphosphate distributively to generate shorter polymer chains and as an exopolyphosphatase catalyzing the hydrolysis of terminal phosphate from polyphosphate, localizes in S. cerevisiae to the vacuole, nucleus and cytosol, functions as a homodimer, relocalizes from vacuole to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: COA6
description: Protein involved in cytochrome c oxidase assembly, also required for efficient formation of respiratory supercomplexes comprised of Complexes III and IV, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mitochondrial intermembrane space, has a human homolog, transcription is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PSD1
description: Phosphatidylserine decarboxylase of the mitochondrial inner membrane, converts phosphatidylserine to phosphatidylethanolamine, deletion in Pichia pastoris is responsible for loss of PSD activity in mitochondria, a severe growth defect on minimal media and depletion of cellular and mitochondrial phosphatidylethanolamine levels, the defect can not be complemented by PSD2, PSD1 represent the major PSD activity in Pichia pastoris

name: APC1
description: Largest subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome, APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition, component of the platform domain of the APC/C, based on structural analysis, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nuclear foci that become diffuse upon DNA replication stress

name: MOB2
description: Activator of Cbk1p kinase, component of the RAM signaling network that regulates cellular polarity and morphogenesis, activation of Cbk1p facilitates the Ace2p-dependent daughter cell-specific transcription of genes involved in cell separation, similar to Mob1p, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: RPO41
description: RNA polymerase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, single subunit enzyme similar to those of T3 and T7 bacteriophages, requires a specificity subunit encoded by MTF1 for promoter recognition, Mtf1p interacts with and stabilizes the Rpo41p-promoter complex, enhancing DNA bending and melting to facilitate pre-initiation open complex formation

name: SNF7
description: One of four subunits of the endosomal sorting complex required for transport III (ESCRT-III), involved in the sorting of transmembrane proteins into the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway, enriched in Golgi and mitochondria, recruited in S. cerevisiae from the cytoplasm to endosomal membranes

name: SED5
description: cis-Golgi t-SNARE syntaxin required for vesicular transport between the ER and the Golgi complex, binds at least 9 SNARE proteins, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0801
description: Protein with low similarity to valyl-tRNA synthetases

name: SLM3
description: tRNA-specific 2-thiouridylase, responsible for 2-thiolation of the wobble base of mitochondrial tRNAs, human ortholog is implicated in myoclonus epilepsy associated with ragged red fibers (MERRF)

name: KHA1
description: Putative K+/H+ antiporter with a probable role in intracellular cation homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein and detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: NUM1
description: Protein required for nuclear migration, component of the mitochondria-ER-cortex-ancor (MECA), required for the association of mitochondria with the cell cortex and for accurate distribution of mitochondrial network, interacts with Mdm36p to link the ER and motochondria at the cortex, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mother cell cortex and the bud tip, may mediate interactions of dynein and cytoplasmic microtubules with the cell cortex

name: MGM101
description: Protein with a role in mitochondrial DNA recombinational repair, also involved in interstrand cross-link repair, binds to and catalyzes the annealing of single-stranded mtDNA, oligomerizes to form rings and filaments, related to Rad52-type recombination proteins, with limited overall similarity but sharing conserved functionally important residues, component of the mitochondrial nucleoid, required for the repair of oxidative mtDNA damage

name: PMT4
description: Protein O-mannosyltransferase, transfers mannose residues from dolichyl phosphate-D-mannose to protein serine/threonine residues, appears to form homodimers in vivo and does not complex with other Pmt proteins, target for new antifungals, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-0807
description: Protein with similarity to YJR142W (8-oxo-dGTP diphosphatase of the Nudix hydrolase family, converts diphosphates of damaged forms of thiamin to monophosphates, in S. cerevisiae the GST fusion protein is a Dbf2p-Mob1p phosphorylation target in a proteome chip analysis and is synthetic lethal with PH085 deletion, plays a role in restricting Ty1 transposition)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0808
description: Protein with low similarity to hamartins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0809
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MNN2-2
description: Alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase, responsible for addition of the first alpha-1,2-linked mannose to form the branches on the mannan backbone of oligosaccharides, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to an early Golgi compartment

name: PP7435_Chr1-0811
description: Protein with low similarity to transcription elongation factors

name: NI2M
description: NI2M (B22) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: FTR1
description: High affinity iron permease, involved in the transport of iron across the plasma membrane, forms complex with Fet3p, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae expression is regulated by iron and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: FET5
description: Multicopper oxidase, integral membrane protein with similarity to Fet3p, may have a role in iron transport, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0815
description: Protein with similarity to YMR099C, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane and vacuole in glucose-grown cells (Glucose-6-phosphate 1-epimerase (hexose-6-phosphate mutarotase), likely involved in carbohydrate metabolism, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to both the nucleus and cytoplasm and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS)

name: SBA1
description: Co-chaperone that binds to and regulates Hsp90 family chaperones, important for pp60v-src activity in yeast, homologous to the mammalian p23 proteins, and like p23 can regulate telomerase activity, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0817
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PBP2
description: RNA binding protein, has similarity to mammalian heterogeneous nuclear RNP K protein, involved in the regulation of telomere position effect and telomere length, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0819
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: SAICAR synthase-like)

name: PFK2
description: Beta subunit of heteromultimeric phosphofructokinase involved in glycolysis, indispensable for anaerobic growth, activated by fructose-2,6-bisphosphate and AMP, enriched in microsome and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, mutation in S. cerevisiae inhibits glucose induction of cell cycle-related genes

name: PP7435_Chr1-0821
description: Putative transfer RNA for Valine (tRNA-Val)

name: RBD2
description: Possible rhomboid protease, has similarity to eukaryotic rhomboid proteases including Pcp1p, enriched in Golgi

name: HOM6
description: Homoserine dehydrogenase (L-homoserine:NADP oxidoreductase), dimeric enzyme that catalyzes the third step in the common pathway for methionine and threonine biosynthesis, enzyme has nucleotide-binding, dimerization and catalytic regions, enriched in cytosol

name: KTR4
description: Glycosyltransferase involved in protein glycosylation, transfers GDP-mannose to methyl-alpha-mannoside in vitro, member of the KRE2/MNT1 mannosyltransferase family of type II membrane proteins with a short cytoplasmic N-terminus, a membrane-spanning region and a highly conserved catalytic lumenal domain, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-0825
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: BRR2
description: RNA-dependent ATPase RNA helicase (DEIH box), required for disruption of U4/U6 base-pairing in native snRNPs to activate the spliceosome for catalysis, homologous to human U5-200kD

name: OTU2
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, shows cytoplasmic localization and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, member of the ovarian tumor-like (OTU) superfamily of predicted cysteine proteases

name: YLF2
description: Protein of unknown function, has weak similarity to E. coli GTP-binding protein gtp1, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: CLN3-1
description: G1 cyclin involved in cell cycle progression, activates Cdc28p kinase to promote the G1 to S phase transition, plays a role in regulating transcription of the other G1 cyclins, CLN1 and CLN2, regulated by phosphorylation and proteolysis, acetly-CoA induces in S. cerevisiae CLN3 transcription in response to nutrient repletion to promote cell-cycle entry

name: PP7435_Chr1-0830
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: clavaminate synthase)

name: GDS1
description: Protein of unknown function, required for growth on glycerol as a carbon source, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: CIR2
description: Putative ortholog of human electron transfer flavoprotein dehydrogenase (ETF-dH), found in a large supramolecular complex with other mitochondrial dehydrogenases, may have a role in oxidative stress response, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-0834
description: Protein with similarity to YMR114C (Protein of unknown function, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm and YMR114C is not an essential gene)

name: SRO77
description: Protein with roles in exocytosis and cation homeostasis, functions in docking and fusion of post-Golgi vesicles with plasma membrane, homolog of Drosophila lethal giant larvae tumor suppressor, interacts with SNARE protein Sec9p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SRO7

name: SAF1
description: F-Box protein involved in proteasome-dependent degradation of Aah1p during entry of cells into quiescence, interacts with Skp1

name: MIX23
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial intermembrane space proten imported via the MIA import machinery, contains an unusual twin cysteine motif (CX13C CX14C)

name: PKH3
description: Protein kinase with similarity to mammalian phosphoinositide-dependent kinase 1 (PDK1) and yeast Pkh1p and Pkh2p, two redundant upstream activators of Pkc1p, identified in S. cerevisiae as a multicopy suppressor of a pkh1 pkh2 double mutant

name: SOD2
description: Mitochondrial manganese superoxide dismutase, protects cells against oxygen toxicity, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: AHA1
description: Co-chaperone that binds to Hsp82p and activates its ATPase activity, similar to Hch1p, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae expression is regulated by stresses such as heat shock, an dprotein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-0843
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: WD40 repeat)

name: YAT1
description: Carnitine acetyltransferase, known in S. cerevisiae as outer mitochondrial protein, minor ethanol-inducible enzyme involved in transport of activated acyl groups from the cytoplasm into the mitochondrial matrix, phosphorylated

name: LRA3
description: L-rhamnonate dehydratase, strictly activated in the presence of rhamnose and almost completely repressed by glucose in Pichia pastoris, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis LRA3

name: PP7435_Chr1-0846
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: FIG1
description: Integral membrane protein required for efficient mating, may participate in or regulate the low affinity Ca2+ influx system, which affects intracellular signaling and cell-cell fusion during mating

name: QDR3
description: Multidrug transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family, has a role in polyamine homeostasis, expression in S. cerevisiae is upregulated under polyamine stress, required for resistance to quinidine, barban, cisplatin, and bleomycin

name: PP7435_Chr1-0849
description: Protein with similarity to YDR018C (Probable membrane protein with three predicted transmembrane domains, similar to C. elegans F55A11.5 and maize 1-acyl-glycerol-3-phosphate acyltransferase, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CST26)

name: FAT1
description: Very long chain fatty acyl-CoA synthetase and long chain fatty acid transporter, activates imported fatty acids with a preference for very long lengths (C20-C26), has a separate function in the transport of long chain fatty acids

name: CDC14
description: Protein phosphatase required for mitotic exit, located in S. cerevisiae in the nucleolus until liberated by the FEAR and Mitotic Exit Network in anaphase, enabling it to act on key substrates to effect a decrease in CDK/B-cyclin activity and mitotic exit, required for meiosis I spindle disassembly, released from nucleolus upon entry into anaphase I of meiosis, resequestered in metaphase II, then released again upon entry into anaphase II, maintained in nucleolus by Cdc55p in early meiosis

name: PP7435_Chr1-0852
description: Protein with similarity to YBR056W (Putative glycoside hydrolase of the mitochondrial intermembrane space)

name: BNA2
description: Tryptophan 2,3-dioxygenase or indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase, required for de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine, interacts genetically with telomere capping gene CDC13, regulated by Hst1p and Aftp

name: EAF6
description: Subunit of the NuA4 acetyltransferase complex that acetylates histone H4 and NuA3 acetyltransferase complex that acetylates histone H3

name: ARP7
description: Component of both the SWI/SNF and RSC chromatin remodeling complexes, actin-related protein involved in transcriptional regulation

name: PP7435_Chr1-0856
description: Putative transfer RNA for Isoleucine (tRNA-Ile)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0857
description: Putative transfer RNA for Histidine (tRNA-His)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0858
description: Protein with low similarity to YeeE/YedE family integral membrane protein

name: PP7435_Chr1-0859

name: TYW3

name: KRI1

name: PTR3

description: Protein with low similarity to Myb-like DNA-binding proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-0879

name: RRP6

name: PP7435_Chr1-0891
description: Protein with similarity to YMR027W, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm and YMR027W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0896

name: HSP82

name: PP7435_Chr1-0898
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: tubulin binding cofactor C (TBCC), Staphylocoagulase)

name: MCH2

name: PEX6

name: SUI3

name: PP7435_Chr1-0903
description: Protein with low similarity to RING finger domain proteins

name: YAR1

name: TSC10

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ARP4
description: Actin-related protein involved in chromatin remodeling, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear component of chromatin-remodeling enzyme complexes

name: PP7435_Chr1-0944
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: MTH938-like, similar to 2P1, a partially characterized nuclear protein)

name: MRPL51
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: SMC_prok_A, chromosome segregation protein SMC)

name: YHB1

name: LIH1-1
description: Putative lipase

description: Protein with similarity to YJL163C (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: CDC7
description: DDK (Dbf4-dependent kinase) catalytic subunit required for origin firing and replication fork progression in mitotic S phase through phosphorylation of Mcm2-7p complexes and Cdc45p, kinase activity correlates with cyclical DBF4 expression, required for pre-meiotic DNA replication, meiotic DSB formation, recruitment of the monopolin complex to kinetochores during meiosis I and as a gene-specific regulator of the meiosis-specific transcription factor Ndt80p

name: TPO1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0971
description: Protein with similarity to YPR003C, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells (Putative sulfate permease, physically interacts with Hsp82p, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER and YPR003C is not an essential gene)

name: CDC16

name: TAM41

name: NDC80

name: SSL2

name: SMT3
description: Ubiquitin-like protein of the SUMO family, conjugated to lysine residues of target proteins, regulates chromatid cohesion, chromosome segregation, APC-mediated proteolysis, DNA replication and septin ring dynamics, phosphorylated at Ser2, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SRP40

name: LPX1

name: GRX5
description: Glutathione-dependent oxidoreductase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix protein, involved at an early step in the biogenesis of iron-sulfur centers along with Bol1p, hydroperoxide and superoxide-radical responsive, monothiol glutaredoxin subfamily member along with Grx3p and Grx4p

name: PP7435_Chr1-0985
description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: IPL1

name: MRH4
description: ATP-dependent RNA helicase of the DEAD-box family, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein with an essential role in mitochondrial function

name: SRP72

name: NIP7
description: Protein required for 60S ribosome subunit biogenesis, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, physically interacts with Nop8p and the exosome subunit Rrp43p

name: PUS1

name: PP7435_Chr1-0991
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: methyltransferase)

name: ARG2

name: PSF2
