name: EFM2
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase, methylates translation elongation factors EF2 (Eft1p and Eft2p) and EF3A (Yef3p), belongs to the seven beta-strand family, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: ARO4
description: 3-deoxy-D-arabino-heptulosonate-7-phosphate (DAHP) synthase, catalyzes the first step in aromatic amino acid biosynthesis and is feedback-inhibited by tyrosine or high concentrations of phenylalanine or tryptophan, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol

name: SDS23
description: Protein involved in cell separation during budding, unique homolog of the S. pombe Sds23 protein, which is implicated in APC/cyclosome regulation, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SDS24

name: PP7435_Chr1-0997
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0998
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: PP7435_Chr1-0999
description: Putative transfer RNA for Methionine (tRNA-Met)

name: BDF1
description: Protein involved in transcription initiation at TATA-containing promoters, associates with the basal transcription factor TFIID, contains two bromodomains, corresponds to the C-terminal region of mammalian TAF1, redundant with Bdf2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog BDF2

name: MET8
description: Bifunctional dehydrogenase and ferrochelatase, involved in the biosynthesis of siroheme, a prosthetic group used by sulfite reductase, required for sulfate assimilation and methionine biosynthesis

name: NGR1
description: RNA binding protein that negatively regulates growth rate, interacts with the 3' UTR of the mitochondrial porin (POR1) mRNA and enhances its degradation, in S. cerevisiae overexpression impairs mitochondrial function, interacts with Dhh1p to mediate POR1 mRNA decay, expressed in stationary phase

name: PP7435_Chr1-1003
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ERV14
description: COPII-coated vesicle protein, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the COPII vesicle coat involved in vesicle formation and incorporation of specific secretory cargo, required for the delivery of bud-site selection protein Axl2p to cell surface, related to Drosophila cornichon, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ERV15

name: PP7435_Chr1-1005
description: Protein with low similarity to elongation factor 1-gamma of Ogataea parapolymorpha, enriched among several compartments

name: ECI1
description: Delta3,delta2-enoyl-CoA isomerase, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal hexameric protein that converts 3-hexenoyl-CoA to trans-2-hexenoyl-CoA, essential in S. cerevisiae for the beta-oxidation of unsaturated fatty acids, oleate-induced, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DCI1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1007
description: Protein with similarity to YLR283W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to mitochondria and YLR283W is not an essential gene)

name: SMD2
description: Core Sm protein Sm D2, part of heteroheptameric complex (with Smb1p, Smd1p, Smd3p, Sme1p, Smx3p, and Smx2p) that is part of the spliceosomal U1, U2, U4, and U5 snRNPs, homolog of human Sm D2

name: PP7435_Chr1-1009
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF4259)

name: GUF1
description: GTPase that associates with mitochondrial ribosomes, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix protein, important for translation under temperature and nutrient stress, may have a role in translational fidelity, similar to bacterial LepA elongation factor

name: COA4
description: Twin Cx(9)C protein involved in cytochrome c oxidase organization, organization includes assembly or stability, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mitochondrial intermembrane space, localized via the Mia40p-Erv1p system, interacts genetically with CYC1 and with cytochrome c oxidase assembly factors

name: SEC31
description: Component of the Sec13p-Sec31p complex of the COPII vesicle coat, required for vesicle formation in ER to Golgi transport, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the COPII vesicle coat, S. cerevisiae mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance

name: SYG1
description: Membrane protein of unknown function, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein which truncation and overexpression suppresses lethality of G-alpha protein deficiency

name: NEO1
description: Phospholipid translocase (flippase), role in phospholipid asymmetry of plasma membrane, involved in endocytosis, vacuolar biogenesis and Golgi to ER vesicle-mediated transport, enriched in Golgi, known in S. cerevisiae to localize also to endosomes

name: HIS1
description: ATP phosphoribosyltransferase, a hexameric enzyme, catalyzes the first step in histidine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae mutations cause histidine auxotrophy and sensitivity to Cu, Co, and Ni salts and transcription is regulated by general amino acid control

name: RPS28B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S28, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPS28A

name: PCL7
description: Pho85p cyclin of the Pho80p subfamily, forms a functional kinase complex with Pho85p which phosphorylates Mmr1p and is regulated by Pho81p, involved in glycogen metabolism, expression in S. cerevisiae is cell-cycle regulated, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PCL6

name: PET117
description: Protein required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase

name: MMF1
description: Protein required for transamination of isoleucine, but not of valine or leucine, may regulate specificity of branched-chain transaminases Bat1p and Bat2p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein that interacts genetically with mitochondrial ribosomal protein genes, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HMF1

name: RPL34A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L34A, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L34, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL34B

name: RCF2
description: Cytochrome c oxidase subunit, has a role in assembly of respiratory supercomplexes, similar to Rcf1p, and either Rcf1p or Rcf2p is required for late-stage assembly of the Cox12p and Cox13p subunits and for cytochrome c oxidase activity, associates with the cytochrome c oxidase - cytochrome bc1 supercomplexreactive oxygen species, member of the conserved hypoxia induced gene family, C. elegans homolog is functional in yeast

name: DCW1
description: Putative mannosidase, GPI-anchored membrane protein required for cell wall biosynthesis in bud formation, homologous to Dfg5p

name: ILV1
description: Threonine deaminase, catalyzes the first step in isoleucine biosynthesis, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is under general amino acid control, ILV1 locus exhibits highly positioned nucleosomes whose organization is independent of known ILV1 regulation

name: ENT1
description: Epsin-like protein involved in endocytosis and actin patch assembly, functionally redundant with Ent2p, binds clathrin via a clathrin-binding domain motif at C-terminus, enriched in plasma membrane and microsome in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ENT2

name: SSL1
description: Subunit of the core form of RNA polymerase transcription factor TFIIH, has both protein kinase and DNA-dependent ATPase/helicase activities, essential in S. cerevisiae for transcription and nucleotide excision repair, interacts with Tfb4p

name: SMF3
description: Putative divalent metal ion transporter involved in iron homeostasis, transcriptionally regulated by metal ions, member of the Nramp family of metal transport proteins, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SMM1
description: Dihydrouridine synthase, member of a family of dihydrouridine synthases including Dus1p, Smm1p, Dus3p, and Dus4p, modifies uridine residues at position 20 of cytoplasmic tRNAs

name: TIM23
description: Component of the Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex), enriched in mitochondria, essential in S. cerevisiae, involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix and inner membrane, with Tim17p, contributes to architecture and function of the import channel

name: ACC1
description: Acetyl-CoA carboxylase, biotin containing enzyme, catalyzes carboxylation of cytosolic acetyl-CoA to form malonyl-CoA and regulates histone acetylation by regulating the availablity of acetyl-CoA, required for de novo biosynthesis of long-chain fatty acids, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HFA1

name: RRT12
description: Probable subtilisin-family protease with a role in formation of the dityrosine layer of spore walls, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the spore wall, nuclear envelope and ER region in mature spores

name: PP7435_Chr1-1031
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved, enriched in vacuole and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: MET3
description: ATP sulfurylase, catalyzes the primary step of intracellular sulfate activation, enriched in cytosol, essential in P. pastoris for assimilatory reduction of sulfate to sulfide, involved in methionine metabolism

name: PDX1
description: E3-binding protein of the mitochondrial pyruvate dehydrogenase complex, plays a structural role in the complex by binding and positioning dihydrolipoamide dehydrogenase (E3) to the dihydrolipoamide acetyltransferase (E2) core, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1034
description: Protein with similarity to YNR063W (Putative zinc-cluster protein of unknown function)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1035
description: Protein with similarity to YNR062C (Putative membrane protein of unknown function)

name: MCH1
description: Protein with similarity to mammalian monocarboxylate permeases, which are involved in transport of monocarboxylic acids across the plasma membrane, S. cerevisiae mutant is not deficient in monocarboxylate transport

name: PP7435_Chr1-1037
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1038
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: methyltransferase)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1039
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1040
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CKA2
description: Alpha' catalytic subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2), CK2 is a Ser/Thr protein kinase with roles in cell growth and proliferation, CK2, comprised of CKA1, CKA2, CKB1 and CKB2, has many substrates including transcription factors and all RNA polymerases, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, regulates Fkh1p-mediated donor preference during mating-type switching

name: PP7435_Chr1-1042
description: Protein with low similarity to SAC6, fimbrin, actin-bundling protein which cooperates with calponin/transgelin Scp1p in organization and maintenance of actin cytoskeleton

name: ERB1
description: Constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, forms a complex with Nop7p and Ytm1p that is required for maturation of the large ribosomal subunit, required for maturation of the 25S and 5.8S ribosomal RNAs, homologous to mammalian Bop1, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PGM2
description: Phosphoglucomutase, catalyzes the conversion from glucose-1-phosphate to glucose-6-phosphate, which is a key step in hexose metabolism, functions as the acceptor for a Glc-phosphotransferase, enriched among several compartments, abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PGM1

name: TAF14
description: Subunit of TFIID, TFIIF, INO80, SWI/SNF, and NuA3 complexes, involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation and in chromatin modification, contains a YEATS domain, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1046
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: AIM41
description: Protein of unknown function, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the authentic protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and null mutant displays reduced frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: RUD3
description: Protein involved in the structural organization of the cis-Golgi, interacts genetically with COG3 and USO1, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein

name: RFC1
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C), which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon

name: PP7435_Chr1-1050
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: COG2329)

name: MKK1
description: MAPKK involved in the protein kinase C signaling pathway, involved in control of cell integrity, upon activation by Bck1p phosphorylates downstream target, Slt2p, functionally redundant with Mkk2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MKK2

name: MGE1
description: Mitochondrial matrix cochaperone, nucleotide release factor for Ssc1p in protein translocation and folding, also acts as cochaperone for Ssq1p in folding of Fe-S cluster proteins, acts as oxidative sensor to regulate mitochondrial Ssc1p, in presence of oxidative stress, dimeric Mge1p becomes a monomer and unable to regulate Ssc1p function, homolog of E. coli GrpE and human Mge1 (GRPEL1), which also responds to oxidative stress, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: KIN4
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase, inhibits the mitotic exit network (MEN) when the spindle position checkpoint is activated, known in S. cerevisiae as protein asymmetrically localized to mother cell cortex, spindle pole body and bud neck, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FRK1

name: NIMM
description: NIMM (MWFE) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: RPL33A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L33A, N-terminally acetylated, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, S. cerevisiae rpl33a null mutant exhibits slow growth while rpl33a rpl33b double null mutant is inviable, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L35A, no bacterial homolog, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL33B

name: RAI1
description: Protein with decapping endonuclease activity, targets mRNAs with unmethylated 7-methylguanosine cap structures, binds to and stabilizes the exoribonuclease Rat1p, required for pre-rRNA processing, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, homologous to human DOM3Z

name: KES1
description: One of seven members of the yeast oxysterol binding protein family, involved in negative regulation of Sec14p-dependent Golgi complex secretory functions, enriched in Golgi and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae is peripheral membrane protein that localizes to the Golgi complex, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HES1

name: SSK22
description: MAP kinase kinase kinase of HOG1 mitogen-activated signaling pathway, functionally redundant with Ssk2p, interacts with and is activated by Ssk1p, phosphorylates Pbs2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSK2

name: PPG1
description: Putative serine/threonine protein phosphatase of the type 2A-like phosphatase family, required for glycogen accumulation, interacts with Tap42p, which binds to and regulates other protein phosphatases

name: HUB1
description: Ubiquitin-like protein modifier, promotes in S. cerevisiae alternative splicing of SRC1 pre-mRNA, binds non-covalently to the HIND domain of Snu66, may function in modification of Sph1p and Hbt1p, functionally complemented in S. cerevisiae by the human or S. pombe ortholog, mechanism of Hub1p adduct formation not yet clear

name: ZRG17
description: Zinc transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein part of a heterodimeric transporter with Msc2p that transfers zinc from the cytosol to the ER lumen, member of the cation diffusion facilitator family of efflux pumps, zinc-regulated directly through Zap1p, transcription induced in S. cerevisiae under conditions of zinc deficiency

name: TBF1
description: Telobox-containing general regulatory factor, binds TTAGGG repeats within subtelomeric anti-silencing regions (STARs), blocking silent chromatin propagation, binds majority of snoRNA gene promoters, required for full snoRNA expression, caps DSB flanked by long T2AG3 repeats and blocks checkpoint activation

name: HHO1
description: Histone H1, linker histone with roles in meiosis and sporulation, decreasing levels early in sporulation may promote meiosis, and increasing levels during sporulation facilitate compaction of spore chromatin, binds to promoters and within genes in mature spores, may be recruited by Ume6p to promoter regions, contributing to transcriptional repression outside of meiosis, suppresses DNA repair involving homologous recombination

name: RIE1
description: Putative RNA binding protein, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the stress granules induced by glucose deprivation, interacts with Rbg1p in a two-hybrid assay, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: NFU1-2
description: Protein involved in iron metabolism in mitochondria, similar to NifU, which is a protein required for the maturation of the Fe/S clusters of nitrogenase in nitrogen-fixing bacteria

name: PP7435_Chr1-1067
description: Protein with low similarity to bacterial alpha/beta hydrolase, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: URB1
description: Protein required for the normal accumulation of 25S and 5.8S rRNAs, nucleolar protein, associated with the 27SA2 pre-ribosomal particle, proposed to be involved in the biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit

name: HCM1
description: Forkhead transcription factor that drives S-phase specific expression of genes involved in chromosome segregation, spindle dynamics, and budding, suppressor in S. cerevisiae of calmodulin mutants with specific SPB assembly defects, telomere maintenance role

name: SET2-1
description: Histone methyltransferase with a role in transcriptional elongation, methylates H3 lysine 36, which suppresses incorporation of acetylated histones and signals for the deacetylation of these histones within transcribed genes, associates with the C-terminal domain of Rpo21p, histone methylation activity is regulated by phosphorylation status of Rpo21p, enriched in plasma membrane, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr1-1071
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: folliculin-interacting protein N-terminu, FNIP_N)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1072
description: Protein with low similarity to IFH1, coactivator, regulates transcription of ribosomal protein (RP) genes

name: PP7435_Chr1-1073
description: Protein with low similarity to eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit F, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-1074
description: Protein with low similarity to transcription factors

name: PGK1
description: 3-phosphoglycerate kinase, catalyzes transfer of high-energy phosphoryl groups from the acyl phosphate of 1,3-bisphosphoglycerate to ADP to produce ATP, key enzyme in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis, enriched in cytosol

name: ARG82
description: Inositol polyphosphate multikinase (IPMK), sequentially phosphorylates Ins(1,4,5)P3 to form Ins(1,3,4,5,6)P5, also has diphosphoinositol polyphosphate synthase activity, regulates arginine-, phosphate-, and nitrogen-responsive genes

name: SSO2
description: Plasma membrane t-SNARE, involved in fusion of secretory vesicles at the plasma membrane, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and among several compartments, syntaxin homolog that is functionally redundant with Sso1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSO1

name: FAS2
description: Alpha subunit of fatty acid synthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of long-chain saturated fatty acids, contains the acyl-carrier protein domain and beta-ketoacyl reductase, beta-ketoacyl synthase and self-pantetheinylation activities, enriched among several compartments

name: STB3
description: Ribosomal RNA processing element (RRPE)-binding protein, involved in the glucose-induced transition from quiescence to growth, restricted to nucleus in quiescent cells, released into cytoplasm after glucose repletion, binds Sin3p, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: STM1
description: Protein required for optimal translation under nutrient stress, perturbs association of Yef3p with ribosomes, involved in TOR signaling, binds G4 quadruplex and purine motif triplex nucleic acid, helps maintain telomere structure, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, serves as a ribosome preservation factor both during quiescence and recovery

name: SEC7
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) for ADP ribosylation factors involved in proliferation of the Golgi, intra-Golgi transport and ER-to-Golgi transport, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae to be also located on Golgi-associated coated vesicles

name: URC1
description: Putative GTP cyclohydrolase similar to Ogataea parapolymorpha URC1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1083
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PTC1 (Serine/threonine protein phosphatase, signal transduction mechanism))

name: NDI1
description: Mitochondrial internal NADH dehydrogenase, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells

name: DRE2
description: Component of the cytosolic Fe-S protein assembly (CIA) machinery, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosoplasmic protein, contains an Fe-S cluster that receives electrons from NADPH via the action of Tah18pin an early step in the CIA pathway, ortholog of human Ciapin1, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1086
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: CMK2
description: Calmodulin-dependent protein kinase, may play a role in stress response, many CA++/calmodulan dependent phosphorylation substrates demonstrated in vitro, amino acid sequence similar to mammalian Cam Kinase II, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CMK1

name: HEM3
description: Porphobilinogen deaminase, catalyzes the conversion of 4-porphobilinogen to hydroxymethylbilane, the third step in heme biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae to localize also the nucleus, expression is regulated by Hap2p-Hap3p, but not by levels of heme

name: PP7435_Chr1-1089
description: Protein with similarity to YDR248C (Putative gluconokinase, sequence similarity to bacterial and human gluconokinase, in S. cerevisiae upregulated by deletion of the RNAP-II associated factor, PAF1 and the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm)

name: ERG10
description: Acetyl-CoA C-acetyltransferase (acetoacetyl-CoA thiolase), cytosolic enzyme that transfers an acetyl group from one acetyl-CoA molecule to another, forming acetoacetyl-CoA, involved in the first step in mevalonate biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SSN3
description: Cyclin-dependent protein kinase, component of RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, involved in phosphorylation of the RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain, involved in glucose repression

name: PP7435_Chr1-1092
description: Protein with low similarity to MRX11, protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1093
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: COY1
description: Golgi membrane protein with similarity to mammalian CASP, enriched in microsome and Golgi, genetic interactions with GOS1 (encoding a Golgi snare protein) suggest a role in Golgi function

name: SWI3
description: Subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex, SWI/SNF regulates transcription by remodeling chromosomes, required for transcription of many genes, including ADH1, ADH2, GAL1, HO, INO1 and SUC2, relocates in S. cerevisiae to the cytosol under hypoxic conditions

name: ATG7
description: Autophagy-related protein and dual specificity member of the E1 family of ubiquitin-activating enzymes, mediates the conjugation of Atg12p with Atg5p and Atg8p with phosphatidylethanolamine, required steps in autophagosome formation, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSA7

name: SDA1
description: Protein required for actin organization and passage through Start, highly conserved nuclear protein, required for actin cytoskeleton organization, plays a critical role in G1 events, binds Nap1p, involved in 60S ribosome biogenesis

name: NNK1
description: Protein kinase, implicated in proteasome function, interacts with TORC1, Ure2 and Gdh2, in S. cerevisiae the overexpression leads to hypersensitivity to rapamycin and nuclear accumulation of Gln3 and the epitope-tagged protein localizes to the cytoplasm

name: QCR8
description: Subunit 8 of ubiquinol cytochrome-c reductase complex, which is a component of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, oriented facing the intermembrane space, enriched in mitochondria, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by Abf1p and Cpf1p

name: ERG20
description: Farnesyl pyrophosphate synthetase, has both dimethylallyltranstransferase and geranyltranstransferase activities, catalyzes the formation of C15 farnesyl pyrophosphate units for isoprenoid and sterol biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: HST2
description: Member of the silencing information regulator 2 (Sir2) family of NAD(+)-dependent protein deacetylases, modulates nucleolar (rDNA) and telomeric silencing, possesses NAD(+)-dependent histone deacetylase activity in vitro, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, contains a nuclear export signal (NES), function regulated by its nuclear export

name: RQC2
description: Component of RQC, which mediates nascent chain degradation, RQC (ribosome quality control complex) is a ribosome-bound complex required for degradation of polypeptides arising from stalled translation, recruits alanine- and threonine-charged tRNA to the A site and directs the elongation of nascent chains independently of mRNA or 40S subunits, monitors translation stress and signals this to Hsf1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RET3
description: Zeta subunit of the coatomer complex (COPI), known in S. cerevisiae as protein which coats Golgi-derived transport vesicles, involved in retrograde transport between Golgi and ER

name: TAF3
description: TFIID subunit (47 kDa), involved in promoter binding and RNA polymerase II transcription initiation

name: RRP12
description: Protein required for export of the ribosomal subunits, associates with the RNA components of the pre-ribosomes, has a role in nuclear import in association with Pse1p, contains HEAT-repeats, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: MRPS16
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1107
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: STB5
description: Transcription factor, involved in regulating multidrug resistance and oxidative stress response, forms a heterodimer with Pdr1p, contains a Zn(II)2Cys6 zinc finger domain that interacts with a pleiotropic drug resistance element in vitro

name: THG1
description: tRNAHis guanylyltransferase, adds a guanosine residue to the 5' end of tRNAHis after transcription and RNase P cleavage, couples nuclear division and migration to cell budding and cytokinesis, essential enzyme in S. cerevisiae conserved among eukaryotes

name: RPA135
description: RNA polymerase I second largest subunit A135, enriched in cytosol

name: PMR1
description: High affinity Ca2+/Mn2+ P-type ATPase required for Ca2+ and Mn2+ transport into Golgi, involved in Ca2+ dependent protein sorting and processing, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae Mn2+ transport into Golgi lumen required for rapamycin sensitivity, mutations in human homolog ATP2C1 cause acantholytic skin condition Hailey-Hailey disease, human ATP2C1 can complement yeast null mutant

name: SUA5
description: Protein involved in threonylcarbamoyl adenosine biosynthesis, Sua5p and Qri7p are necessary and sufficient for RNA t6A modification in vitro, S. cerevisiae null mutant lacks N6-threonylcarbamoyl adenosine (t6A) modification in the anticodon loop of ANN-decoding tRNA, member of conserved YrdC/Sua5 family, binds single-stranded telomeric DNA and null mutant has abnormal telomere length

name: PP7435_Chr1-1113
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1115
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: telomere regulation protein Stn1)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1116
description: Protein with low similarity to transthyretin-like proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-1117
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1118
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: BP28CT, C-terminal domain is found in BAP28-like nucleolar proteins)

name: CDC1-1
description: Putative mannose-ethanolamine phosphate phosphodiesterase, involved in GPI-anchor remodeling prior to the attachment of cell wall proteins to beta 1,3-glucan, mutants display elevated Ca2+-dependent signaling resulting in secondary actin polarization and Golgi inheritance defects, enzyme is Mn2+-dependent, S. cerevisiae mutants have cell division cycle defect and fragile cell walls

name: SEC10
description: Essential 100kDa subunit in S. cerevisiae of the exocyst complex, the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion

name: THO1
description: Conserved nuclear RNA-binding protein, specifically binds to transcribed chromatin in a THO- and RNA-dependent manner, genetically interacts with shuttling hnRNP NAB2, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, overproduction in S. cerevisiae suppresses transcriptional defect caused by hpr1 mutation

name: VHR2
description: Non-essential nuclear protein in S. cerevisiae and null mutation has global effects on transcription, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog VHR1, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: ICL1
description: Isocitrate lyase, catalyzes the formation of succinate and glyoxylate from isocitrate, a key reaction of the glyoxylate cycle, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae expression of ICL1 is induced by growth on ethanol and repressed by growth on glucose

name: GCN4
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcriptional activator of amino acid biosynthetic genes, activator responds to amino acid starvation, expression is tightly regulated at both the transcriptional and translational levels

name: CYB5-2
description: Cytochrome b5, involved in the sterol and lipid biosynthesis pathways, acts as an electron donor to support sterol C5-6 desaturation

name: AGE2
description: ADP-ribosylation factor (ARF) GTPase activating protein (GAP) effector, involved in Trans-Golgi-Network (TGN) transport, contains C2C2H2 cysteine/histidine motif

name: UBP8
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease that is a component of the SAGA (Spt-Ada-Gcn5-Acetyltransferase) acetylation complex, required for SAGA-mediated deubiquitination of histone H2B

name: PLP2
description: Protein that interacts with the CCT complex to stimulate actin folding, has similarity to phosducins, in S. cerevisiae null mutant lethality is complemented by mouse phosducin-like protein MgcPhLP, CCT is short for chaperonin containing TCP-1, essential gene

name: CWC22
description: Spliceosome-associated protein that is required for pre-mRNA splicing, necessary for Prp2p function at the first catalytic step of splicing, has similarity to S. pombe Cwf22p, in S. cerevisiae CWC22 is an essential protein

name: ENP2
description: Component of the SSU, required for pre-18S rRNA processing, biogenesis of the small ribosomal subunit, interacts with U3 snoRNA, Mpp10p and Bfr2p, contains WD repeats, and has homology to Spb1p, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-1131
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1132
description: Protein with similarity to YOL057W, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells (Dipeptidyl-peptidase III, cleaves dipeptides from the amino terminus of target proteins, highly active on synthetic substrate Arg-Arg-2-naphthylamide, mammalian ortholog may be a biomarker for some cancers)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1133
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: DSC2
description: Multi-transmembrane subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex, similar in sequence to rhomboid pseudoproteases Der1p and UBAC2 that function in ERAD, ortholog of fission yeast dsc2

name: PAC10
description: Part of the heteromeric co-chaperone GimC/prefoldin complex, which promotes efficient protein folding

name: TRM11
description: Catalytic subunit of an adoMet-dependent tRNA methyltransferase complex (Trm11p-Trm112p), required for the methylation of the guanosine nucleotide at position 10 (m2G10) in tRNAs, contains a THUMP domain and a methyltransferase domain

name: HRP1
description: Subunit of cleavage factor I, a five-subunit complex required for the cleavage and polyadenylation of pre-mRNA 3' ends, RRM-containing heteronuclear RNA binding protein and hnRNPA/B family member that binds to poly (A) signal sequences, enriched in cytosol

name: DFG10
description: Probable polyprenol reductase that catalyzes conversion of polyprenol to dolichol, the precursor for N-glycosylation, involved in filamentous growth, mutations in human ortholog SRD5A3 confer CDG (Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation)

name: DBP10

name: TPK2

name: MNP1
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, has similarity to E. coli L7/L12 and human MRPL7 ribosomal proteins, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein that associates with the mitochondrial nucleoid, required for normal respiratory growth

name: RPB9
description: RNA polymerase II subunit B12.6, contacts DNA, mutations in S. cerevisiae affect transcription start site selection and fidelity of transcription

name: MCM6
description: Protein involved in DNA replication, component of the Mcm2-7 hexameric complex that binds chromatin as a part of the pre-replicative complex, forms a subcomplex with Mcm4p and Mcm7p

name: PpAFT1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1147
description: Protein with similarity to YIL108W, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells (Putative metalloendopeptidase, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1148
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CAK1
description: Cyclin-dependent kinase-activating kinase required for passage through the cell cycle, phosphorylates and activates Cdc28p, nucleotide-binding pocket differs significantly from those of most other protein kinases

name: GYP8
description: GTPase-activating protein for yeast Rab family members, Ypt1p is the preferred in vitro substrate but also acts on Sec4p, Ypt31p and Ypt32p, involved in the regulation of ER to Golgi vesicle transport

name: SPT8
description: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex but not present in SAGA-like complex SLIK/SALSA, required for SAGA-mediated inhibition at some promoters

name: CAF16

name: ERG3
description: C-5 sterol desaturase, glycoprotein that catalyzes the introduction of a C-5(6) double bond into episterol, a precursor in ergosterol biosynthesis, S. cerevisiae mutants are viable, but cannot grow on non-fermentable carbon sources, substrate of the HRD ubiquitin ligase

name: RIM11
description: Protein kinase, required for signal transduction during entry into meiosis, promotes the formation of the Ime1p-Ume6p complex by phosphorylating Ime1p and Ume6p, shares similarity with mammalian glycogen synthase kinase 3-beta, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MRK1

name: PMP3-2
description: Small protein, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein that confers resistance to amphotericin B and is a potential target of this common antifungal drug, related to a family of plant polypeptides that are overexpressed under high salt concentration or low temperature, not essential for viability, deletion in S. cerevisiae causes hyperpolarization of the plasma membrane potential

name: ACB1
description: Acyl-CoA-binding protein, in Pichia pastoris is induced by nitrogen starvation, binds medium-chain fatty acyl CoA generated by peroxisomes, is involved in unconventional secretion via autophagosomes pathway and is involved in sporulation, enriched in cytosol

name: NUFM
description: NUFM (B13) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-1158
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: GAL4-like Zn2Cys6 binuclear cluster DNA-binding domain and fungal transcription factor regulatory middle homology region)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1159
description: Protein with similarity to YCR090C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and YCR090C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1160
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: SAC3/GANP/Nin1/mts3/eIF-3 p25 family)

name: TRM112
description: Protein involved in methylation of tRNA, rRNA, and translation factors, also involved in ribosome biogenesis, subunit of tRNA methyltransferase (MTase) complexes in combination with Trm9p and Trm11p, interacts with and stabilizes 18S rRNA methyltransferase Bud23p, subunit of complex with Mtq2p that methylates Sup45p (eRF1) in the ternary complex eRF1-eRF3-GTP, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol

name: FPK1

name: MSH3

name: CWC21
description: Protein involved in RNA splicing by the spliceosome, component of a complex containing Cef1p, interacts genetically with ISY1 and BUD13, may bind RNA, has similarity to S. pombe Cwf21p

name: PP7435_Chr1-1165
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PEF1
description: Penta-EF-hand protein required for polar bud growth and cell wall abscission, binds calcium and zinc with different affinity, known in S. cerevisiae as protein localized to bud site in G1, bud neck in G2, binds to Sec31p and modulates COPII coat assembly

name: PP7435_Chr1-1167
description: Putative transfer RNA for Arginine (tRNA-Arg)

name: PIK1
description: Phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase, catalyzes first step in the biosynthesis of phosphatidylinositol-4,5-biphosphate, may control cytokinesis through the actin cytoskeleton

name: GPI13
description: Phosphoryltransferase known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane that adds phosphoethanolamine onto the third mannose residue of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor precursor, similar to human PIG-O protein

name: PP7435_Chr1-1170
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1171
description: Protein with low similarity to sterol-sensing super family, enriched in microsome

name: RVS161-1
description: Amphiphysin-like lipid raft protein, interacts with Rvs167p and regulates polarization of the actin cytoskeleton, endocytosis, cell polarity, cell fusion and viability following starvation or osmotic stress, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: NPR3
description: Subunit of SEA (Seh1-associated), Npr2/3, and Iml1p complexes, Npr2/3 complex mediates downregulation of TORC1 activity upon amino acid limitation, SEA complex is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole, Iml1p complex (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) is required for non-nitrogen-starvation (NNS)-induced autophagy, required for Npr2p phosphorylation and Iml1p-Npr2p interaction, S. cerevisiae null mutant shows delayed meiotic DNA replication and double-strand break repair

name: PP7435_Chr1-1174
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1175
description: Protein with similarity to YLL032C (Protein of unknown function that may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and YLL032C is not an essential gene)

name: CKI1
description: Choline kinase, catalyzes the first step in phosphatidylcholine synthesis via the CDP-choline (Kennedy pathway), exhibits some ethanolamine kinase activity contributing to phosphatidylethanolamine synthesis via the CDP-ethanolamine pathway, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EKI1

name: OPT1-2
description: Proton-coupled oligopeptide transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, transports glutathione and phytochelatin, member of the OPT family

name: SNO1
description: Protein of unconfirmed function, involved in pyridoxine metabolism, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced during stationary phase, forms a putative glutamine amidotransferase complex with Snz1p, with Sno1p serving as the glutaminase

name: SNZ3
description: Member of a stationary phase-induced gene family, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, transcription of SNZ2 is induced in S. cerevisiae prior to diauxic shift, and also in the absence of thiamin in a Thi2p-dependent manner, forms a coregulated gene pair with SNO3

name: PP7435_Chr1-1180
description: Putative transfer RNA for Tyrosine (tRNA-Tyr)

name: AIM17
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and null mutant displays reduced frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: MEP2

name: FEP1
description: Iron responsive transcription factor of Pichia pastoris, a GATA type transcriptional repressor that regulates the high affinity iron uptake

name: PP7435_Chr1-1184
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF2216)

name: TIM22

name: DUG3

name: PP7435_Chr1-1187
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: universal stress protein family, USP_Like (Usp is a small cytoplasmic bacterial protein whose expression in S. cerevisiae is enhanced when the cell is exposed to stress agents))

name: PP7435_Chr1-1189
description: Protein with similarity to YNL011C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae YNL011C is not an essential gene)

name: UPS1

name: UGA3

name: PP7435_Chr1-1192
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1194
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: POC1 chaperone)

name: YKE2
description: Subunit of the heterohexameric Gim/prefoldin protein complex involved in the folding of alpha-tubulin, beta-tubulin, and actin

name: CBF1

name: MNN4-1

name: MNN14

name: CWC24

name: PEX30

name: TFG2

name: WSC2

name: SLM1

name: LYS20

name: RPS9B

name: RPL21B

name: RIM2

name: BEM3

name: LIP5

name: BGL2

name: BFR1

name: IDI1

name: MCA1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1223
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1224
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: FLR1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1226
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: GEA2

name: PEX7

name: PP7435_Chr1-1229
description: Protein with low similarity to SPT21, protein with a role in transcriptional silencing

name: SPO71

name: QOR2

name: PP7435_Chr1-1233
description: Protein with low similarity to scaffold protein for the mitogen-activated protein (MAP) kinase cascade that regulates mating

name: CAO1

name: RTC1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1238
description: Protein with low similarity to cytoplasmic dynein intermediate chain

name: SLD5

name: ATP16

name: PP7435_Chr1-1241

description: Protein with similarity to YLR446W (Putative hexokinase, transcript is upregulated during sporulation and the unfolded protein response, in S. cerevisiae YLR446W is not an essential gene)

name: ALG13

name: PP7435_Chr1-1244
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ADE1

name: SEC6

name: PP7435_Chr1-1248
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: centromere complex subunit, CENP_Q)

description: Protein with low similarity to PCI-domain-containing proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-1250
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RRP40

name: FIG4

name: FAL1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1258
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: SEC20

name: SES1

description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1264
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1266
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1267
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: MRX1
description: Protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the mitochondrion and null mutation results in a decrease in plasma membrane electron transport

name: PP7435_Chr1-1269

name: GPI1

name: AMA1

name: MTC6
