description: Protein involved in the regulation of cell wall synthesis, proposed to be involved in coordinating cell cycle progression with cell wall integrity

name: PHB2
description: Subunit of the prohibitin complex (Phb1p-Phb2p), a 1.2 MDa ring-shaped inner mitochondrial membrane chaperone that stabilizes newly synthesized proteins, determinant of replicative life span, involved in mitochondrial segregation, enriched in mitochondria

name: NAS6
description: Evolutionarily conserved 19S regulatory particle assembly-chaperone, proteasome-interacting protein involved in the assembly of the base subcomplex of the 19S proteasomal regulatory particle (RP), ortholog of human oncoprotein gankyrin, also known as p28, which interacts with the Rb tumor suppressor and CDK4/6

name: TAT2
description: High affinity tryptophan and tyrosine permease, enriched among several compartments, overexpression in S. cerevisiae confers FK506 and FTY720 resistance

name: ZPR1
description: Essential protein with two zinc fingers, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as protein present in the nucleus of growing cells which relocates to the cytoplasm in starved cells via a process mediated by Cpr1p, binds to translation elongation factor eEF-1 (Tef1p), relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1283
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CMC1
description: Copper-binding protein known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial intermembrane space protein, evolutionarily conserved, may be involved in delivering copper from the matrix to the cytochrome c oxidase complex, contains a twin CX9C motif

name: SPC24
description: Component of the evolutionarily conserved kinetochore-associated Ndc80 complex (Ndc80p-Nuf2p-Spc24p-Spc25p), involved in chromosome segregation, spindle checkpoint activity and kinetochore clustering

name: MRPL31
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PP7435_Chr1-1287
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DASH complex subunit Hsk3 like)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1288
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: minimal binding domain of Hap4 for binding to Hap2/3/5)

name: SHH3
description: Putative mitochondrial inner membrane protein of unknown function, enriched in mitochondria, although similar to paralogous Sdh3p, Shh3p is not a stoichiometric subunit of either succinate dehydrogenase or of the TIM22 translocase, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SDH3

name: AIM9
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and null mutant displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: PP7435_Chr1-1291
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Peptidase S8 family domain in CspA-like proteins)

name: CYS3
description: Cystathionine gamma-lyase, catalyzes one of the two reactions involved in the transsulfuration pathway that yields cysteine from homocysteine with the intermediary formation of cystathionine, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RPP2B
description: Ribosomal protein P2 beta, a component of the ribosomal stalk, which is involved in the interaction between translational elongation factors and the ribosome, regulates the accumulation of P1 (Rpp1Ap and Rpp1Bp) in the cytoplasm, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RPS15
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S15 and bacterial S19, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: DEP1
description: Component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex, required for diauxic shift-induced histone H2B deposition onto rDNA genes, transcriptional modulator involved in regulation of structural phospholipid biosynthesis genes and metabolically unrelated genes, as well as maintenance of telomeres, mating efficiency, and sporulation

name: NOP12
description: Protein involved in pre-25S rRNA processing and biogenesis of large 60S ribosomal subunit, contains an RNA recognition motif (RRM), binds to Ebp2, similar to Nop13p and Nsr1p, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: LAP3
description: Cysteine aminopeptidase with homocysteine-thiolactonase activity, protects cells against homocysteine toxicity, has bleomycin hydrolase activity in vitro, transcription is regulated by galactose via Gal4p, orthologous to human BLMH

name: PP7435_Chr1-1298
description: Protein with low similarity to RRT8, protein involved in spore wall assembly

name: GSH2
description: Glutathione synthetase, catalyzes the ATP-dependent synthesis of glutathione (GSH) from gamma-glutamylcysteine and glycine, induced in S. cerevisiae by oxidative stress and heat shock

name: STT3
description: Subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex of the ER lumen, which catalyzes asparagine-linked glycosylation of newly synthesized proteins, forms a subcomplex with Ost3p and Ost4p and is directly involved in catalysis, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: KIP3-1
description: Kinesin-related motor protein involved in mitotic spindle positioning

name: SIP2
description: One of three beta subunits of the Snf1 kinase complex, involved in the response to glucose starvation, in S. cerevisiae null mutants exhibit accelerated aging and the N-myristoylprotein is known as cytoplasmic and plasma membrane protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GAL83

name: MDM34
description: Component of the ERMES complex, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, links the ER to mitochondria and may promote inter-organellar calcium and phospholipid exchange as well as coordinating mitochondrial DNA replication and growth

name: VAM7
description: SNARE protein, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein which functions with Vam3p in vacuolar protein trafficking, has an N-terminal PX domain (phosphoinositide-binding module) that binds PtdIns-3-P and mediates membrane binding, SNAP-25 homolog, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SKI8
description: Ski complex component and WD-repeat protein, mediates 3'-5' RNA degradation by the cytoplasmic exosome, also required for meiotic double-strand break recombination, S. cerevisiae null mutants have superkiller phenotype

name: LAS1
description: Endonuclease involved in pre-rRNA processing at both ends of ITS2, functions with Grc3p in a conserved mechanism to modulate rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis, may coordinate the action of the Rat1p-Rai1p exoRNAse, required for the G1/S cell cycle transition, human ortholog is Las1L, S. cerevisiae mutants require the SSD1-v allele for viability

name: VPS35
description: Subunit of membrane-associated retromer complex required for retrograde transport, enriched in microsome and vacuole, known in S. cerevisiae as endosomal receptor that recognizes retrieval signals on cargo proteins, forms subcomplex with Vps26p and Vps29p that selects cargo proteins for retrieval, interacts with Ypt7p

name: VAC14
description: Enzyme regulator, involved in synthesis of phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate, in control of trafficking of some proteins to the vacuole lumen via the MVB, and in maintenance of vacuole size and acidity, binds negative (Fig4p) and positive (Fab1p) regulators of PtdIns(3,5)P(2) to control endolysosome function, similar to mammalian Vac14p, enriched in Golgi and vacuole

name: STE23
description: Metalloprotease involved, with homolog Axl1p, in N-terminal processing of pro-a-factor to the mature form, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, expressed in S. cerevisiae in both haploids and diploids, member of the insulin-degrading enzyme family

name: PP7435_Chr1-1312
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: RAD50
description: Subunit of MRX complex with Mre11p and Xrs2p, complex is involved in processing double-strand DNA breaks in vegetative cells, initiation of meiotic DSBs, telomere maintenance, and nonhomologous end joining, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1314
description: Protein with similarity to YNL247W, enriched in cytosol (Cysteinyl-tRNA synthetase, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1315
description: Protein with similarity to YJR015W (Putative protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as ER and cytoplasmic protein, predicted to encode a membrane transporter based on phylogenetic analysis, in S. cerevisiae YJR015W is not an essential gene, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SNG1)

name: SUT2
description: Zn2Cys6 family transcription factor, in S. cerevisiae positively regulates sterol uptake under anaerobic conditions with SUT1, represses filamentation-inducing genes during non-starvation conditions and positively regulates mating along with SUT1 by repressing the expression of genes (PRR2, NCE102 and RHO5) which function as mating inhibitors, in S. cerevisiae is multicopy suppressor of mutations that cause low activity of the cAMP/PKA pathway, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SUT1

name: POP1
description: Subunit of both RNase MRP and nuclear RNase P, RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, while nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, binds to the RPR1 RNA subunit in RNase P

name: UAP3
description: Putative uric acid-xanthine permease (UAPA transporter) similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis UAP3

name: JJJ1
description: Co-chaperone that stimulates the ATPase activity of Ssa1p, required for a late step of ribosome biogenesis, associated with the cytosolic large ribosomal subunit, contains a J-domain, mutation in S. cerevisiae causes defects in fluid-phase endocytosis

name: GUD1-2
description: Guanine deaminase, a catabolic enzyme of the guanine salvage pathway producing xanthine and ammonia from guanine, in S. cerevisiae activity is low in exponentially-growing cultures but expression is increased in post-diauxic and stationary-phase cultures

name: SQS1
description: Protein that stimulates the ATPase and helicase activities of Prp43p, acts with Prp43p to stimulate 18s rRNA maturation by Nob1p, overexpression in S. cerevisiae antagonizes the suppression of splicing defects by spp382 mutants, component of pre-ribosomal particles, known in S. cerevisiae as protein that relocalizes from nucleus to nucleolus upon DNA replication stress

name: GUD1-1
description: Guanine deaminase, a catabolic enzyme of the guanine salvage pathway producing xanthine and ammonia from guanine, in S. cerevisiae activity is low in exponentially-growing cultures but expression is increased in post-diauxic and stationary-phase cultures

name: PP7435_Chr1-1324
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MIG1-2
description: Transcription factor involved in glucose repression, sequence specific DNA binding protein containing two Cys2His2 zinc finger motifs, regulated by the SNF1 kinase and the GLC7 phosphatase, regulates in S. cerevisiae filamentous growth along with Mig2p in response to glucose depletion

name: SMB1
description: Core Sm protein Sm B, part of heteroheptameric complex (with Smd1p, Smd2p, Smd3p, Sme1p, Smx3p, and Smx2p) that is part of the spliceosomal U1, U2, U4, and U5 snRNPs, homolog of human Sm B and Sm B'

name: CHZ1
description: Histone chaperone for Htz1p/H2A-H2B dimer, required for the stabilization of the Chz1p-Htz1-H2B complex, has overlapping function with Nap1p, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays weak sensitivity to MMS and benomyl, contains a highly conserved CHZ motif, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: YPT32
description: Rab family GTPase involved in the exocytic pathway, mediates intra-Golgi traffic or the budding of post-Golgi vesicles from the trans-Golgi, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YPT31

name: SPT16
description: Subunit of the heterodimeric FACT complex (Spt16p-Pob3p), which associates with chromatin via interaction with Nhp6Ap and Nhp6Bp, and reorganizes nucleosomes to facilitate access to DNA by RNA and DNA polymerases, some mutations cause reduced nucleosome occupancy over highly transcribed regions of the yeast genome, enriched in cytosol

name: SOK2
description: Protein that negatively regulates pseudohyphal differentiation, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, plays a regulatory role in the cyclic AMP (cAMP)-dependent protein kinase (PKA) signal transduction pathway, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PHD1

name: PEX11C
description: Biogenesis factor 11 similar to peroxisomal protein Pex11c of O. polymorpha

name: CSR1
description: Phosphatidylinositol transfer protein, has a potential role in regulating lipid and fatty acid metabolism under heme-depleted conditions, interacts specifically with thioredoxin peroxidase, may have a role in oxidative stress resistance, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1333
description: Putative transfer RNA for Serine (tRNA-Ser)

name: CDC24
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor for Cdc42p, also known as a GEF or GDP-release factor, required for polarity establishment and maintenance, and S. cerevisiae mutants have morphological defects in bud formation and shmooing, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: NAM2
description: Leucyl-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein with direct role in splicing of several mitochondrial group I introns, indirectly required for mitochondrial genome maintenance

name: SMC6
description: Component of the SMC5-SMC6 complex, this complex plays a key role in the removal of X-shaped DNA structures that arise between sister chromatids during DNA replication and repair, homologous to S. pombe rad18

name: PP7435_Chr1-1337
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: BOL2
description: Protein involved in repression of iron regulon transcription, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein which forms an iron-independent complex with Fra1p, Grx3p, and Grx4p, in S. cerevisiae null mutant fails to repress the iron regulon and is sensitive to nickel, sequence similarity to human BOLA family member, BOLA2

name: NIF3
description: Protein of unknown function, similar to Listeria monocytogenes major sigma factor (rpoD gene product), in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: MRPS35
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, S. cerevisiae null mutant does not grow on glycerol, is sensitive to 2,4-dichlorophenol, and accumulates large lipid droplets, enriched in mitochondria

name: POX1
description: Fatty-acyl coenzyme A oxidase, involved in the fatty acid beta-oxidation pathway, enriched in peroxisome, localized to the peroxisomal matrix

name: ESF2
description: Essential nucleolar protein in S. cerevisiae involved in pre-18S rRNA processing, binds to RNA and stimulates ATPase activity of Dbp8, involved in assembly of the small subunit (SSU) processome

name: PP7435_Chr1-1343
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ESP1
description: Separase, a caspase-like cysteine protease, promotes sister chromatid separation by mediating dissociation of the cohesin Scc1p from chromatin, inhibits protein phosphatase 2A-Cdc55p to promote mitotic exit, inhibited by Pds1p, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1345
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1346
description: Protein with low similarity to NADH-dependent oxidoreductase

name: NNF2
description: Protein that exhibits physical and genetic interactions with Rpb8p, which is a subunit of RNA polymerases I, II, and III, computational analysis of large-scale protein-protein interaction data suggests a role in chromosome segregation

name: MRI1
description: 5'-methylthioribose-1-phosphate isomerase, catalyzes the isomerization of 5-methylthioribose-1-phosphate to 5-methylthioribulose-1-phosphate in the methionine salvage pathway, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1349
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved, enriched in Golgi

name: CHC1
description: Clathrin heavy chain, subunit of the major coat protein involved in intracellular protein transport and endocytosis, two heavy chains form the clathrin triskelion structural component, the light chain (CLC1) is thought to regulate function, enriched in cytosol

name: PMP20
description: Peroxiredoxin, similar to peroxisomal membrane associated protein PMP20 of C. boidinii, enriched in peroxisome and among several compartments

name: YSP3
description: Putative precursor to the subtilisin-like protease III, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PRB1

name: MPH1
description: 3'-5' DNA helicase involved in error-free bypass of DNA lesions, binds to flap DNA in an error-free bypass pathway and stimulates the activity of Rad27p and Dna2p, also involved in interstrand cross-link repair mutations confer a mutator phenotype, similarity to FANCM, a human Fanconi anemia complementation group protein that along with the MHF complex is involved in stabilizing and remodeling blocked replication forks, member of the SF2 DExD/H superfamily of helicases

name: SEC3
description: Subunit of the exocyst complex, the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to sites of exocytosis prior to SNARE-mediated fusion, PtdIns[4,5]P2-binding protein that localizes to exocytic sites in a Rho1p-dependent, actin-independent manner, targeting and anchoring the exocyst to the plasma membrane with Exo70p, direct GTP Rho1p effector, required for ER inheritance, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck that relocalizes away from bud neck upon DNA replication stress

name: ADE6
description: Formylglycinamidine-ribonucleotide (FGAM)-synthetase, catalyzes a step in the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway, enriched in cytosol

name: MEP3
description: Ammonium permease of high capacity and low affinity, belongs to a ubiquitous family of cytoplasmic membrane proteins that transport only ammonium (NH4+), expression in S. cerevisiae is under the nitrogen catabolite repression regulation ammonia permease, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MEP1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1357
description: Protein with similarity to YBR096W, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER)

name: ATG11
description: Adapter protein for pexophagy and the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway, directs receptor-bound cargo to the phagophore assembly site (PAS) for packaging into vesicles, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSA9, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: RFC5
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C), which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon

name: MRPL16
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: HXK1
description: Hexokinase isoenzyme 1, a cytosolic protein that catalyzes phosphorylation of glucose during glucose metabolism, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae is highest during growth on non-glucose carbon sources, glucose-induced repression involves hexokinase Hxk2p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog HXK2

name: PP7435_Chr1-1363
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: BPT1
description: ABC type transmembrane transporter of MRP/CFTR family, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, found in S. cerevisiae in the vacuolar membrane, involved in the transport of unconjugated bilirubin and in heavy metal detoxification via glutathione conjugates, along with Ycf1p

name: PP7435_Chr1-1365
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MSS1
description: Protein that forms a heterodimer complex with Mto1p that performs the 5-carboxymethylaminomethyl modification of the wobble uridine base in mitochondrial tRNAs, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, similar to human GTPBP3

name: IND1
description: Iron-sulfur protein similar to Yarrowia lipolytica IND1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1368
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PDE1
description: Low-affinity cyclic AMP phosphodiesterase, controls glucose and intracellular acidification-induced cAMP signaling, target of the cAMP-protein kinase A (PKA) pathway, glucose induces transcription and inhibits translation

name: PRE4
description: Beta 7 subunit of the 20S proteasome, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr1-1371
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: single strand annealing-weakened 1)

name: PIL1
description: Eisosome core component, eisosomes are large immobile cell cortex structures associated with endocytosis, phosphorylated on Thr233 upon Pkc1p hyperactivation in a Slt2p MAPK-dependent fashion, enriched in plasma membrane, microsome and mitochondria, in S. cerevisiae detected in phosphorylated state in mitochondria, null mutant shows activation of Pkc1p/Ypk1p stress resistance pathways, member of BAR domain family, in S. cerevisiae protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from plasma membrane to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1373
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: PpHXT1
description: Low affinity glucose transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, induced in Pichia pastoris by high levels of glucose, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-1375
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TRA1
description: Subunit of SAGA and NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complexes, interacts with acidic activators (e.g., Gal4p) which leads to transcription activation, similar to human TRRAP, which is a cofactor for c-Myc mediated oncogenic transformation, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: GEP4
description: Phosphatidylglycerophosphatase (PGP phosphatase), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, dephosphorylates phosphatidylglycerolphosphate to generate phosphatidylglycerol, an essential step during cardiolipin biosynthesis, S. cerevisiae null mutant is sensitive to tunicamycin, DTT

name: HEL2
description: RING finger ubiquitin ligase (E3), involved in ubiquitylation and degradation of excess histones, interacts with Ubc4p and Rad53p, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant is sensitive to hydroxyurea (HU) and the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, computational analysis suggests a role as a transcription factor

name: NI8M
description: NI8M (B8) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1381
description: Protein with low similarity to putative LigB subunit of aromatic ring-opening dioxygenase (C. maltosa)

name: OXA1
description: Mitochondrial inner membrane insertase, mediates the insertion of both mitochondrial- and nuclear-encoded proteins from the matrix into the inner membrane, also has a role in insertion of carrier proteins into the inner membrane, interacts with mitochondrial ribosomes, conserved from bacteria to animals, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-1383
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1384
description: Protein with similarity to YER152C, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells (Protein with 2-aminoadipate transaminase activity, shares amino acid similarity with the aminotransferases Aro8p and Aro9p, in S. cerevisiae YER152C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1385
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: SWIM zinc finger)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1386
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: PP7435_Chr1-1387
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1388
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: FLO5-1
description: Lectin-like cell wall protein (flocculin) involved in flocculation, binds mannose chains on the surface of other cells, confers floc-forming ability that is chymotrypsin resistant but heat labile, important for co-flocculation with other yeasts, mediating interaction with specific specie, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cellss, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FLO1 but has more isoforms of those flocculins

name: UBP3
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease involved in transport and osmotic response, interacts with Bre5p to co-regulate anterograde and retrograde transport between the ER and Golgi, involved in transcription elongation in response to osmostress through phosphorylation at Ser695 by Hog1p, inhibitor of gene silencing, cleaves ubiquitin fusions but not polyubiquitin, also has mRNA binding activity, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SPI1
description: GPI-anchored cell wall protein involved in weak acid resistance, in S. cerevisiae basal expression requires Msn2p/Msn4p and expression is induced under conditions of stress and during the diauxic shift, in Pichia pastoris has a strong constititive promoter, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SED1, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GCW14

name: PP7435_Chr1-1392
description: Protein with low similarity to RAD55, protein that stimulates strand exchange whcih stimulates strand exchange by stabilizing the binding of Rad51p to single-stranded DANN

name: PP7435_Chr1-1393
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1394
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1395
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF88), enriched among several compartments

name: RPS2
description: Protein component of the small (40S) subunit, enriched among several compartments essential in S. cerevisiae for control of translational accuracy, phosphorylation by C-terminal domain kinase I (CTDK-I) enhances translational accuracy, methylated on one or more arginine residues by Hmt1p, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S2 and bacterial S5

name: NAB2
description: Polyadenylated RNA-binding protein, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein required for nuclear mRNA export and poly(A) tail length control, binds nuclear pore protein Mlp1p, autoregulates mRNA levels, related to human hnRNPs, nuclear localization sequence binds Kap104p, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1398
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: fusaric acid resistance protein-like, FUSC_2)

name: COQ8
description: ATPase required for ubiquinone biosynthesis and respiratory growth, maintains levels of CoQ biosynthetic proteins, binds to CoQ biosynthesis intermediates, UbiB protein kinase-like family member that lacks canonical protein kinase activity, similar to prokaryotic proteins involved in ubiquinone biosynthesis, human homolog ADCK3 complements a coq8 null, is associated with CoQ and respiratory-chain deficiencies, and is mutated in autosomal-recessive cerebellar ataxia type 2, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YBR230W-A

name: PRP43
description: RNA helicase in the DEAH-box family, functions in both RNA polymerase I and polymerase II transcript metabolism, catalyzes removal of U2, U5, and U6 snRNPs from the postsplicing lariat-intron ribonucleoprotein complex, required for efficient biogenesis of both small- and large-subunit rRNAs, acts with Sqs1p to promote 20S to 18S rRNA processing catalyzed by endonuclease Nob1p, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PDB1
description: E1 beta subunit of the pyruvate dehydrogenase (PDH) complex, which is an evolutionarily-conserved multi-protein complex, enriched in mitochondria

name: KAP114
description: Karyopherin, responsible for nuclear import of specific proteins, cargoes include Spt15p, Sua7p, histones H2A and H2B, and Nap1p, amino terminus shows similarity to those of other importins, particularly Cse1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae mainly as nuclear protein, function is regulated by sumoylation and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RTF1
description: Subunit of RNAPII-associated chromatin remodeling Paf1 complex, regulates gene expression by directing cotranscriptional histone modification, influences transcription and chromatin structure through several independent functional domains, directly or indirectly regulates DNA-binding properties of Spt15p and relative activities of different TATA elements, involved in transcription elongation as demonstrated by the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RMD8
description: Protein required for sporulation, enriched in vacuole, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: GUS1
description: Glutamyl-tRNA synthetase (GluRS), forms a complex with methionyl-tRNA synthetase (Mes1p) and Arc1p, complex formation increases the catalytic efficiency of both tRNA synthetases and ensures their correct localization to the cytoplasm, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: BRR6
description: Integral membrane protein, known in S. cerevisiae as essential nuclear envelope protein required for nuclear envelope morphology, nuclear pore complex localization, nuclear export, exhibits synthetic lethal genetic interactions with genes involved in lipid metabolism

name: YMR31
description: Putative mitochondrial 37S ribosomal protein, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis YMR31 and human mitochondrial ribosomal protein MRP-S36

name: CAN1
description: Arginine permease, enriched in microsome and Golgi, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein which requires phosphatidyl ethanolamine (PE) for its localization, exclusively associated with lipid rafts, mutation confers canavanine resistance, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ALP1

name: EFM5
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent lysine methyltransferase, involved in the trimethylation of eEF1A (Tef1p/Tef2p) at lysine 79, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, required for replication of Brome mosaic virus in budding yeast, expresses a circular RNA, originally misclassified as a N-6-adenine specific DNA methyltransferase based on sequence similarity

name: NUP60
description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport and maintenance of the NPC permeability barrier and is involved in gene tethering at the nuclear periphery, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, both NUP1 and NUP60 are homologous to human NUP153

name: ERG26
description: C-3 sterol dehydrogenase, catalyzes the second of three steps required to remove two C-4 methyl groups from an intermediate in ergosterol biosynthesis, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr1-1414
description: Protein with low similarity to putative GPI-anchored protein

name: VPS8
description: Membrane-binding component of the CORVET complex, involved in endosomal vesicle tethering and fusion in the endosome to vacuole protein targeting pathway, interacts with Vps21p, contains RING finger motif

name: PP7435_Chr1-1416
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SWD1
description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex, which methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in transcriptional silencing near telomeres, WD40 beta propeller superfamily member with similarity to mammalian Rbbp7

name: ARO8
description: Aromatic aminotransferase I, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by general control of amino acid biosynthesis

name: CUL4
description: Putative cullin, ubiquitin ligase activity similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis CUL4

name: PP7435_Chr1-1420
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: complex proteins associated with Set1p, COMPASS)

name: APE3
description: Vacuolar aminopeptidase Y, processed to mature form by Prb1p, enriched in vacuole

name: PP7435_Chr1-1422
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: PP7435_Chr1-1423
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: bacterial low temperature requirement A protein), enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: SEO1-1
description: Putative permease, member of the allantoate transporter subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily, mutation in S. cerevisiae confers resistance to ethionine sulfoxide

name: PP7435_Chr1-1426
description: Protein with low similarity to YRA1, nuclear polyadenylated RNA-binding protein which is required for export of poly(A)+ mRNA from the nucleus, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SAC1
description: Phosphatidylinositol phosphate (PtdInsP) phosphatase, involved in hydrolysis of PtdIns[4]P in the early and medial Golgi, regulated by interaction with Vps74p, enriched in microsome, Golgi and mitochondria, ER localized transmembrane protein which cycles through the Golgi, involved in protein trafficking and processing, secretion, and cell wall maintenance, regulates sphingolipid biosynthesis through the modulation of PtdIns(4)P metabolism

name: DOA1
description: WD repeat protein required for ubiquitin-mediated protein degradation, forms a complex with Cdc48p, plays a role in controlling cellular ubiquitin concentration, also promotes efficient NHEJ in postdiauxic/stationary phase, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein which increases in abundance and relocalizes from nucleus to nuclear periphery upon DNA replication stress

name: YCF1
description: Vacuolar glutathione S-conjugate transporter, member of ATP-binding cassette family, enriched in vacuole and among several compartments, ATPase activity required to support vacuole fusion, forms stable complexes with vacuole fusion machinery, regulates Vam7p recruitment to vacuoles, has role in detoxifying metals such as cadmium, mercury, and arsenite, also transports unconjugated bilirubin, selenodigluthatione, and oxidized glutathione, similar to human cystic fibrosis protein CFTR

name: SPT20
description: Subunit of the SAGA transcriptional regulatory complex, involved in maintaining the integrity of the complex, S. cerevisiae mutant displays reduced transcription elongation in the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay

name: PpBMT3
description: Beta-mannosyltransferase 3 of Pichia pastoris, not related to S. cerevisiae BMT3, enriched in microsome and Golgi

name: SOA1-2
description: Putative protein with similarity to allantoate permease, similar to the allantoate permease (Dal5p) subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily, in S. cerevisiae mRNA expression is elevated by sulfur limitation and YIL166C is a non-essential gene

name: PP7435_Chr1-1433
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: LAS17
description: Actin assembly factor, C-terminal WCA domain activates Arp2/3 complex-mediated nucleation of branched actin filaments and a polyproline domain which can nucleate actin filaments independent of Arp2/3, S. cerevisiae mutants are defective in actin cytoskeleton dependent processes such as: endocytosis, bud site selection and cytokinesis, known in S. cerevisiae to localize with the Arp2/3 complex to actin cortical patches, homolog of the Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome protein (WASP), implicated in severe immunodeficiency

name: PP7435_Chr1-1435
description: Protein with similarity to YLR287C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and YLR287C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1436
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: UPF0183)

name: YPT10
description: Rab family GTP-binding protein that contains the PEST signal sequence specific for proteolytic enzymes, may be involved in vesicular transport, overexpression in S. cerevisiae leads to accumulation of Golgi-like cisternae with budding vesicles

name: IKS1
description: Protein kinase of unknown cellular role, putative serine/threonine kinase, expression is induced during mild heat stress, S. cerevisiae deletion mutants are hypersensitive to copper sulphate and resistant to sorbate, interacts with an N-terminal fragment of Sst2p

name: TSR4
description: Protein required for correct processing of the 20S pre-rRNA at site D to generate mature 18S rRNA, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein and as essential gene in S. cerevisiae S288C background but not in CEN.PK2

name: SSH1
description: Subunit of the Ssh1 translocon complex, Sec61p homolog involved in co-translational pathway of protein translocation, enriched among several compartments, not essential in S. cerevisiae

name: ESL2
description: hEST1A/B (SMG5/6)-like protein, contributes to environment-sensing adaptive gene expression responses, Esl2p and Esl1p contain a 14-3-3-like domain and a putative PilT N-terminus ribonuclease domain, interacts with Pex14p, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ESL1

name: MIS1-1
description: Mitochondrial C1-tetrahydrofolate synthase, involved in interconversion between different oxidation states of tetrahydrofolate (THF), provides activities of formyl-THF synthetase, methenyl-THF cyclohydrolase, and methylene-THF dehydrogenase, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: RAD27
description: 5' to 3' exonuclease, 5' flap endonuclease, required for Okazaki fragment processing and maturation as well as for long-patch base-excision repair, member of the S. pombe RAD2/FEN1 family, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: MSH2
description: Protein that forms heterodimers with Msh3p and Msh6p that bind to DNA mismatches to initiate the mismatch repair process, contains a Walker ATP-binding motif required for repair activity and involved in interstrand cross-link repair, Msh2p-Msh6p binds to and hydrolyzes ATP

name: PP7435_Chr1-1446
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: SOA1-6
description: Putative protein with similarity to allantoate permease, similar to the allantoate permease (Dal5p) subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily, in S. cerevisiae mRNA expression is elevated by sulfur limitation and YIL166C is a non-essential gene

name: KTI12
description: Protein that plays a role, with Elongator complex, in modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA, involved in sensitivity to G1 arrest induced by zymocin, interacts with chromatin throughout the genome, also interacts with Cdc19p

name: ATP25
description: Protein required for the stability of Oli1p (Atp9p) mRNA and for the Oli1p ring formation, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, but is not an essential gene

name: YAP3
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor

name: UTP15
description: Protein component of the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: AIP1
description: Actin cortical patch component, interacts with the actin depolymerizing factor cofilin, required to restrict cofilin localization to cortical patches, contains WD repeats, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from cytoplasm to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

name: UTP11
description: Subunit of U3-containing Small Subunit (SSU) processome complex involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit

name: MTC2
description: Protein of unknown function, mtc2 is synthetically sick with cdc13-1

name: VPS1
description: Dynamin-like GTPase required for vacuolar sorting, also involved in actin cytoskeleton organization, endocytosis, late Golgi-retention of some proteins, regulation of peroxisome biogenesis, enriched among several compartments

name: OSH6
description: Member of an oxysterol-binding protein family, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, overlapping, redundant functions in sterol metabolism and which collectively perform a function essential for viability, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery, its overexpression extends lifespan by promoting vacuolar fusion, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog OSH7

name: SAM50-2
description: Component of the Sorting and Assembly Machinery (SAM) complex, the SAM (or TOB) complex is located in the mitochondrial outer membrane, the complex binds precursors of beta-barrel proteins and facilitates their outer membrane insertion, homologous to bacterial Omp85, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: YTA12
description: Mitochondrial inner membrane m-AAA protease component, mediates degradation of misfolded or unassembled proteins, also required for correct assembly of mitochondrial enzyme complexes, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, overexpression of human AFG3L2 complements respiratory defect of yeast afg3 yta12 double null mutation, but overexpression of disease-associated AFG3L2 variants does not, expression of both human SPG7 (paraplegin) and AFG3L2 complements yeast yta12 afg3 double mutation

name: NPL6
description: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex, interacts with Rsc3p, Rsc30p, Ldb7p, and Htl1p to form a module important for a broad range of RSC functions, involved in nuclear protein import and maintenance of proper telomere length

name: SGF73
description: Subunit of DUBm module of SAGA and SLIK, has roles in anchoring deubiquitination module (DUBm) into SAGA and SLIK complexes, maintaining organization and ubiquitin-binding conformation of Ubp8p, thereby contributing to overall DUBm activity, involved in preinitiation complex assembly at promoters, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes to cytosol under hypoxia, human homolog ATXN7 implicated in spinocerebellar ataxia, and can complement yeast null mutant

name: ALG2
description: Mannosyltransferase that catalyzes two consecutive steps in the N-linked glycosylation pathway, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit temperature-sensitive growth and abnormal accumulation of the lipid-linked oligosaccharide Man2GlcNAc2-PP-Dol

name: PP7435_Chr1-1464
description: Protein with low similarity to putative GTPase-activating protein

name: MHP1
description: Microtubule-associated protein involved in assembly and stabilization of microtubules, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, overproduction in S. cerevisiae results in cell cycle arrest at G2 phase, similar to Drosophila protein MAP and to mammalian MAP4 proteins

name: PP7435_Chr1-1466
description: Protein with low similarity to protein involved in calcineurin-dependent signaling that controls stress response and virulence

name: CIC1
description: Protein that interacts with proteasome components and has a potential role in proteasome substrate specificity, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae, also copurifies with 66S pre-ribosomal particles

name: ELF1
description: Transcription elongation factor that contains a conserved zinc finger domain, implicated in the maintenance of proper chromatin structure in actively transcribed regions, in S. cerevisiae the deletion inhibits Brome mosaic virus (BMV) gene expression

name: RKR1
description: RING domain E3 ubiquitin ligase, involved in ubiquitin-mediated degradation of non-stop proteins, component of the ribosome quality control (RQC) complex (Rqc1p-Rkr1p-Tae2p-Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p), a ribosome-bound complex required for degradation of polypeptides arising from stalled translation, functional connections to chromatin modification, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein which co-localizes with ribosomes, homolog of mouse Listerin, mutations in which reported to cause neurodegeneration

name: SRC1
description: Inner nuclear membrane protein, functions in regulation of subtelomeric genes and is linked to TREX (transcription export) factors, enriched in microsome, in S. cerevisiae there are 2 splice variant proteins with different functions, alternative splicing of SRC1 pre-mRNA is promoted by Hub1p, S. cerevisiae mutant has aneuploidy tolerance, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HEH2

name: AMD1
description: AMP deaminase, tetrameric enzyme that catalyzes the deamination of AMP to form IMP and ammonia, thought to be involved in regulation of intracellular purine (adenine, guanine, and inosine) nucleotide pools, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PFA5
description: Palmitoyltransferase with autoacylation activity, likely functions in pathway(s) outside Ras, member of a family of putative palmitoyltransferases containing an Asp-His-His-Cys-cysteine rich (DHHC-CRD) domain

name: PP7435_Chr1-1474
description: Protein with similarity to YJL218W (Putative acetyltransferase, similar to bacterial galactoside O-acetyltransferases, induced by oleate in an OAF1/PIP2-dependent manner, promoter contains an oleate response element consensus sequence, in S. cerevisiae YJL218W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1475
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1476
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PHA03247)

name: MRPL28
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PHO81
description: Cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) inhibitor, regulates Pho80p-Pho85p and Pcl7p-Pho85p cyclin-CDK complexes in response to phosphate levels, inhibitory activity for Pho80p-Pho85p requires myo-D-inositol heptakisphosphate (IP7) generated by Vip1p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr1-1479
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1480
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain:Minimal binding motif of Hap4, role in transcription)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1482
description: Protein with low similarity to Rho GTPase activating proteins

name: SMX2
description: Core Sm protein Sm G, part of heteroheptameric complex (with Smb1p, Smd1p, Smd2p, Smd3p, Sme1p, and Smx3p) that is part of the spliceosomal U1, U2, U4, and U5 snRNPs, homolog of human Sm G

name: IES1
description: Subunit of the INO80 chromatin remodeling complex, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: YKT6
description: Vesicle membrane protein (v-SNARE) with acyltransferase activity, involved in trafficking to and within the Golgi, endocytic trafficking to the vacuole, and vacuolar fusion, enriched in Golgi and vacuole, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, membrane localization due to prenylation at the carboxy-terminus

name: VTS1
description: Flap-structured DNA-binding and RNA-binding protein, stimulates deadenylation-dependent mRNA degradation mediated by the CCR4-NOT deadenylase complex, member of the Smaug (Smg) family of post-transcriptional regulators which bind RNA through a conserved sterile alpha motif (SAM) domain that interacts with Smg recognition element (SREs) containing transcripts, stimulates Dna2p endonuclease activity

name: PDE2
description: High-affinity cyclic AMP phosphodiesterase, component of the cAMP-dependent protein kinase signaling system, protects the cell from extracellular cAMP, contains readthrough motif surrounding termination codon

name: GCV3
description: H subunit of the mitochondrial glycine decarboxylase complex, required for the catabolism of glycine to 5,10-methylene-THF, also required for all protein lipoylation, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by levels of 5,10-methylene-THF

name: BOL1
description: Protein involved in Fe-S cluster biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the itochondrial matrix which facilitates [4Fe-2S] cluster inception into mitochondrial proteins such as lipoate synthase and succinate dehydrogenase, interacts and may function with Grx5p at an early step in Fe-S cluster biosynthesis, forms dimeric complexes with Grx5p and Nfu1p that alter the stability of shared Fe/S clusters, sequence similarity to human BOLA family member, BOLA1 and Schizosaccharomyces pombe uvi31, a putative DNA repair protein

name: SNC2
description: Vesicle membrane receptor protein (v-SNARE), involved in the fusion between Golgi-derived secretory vesicles with the plasma membrane, member of the synaptobrevin/VAMP family of R-type v-SNARE proteins, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SNC1

name: MYO2
description: Type V myosin motor involved in actin-based transport of cargos, required for the polarized delivery of secretory vesicles, the vacuole, late Golgi elements, peroxisomes, and the mitotic spindle, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MYO4

name: PP7435_Chr1-1492
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Synaptonemal complex protein 1, SCP-1)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1493
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SOG2
description: Key component of the RAM signaling network, required for proper cell morphogenesis and cell separation after mitosis

name: YHM2
description: Citrate and oxoglutarate carrier protein, exports citrate from and imports oxoglutarate into the mitochondrion, causing net export of NADPH reducing equivalents, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, also associates in S. cerevisiae with mt nucleoids and has a role in replication and segregation of the mt genome

name: PP7435_Chr1-1496
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Life-span regulatory factor)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1498
description: Putative transfer RNA for Serine (tRNA-Ser)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1499
description: Putative transfer RNA for Serine (tRNA-Ser)

name: DUS1
description: Dihydrouridine synthase, member of a widespread family of conserved proteins including Smm1p, Dus3p, and Dus4p, modifies pre-tRNA(Phe) at U17

name: VPS70-2
description: Protein of unknown function involved in vacuolar protein sorting

name: CPR3
description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin), catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues, involved in protein refolding after import into mitochondria (Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (CYP1) in Pichia pastoris), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: ENT3
description: Protein containing an N-terminal epsin-like domain involved in clathrin recruitment and traffic between the Golgi and endosomes, associates with the clathrin adaptor Gga2p, enriched among several compartments

name: ECH1
description: Putative enoyl CoA hydratase similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis ECH1 and predicted peroxisomal

name: TNA1-2
description: High affinity nicotinic acid permease, responsible for upTake of low levels of nicotinic acid, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein whose expression increases in the absence of extracellular nicotinic acid or para-aminobenzoate (PABA)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1506
description: Protein with similarity to YMR315W, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells (Protein with NADP(H) oxidoreductase activity, transcription is regulated by Stb5p in response to NADPH depletion induced by diamide, promoter contains a putative Stb5p binding site, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1507
description: Protein with low similarity to phytanoyl-CoA dioxygenase domain-containing protein of Ogataea parapolymorpha

name: PP7435_Chr1-1508
description: Protein with low similarity to KXD1, subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation

name: APL5
description: Delta adaptin-like subunit of the clathrin associated protein complex (AP-3), functions in transport of alkaline phosphatase to the vacuole via the alternate pathway, suppressor of loss of casein kinase 1 function

name: DDC1
description: DNA damage checkpoint protein, part of a PCNA-like complex required for DNA damage response, required in S. cerevisiae for pachytene checkpoint to inhibit cell cycle in response to unrepaired recombination intermediates, potential Cdc28p substrate, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: MPC1
description: Highly conserved subunit of the mitochondrial pyruvate carrier, a mitochondrial inner membrane complex comprised of Fmp37p/Mpc1p and either Mpc2p or Fmp43p/Mpc3p mediates mitochondrial pyruvate upTake, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays slow growth that is complemented by expression of human or mouse ortholog, mutation in human ortholog is associated with lactic acidosis and hyperpyruvatemia, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr1-1512
description: Protein with low similarity to late-stage biofilm-induced protein of Candida albicans

name: PP7435_Chr1-1513
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1514
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1515
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-1516
description: Protein with similarity to YMR090W, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to DTDP-glucose 4,6-dehydratases, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, up-regulated in response to the fungicide mancozeb and is not essential for viability)

name: PP7435_Chr1-1517
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: RPL36A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L36A, N-terminally acetylated, binds to 5.8 S rRNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L36, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL36B

name: MRPL24
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, two mitochondrial ribosomal proteins, YmL14 and YmL24, have been assigned to the same gene, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: GYP5
description: GTPase-activating protein (GAP) for yeast Rab family members, involved in ER to Golgi trafficking, exhibits GAP activity toward Ypt1p that is stimulated by Gyl1p, also acts on Sec4p, interacts with Gyl1p, Rvs161p and Rvs167p, involved in recruiting Rvs167p to the bud tip during polarized growth, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GYL1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1521
description: Protein with low similarity to SPG5, required for proteasome assembly during quiescence

name: CRA1
description: DNA-binding transcription factor, ortholog of Saccharomyces cerevisiae Gal4 but not involved in galactose utilization (no galactose metabolism in P. pastoris), activator of glycolytic genes, activates the Crabtree effect in P. pastoris when overexpressed, knockout strain grows slower and does not produce ethanol

name: RDH54
description: DNA-dependent ATPase, DNA recombination/repair factor, supercoils DNA and promotes DNA strand opening, stimulates strand exchange by modifying the topology of double-stranded DNA, involved in recombinational repair of DNA double-strand breaks during mitosis and meiosis, proposed to be involved in crossover interference, interacts with Dmc1p, stimulates Dmc1p and Rad51p

name: DSS4
description: Guanine nucleotide dissociation stimulator for Sec4p, functions in the post-Golgi secretory pathway, binds zinc, found both on membranes and in the cytosol

name: LCB1
description: Component of serine palmitoyltransferase, responsible along with Lcb2p for the first committed step in sphingolipid synthesis, which is the condensation of serine with palmitoyl-CoA to form 3-ketosphinganine, enriched among several compartments

name: YAH1
description: Ferredoxin, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mitochondrial matrix required for formation of cellular iron-sulfur proteins, involved in heme A biosynthesis, homologous to human adrenodoxin

name: PP7435_Chr1-1528
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: HR1 repeat)

name: CLN2
description: G1 cyclin involved in regulation of the cell cycle, activates Cdc28p kinase to promote the G1 to S phase transition, late G1 specific expression in S. cerevisiae depends on transcription factor complexes, MBF (Swi6p-Mbp1p) and SBF (Swi6p-Swi4p), Pichia pastoris has also the paralog CLN1

name: ROT1
description: Molecular chaperone enriched in Golgi, known in S. cerevisiae to be involved in protein folding in the ER, in S. cerevisiae mutation causes defects in cell wall synthesis and in lysis of autophagic bodies, suppresses tor2 mutations, and is synthetically lethal with kar2-1 and with rot2 mutations, involved in N-linked glycosylation and O-mannosylation

name: VPS27
description: Protein that forms a complex with Hse1p, known in S. cerevisiae as endosomal protein required for recycling Golgi proteins, forming lumenal membranes and sorting ubiquitinated proteins destined for degradation, has Ubiquitin Interaction Motifs which bind ubiquitin (Ubi4p)

name: ERC1
description: Member of the multi-drug and toxin extrusion (MATE) family of the multidrug/oligosaccharidyl-lipid/polysaccharide (MOP) exporter superfamily, overproduction in S. cerevisiae confers ethionine resistance and accumulation of S-adenosylmethionine

name: PP7435_Chr1-1534
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TEF2
description: Translational elongation factor EF-1 alpha, also encoded by TEF1, functions in the binding reaction of aminoacyl-tRNA (AA-tRNA) to ribosomes, may also have a role in tRNA re-export from the nucleus, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TEF1

name: PP7435_Chr1-1537
description: Protein with low similarity to ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme E2 W of Candida albicans

name: SGS1
description: RecQ family nucleolar DNA helicase, role in genome integrity maintenance, chromosome synapsis, meiotic joint molecule/crossover formation, stimulates activity of Top3p, in S. cerevisiae rapidly lost in response to rapamycin in Rrd1p-dependent manner, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress, S. cerevisiae SGS1 complements mutations in human homolog BLM implicated in Bloom syndrome, also similar to human WRN implicated in Werner syndrome, human BLM and WRN can each complement yeast null mutant

name: DSS1
description: 3'-5' exoribonuclease, known in S. cerevisiae as component of the mitochondrial degradosome along with the ATP-dependent RNA helicase Suv3p, the degradosome associates with the ribosome and mediates turnover of aberrant or unprocessed RNAs

name: YEN1
description: Holliday junction resolvase, promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs), localization in S. cerevisiae is cell-cycle dependent and regulated by Cdc28p phosphorylation, homolog of human GEN1, similar to S. cerevisiae endonuclease Rth1p

name: PCK1
description: Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase, key enzyme in gluconeogenesis, catalyzes early reaction in carbohydrate biosynthesis, glucose represses transcription and accelerates mRNA degradation, regulated by Mcm1p and Cat8p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr1-1543
description: Protein with low similarity to THI74, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial transporter repressible by thiamine

name: PFS2
description: Integral subunit of the pre-mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation factor (CPF) complex, plays an essential role in S. cerevisiae in mRNA 3'-end formation by bridging different processing factors and thereby promoting the assembly of the processing complex

name: PFK27
description: 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase, catalyzes synthesis of fructose-2,6-bisphosphate, inhibited by phosphoenolpyruvate and sn-glycerol 3-phosphate, expression in S. cerevisiae induced by glucose and sucrose, transcriptional regulation involves protein kinase A

name: NPC2
description: Sterol transport protein and functional homolog of human NPC2/He1, human NPC2 is a cholesterol-binding protein whose deficiency causes Niemann-Pick type C2 disease involving retention of cholesterol in lysosomes, enriched in vacuole, yeast NPC2 can complement mutations in human NPC2

name: PP7435_Chr1-1547
description: Protein with similarity to YOL075C, enriched among several compartments (Putative ABC transporter)

name: CIN5-1
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor of the yAP-1 family, physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets, mediates pleiotropic drug resistance and salt tolerance, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein under oxidative stress and sequestered in the cytoplasm by Lot6p under reducing conditions, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YAP6

name: BSC1
description: Protein of unconfirmed function, similar to cell surface flocculin Flo11p, ORF exhibits genomic organization compatible with a translational readthrough-dependent mode of expression

name: PP7435_Chr1-1550
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PT repeat)

name: HSP42
description: Small heat shock protein (sHSP) with chaperone activity, forms barrel-shaped oligomers that suppress unfolded protein aggregation, involved in cytoskeleton reorganization after heat shock, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases and forms cytoplasmic foci in response to DNA replication stress

name: CWC27
description: Component of a complex containing Cef1p, putatively involved in pre-mRNA splicing, has similarity to S. pombe Cwf27p, protein abundance increases in S. cerevisiae in response to DNA replication stress

name: RPN12
description: Subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome lid, synthetically lethal with RPT1, which is an ATPase component of the 19S regulatory particle, physically interacts with Nob1p and Rpn3p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: GPI18
description: Functional ortholog of human PIG-V, which is a mannosyltransferase that transfers the second mannose in glycosylphosphatidylinositol biosynthesis, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein was localized in S. cerevisiae to mitochondria

name: HHT1-1
description: Histone H3, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly, part of heterochromatin-mediated telomeric and HM silencing, one of two identical histone H3 proteins (see HHT2), regulated by acetylation, methylation, and phosphorylation, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: HHF2
description: Histone H4, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function, one of two identical histone proteins (see also HHF1), contributes to telomeric silencing, N-terminal domain involved in maintaining genomic integrity, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: TOS1
description: Covalently-bound cell wall protein of unknown function, identified as a cell cycle regulated SBF target gene, S. cerevisiae deletion mutants are highly resistant to treatment with beta-1,3-glucanase, has sequence similarity to YJL171C

name: PP7435_Chr1-1558
description: Protein with low similarity to RGL1, regulator of Rho1p signaling, cofactor of Tus1p

name: GAS3
description: Putative 1,3-beta-glucanosyltransferase, has similarity to other GAS family members, enriched in plasma membrane and microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae low abundance, possibly inactive member of the GAS family of GPI-containing proteins, localizes to the cell wall and mRNA is induced during sporulation

name: DPC25
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to mitochondria and YPL107W is not an essential gene

name: NPL4
description: Substrate-recruiting cofactor of the Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p segregase, assists Cdc48p in the dislocation of misfolded, polyubiquitinated ERAD substrates that are subsequently delivered to the proteasome for degradation, also involved in the regulated destruction of resident ER membrane proteins, such as HMG-CoA reductase (Hmg1/2p) and cytoplasmic proteins (Fbp1p), role in mobilizing membrane bound transcription factors by regulated ubiquitin/proteasome-dependent processing (RUP)

name: SSE1
description: ATPase component of the heat shock protein Hsp90 chaperone complex, binds unfolded proteins, member of the heat shock protein 70 (HSP70) family, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSE2

name: AIM18

name: HFI1
description: Adaptor protein required for structural integrity of the SAGA complex, a histone acetyltransferase-coactivator complex that is involved in global regulation of gene expression through acetylation and transcription functions

name: PP7435_Chr1-3314
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr1-3336

name: PP7435_Chr1-3347
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

description: Formin, nucleates the formation of linear actin filaments, involved in cell processes such as budding and mitotic spindle orientation which require the formation of polarized actin cables, functionally redundant with BNI1

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

description: RNA exonuclease, required for maturation of the RNA component of RNase MRP, functions redundantly with Rnh70p and Rex2p in processing of U5 snRNA and RNase P RNA, member of RNase D family of exonucleases

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: BNA7
description: Formylkynurenine formamidase, involved in the de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine

name: MFA1
description: Mating pheromone a-factor. made by mating type a cells. interacts with alpha cells to induce cell cycle arrest and other responses leading to mating. biogenesis involves C-terminal modification, N-terminal proteolysis, and export, similar to mating pheromone a-factor encoded by MFA2

name: PP7435_Chr2-0001
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0002
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ALR2
description: Probable Mg(2+) transporter, overexpression in S. cerevisiae confers increased tolerance to Al(3+) and Ga(3+) ions, plays a role in regulating Ty1 transposition

name: PP7435_Chr2-0004
description: Protein with low similarity to flocculins

name: FET4-1
description: Low-affinity Fe(II) transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0006
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:GAL_4)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0007
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: TOF1
description: Subunit of a replication-pausing checkpoint complex, Tof1p-Mrc1p-Csm3p acts at the stalled replication fork to promote sister chromatid cohesion after DNA damage, facilitating gap repair of damaged DNA, interacts with the MCM helicase, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: SEC2

name: JEM1
description: DnaJ-like chaperone required for nuclear membrane fusion during mating, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, exhibits genetic interactions with KAR2

name: HOS2

name: RHB1
description: Putative Rheb-related GTPase involved in regulating canavanine resistance and arginine upTake, member of the Ras superfamily of G-proteins

name: YND1-2
description: Apyrase with wide substrate specificity, helps prevent inhibition of glycosylation by hydrolyzing nucleoside tri- and diphosphates that inhibit glycotransferases, partially redundant with Gda1p, mediates adenovirus E4orf4-induced toxicity, enriched in Golgi

name: PP7435_Chr2-0014
description: Protein with similarity to YBL086C (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery)

name: ARY100
description: D-arabinitol 2-dehydrogenase (ribulose forming), homolog of Candida albicans ARD1, also known as ArDH, but not related to S. cerevisiae ARD1

name: URA1

name: BUL1

name: BUL2

name: PYC2

name: PP7435_Chr2-0020
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DASH complex subunit Duo1)

name: SOH1
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, involved in telomere maintenance, conserved with other metazoan MED31 subunits

name: SCS3
description: Protein required for inositol prototrophy, required for normal ER membrane biosynthesis, ortholog of the FIT family of proteins involved in triglyceride droplet biosynthesis and homologous to human FIT2, disputed role in the synthesis of inositol phospholipids from inositol

name: PP7435_Chr2-0023
description: Protein with similarity to YBR220C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae YBR220C is not an essential gene)

name: SNP1
description: Component of U1 snRNP required for mRNA splicing via spliceosome, substrate of the arginine methyltransferase Hmt1p, may interact with poly(A) polymerase to regulate polyadenylation, homolog of human U1 70K protein, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0025
description: Protein with low similarity to YML108W, protein of unknown function, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ARC15
description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex, which is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches, has mRNA binding activity, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ATG20
description: Sorting nexin family member required for the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway and for endosomal sorting, has a Phox homology domain that binds phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate, interacts with Snx4p, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: RRG9
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant lacks mitochondrial DNA and cannot grow on glycerol and the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: VID27
description: Protein of unknown function, possibly involved in vacuolar protein degradation, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein not essential for proteasome-dependent degradation of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase (FBPase), S. cerevisiae null mutants exhibit normal growth

name: YPD1
description: Osmotic stress-responsive phosphorelay intermediate sensor protein, phosphorylated by the plasma membrane sensor Sln1p in response to osmotic stress and then in turn phosphorylates the response regulators Ssk1p in the cytosol and Skn7p in the nucleus

name: PHO13
description: Conserved phosphatase acting as a metabolite repair enzyme, shows specific dephosphorylating activity on two side-products of central carbohydrate metabolism, 2-phosphoglycolate and 4-phosphoerythronate, alkaline phosphatase specific for p-nitrophenyl phosphate, also has protein phosphatase activity, human ortholog PGP shows similar substrate specificity, deletion causes similar metabolite accumulation phenotypes, suggesting conserved role in eliminating glycolytic byproducts, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: NB6M
description: NB6M (B16.6) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells

name: ALG9

name: LAA1
description: AP-1 accessory protein, known in S. cerevisiae to colocalizes with clathrin to the late-Golgi apparatus, involved in TGN-endosome transport, physically interacts with AP-1, similar to the mammalian p200, may interact with ribosomes, in S. cerevisiae YJL207C is a non-essential gene

name: PTK2

name: GPI10
description: Integral membrane protein involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor synthesis, putative alpha 1,2 mannosyltransferase required for addition of the third mannose onto the GPI core structure, human PIG-Bp is a functional homolog

name: PP7435_Chr2-0037
description: Putative transfer RNA for Lysine (tRNA-Lys)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0038
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamine acid (tRNA-Gln)

name: CYK3
description: SH3-domain protein located in S. cerevisiae in the bud neck and cytokinetic actin ring, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck that relocalizes to nucleus upon DNA replication stress, activates the chitin synthase activity of Chs2p during cytokinesis, suppressor of growth and cytokinesis defects of chs2 phospho-mutants

name: KIN28
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase, subunit of transcription factor TFIIH, involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase II promoters, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: EAR1
description: Specificity factor required for Rsp5p-dependent ubiquitination and sorting of specific cargo proteins at the multivesicular body, mRNA is targeted to the bud via the mRNA transport system involving She2p

name: PHO2
description: Homeobox transcription factor, regulatory targets include genes involved in phosphate metabolism, binds cooperatively with Pho4p to the PHO5 promoter, phosphorylation of Pho2p facilitates interaction with Pho4p, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr2-0044
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CDS1
description: Phosphatidate cytidylyltransferase (CDP-diglyceride synthetase), an enzyme that catalyzes that conversion of CTP + phosphate into diphosphate + CDP-diaclglyerol, a critical step in the synthesis of all major yeast phospholipids, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: UTP10
description: Protein component of the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, S. cerevisiae mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance

name: IMO32-1
description: Conserved protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, processed by both mitochondrial processing peptidase and mitochondrial octapeptidyl aminopeptidase, gene contains the nested antisense gene NAG1

name: SOA1-4
description: Putative protein with similarity to allantoate permease, similar to the allantoate permease (Dal5p) subfamily of the major facilitator superfamily, in S. cerevisiae mRNA expression is elevated by sulfur limitation and YIL166C is a non-essential gene

name: LPD1
description: Dihydrolipoamide dehydrogenase, the lipoamide dehydrogenase component (E3) of the pyruvate dehydrogenase and 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase multi-enzyme complexes, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog IRC15

name: PP7435_Chr2-0050
description: Protein with low similarity to NAD-dependent protein deacetylases, SIR2 family

name: RSC2
description: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex, required for expression of mid-late sporulation-specific genes, involved in telomere maintenance, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RSC1

name: BOS1
description: v-SNARE (vesicle specific SNAP receptor), known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein necessary for vesicular transport from the ER to the Golgi

name: FMP25
description: Protein required for assembly of respiratory complex III, mitochondrial inner membrane protein, required for an early step in assembly of respiratory complex III (cytochrome bc1 complex), mRNA is targeted to mitochondria, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: FMP32
description: Putative assembly factor for cytochrome c oxidase, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, has similarity to human MCUR1/CCDC90A

name: SEC53
description: Phosphomannomutase, involved in synthesis of GDP-mannose and dolichol-phosphate-mannose, required for folding and glycosylation of secretory proteins in the ER lumen, enriched in cytosol

name: RPL10
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L10, responsible for joining the 40S and 60S subunits, regulates translation initiation, similar to members of the QM gene family, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L10 and bacterial L16, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, mutations in the human ortholog are associated with development of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and similar changes in the yeast gene result in ribosome biogenesis defects, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: BUD20
