name: PP7435_Chr2-0058
description: Protein with low similarity to RFU1, protein that inhibits Doa4p deubiquitinating activity and contributes to ubiquitin homeostasis

name: OTU1
description: Deubiquitylation enzyme that binds to the chaperone-ATPase Cdc48p, may contribute to regulation of protein degradation by deubiquitylating substrates that have been ubiquitylated by Ufd2p, member of the Ovarian Tumor (OTU) family, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0060
description: Protein with similarity to YGR054W, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells (Eukaryotic initiation factor (eIF) 2A, associates specifically with both 40S subunits and 80 S ribosomes, and interacts genetically with both eIF5b and eIF4E, homologous to mammalian eIF2A), enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: YNK1

name: PFK26-1
description: 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase, inhibited by phosphoenolpyruvate and sn-glycerol 3-phosphate, has negligible fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase activity, transcriptional regulation involves protein kinase A

name: PP7435_Chr2-0063
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MOT1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in regulation of transcription, removes Spt15p (TBP) from DNA via its C-terminal ATPase activity, forms a complex with TBP that binds TATA DNA with high affinity but with altered specificity, the Mot1p-Spt15p-DNA ternary complex contains unbent DANN, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0065
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: GDT1
description: Calcium transporter localized to the cis- and medial-Golgi apparatus, required for protein glycosylation, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae GFP-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole, TMEM165, a human gene which causes Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation is orthologous and functionally complements the null allele in S. cerevisiae, expression pattern and physical interactions suggest a possible role in ribosome biogenesis, in S. cerevisiae expression reduced in a gcr1 null mutant

name: AYR1
description: Bifunctional triacylglycerol lipase and 1-acyl DHAP reductase, NADPH-dependent 1-acyl dihydroxyacetone phosphate reductase involved in phosphatidic acid biosynthesis, lipid droplet triacylglycerol lipase involved in the mobilization of non-polar lipids, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and microsome in methanol-grown cells, found in S. cerevisiae in lipid particles, the ER and the mitochondrial outer membrane, required for spore germination, role in cell wall biosynthesis, capable of metabolizing steroid hormones, oleic acid inducible

name: SUN4
description: Cell wall protein related to glucanases, possibly involved in cell wall septation, member of the SUN family, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SIM1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0069
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF2722)

name: AQR1
description: Transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family, confers resistance to short-chain monocarboxylic acids and quinidine, involved in the excretion of excess amino acids, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog QDR1, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from plasma membrane to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: NIT2
description: Nit protein, one of two proteins in S. cerevisiae with similarity to the Nit domain of NitFhit from fly and worm and to the mouse and human Nit protein which interacts with the Fhit tumor suppressor, nitrilase superfamily member

name: PP7435_Chr2-0075
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF1687)

name: MTC1
description: Protein of unknown function that may interact with ribosomes, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and to COPI-coated vesicles (early Golgi) and mtc1 is synthetically lethal with cdc13-1

name: CMC2
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial intermembrane space protein with a role in respiratory chain complex assembly or maintenance, contains twin Cx9C motifs that can form coiled coil-helix-coiled-coil helix fold

name: PUP3
description: Beta 3 subunit of the 20S proteasome involved in ubiquitin-dependent catabolism, human homolog is subunit C10

name: YEL1
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor specific for Arf3p, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck and tip, required for localization of Arf3p to the bud neck and tip

name: IMG2

name: ABZ1

name: MCD4
description: Protein involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor synthesis, known in S. cerevisiae as multimembrane-spanning protein of the ER, highly conserved among eukaryotes

name: PP7435_Chr2-0083
description: Protein with low similarity to DnaJ domain containing proteins

name: SFH5
description: Non-classical phosphatidylinositol transfer protein (PITP), exhibits PI- but not PC-transfer activity, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to the peripheral ER, cytosol and microsomes, similar to Sec14p, partially relocalizes to the plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

name: AIF1-2
description: Cell death effector, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein that translocates to the nucleus in response to apoptotic stimuli in S. cerevisiae, homolog of mammalian Apoptosis-Inducing Factor, putative reductase

name: AIF1-1
description: Mitochondrial cell death effector, enriched in mitochondria and among several compartments, translocates the nucleus in response to apoptotic stimuli in S. cerevisiae, homolog of mammalian Apoptosis-Inducing Factor, putative reductase

name: RPA34
description: RNA polymerase I subunit A34.5

name: PHO8
description: Repressible vacuolar alkaline phosphatase, regulated by levels of Pi and by Pho4p, Pho9p, Pho80p, Pho81p and Pho85p, dephosphorylates phosphotyrosyl peptides, contributes to NAD+ metabolism by producing nicotinamide riboside from NMN, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: SAT4-2
description: Ser/Thr protein kinase involved in salt tolerance, funtions in regulation of Trk1p-Trk2p potassium transporter, partially redundant with Hal5p, has similarity to Npr1p

name: DJP1
description: J-domain-containing protein, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, required for peroxisomal protein import and involved in peroxisome assembly, homologous to E. coli DnaJ

name: MRPS5
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ARF1
description: ADP-ribosylation factor, GTPase of the Ras superfamily involved in regulation of coated vesicle formation in intracellular trafficking within the Golgi, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ARF2

name: GPC1

name: PUF4
description: Member of the PUF protein family, which is defined by the presence of Pumilio homology domains that confer RNA binding activity, preferentially binds mRNAs encoding nucleolar ribosomal RNA-processing factors, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr2-0097
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0099
description: Protein with similarity to YER156C, enriched in cytosol (Putative protein of unknown function, interacts with Hsp82p and copurifies with Ipl1p, in S. cerevisiae expression is copper responsive and downregulated in strains deleted for MAC1, a copper-responsive transcription factor, similarity to mammalian MYG1)

name: SEN34
description: Subunit of the tRNA splicing endonuclease, which is composed of Sen2p, Sen15p, Sen34p, and Sen54p, Sen34p contains the active site for tRNA 3' splice site cleavage and has similarity to Sen2p and to Archaeal tRNA splicing endonuclease

name: YME2
description: Integral inner mitochondrial membrane protein with a role in maintaining mitochondrial nucleoid structure and number, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit an increased rate of mitochondrial DNA escape, shows some sequence similarity to exonucleases

name: ULP1

name: EBP2

name: EFT1
description: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT2, catalyzes ribosomal translocation during protein synthesis, contains diphthamide, the unique posttranslationally modified histidine residue specifically ADP-ribosylated by diphtheria toxin, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog EFT2

name: TPO5
description: Protein involved in excretion of putrescine and spermidine, known in S. cerevisiae as putative Golgi or post-Golgi vesicles polyamine transporter

name: TIM17
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex), with Tim23p, contributes to the architecture and function of the import channel, may link the import motor to the core TIM23 complex, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: YAK1-1
description: Serine-threonine protein kinase, component of a glucose-sensing system that inhibits growth in response to glucose availability, upon nutrient deprivation Yak1p phosphorylates Pop2p to regulate mRNA deadenylation, the co-repressor Crf1p to inhibit transcription of ribosomal genes, and the stress-responsive transcription factors Hsf1p and Msn2p, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose localization is negatively regulated by the Ras/PKA signaling pathway in the presence of glucose

name: RPB4
description: RNA polymerase II subunit B32, forms two subunit dissociable complex with Rpb7p, involved in recruitment of 3'-end processing factors to transcribing RNA polymerase II complex and in export of mRNA to cytoplasm under stress conditions, also involved in translation initiation

name: YUR1
description: Mannosyltransferase involved in protein N-glycosylation, member of the KTR1 family, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog KTR2

name: UTP30
description: Putative subunit of U3-containing 90S preribosome complex, complex is involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit

name: YTE1
description: Putative palmitoyl-protein thioesterase, similar to human PPT1 but not related to S. cerevisiae PPT1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0113
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF2420)

name: RPL17B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L17B, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L17 and bacterial L22, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL17A

name: ATG27
description: Type I membrane protein involved in autophagy and the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway, may be involved in membrane delivery to the phagophore assembly site, enriched in Golgi

name: PFD1
description: Subunit of heterohexameric prefoldin, which binds cytosolic chaperonin and transfers target proteins to it, involved in the biogenesis of actin and of alpha- and gamma-tubulin

name: GPD1
description: NAD-dependent glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase, key enzyme of glycerol synthesis, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae essential for growth under osmotic stress, expression regulated by high-osmolarity glycerol response pathway, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and constitutively inactivated via phosphorylation by the protein kinases YPK1 and YPK2, dephosphorylation increases catalytic activity, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GPD2

name: XDE1
description: Putative xanthine dehydrogenase

name: INO1
description: Inositol-3-phosphate synthase, involved in synthesis of inositol phosphates and inositol-containing phospholipids, transcription is coregulated with other phospholipid biosynthetic genes by Ino2p and Ino4p, which bind the UASINO DNA element

name: PER1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, required for GPI-phospholipase A2 activity that remodels the GPI anchor as a prerequisite for association of GPI-anchored proteins with lipid rafts, functionally complemented by human ortholog PERLD1

name: BOR1
description: Boron efflux transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein that binds HCO3-, I-, Br-, NO3- and Cl-, has similarity to the characterized boron efflux transporter A. thaliana BOR1

name: GTT1
description: ER associated glutathione S-transferase capable of homodimerization, enriched in microsome and among several compartments, expression in S. cerevisiae induced during the diauxic shift and throughout stationary phase, functional overlap with Gtt2p, Grx1p, and Grx2p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0123
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0124
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DBL homology domain, DH-domain)

name: ATP12
description: Assembly factor for F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, conserved protein, required for assembly of alpha and beta subunits into F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, human homolog ATPAF2 can complement yeast atp12 mutant, mutation of human homolog reduces active ATP synthase levels and is associated with the disorder ATPAF2 deficiency, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0126
description: Protein with low similarity to eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunits, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: GON7
description: Component of the EKC/KEOPS protein complex with Kae1p, Cgi121p, Pcc1p, and Bud32p, EKC/KEOPS complex is required for t6A tRNA modification and may have roles in telomere maintenance and transcription, implicated in osmotic stress response

name: IBA57
description: Protein involved in incorporating iron-sulfur clusters into proteins, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix protein, involved in the incorporation of iron-sulfur clusters into mitochondrial aconitase-type proteins, activates the radical-SAM family members Bio2p and Lip5p, interacts with Ccr4p in the two-hybrid system

name: INO4
description: Transcription factor required for derepression of inositol-choline-regulated genes involved in phospholipid synthesis, forms a complex, with Ino2p, that binds the inositol-choline-responsive element through a basic helix-loop-helix domain

name: PP7435_Chr2-0130
description: Protein with similarity to YOL107W, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and colocalizes in a punctate pattern with the early Golgi/COPI vesicles and YOL107W is not an essential protein)

name: MNN11
description: Subunit of a Golgi mannosyltransferase complex that also contains Anp1p, Mnn9p, Mnn10p, and Hoc1p, and mediates elongation of the polysaccharide mannan backbone, has homology to Mnn10p, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PAM17
description: Constituent of the TIM23 complex, proposed alternatively to be a component of the import motor (PAM complex) or to interact with and modulate the core TIM23 (Translocase of the Inner mitochondrial Membrane) complex, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, enriched in mitochondria

name: CCP1-1
description: Cytochrome-c peroxidase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, degrades reactive oxygen species in the mitochondria, involved in the response to oxidative stress

name: STH1
description: ATPase component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex, required for expression of early meiotic genes, essential helicase-related protein in S. cerevisiae, homologous to Snf2p

name: NSA2
description: Protein constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, contributes to processing of the 27S pre-rRNA, enriched among several compartments

name: LCP5
description: Essential protein involved in maturation of 18S rRNA, depletion leads to inhibited pre-rRNA processing and reduced polysome levels, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, mainly in the nucleolus

name: CTA1
description: Catalase A, breaks down hydrogen peroxide in the peroxisomal matrix formed by acyl-CoA oxidase (Pox1p) during fatty acid beta-oxidation, kinetic studies shows high termal stability of Pichia pastoris catalase, enriched in peroxisome and among several compartments

name: NUBM
description: NUBM (51 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SEC9
description: t-SNARE protein important for fusion of secretory vesicles with the plasma membrane, similar to but not functionally redundant with Spo20p, SNAP-25 homolog

name: PP7435_Chr2-0140
description: Protein with low similarity to PTI1, essential component in S. cerevisiae of CPF (cleavage and polyadenylation factor)

name: RNA15
description: Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation factor I (CF I), CF 1, composed of the CF 1A complex (Rna14p, Rna15p, Clp1p, Pcf11p) and Hrp1, is involved in cleavage and polyadenylation of mRNA 3' ends, interacts with the A-rich polyadenylation signal in complex with Rna14p and Hrp1p, S. cerevisiae mutant displays reduced transcription elongation in the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay, required for gene looping

name: DST1
description: General transcription elongation factor TFIIS, enables RNA polymerase II to read through blocks to elongation by stimulating cleavage of nascent transcripts stalled at transcription arrest sites, maintains RNAPII elongation activity on ribosomal protein genes during conditions of transcriptional stress, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0143
description: Protein with low similarity to YGL041W-A, putative protein of unknown function, conserved in fungi

name: CYS4
description: Cystathionine beta-synthase, catalyzes synthesis of cystathionine from serine and homocysteine, the first committed step in cysteine biosynthesis, responsible for hydrogen sulfide generation, advances passage through START by promoting cell growth which requires catalytic activity, and reducing critical cell size independent of catalytic activity, mutations in human ortholog cause homocystinuria, previously known in Pichia pastoris as CBS, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PTH1
description: One of two (see also PTH2) peptidyl-tRNA hydrolases known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial proteins, dispensable for respiratory growth on rich medium, but required for respiratory growth on minimal medium

name: PP7435_Chr2-0146
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: SPT10-2
description: Histone H3 acetylase with a role in transcriptional regulation, sequence-specific activator of histone genes, binds specifically and cooperatively to pairs of UAS elements in core histone promoters, functions at or near TATA box, involved in S phase-specific acetylation of H3K56 at histone promoters, which is required for recruitment of SWI/SNF nucleosome remodeling complex and subsequent transcription

name: SPT10-1
description: Histone H3 acetylase with a role in transcriptional regulation, sequence-specific activator of histone genes, binds specifically and cooperatively to pairs of UAS elements in core histone promoters, functions at or near TATA box, involved in S phase-specific acetylation of H3K56 at histone promoters, which is required for recruitment of SWI/SNF nucleosome remodeling complex and subsequent transcription

name: URA2
description: Bifunctional carbamoylphosphate synthetase (CPSase)-aspartate transcarbamylase (ATCase), catalyzes the first two enzymatic steps in the de novo biosynthesis of pyrimidines, both activities are subject to feedback inhibition by UTP, enriched in cytosol

name: TRK2
description: Component of the Trk1p-Trk2p potassium transport system, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TRK1

name: MET13-1
description: Major isozyme of methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase, catalyzes the reduction of 5,10-methylenetetrahydrofolate to 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the methionine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in cytosol

name: HET1
description: Putative sphingolipid transfer protein similar to Candida sp. HET1, enriched in cytosol

name: PST1
description: Cell wall protein that contains a putative GPI-attachment site, secreted by regenerating protoplasts, up-regulated by activation of the cell integrity pathway, as mediated by Rlm1p, upregulated by cell wall damage via disruption of FKS1, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ECM33

name: CBF5
description: Pseudouridine synthase catalytic subunit of box H/ACA small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein particles (snoRNPs), acts on both large and small rRNAs and on snRNA U2, mutations in human ortholog dyskerin cause the disorder dyskeratosis congenita, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol

name: LST8
description: Protein required for the transport of amino acid permease Gap1p from the Golgi to the cell surface, component of the TOR signaling pathway, associates with both Tor1p and Tor2p, contains a WD-repeat, enriched in vacuole

name: SIS1
description: Type II HSP40 co-chaperone that interacts with the HSP70 protein Ssa1p, not functionally redundant with Ydj1p due to due to substrate specificity, has similarity to bacterial DnaJ proteins, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0157
description: Protein with low similarity to SET domain-containing protein

name: RFX1
description: Major transcriptional repressor of DNA-damage-regulated genes, recruits repressors Tup1p and Cyc8p to their promoters, involved in DNA damage and replication checkpoint pathway, similar to a family of mammalian DNA binding RFX1-4 proteins

name: PP7435_Chr2-0159
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DDE superfamily endonuclease)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0160
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: SEN2
description: Subunit of the tRNA splicing endonuclease, which is composed of Sen2p, Sen15p, Sen34p, and Sen54p, Sen2p contains the active site for tRNA 5' splice site cleavage and has similarity to Sen34p and to Archaeal tRNA splicing endonuclease

name: LCL2
description: Putative protein of unknown function, S. cerevisiae mutant is deficient in amounts of cell wall mannosylphosphate and has long chronological lifespan, genetic interactions suggest a role in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD)

name: SCS2
description: Membrane protein that regulates phospholipid metabolism, known in S. cerevisiae as integral ER protein, one of 6 proteins (Ist2p, Scs2p, Scs22p, Tcb1p, Tcb2p, Tcb3p) that connect ER to the plasma membrane (PM) and regulate PI4P levels by controlling access of Sac1p phosphatase to its substrate PI4P in the PM, interacts with FFAT motif of Opi1p, involved in telomeric silencing, null shows inositol auxotrophy above 34 deg C, VAP homolog, enriched in microsome and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SCS22

name: MAP2
description: Methionine aminopeptidase, catalyzes the cotranslational removal of N-terminal methionine from nascent polypeptides, function is partially redundant with that of Map1p, enriched in cytosol

name: MRP21
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, MRP21 exhibits genetic interactions with mutations in the COX2 and COX3 mRNA 5'-untranslated leader sequences, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: AVT6
description: Vacuolar aspartate and glutamate exporter, member of a family of seven genes (AVT1-7) related to vesicular GABA-glycine transporters, involved in S. cerevisiae in compartmentalizing acidic amino acids in response to nitrogen starvation, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog AVT5

name: TDA4
description: Putative protein of unknown function, S. cerevisiae null mutant is sensitive to expression of the top1-T722A allele

name: ADO1
description: Adenosine kinase, required for the utilization of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet), may be involved in recycling adenosine produced through the methyl cycle, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr2-0169
description: Protein with similarity to YDL144C (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus, YDL144C is not an essential gene and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: SRB4
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, essential in S. cerevisiae for transcriptional regulation, homozygosity of the human MED17 L371P mutation is associated with infantile cerebral and cerebellar atrophy with poor myelination

name: STE24
description: Highly conserved zinc metalloprotease that functions in two steps of a-factor maturation, C-terminal CAAX proteolysis and the first step of N-terminal proteolytic processing, contains multiple transmembrane spans, enriched among several compartments

name: ATP2
description: Beta subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, which is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis, F1 translationally regulates ATP6 and ATP8 expression to achieve a balanced output of ATP synthase genes encoded in nucleus and mitochondria, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria

name: JHD2
description: JmjC domain family histone demethylase specific for H3-K4 (histone H3 Lys4), removes methyl groups specifically added by Set1p methyltransferase, protein levels regulated by Not4p (E3 ubiquitin ligase) polyubiquitin-mediated degradation

name: RCM1
description: rRNA m5C methyltransferase, methylates cytosine at position 2278 of 25S rRNA while Nop2p methylates cytosine at position 2870, contains seven beta-strand methyltransferase motif, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleolus, interacts with Trm112p, homolog of NSUN5A, a human gene which is deleted in Williams-Beuren Syndrome

name: LYS12
description: Homo-isocitrate dehydrogenase, an NAD-linked mitochondrial enzyme required for the fourth step in the biosynthesis of lysine, in which homo-isocitrate is oxidatively decarboxylated to alpha-ketoadipate, enriched in mitochondria

name: FAP1
description: Protein that binds to Fpr1p, conferring rapamycin resistance by competing with rapamycin for Fpr1p binding, accumulates in the nucleus upon treatment of cells with rapamycin, has similarity to D. melanogaster shuttle craft and human NFX1

name: RSM25
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr2-0178
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: PPR repeats)

name: NAP1
description: Histone chaperone, involved in histone exchange by removing and replacing histone H2A-H2B dimers or histone variant dimers from assembled nucleosomes, involved in the transport of H2A and H2B histones to the nucleus, required for the regulation of microtubule dynamics during mitosis, interacts with mitotic cyclin Clb2p, controls bud morphogenesis, phosphorylated by CK2, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MAM3
description: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology, has similarity to hemolysins

name: RTK1
description: Putative protein kinase, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p, interacts with ribosome biogenesis factors, Cka2, Gus1 and Arc1, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PRS5
description: 5-phospho-ribosyl-1(alpha)-pyrophosphate synthetase, synthesizes PRPP, which is required for nucleotide, histidine, and tryptophan biosynthesis, one of five related enzymes, which are active as heteromultimeric complexes, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: APM4
description: Cargo-binding mu subunit of AP-2, AP-2 is a heterotetrameric endocytic cargo-binding adaptor that facilitates uptake of membrane proteins during clathrin-mediated endocytosis, Apm4p is required for AP-2 function and localization, and binds cell wall stress receptor Mid2p, AP-2 is required for cell polarity responses to pheromone, nutritional status and cell wall damage in S. cerevisiae, and for hyphal growth in Candida albicans, AP-2 complex is conserved in mammals

name: PP7435_Chr2-0184
description: Protein with low similarity to cell division control protein 14

name: SHB17
description: Sedoheptulose bisphosphatase involved in riboneogenesis, dephosphorylates sedoheptulose 1,7-bisphosphate, which is converted via the nonoxidative pentose phosphate pathway to ribose-5-phosphate, facilitates the conversion of glycolytic intermediates to pentose phosphate units, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae also has fructose 1,6-bisphosphatase activity but this is probably not biologically relevant, since deletion does not affect FBP levels and GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus

name: PP7435_Chr2-0186
description: Protein with low similarity to putative oxidoreductase CIP1 (Candida sp)

name: UIP5
description: Protein of unknown function that interacts with Ulp1p, a Ubl (ubiquitin-like protein)-specific protease for Smt3p protein conjugates, enriched in Golgi

name: VHS1
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein where is was identified as a high-copy suppressor of the synthetic lethality of a sis2 sit4 double mutant, suggesting a role in G1/S phase progression, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SKS1

name: TRS23
description: Core component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complexes I-III, TRAPP complexes are related multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factor for the GTPase Ypt1p, regulating ER-Golgi traffic (TRAPPI), intra-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII), endosome-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII and III) and autophagy (TRAPPIII), human homolog is TRAPPC4

name: PP7435_Chr2-0190
description: Protein with low similarity to RMI1, subunit of the RecQ (Sgs1p) - Topo III (Top3p) complex which stimulates superhelical relaxing, DNA catenation/decatenation and ssDNA binding activities of Top3p

name: MET13-2
description: Major isozyme of methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase, catalyzes the reduction of 5,10-methylenetetrahydrofolate to 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the methionine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: RAD1
description: Single-stranded DNA endonuclease (with Rad10p), cleaves single-stranded DNA during nucleotide excision repair and double-strand break repair, subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 1 (NEF1), homolog of human XPF protein

name: SWI1
description: Subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex, regulates transcription by remodeling chromatin, required for transcription of many genes, including ADH1, ADH2, GAL1, HO, INO1 and SUC2, can form the prion [SWI+], human homolog ARID1A is a C.te tumor suppressor gene in breast cancer

name: PEX5
description: Peroxisomal membrane signal receptor for the C-terminal tripeptide signal sequence (PTS1) of peroxisomal matrix proteins, required for peroxisomal matrix protein import, also proposed to have PTS1-receptor independent functions, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PAS8, enriched in peroxisome

name: PRP28
description: RNA helicase in the DEAD-box family, involved in RNA isomerization at the 5' splice site

name: CWC2
description: Member of the NineTeen Complex (NTC) that contains Prp19p and stabilizes U6 snRNA in catalytic forms of the spliceosome containing U2, U5, and U6 snRNAs, binds directly to U6 snRNA, similar to S. pombe Cwf2

name: PP7435_Chr2-0198
description: Protein with similarity to YNL035C (Nuclear protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, contains WD-40 domains, not an essential gene, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: BDP1
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of RNA polymerase III transcription factor (TFIIIB), which is involved in transcription of genes encoding tRNAs, 5S rRNA, U6 snRNA, and other small RNAs

name: PP7435_Chr2-0200
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: AVT5
description: Putative transporter, member of a family of seven S. cerevisiae genes (AVT1-7) related to vesicular GABA-glycine transporters, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog AVT6

name: LAC1
description: Ceramide synthase component, involved in synthesis of ceramide from C26(acyl)-coenzyme A and dihydrosphingosine or phytosphingosine, functionally equivalent to Lag1p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog LAG1, previously known in Pichia pastoris as BAR1

name: SSN8
description: Cyclin-like component of the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, involved in phosphorylation of the RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain, forms a kinase-cyclin pair in the RNAPII holoenzyme with Ssn3p, required for both entry into and execution of the meiotic program, involved in glucose repression and telomere maintenance, cyclin homolog 35% identical to human cyclin C

name: UTP25
description: Protein required for 35S pre-RNA processing and 40S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: SIW14
description: Tyrosine phosphatase that plays a role in actin filament organization and endocytosis, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein

name: AIM19
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein that physically interacts with Tim23p and null mutant displays reduced respiratory growth

name: HHT2
description: Histone H3, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly, part of heterochromatin-mediated telomeric and HM silencing, one of two identical histone H3 proteins (see HHT1), regulated by acetylation, methylation, and phosphorylation, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: HHF1
description: Histone H4, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function, one of two identical histone proteins (see also HHF2), contributes to telomeric silencing, N-terminal domain involved in maintaining genomic integrity, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: CRZ1
description: Transcription factor, activates transcription of stress response genes, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose localization is positively regulated by calcineurin-mediated dephosphorylation and rapidly localizes to the nucleus under blue light stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0211
description: Hypothetical protein conserved, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: UBP1
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease that removes ubiquitin from ubiquitinated proteins, cleaves at the C terminus of ubiquitin fusions irrespective of their size, capable of cleaving polyubiquitin chains, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: CAB2
description: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC), subunits of this complex are: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, Cab5p, Sis2p and Vhs3p, probable phosphopantothenoylcysteine synthetase (PPCS), which catalyzes the second step of coenzyme A biosynthesis from pantothenate, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, S. cerevisiae null mutant lethality is complemented by human homolog PPCS and by E. coli coaBC (encoding a bifunctional enzyme with PPCS activity)

name: SAM50-1
description: Component of the Sorting and Assembly Machinery (SAM) complex, the SAM (or TOB) complex is known in S. cerevisiae to be localized in the mitochondrial outer membrane, the complex binds precursors of beta-barrel proteins and facilitates their outer membrane insertion, homologous to bacterial Omp85

name: PP7435_Chr2-0215
description: Protein with low similarity to WWM1, WW domain-containing protein of unknown function

name: PP7435_Chr2-0216
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PHA_synthase_subunit_Ph)

name: PEX13
description: Importomer complex component, known in S. cerevisiae as integral peroxisomal membrane protein required for docking and translocation of peroxisomal matrix proteins, interacts with the PTS1 signal recognition factor Pex5p and the PTS2 signal recognition factor Pex7p, forms a complex with Pex14p and Pex17p, human homolog PEX13 complements yeast null mutant

name: PP7435_Chr2-0218
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: phage minor structural protein GP20, Apolipoprotein A-I), enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: AIM10
description: Protein with similarity to tRNA synthetases, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria and the null mutant is viable and displays elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: SBH1
description: Beta subunit of Sec61p ER translocation complex (Sec61p-Sss1p-Sbh1p), involved in protein translocation into the ER, interacts with the exocyst complex and also with Rtn1p, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SBH2

name: PIN4
description: Protein involved in G2/M phase progression and response to DNA damage, interacts with Rad53p, contains an RNA recognition motif, known in S. cerevisiae to have a nuclear localization signal, and several SQ/TQ cluster domains, hyperphosphorylated in S. cerevisiae in response to DNA damage

name: TRM12
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase of the seven beta-strand family, required for wybutosine formation in phenylalanine-accepting tRNA

name: SAS3
description: Histone acetyltransferase catalytic subunit of NuA3 complex that acetylates histone H3, involved in transcriptional silencing, homolog of the mammalian MOZ proto-oncogene, in S. cerevisiae mutant has aneuploidy tolerance and sas3gcn5 double mutation is lethal

name: DOT6
description: Protein involved in rRNA and ribosome biogenesis, binds polymerase A and C motif, subunit of the RPD3L histone deacetylase complex, has chromatin specific SANT domain, involved in telomeric gene silencing and filamentation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TOD6, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0225
description: Putative transfer RNA for Phenylalanine (tRNA-Phe)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0226
description: Protein with similarity to YBL055C, enriched in cytosol (3'-->5' exonuclease and endonuclease with a possible role in apoptosis, has similarity to mammalian and C. elegans apoptotic nucleases)

name: PTC2
description: Type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C), dephosphorylates Hog1p to limit maximal osmostress induced kinase activity, dephosphorylates Ire1p to downregulate the unfolded protein response, dephosphorylates Cdc28p, inactivates the DNA damage checkpoint, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PTC3

name: PP7435_Chr2-0228
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: RNB domain, catalytic domain of ribonuclease II)

name: PTH2
description: One of two (see also PTH2) peptidyl-tRNA hydrolases known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial proteins, negatively regulates the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway via interactions with ubiquitin-like ubiquitin-associated proteins, dispensable for cell growth

name: GUK1
description: Guanylate kinase, converts GMP to GDP, required for growth and mannose outer chain elongation of cell wall N-linked glycoproteins, enriched in cytosol

name: TSA1
description: Thioredoxin peroxidase, acts as both a ribosome-associated and free cytoplasmic antioxidant, self-associates to form a high-molecular weight chaperone complex under oxidative stress, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae deletion results in mutator phenotype and protein abundance increases and forms cytoplasmic foci in response to DNA replication stress, required for telomere length maintenace, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TSA2

name: PP7435_Chr2-0232
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: ubiquitin-like)

name: MSS51
description: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial COX1 mRNA, loosely associated with the matrix face of the mitochondrial inner membrane, influences both COX1 mRNA translation and Cox1p assembly into cytochrome c oxidase, binds to heme B, which may be a mechanism for sensing oxygen levels in order to regulate cytochrome c oxidase biogenesis, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr2-0234
description: Protein with low similarity to putative transcription factor

name: PP7435_Chr2-0235
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: RING), similar to PAS_chr4_0575

name: BET5
description: Core component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complexes I-III, TRAPP complexes are related multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factors for the GTPase Ypt1p, regulating ER-Golgi traffic (TRAPPI), intra-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII), endosome-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII and III) and autophagy (TRAPPIII), human homology TRAPPC1 complements yeast null mutant

name: FBX1
description: Putative leucine rich repeat protein, with effector domain of the CAP family of transcription factors and AMN1 domains similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis FBX1

name: VMA6
description: Subunit d of the five-subunit V0 integral membrane domain of vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase), an electrogenic proton pump found in the endomembrane system, stabilizes VO subunits, required for V1 domain assembly on the vacuolar membrane, enriched in vacuole and among several compartments

name: COG8
description: Component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex (Cog1p through Cog8p), known in S. cerevisiae as a cytosolic tethering complex that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments

name: RPL6A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L6A, N-terminally acetylated, binds 5.8S rRNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L6, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPL6B

name: FPR3
description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (PPIase), FK506 binding protein, phosphorylated by casein kinase II (Cka1p-Cka2p-Ckb1p-Ckb2p) and dephosphorylated by Ptp1p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FPR4

name: HMG1
description: HMG-CoA reductase, catalyzes the conversion of HMG-CoA to mevalonate, which is a rate-limiting step in sterol biosynthesis, one of two isozymes, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the the nuclear envelope, overproduction in S. cerevisiae induces the formation of karmellae, forms foci at the nuclear periphery upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HMG2

name: TAF11
description: TFIID subunit (40 kDa), involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation, similar to histone H3 with atypical histone fold motif of Spt3-like transcription factors

name: AXL1
description: Haploid specific endoprotease that performs one of two N-terminal cleavages during maturation of a-factor mating pheromone, required for axial budding pattern of haploid cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0245
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: putative S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase)

name: PPM1
description: Carboxyl methyltransferase, methylates the C terminus of the protein phosphatase 2A catalytic subunit (Pph21p or Pph22p), which is important for complex formation with regulatory subunits

name: NUMM
description: NUMM (13 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris

name: PP7435_Chr2-0248
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3237), enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0249
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF1689)

name: THS1
description: Threonyl-tRNA synthetase, enriched in cytosol, essential cytoplasmic protein in S. cerevisiae

name: AIR2
description: RNA-binding subunit of the TRAMP nuclear RNA surveillance complex, involved in nuclear RNA processing and degradation, involved in TRAMP complex assembly as a bridge between Mtr4p and Trf4p, stimulates the poly(A) polymerase activity of Pap2p in vitro, has 5 zinc knuckle motifs, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog AIR1

name: MRPL9
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: MRPL6
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: IMP3
description: Component of the SSU processome, which is required for pre-18S rRNA processing, essential protein in S. cerevisiae that interacts with Mpp10p and mediates interactions of Imp4p and Mpp10p with U3 snoRNA

name: PP7435_Chr2-0255
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: transmembrane alpha-helix)

name: CRM1
description: Major karyopherin, involved in export of proteins, RNAs, and ribosomal subunits from the nucleus, exportin, enriched in cytosol

name: TRR1
description: Cytoplasmic thioredoxin reductase, key regulatory enzyme that determines the redox state of the thioredoxin system, which acts as a disulfide reductase system and protects cells against both oxidative and reductive stress, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TRR2

name: YPT35

name: PP7435_Chr2-0266
description: 8S ribosomal RNA
