description: Aminopeptidase yscII, may have a role in obtaining leucine from dipeptide substrates, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog AAP1

name: ESS1
description: Peptidylprolyl-cis/trans-isomerase (PPIase), specific for phosphorylated serine and threonine residues N-terminal to proline, regulates phosphorylation of the RNAP II large subunit (Rpo21p) C-terminal domain (CTD), associates with phospho-Ser5 form of RNAP II in vivo, regulates phosphorylation of Ser7 within CTD, present along entire coding length of genes, represses initiation of CUTs, required for efficient termination of mRNA transcription and trimethylation of histone H3

name: HYR1
description: Thiol peroxidase, functions as a hydroperoxide receptor to sense intracellular hydroperoxide levels and transduce a redox signal to the Yap1p transcription factor, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GPX1

name: ISW1
description: ATPase subunit of imitation-switch (ISWI) class chromatin remodelers, ATPase, forms a complex with Ioc3p (Isw1a), and a complex with Ioc2p and Ioc4p (Isw1b), Isw1a and Isw1b have partially overlapping and distinct roles, Isw1a involved in repression of transcription initiation and Isw1b involved in regulation of transcription elongation, Isw1b recruited to open reading frames by H3K36 methylation and acts with Chd1p to prevent trans-histone exchange over coding regions

name: NBP35
description: Essential iron-sulfur cluster binding protein known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, forms a complex with Cfd1p that is involved in iron-sulfur protein assembly in the cytosol, similar to P-loop NTPases

name: NUP145
description: Protein enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as essential protein with distinct roles in two nuclear pore subcomplexes, catalyzes its own proteolytic cleavage in vivo to generate a C-terminal fragment that is a structural component of the Nup84p subcomplex (with roles in NPC biogenesis and localization of genes to the nuclear periphery), and an N-terminal fragment that is one of several FG-nucleoporins within the NPC central core directly responsible for nucleocytoplasmic transport, homologous to human NUP98

name: RPA190
description: RNA polymerase I largest subunit A190, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr2-0409
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MEP1
description: Ammonium permease, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae to belong to a ubiquitous family of cytoplasmic membrane proteins that transport only ammonium (NH4+), expression in S. cerevisiae is under the nitrogen catabolite repression regulation, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MEP3

name: POR1
description: Mitochondrial porin (voltage-dependent anion channel), outer membrane protein required for maintenance of mitochondrial osmotic stability and mitochondrial membrane permeability, couples the glutathione pools of the intermembrane space (IMS) and the cytosol, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria and vacuole, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog POR2

name: OCA2
description: Protein of unknown function, similar to predicted tyrosine phosphatases Oca1p and Siw14p, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and OCA2 is not an essential gene

name: STO100
description: Putative stomatin family protein, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis STM1 but not related to S. cerevisiae STM1, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr2-0414
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0415
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0416
description: Protein with similarity to YGR237C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm)

name: RIM9
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein involved in the proteolytic activation of Rim101p in response to alkaline pH, interacts with Rim21p and Dfg16p to form a pH-sensing complex in the Rim101 pathway and is required to maintain Rim21p levels, has similarity to A. nidulans PalI,

name: PP7435_Chr2-0418
description: Putative transfer RNA for Valine (tRNA-Val)

name: JIP5
description: Protein required for biogenesis of the large ribosomal subunit, required for biogenesis of the large ribosomal subunit, interacts with proteins involved in RNA processing, ribosome biogenesis, ubiquitination and demethylation, similar to WDR55, a human WD repeat protein, essential gene in S. cerevisiae

name: PCT1
description: Cholinephosphate cytidylyltransferase, a rate-determining enzyme of the CDP-choline pathway for phosphatidylcholine synthesis, inhibited by Sec14p, activated upon lipid-binding, contains an element within the regulatory domain involved in both silencing and activation of enzymatic activity, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0422
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0423
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YAP1801
description: Protein of the AP180 family, involved in clathrin cage assembly, binds Pan1p and clathrin, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YAP1802

name: PP7435_Chr2-0425
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0426
description: Protein with low similarity to sucrose transporters

name: LSC2
description: Beta subunit of succinyl-CoA ligase, which is a mitochondrial enzyme of the TCA cycle that catalyzes the nucleotide-dependent conversion of succinyl-CoA to succinate, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: CHA1
description: Catabolic L-serine (L-threonine) deaminase, catalyzes the degradation of both L-serine and L-threonine, required to use serine or threonine as the sole nitrogen source, transcriptionally induced in S. cerevisiae by serine and threonine

name: MEF1
description: Mitochondrial elongation factor involved in translational elongation, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PUT2
description: Delta-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase, nuclear-encoded mitochondrial protein involved in utilization of proline as sole nitrogen source, deficiency of the human homolog causes HPII, an autosomal recessive inborn error of metabolism, enriched in mitochondria

name: PPR1
description: Zinc finger transcription factor containing a Zn(2)-Cys(6) binuclear cluster domain, positively regulates in S. cerevisiae transcription of URA1, URA3, URA4, and URA10, which are involved in de novo pyrimidine biosynthesis, in response to pyrimidine starvation, activity may be modulated by interaction with Tup1p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0432
description: Protein with low similarity to tRNA A58 N-methyltranspherases

name: PP7435_Chr2-0433
description: Protein with low similarity to tRNA (adenine-N(1)-)-methyltransferase

name: RLP24
description: Protein quired for ribosomal large subunit biogenesis, associated with pre-60S ribosomal subunits, stimulates the ATPase activity of Afg2p, which is required for release of Rlp24p from the pre-60S particle, has similarity to Rpl24Ap and Rpl24Bp, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: PAM18
description: Subunit of the import motor (PAM complex), the PAM complex is a component of the Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex), in S. cerevisiae essential J-protein cochaperone that stimulates Ssc1p ATPase activity to drive import, inhibited by Pam16p, enriched in mitochondria

name: SSD1
description: Translational repressor with a role in polar growth and wall integrity, regulated by Cbk1p phosphorylation to effect bud-specific translational control and localization of specific mRNAs, interacts with TOR pathway components, contains a functional N-terminal nuclear localization sequence and nucleocytoplasmic shuttling appears to be critical to Ssd1p function, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol

name: APL6
description: Beta3-like subunit of the yeast AP-3 complex, functions in transport of alkaline phosphatase to the vacuole via the alternate pathway, exists in both cytosolic and peripherally associated membrane-bound pools

name: SMC4
description: Subunit of the condensin complex, reorganizes chromosomes during cell division, forms a complex with Smc2p that has ATP-hydrolyzing and DNA-binding activity, required for tRNA gene clustering at the nucleolus, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: MRPL10
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, appears as two protein spots (YmL10 and YmL18) on two-dimensional SDS gels, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0440
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0441
description: Protein with similarity to YKR070W, enriched in cytosol (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: VTC4
description: Vacuolar membrane polyphosphate polymerase, subunit of the vacuolar transporter chaperone (VTC) complex involved in synthesis and transfer of polyP to the vacuole, enriched in vacuole and among several compartments, regulates membrane trafficking, role in non-autophagic vacuolar fusion, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ISN1
description: Inosine 5'-monophosphate (IMP)-specific 5'-nucleotidase, catalyzes the breakdown of IMP to inosine, does not show similarity to known 5'-nucleotidases from other organisms

name: PP7435_Chr2-0444
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Leucine Rich repeats, 2X), enriched in vacuole

name: PP7435_Chr2-0445
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: OXP1
description: 5-oxoprolinase, enzyme is ATP-dependent and functions as a dimer, similar to mouse Oplah gene, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PRP4
description: Splicing factor, component of the U4/U6-U5 snRNP complex

name: HDA3
description: Subunit of the HDA1 histone deacetylase complex, possibly tetrameric trichostatin A-sensitive class II histone deacetylase complex contains Hda1p homodimer and an Hda2p-Hda3p heterodimer, required for the activity of the complex, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, similar to Hda2p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0450
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF2414), enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: QCR2
description: Subunit 2 of the ubiquinol cytochrome-c reductase complex, which is a component of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, phosphorylated, transcription is regulated by Hap1p, Hap2p/Hap3p, and heme, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: RPC82
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C82

name: ATG13
description: Regulatory subunit of the Atg1p signaling complex, stimulates Atg1p kinase activity, required for vesicle formation during autophagy and the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway, contains a HORMA domain required for autophagy and for recruitment of the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase complex subunit Atg14p to the pre-autophagosomal structure

name: PZF1
description: Transcription factor IIIA (TFIIIA), essential DNA binding protein in S. cerevisiae required for transcription of 5S rRNA by RNA polymerase III, not involved in transcription of other RNAP III genes, nine conserved zinc fingers, may also bind 5S rRNA

name: RPO26
description: RNA polymerase subunit ABC23, common to RNA polymerases I, II, and III, part of central core, similar to bacterial omega subunit

name: MLC2
description: Regulatory light chain for the type II myosin, Myo1p, binds to an IQ motif of Myo1p, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck depends on Myo1p, involved in the disassembly of the Myo1p ring

name: SKI3
description: Ski complex component and TPR protein, mediates 3'-5' RNA degradation by the cytoplasmic exosome, S. cerevisiae null mutants have superkiller phenotype of increased viral dsRNAs and are synthetic lethal with mutations in 5'-3' mRNA decay, mutations in the human ortholog, TTC37, causes Syndromic diarrhea/Trichohepatoenteric (SD/THE) syndrome

name: GDB1
description: Glycogen debranching enzyme, contains glucanotranferase and alpha-1,6-amyloglucosidase activities, required for glycogen degradation, phosphorylated in mitochondria, activity is inhibited by Igd1p, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: APD1-2
description: Protein of unknown function, required for normal localization of actin patches and for normal tolerance of sodium ions and hydrogen peroxide, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic and nuclear protein

name: IMO32-2
description: Conserved protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, processed by both mitochondrial processing peptidase and mitochondrial octapeptidyl aminopeptidase, gene contains the nested antisense gene NAG1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0461
description: Protein with similarity to YBR053C (Putative protein of unknown function, induced in S. cerevisiae by cell wall perturbation)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0462
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RAD7
description: Nucleotide excision repair (NER) protein, binds damaged DNA during NER, binds DNA in an ATP-dependent manner (with Rad16p) during NER, required for repair of non-transcribed chromatin, subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 4 (NEF4) and the Elongin-Cullin-Socs (ECS) ligase complex

name: PRP39
description: U1 snRNP protein involved in splicing, contains multiple tetriatricopeptide repeats

name: RAD23
description: Protein with ubiquitin-like N terminus, subunit of Nuclear Excision Repair Factor 2 (NEF2) with Rad4p that binds damaged DNA, enhances protein deglycosylation activity of Png1p, also involved, with Rad4p, in ubiquitylated protein turnover, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: UTR4
description: Protein with sequence similarity to 2,3-diketo-5-methylthiopentyl-1-phosphate enolase-phosphatases, involved in methionine salvage, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae to be also found in nucleus

name: JJJ3
description: Protein of unknown function, contains a CSL Zn finger and a DnaJ-domain, involved in diphthamide biosynthesis, ortholog human Dph4

name: PP7435_Chr2-0468
description: Protein with similarity to YJR098C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: PRR1
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase that inhibits pheromone induced signalling downstream of MAPK, possibly at the level of the Ste12p transcription factor

name: RGR1
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, required for glucose repression, HO repression, RME1 repression and sporulation

name: HIR3
description: Subunit of the HIR complex, a nucleosome assembly complex involved in regulation of histone gene transcription, involved in position-dependent gene silencing and nucleosome reassembly, ortholog of human CABIN1 protein

name: IPA1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae of unknown function

name: RAD3
description: 5' to 3' DNA helicase, involved in nucleotide excision repair and transcription, subunit of RNA polII initiation factor TFIIH and of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 3 (NEF3), homolog of human XPD protein, S. cerevisiae mutant has aneuploidy tolerance, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ERV46
description: Protein enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae to be localized at COPII-coated vesicles, forms a complex with Erv41p, involved in the membrane fusion stage of transport

name: TGL2
description: Triacylglycerol lipase known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, has lipolytic activity towards triacylglycerols and diacylglycerols when expressed in E. coli

name: PP7435_Chr2-0479
description: Protein with low similarity to ARP10, component of the dynactin complex

name: PP7435_Chr2-0480
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: FET3
description: Ferro-O2-oxidoreductase, required for high-affinity iron upTake and involved in mediating resistance to copper ion toxicity, belongs to class of integral membrane multicopper oxidases, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: CLD1-1
description: Cardiolipin-specific phospholipase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, functions upstream of Taz1p to generate monolyso-cardiolipin, transcription increases upon genotoxic stress, involved in restricting Ty1 transposition, has homology to mammalian CGI-58

name: FAA1
description: Long chain fatty acyl-CoA synthetase, activates imported fatty acids with a preference for C12:0-C16:0 chain lengths, functions in long chain fatty acid import, accounts for most acyl-CoA synthetase activity, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the lipid particles, involved in sphingolipid-to-glycerolipid metabolism, forms ER foci upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FAA4

name: YHP1
description: Homeobox transcriptional repressor, binds Mcm1p and early cell cycle box (ECB) elements of cell cycle regulated genes, thereby restricting ECB-mediated transcription to the M/G1 interval, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YOX1

name: RPS18A
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S18 and bacterial S13, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane and Golgi in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from cytoplasm to nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS18B

name: YML6
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, has similarity to E. coli L4 ribosomal protein and human mitoribosomal MRP-L4 protein, in S. cerevisiae essential for viability, unlike most other mitoribosomal proteins

name: PSP1
description: Asn and gln rich protein of unknown function, high-copy suppressor of POL1 (DNA polymerase alpha) and partial suppressor of CDC2 (polymerase delta) and CDC6 (pre-RC loading factor) mutations, overexpression in S. cerevisiae results in growth inhibition, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YLR177W

name: UTP6
description: Protein component of the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: ADA2
description: Transcription coactivator, component of the ADA and SAGA transcriptional adaptor/HAT (histone acetyltransferase) complexes

name: RPS17B
description: Ribosomal protein 51 (rp51) of the small (40s) subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S17, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS17A

name: CTR2
description: Low-affinity copper transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar membrane protein whose mutation confers resistance to toxic copper concentrations, while overexpression confers resistance to copper starvation, regulated by nonsense-mediated mRNA decay pathway

name: ROT2
description: Glucosidase II catalytic subunit required for normal cell wall synthesis, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae mutations in rot2 suppress tor2 mutations and are synthetically lethal with rot1 mutations

name: PUS9
description: tRNA:pseudouridine synthase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, catalyzes the formation of pseudouridine at position 32 in mitochondrial tRNAs, contains an N-terminal mitochondrial targeting sequence, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RIB2

name: FOX2
description: 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase and enoyl-CoA hydratase, multifunctional enzyme of the peroxisomal fatty acid beta-oxidation pathway, enriched in microsome, mutation in S. cerevisiae is functionally complemented by human HSD17B4

name: ARA2
description: NAD-dependent arabinose dehydrogenase, involved in biosynthesis of dehydro-D-arabinono-1,4-lactone, similar to plant L-galactose dehydrogenase

name: TRS85
description: Component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complex III, TRAPPIII is a multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factor for the GTPase Ypt1p, regulating endosome-Golgi traffic and required for membrane expansion during autophagy and the CVT pathway, directs Ypt1p to the PAS, late post-replication meiotic role, enriched in Golgi

name: EMP70
description: Protein with a role in cellular adhesion and filamentous growth, also endosome-to-vacuole sorting, similar to Tmn3p, member of Transmembrane Nine family of proteins with 9 transmembrane segments, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TMN2

name: VAN1
description: Component of the mannan polymerase I, which contains Van1p and Mnn9p and is involved in the first steps of mannan synthesis, S. cerevisiae mutants are vanadate-resistant

name: PRM15
description: Phosphoribomutase, catalyzes interconversion of ribose-1-phosphate and ribose-5-phosphate, has some phosphoglucomutase activity but primary activity in vivo is phosphoribomutase, contributes to ribose recycling in the pentose phosphate pathway, in S. cerevisiae transcription induced in response to stress, the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and is non-essential

name: PIR1
description: Cell wall protein of Pichia pastoris with internal repeats, suggested to be in S. cerevisiae O-glycosylated and important for cell wall stability, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpPIR1, homolog of S. cerevisiae Pir1-5p proteins

name: URK1
description: Uridine/cytidine kinase, component of the pyrimidine ribonucleotide salvage pathway that converts uridine into UMP and cytidine into CMP, involved in the pyrimidine deoxyribonucleotide salvage pathway, converting deoxycytidine into dCMP

name: CDC19
description: Pyruvate kinase, functions as a homotetramer in glycolysis to convert phosphoenolpyruvate to pyruvate, the input for aerobic (TCA cycle) or anaerobic (glucose fermentation) respiration, regulated via allosteric activation by fructose bisphosphate, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PYK2

name: REV1
description: Deoxycytidyl transferase, involved in repair of abasic sites and adducted guanines in damaged DNA by translesion synthesis (TLS), forms a complex with the subunits of DNA polymerase zeta, Rev3p and Rev7p, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: ACS1
description: Acetyl-coA synthetase isoform which, along with Acs2p, is the nuclear source of acetyl-coA for histone acetylation, enriched in cytosol, expressed in S. cerevisiae during growth on nonfermentable carbon sources and under aerobic conditions

name: FLC2
description: Putative calcium channel involved in calcium release under hypotonic stress, required for upTake of FAD into ER, involved in cell wall maintenance, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YOR365C

name: PP7435_Chr2-0507
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: COQ5
description: 2-hexaprenyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinone methyltransferase, involved in ubiquinone (Coenzyme Q) biosynthesis, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to the matrix face of the mitochondrial inner membrane in a large complex with other ubiquinone biosynthetic enzymes

name: PP7435_Chr2-0509
description: Protein with low similarity to MED1, sSubunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex

name: CYC8
description: General transcriptional co-repressor, acts together with Tup1p, also acts as part of a transcriptional co-activator complex that recruits the SWI/SNF and SAGA complexes to promoters, can form the prion [OCT+], enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SUS1
description: Component of both the SAGA histone acetylase and TREX-2 complexes, interacts with RNA polymerase II, involved in mRNA export coupled transcription activation and elongation, involved in post-transcriptional tethering of active genes to the nuclear periphery and to non-nascent mRNP

name: YSA1
description: Nudix hydrolase family member with ADP-ribose pyrophosphatase activity, shown to metabolize O-acetyl-ADP-ribose to AMP and acetylated ribose 5'-phosphate, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SPE3
description: Spermidine synthase, involved in biosynthesis of spermidine and also in biosynthesis of pantothenic acid, spermidine is required for growth of wild-type cells, enriched in cytosol

name: ALG1
description: Mannosyltransferase, involved in asparagine-linked glycosylation in the ER, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein essential for viability, mutation is functionally complemented by human ortholog

name: CMD1
description: Calmodulin, Ca++ binding protein that regulates Ca++ independent processes (mitosis, bud growth, actin organization, endocytosis, etc.) and Ca++ dependent processes (stress-activated pathways), targets include Nuf1p, Myo2p and calcineurin

name: CAT8-1
description: Zinc cluster transcriptional activator, necessary for derepression of a variety of genes under non-fermentative growth conditions, active after diauxic shift, binds carbon source responsive elements, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0517
description: Putative transfer RNA for Lysine (tRNA-Lys)

name: DNF2
description: Aminophospholipid translocase (flippase), enriched in plasma membrane, microsome and mitochondria, known in S. cerevisiae to localize primarily to the plasma membrane, contributes to endocytosis, protein transport and cell polarity, type 4 P-type ATPase, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog DNF1

name: EGD2
description: Alpha subunit of the heteromeric nascent polypeptide-associated complex (NAC) involved in protein sorting and translocation, associated with cytoplasmic ribosomes, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: LNP1
description: Lunapark family member involved in ER network formation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the ER junctions whose localization is regulated by the yeast atlastin ortholog Sey1p, interacts with the reticulon protein Rtn1p, in S. cerevisiae induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

name: CTF8
description: Subunit of a complex with Ctf18p that shares some subunits with Replication Factor C and is required for sister chromatid cohesion

name: MF(ALPHA)1
description: Mating pheromone alpha-factor, made by alpha cells, interacts with mating type a cells to induce cell cycle arrest and other responses leading to mating, also encoded in S. cerevisiae by MF(ALPHA)2, although MF(ALPHA)1 produces most alpha-factor, binds copper(II) ions, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MF(ALPHA)2

name: MNS1
description: Alpha-1,2-mannosidase involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), catalyzes the removal of one mannose residue from a glycosylated protein, converting the modification from Man9GlcNAc to Man8GlcNAc, catalyzes the last step in glycoprotein maturation in the ER and is critical for ER protein degradation, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: STR2
description: Cystathionine gamma-synthase, converts cysteine into cystathionine, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YML082W

name: PP7435_Chr2-0525
description: Protein with similarity to YGR127W (Putative protein of unknown function, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by Msn2p/Msn4p, indicating a possible role in stress response)

name: DAL2
description: Allantoicase, converts allantoate to urea and ureidoglycolate in the second step of allantoin degradation, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression and induced by allophanate, an intermediate in allantoin degradation

name: PP7435_Chr2-0527
description: Protein with low similarity to glutathione transferases, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0528
description: Protein with low similarity to potential fungal zinc cluster transcription factors

name: COX7
description: Subunit VII of cytochrome c oxidase, which is the terminal member of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PSH1
description: E3 ubiquitin ligase that mediates poyubiquitination and degradation of centromere-binding protein Cse4p and prevents Cse4p from mislocalizing to euchromatin, ubiquitylation of Cse4p may be antagonized by Scm3p

name: ROY1
description: GTPase inhibitor with similarity to F-box proteins, inhibits Ypt52p GTPase activity by preventing Ypt52p from binding GTP, involved in regulating intracellular trafficking, physically interacts with Skp1p

name: DYN1
description: Heavy chain dynein, microtubule motor protein, required for anaphase spindle elongation, involved in spindle assembly, chromosome movement, and spindle orientation during cell division, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein targeted to microtubule tips by Pac1p

name: TRM732
description: Protein involved in 2'-O-methylation of C32 of substrate tRNAs, interacts with 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase Trm7p, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, non-essential gene, yeast null mutant can be functionally complemented by human THADA, mutations in which have been implicated in epithelial thyroid adenomas, type 2 diabetes, and polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0534
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Magnesium transporter NIPA family), enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: TIF11
description: Translation initiation factor eIF1A, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential protein in S. cerevisiae that forms a complex with Sui1p (eIF1) and the 40S ribosomal subunit and scans for the start codon, C-terminus associates with Fun12p (eIF5B), N terminus interacts with eIF2 and eIF3

name: CTK3
description: Gamma subunit of C-terminal domain kinase I, CTDK-I phosphorylates RNA polymerase II subunit Rpo21p to affect transcription and pre-mRNA 3' end processing, and also phosphorylates ribosomal protein Rps2p to increase translational fidelity, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: TPS3
description: Regulatory subunit of trehalose-6-phosphate synthase/phosphatase, involved in synthesis of storage carbohydrate trehalose, in S. cerevisiae expression is induced by stress conditions and repressed by the Ras-cAMP pathway, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TSL1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0538
description: Protein with similarity to YMR262W (Protein of unknown function, interacts weakly with Knr4p, in S. cerevisiae YMR262W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0539
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Pyridine nucleotide-disulphide oxidoreductase, FAD/NAD(P)-binding domain)

name: RIB1
description: GTP cyclohydrolase II, catalyzes the first step of the riboflavin biosynthesis pathway, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0541
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Thioredoxin-like)

name: RRT2
description: Methylesterase performing penultimate step of diphthamide biosynthesis, hydrolyzes methylated diphthine to produce diphthine and allows Dph6-catalyzed amidation reaction to occur, deletion leads to resistance to sordarin and accumulation of methylatediphthine, WD40 domain-containing protein, involved in endosomal recycling, forms complex with Rtt10p that functions in retromer-mediated pathway for recycling internalized cell-surface proteins

name: MLC1
description: Light chain for Myo1p, light chain for Myo2p, stabilizes Myo2p by binding to the neck region, interacts with Myo1p, Iqg1p, and Myo2p to coordinate formation and contraction of the actomyosin ring with targeted membrane deposition, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: ERT1
description: Transcriptional regulator of nonfermentable carbon utilization, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to cytoplasm, nucleus, null mutation affects periodicity of transcriptional and metabolic oscillation, plays role in restricting Ty1 transposition

name: ARC1
description: Protein that binds tRNA and methionyl- and glutamyl-tRNA synthetases (Mes1p and Gus1p), delivering tRNA to them, stimulating catalysis, and ensuring their localization to the cytoplasm, also binds quadruplex nucleic acids, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance increases in S. cerevisiae in response to DNA replication stress

name: DOM34
description: Protein that facilitates ribosomal subunit dissociation, acts when translation is stalled, with binding partner Hbs1p, required for RNA cleavage in no-go decay, but reports conflict on endonuclease activity, Pelota ortholog, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YCL001W-B

name: PP7435_Chr2-0547
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Tim17/Tim22/Tim23/Pmp24 family)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0548
description: Protein with similarity to YBR241C (Putative transporter, member of the sugar porter family, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuolar membrane and YBR241C is not an essential gene, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog VPS73)

name: RPL28
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L28, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L27A and bacterial L15, may have peptidyl transferase activity, can mutate to cycloheximide resistance, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0550
description: Protein with similarity to YBR242W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and YBR242W is not an essential gene, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YGL101W)

name: ALG7
description: UDP-N-acetyl-glucosamine-1-P transferase, transfers Glc-Nac-P from UDP-GlcNac to Dol-P in the ER in the first step of the dolichol pathway of protein asparagine-linked glycosylation, inhibited by tunicamycin

name: CUE3
description: Protein of unknown function, has a CUE domain that binds ubiquitin, which may facilitate intramolecular monoubiquitination

name: NSA1
description: Constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, involved in 60S ribosomal subunit biogenesis

name: NNF1
description: Essential component in S. cerevisiae of the MIND kinetochore complex (Mtw1p Including Nnf1p-Nsl1p-Dsn1p) which joins kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules, required for accurate chromosome segregation

name: MSN4
description: Stress-responsive transcriptional activator, activated in S. cerevisiae in stochastic pulses of nuclear localization in response to various stress conditions, binds DNA at stress response elements of responsive genes, inducing gene expression, involved in diauxic shift, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MSN2

name: EIS1
description: Component of the eisosome required for proper eisosome assembly, similar to Uso1p, enriched in plasma membrane, microsome and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in a phosphorylated state in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, in S. cerevisiae the protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from plasma membrane to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YKL050C

name: HHT1-2
description: Histone H3, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly, part of heterochromatin-mediated telomeric and HM silencing, one of two identical histone H3 proteins (see HHT2), regulated by acetylation, methylation, and phosphorylation

name: ARP9
description: Component of both the SWI/SNF and RSC chromatin remodeling complexes, actin-related protein involved in transcriptional regulation

name: RCH1
description: Putative transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein in response to high levels of extracellular calcium, member of the SLC10 carrier family, identified in S. cerevisiae in a transposon mutagenesis screen as a gene involved in azole resistance and not essential gene

name: MNN4-2
description: Putative positive regulator of mannosylphosphate transferase Mnn6p, involved in mannosylphosphorylation of N-linked oligosaccharides, expression in S. cerevisiae increases in late-logarithmic and stationary growth phases, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MNN14

name: QCR10
description: Subunit of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase complex which includes Cobp, Rip1p, Cyt1p, Cor1p, Qcr2p, Qcr6p, Qcr7p, Qcr8p, Qcr9p, and Qcr10p and comprises part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain, enriched in mitochondria

name: HEM1
description: 5-aminolevulinate synthase, catalyzes the first step in the heme biosynthetic pathway, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, an N-terminal signal sequence is required in S. cerevisiae for localization to the mitochondrial matrix and expression is regulated by Hap2p-Hap3p

name: PEX19
description: Chaperone required for indirect trafficking of peroxisomal membrane proteins to peroxisomes via the ER in Pichia pastoris, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein

name: UBC9
description: SUMO-conjugating enzyme involved in the Smt3p conjugation pathway, nuclear protein required for S- and M-phase cyclin degradation and mitotic control, involved in proteolysis mediated by the anaphase-promoting complex cyclosome (APCC)

name: SYO1
description: Transport adaptor or symportin, facilitates synchronized nuclear coimport of the two 5S-rRNA binding proteins Rpl5p and Rpl11p, required for biogenesis of the large ribosomal subunit, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus

name: ECM19
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: PP7435_Chr2-0567
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: AFG2
description: ATPase of the CDC48/PAS1/SEC18 (AAA) family, forms a hexameric complex, is essential in S. cerevisiae for pre-60S maturation and release of several preribosome maturation factors, releases Rlp24p from purified pre-60S particles in vitro, may be involved in degradation of aberrant mRNAs

name: PP7435_Chr2-0569
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SKI2
description: Ski complex component and putative RNA helicase, mediates 3'-5' RNA degradation by the cytoplasmic exosome, S. cerevisiae null mutants have superkiller phenotype of increased viral dsRNAs and are synthetic lethal with mutations in 5'-3' mRNA decay, mutations in the human ortholog, SKIV2L, causes Syndromic diarrhea/Trichohepatoenteric (SD/THE) syndrome

name: ATP10
description: Assembly factor for the F0 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, mitochondrial inner membrane protein, interacts genetically with ATP6, enriched in mitochondria

name: SSY5
description: Serine protease of SPS plasma membrane amino acid sensor system (Ssy1p-Ptr3p-Ssy5p), known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein that contains an inhibitory domain that dissociates in response to extracellular amino acids, freeing a catalytic domain to activate transcription factor Stp1p

name: MNN4-3
description: Putative positive regulator of mannosylphosphate transferase Mnn6p, involved in mannosylphosphorylation of N-linked oligosaccharides, enriched in Golgi, expression in S. cerevisiae increases in late-logarithmic and stationary growth phases, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MNN14

name: PP7435_Chr2-0574
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RRG7
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the mitochondrion and deletion confers sensitivity to 4-(N-(S-glutathionylacetyl)amino) phenylarsenoxide (GSAO), YOR305W is not an essential gene

name: PP7435_Chr2-0576
description: Protein with similarity to YGL159W, enriched in cytosol (Putative protein of unknown function, S. cerevisiae deletion mutant has no detectable phenotype)

name: RAD14
description: Protein that recognizes and binds damaged DNA during nucleotide excision repair, subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 1 (NEF1), contains zinc finger motif, homolog of human XPA protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0578
description: Protein with low similarity to acyl-coenzyme A thioesterase, enriched in mitochondria

name: AXL2
description: Integral plasma membrane protein required for axial budding in haploid cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the incipient bud site and bud neck, glycosylated by Pmt4p, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: BST1
description: GPI inositol deacylase, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein that negatively regulates COPII vesicle formation, prevents production of vesicles with defective subunits, required for proper discrimination between resident ER proteins and Golgi-bound cargo molecules

name: TUM1
description: Rhodanese domain sulfur transferase, accepts persulfite from Nfs1p and transfers it to Uba4p in the pathway for 2-thiolation of the wobble uridine base of tRNAs, also stimulates sulfur transfer by Nfs1p, suggested in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0582
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: REV3
description: Catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase zeta, involved in translesion synthesis during post-replication repair, required for mutagenesis induced by DNA damage, involved in double-strand break repair

name: APC5
description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C), APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition, component of the platform domain of the APC/C, based on structural analysis, relative distribution to nuclear foci decreases upon DNA replication stress

name: PIS1
description: Phosphatidylinositol synthase, required for biosynthesis of phosphatidylinositol, which is a precursor for polyphosphoinositides, sphingolipids, and glycolipid anchors for some of the plasma membrane proteins, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: RIX1
description: Component of the Rix1 complex and possibly pre-replicative complexes (pre-RCs), required for processing of ITS2 sequences from 35S pre-rRNA, component of the pre-60S ribosomal particle with the dynein-related AAA-type ATPase Mdn1p, required for pre-RC formation and maintenance during DNA replication licensing, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, essential gene

name: LRO1
description: Major diacylglycerol acyltransferase in Pichia pastoris, catalyzes the terminal step of triacylglycerol formation, enriched in microsome, and addionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae Dga1, and not Lro1, is major contributor to triacylglycerols synthesis, localized to ER

name: PP7435_Chr2-0588
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Whi5)

name: HUT1
description: Protein with a role in UDP-galactose transport to the Golgi lumen, has similarity to human UDP-galactose transporter UGTrel1, exhibits a genetic interaction with S. cerevisiae ERO1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0590
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ENV7
description: Membrane protein kinase, negatively regulates membrane fusion, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein which associates with vacuolar membrane through palmitoylation of one or more cysteines in consensus sequence, vacuolar membrane association is essential to its kinase activity, S. cerevisiae mutant shows defect in CPY processing, ortholog of human serine/threonine kinase 16 (STK16)

name: RVB2
description: ATP-dependent DNA helicase, also known as reptin, member of the AAA+ and RuvB protein families, similar to Rvb1p, conserved component of multiple complexes including the INO80 complex, the Swr1 complex, and the R2TP complex (Rvb1-Rvb2-Tah1-Pih1), involved in multiple processes such as chromatin remodeling, box C/D snoRNP assembly, and RNA polymerase II assembly, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: VMA11
description: Vacuolar ATPase V0 domain subunit c', involved in proton transport activity, hydrophobic integral membrane protein (proteolipid) containing four transmembrane segments, N and C termini are in the vacuolar lumen, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0594
description: Protein with low similarity to NSL1, essential component in S. cerevisiae of the MIND kinetochore complex

name: PP7435_Chr2-0595
description: Protein with low similarity to 5'-nucleotidase

name: HIS5
description: Histidinol-phosphate aminotransferase, catalyzes the seventh step in histidine biosynthesis, responsive to general control of amino acid biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, mutations in S. cerevisiae cause histidine auxotrophy and sensitivity to Cu, Co, and Ni salts

name: MRPS17
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SGM1
description: Protein of unknown function, required for wild-type growth rate on galactose and mannose, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of COPI coated vesicles and Golgi apparatus

name: XPT1
description: Xanthine-guanine phosphoribosyl transferase, required for xanthine utilization and for optimal utilization of guanine, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0600
description: Protein with low similarity to U3 small nucleolar RNA-associated proteins, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: TRP5-1
description: Tryptophan synthase, catalyzes the last step of tryptophan biosynthesis, regulated by the general control system of amino acid biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: RRN6
description: Component of the core factor (CF) rDNA transcription factor complex, CF is required for transcription of 35S rRNA genes by RNA polymerase I and is composed of Rrn6p, Rrn7p, and Rrn11p

name: NMD5
description: Karyopherin, a carrier protein involved in nuclear import of proteins, importin beta homolog

name: PP7435_Chr2-0604
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0605
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3784)

name: MDM31
description: Protein that may have a role in phospholipid metabolism, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein with similarity to Mdm32p, required for normal mitochondrial morphology and inheritance, interacts genetically with MMM1, MMM2, MDM10, MDM12, and MDM34

name: CDC73
description: Component of the Paf1p complex, binds to and modulates the activity of RNA polymerases I and II, required for expression of certain genes, modification of some histones, and telomere maintenance, involved in transcription elongation as demonstrated by the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MST1
description: Threonyl-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, aminoacylates both the canonical threonine tRNA tT(UGU)Q1 and the unusual threonine tRNA tT(UAG)Q2 in vitro

name: ATG17
description: Scaffold protein responsible for phagophore assembly site organization, regulatory subunit of an autophagy-specific complex that includes Atg1p and Atg13p, stimulates Atg1p kinase activity, human ortholog RB1CC1/FIP200 interacts with p53, which inhibits autophagy in human cells

name: SPP382
description: Essential protein that forms a dimer with Ntr2p, also forms a trimer, with Ntr2p and Prp43p, that is involved in spliceosome disassembly, found also in a multisubunit complex with the splicing factor Clf1p, suppressor of prp38-1 mutationin S. cerevisiae

name: VTC2
description: Regulatory subunit of the vacuolar transporter chaperone (VTC) complex, involved in membrane trafficking, vacuolar polyphosphate accumulation, microautophagy and non-autophagic vacuolar fusion, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in microsome and Golgi in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog VTC3

name: FRA1-2
description: Protein involved in negative regulation of transcription of iron regulon, forms an iron independent complex with Fra2p, Grx3p, and Grx4p, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein, S. cerevisiae mutant fails to repress transcription of iron regulon and is defective in spore formation

name: WWM1
description: WW domain containing protein of unknown function, binds to Mca1p, a caspase-related protease that regulates H2O2-induced apoptosis, overexpression in S. cerevisiae causes G1 phase growth arrest and clonal death that is suppressed by overexpression of MCA1

name: CDC4
description: F-box protein required for both the G1/S and G2/M phase transitions, modular substrate specificity factor which associates with core SCF (Cdc53p, Skp1p and Hrt1p/Rbx1p) to form the SCFCdc4 complex, SCFCdc4 acts as a ubiquitin-protein ligase directing ubiquitination of cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) phosphorylated substrates, such as: Sic1p, Far1p, Cdc6p, Clb6p, and Cln3p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0616
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: C3HC zinc finger-like)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0617
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: ARC105 or Med15 subunit of Mediator complex and TATA element modulatory factor 1 DNA binding)

name: STO1
description: Large subunit of the nuclear mRNA cap-binding protein complex, interacts with Npl3p to carry nuclear poly(A)+ mRNA to cytoplasm, also involved in nuclear mRNA degradation and telomere maintenance, orthologous to mammalian CBP80, enriched in cytosol

name: FKS1
description: Catalytic subunit of 1,3-beta-D-glucan synthase, functionally redundant with alternate catalytic subunit Gsc2p, binds to regulatory subunit Rho1p, involved in cell wall synthesis and maintenance, enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells and among several compartments, localizes in S. cerevisiae to sites of cell wall remodeling, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog GSC2

name: ADE17
description: Enzyme of 'de novo' purine biosynthesis, contains both 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide transformylase and inosine monophosphate cyclohydrolase activities, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ADE16, ade16 ade17 mutants in S. cerevisiae require adenine and histidine

name: PUT4-2
description: Proline permease, required for high-affinity transport of proline, also transports the toxic proline analog azetidine-2-carboxylate (AzC), enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, ranscription is repressed in S. cerevisiae in ammonia-grown cells

name: RPL15B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L15B, binds to 5.8 S rRNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L15, no bacterial homolog, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to nucleolus upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL15A

name: SER3
description: 3-phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase, catalyzes the first step in serine and glycine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SER33

name: RPN2
description: Subunit of the 26S proteasome, substrate of the N-acetyltransferase Nat1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: UTP7
description: Protein component of the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: PP7435_Chr2-0627
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CCE1
description: Cruciform cutting endonuclease, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, cleaves Holliday junctions formed during recombination of mitochondrial DNA, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MRS1

name: AAP1
description: Arginine/alanine amino peptidase, overproduction in S. cerevisiae stimulates glycogen accumulation, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog APE2

name: EDE1
description: Scaffold protein involved in the formation of early endocytic sites, putative regulator of cytokinesis, homo-oligomerization is required for localization to and organization of endocytic sites, has a network of interactions with other endocytic proteins, binds membranes in a ubiquitin-dependent manner, may also bind ubiquitinated membrane-associated proteins, interacts with Cmk2 and functions upstream of CMK2 in regulating non-apoptotic cell death, homolog of mammalian Eps15, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: ATO2
description: Putative transmembrane protein involved in export of ammonia, ammonia is a starvation signal that promotes cell death in aging colonies, phosphorylated in mitochondria, member of the TC 9.B.33 YaaH family, homolog of Yarrowia lipolytica Gpr1p, Pichia pastoris has also four copies of the paralog ADY2

name: ALP100
description: Putative amino acids permease

name: GAR1
description: Protein component of the H/ACA snoRNP pseudouridylase complex, involved in the modification and cleavage of the 18S pre-rRNA, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr2-0634
description: Protein with low similarity to Intron-binding protein aquarius

name: PP7435_Chr2-0635
description: Protein with low similarity to PSP2, asn rich cytoplasmic protein that contains RGG motifs, enriched in plasma membrane

name: SEC17
description: Alpha-SNAP cochaperone, SNARE-complex adaptor for Sec18 (NSF) during the disassembly of postfusion cis-SNARE complexes, stimulates the ATPase activity of Sec18p, peripheral membrane protein required for vesicular transport between ER and Golgi, the 'priming' step in homotypic vacuole fusion, and autophagy, similar to mammalian alpha-SNAP, enriched among several compartments

name: RTT107
description: Protein implicated in Mms22-dependent DNA repair during S phase, involved in recruiting the SMC5/6 complex to double-strand breaks, DNA damage induces phosphorylation by Mec1p at one or more SQ/TQ motifs, interacts with Mms22p and Slx4p, has four BRCT domains, has a role in regulation of Ty1 transposition, enriched in mitochondria, in S.cerevisiae relative distribution to nuclear foci increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0638
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ATG1
description: Protein serine/threonine kinase, required for vesicle formation in autophagy and the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway, structurally required for phagophore assembly site formation, during autophagy forms a complex with Atg13p and Atg17p, essential in S. cerevisiae for cell cycle progression from G2/M to G1 under nitrogen starvation, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSA10

name: HBN1
description: Protein of unknown function, similar to bacterial nitroreductases, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus, protein becomes insoluble upon intracellular iron depletion and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SAK1
description: Upstream serine/threonine kinase for the SNF1 complex, partially redundant with Elm1p and Tos3p, members of this family have functional orthology with LKB1, a mammalian kinase associated with Peutz-Jeghers cancer-susceptibility syndrome, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TOS3

name: PP7435_Chr2-0642
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: galactose oxidase, central domain)

name: ARO2
description: Bifunctional chorismate synthase and flavin reductase, catalyzes the conversion of 5-enolpyruvylshikimate 3-phosphate (EPSP) to form chorismate, which is a precursor to aromatic amino acids, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: VFA1
description: Protein that interacts with Vps4p and has a role in vacuolar sorting, known in S. cerevisiae as protein that localizes to endosomes in a Vps4-dependent manner and whose overexpression causes canavanine sensitivity and confers a partial class D vacuole morphology

name: GLC7
description: Type 1 serine/threonine protein phosphatase catalytic subunit, involved in various processes including glycogen metabolism, sporulation, mitosis, accumulates at mating projections by interaction with Afr1p, interacts with many regulatory subunits, involved in regulation of the nucleocytoplasmic shuttling of Hxk2p, import into nucleus is inhibited during spindle assembly checkpoint arrest, enriched among several compartments

name: RPS27B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S27, no bacterial homolog, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPS27A

name: EMP24
description: Component of the p24 complex, binds to GPI anchor proteins and mediates their efficient transport from the ER to the Golgi, integral membrane protein that associates with ER-derived COPII-coated vesicles, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr2-0648
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: anaphase-promoting complex subunit 9)

name: SAC6
description: Fimbrin, actin-bundling protein, cooperates with Scp1p (calponin/transgelin) in the organization and maintenance of the actin cytoskeleton, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from plasma membrane to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PAC2
description: Microtubule effector required for tubulin heterodimer formation, binds alpha-tubulin, required for normal microtubule function, S. cerevisiae null mutant exhibits cold-sensitive microtubules and sensitivity to benomyl

name: RAD26
description: Protein involved in transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair of UV-induced DNA lesions, recruitment to DNA lesions is dependent on an elongating RNA polymerase II, homolog of human CSB protein

name: FUS3
description: Mitogen-activated serine/threonine protein kinase involved in mating, phosphoactivated by Ste7p, substrates include Ste12p, Far1p, Bni1p, Sst2p, inhibits invasive growth during mating by phosphorylating Tec1p, promoting its degradation

name: ERG27
description: 3-keto sterol reductase, catalyzes the last of three steps required to remove two C-4 methyl groups from an intermediate in ergosterol biosynthesis, enriched in microsome and Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae mutants are sterol auxotrophs

name: YCG1
description: Subunit of the condensin complex, required for establishment and maintenance of chromosome condensation, chromosome segregation and chromatin binding of the condensin complex, required for clustering of tRNA genes at the nucleolus, required for replication slow zone (RSZ) breakage following Mec1p inactivation

name: GFA1
description: Glutamine-fructose-6-phosphate amidotransferase, catalyzes the formation of glucosamine-6-P and glutamate from fructose-6-P and glutamine in the first step of chitin biosynthesis, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralogous region which comprises in S. cerevisiae the ORFs YMR084W-YMR085W

name: CAB3
description: Subunit of a phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase (PPCDC, Cab3p, Sis2p, Vhs3p) complex, which catalyzes the third step of coenzyme A biosynthesis, S. cerevisiae null mutant lethality is complemented by E. coli coaBC

name: PEP1
description: Type I transmembrane sorting receptor for multiple vacuolar hydrolases, cycles between the late-Golgi and prevacuolar endosome-like compartments, enriched among several compartments

name: PFK26-2
description: 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase, inhibited by phosphoenolpyruvate and sn-glycerol 3-phosphate, has negligible fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase activity, transcriptional regulation involves protein kinase A

name: PP7435_Chr2-0659
description: Protein with similarity to YPL088W, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells (Putative aryl alcohol dehydrogenase, transcription is activated by paralogous transcription factors Yrm1p and Yrr1p along with genes involved in multidrug resistance)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0660
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: RNI-like)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0661
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MRPL27
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, homolog of human Bcl-2 interacting protein BMRP

name: DPB3
description: Third-largest subunit of DNA polymerase II (DNA polymerase epsilon), required to maintain fidelity of chromosomal replication and also for inheritance of telomeric silencing, stabilizes the interaction of Pol epsilon with primer-template DNA, positively affecting the processivity of the polymerase and exonuclease activities of Pol epsilon, mRNA abundance peaks at the G1/S boundary of the cell cycle, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DLS1

name: RFC2
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C), which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon

name: PP7435_Chr2-0665
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: topoisomerase II-associated protein PAT1, PAT1)

name: LOS1
description: Protein involved in nuclear export of pre-tRNA and in re-export of mature tRNAs after their retrograde import from the cytoplasm, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein

name: KEL3
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein

name: DIM1
description: 0S pre-particles in nucleolus, involved in pre-ribosomal RNA processing, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: KAR9
description: Spindle positioning factor, orients astral microtubules, connecting them to actin cables at the cortex with Bim1p and Myo2, resulting in proper spindle positioning, targeted for StuBL-dependent degradation at kinetochores by Slx5p-Slx8p, ensuring chromosome transmission fidelity and correct spindle positioning, role in karyogamy, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the shmoo tip, the growing bud-tip, the nucleus, the kinetochore, the spindle and microtubules, homolog of adenomatous polyposis coli

name: MDL2
description: Half-type ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane required for respiratory growth at high temperature, similar to human TAP1 and TAP2 implicated in bare lymphocyte syndrome and Wegener-like granulomatosis

name: POL5
description: DNA Polymerase phi, has sequence similarity to the human MybBP1A and weak sequence similarity to B-type DNA polymerases, not required for chromosomal DNA replication, required for the synthesis of rRNA, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SNG1
description: Protein involved in resistance to nitrosoguanidine and 6-azauracil, enriched among several compartments, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by transcription factors involved in multidrug resistance, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YJR015W

name: PP7435_Chr2-0673
description: Protein with similarity to YNL134C (Protein of unknown function, similar to dehydrogenases from other model organisms, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: SWC5
description: Component of the SWR1 complex, complex exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia and whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0675
description: Protein with similarity to YGL114W (Putative protein of unknown function, predicted member of the oligopeptide transporter (OPT) family of membrane transporters)

name: SNF4

name: PP7435_Chr2-0709
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-0712
description: Protein with similarity to YMR253C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern and YMR253C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0720
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Smc)

description: Protein with low similarity to SCW10 (putative SCW10-2), cell wall Protein with low similarity to glucanases

description: Protein with low similarity to flagellar biosynthesis protein FliS

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SNF1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0783
description: Protein with low similarity to DAP1 (putative DAP1-2), Heme-binding protein, involved in regulation of cytochrome P450 protein Erg11p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0784
description: Protein with similarity to YDL057W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae YDL057W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0789

name: LHP1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0796
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SEC59
description: Dolichol kinase, catalyzes the terminal step in dolichyl monophosphate (Dol-P) biosynthesis, required for viability and for normal rates of lipid intermediate synthesis and protein N-glycosylation

name: PP7435_Chr2-0798

name: DSF2

name: URE2-2

name: ITR2
description: Myo-inositol transporter, member of the sugar transporter superfamily, expressed in S. cerevisiae constitutively, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ITR1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0807
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF4246), enriched in cytosol

name: LAP2
description: Leucyl aminopeptidase yscIV (leukotriene A4 hydrolase) with epoxide hydrolase activity, metalloenzyme containing one zinc atom, enriched in cytosol and vacuole, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus

name: RPL40A

name: PP7435_Chr2-0810
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: phage Tail Protein X)

name: YIP3-1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae to localize at COPII-coated vesicles, proposed to be involved in ER to Golgi transport, interacts with members of the Rab GTPase family and Yip1p, also interacts with Rtn1p

name: RPS14A

name: MDM38
