name: DUT1
description: Deoxyuridine triphosphate diphosphatase (dUTPase), catalyzes hydrolysis of dUTP to dUMP and PPi, thereby preventing incorporation of uracil into DNA during replication, critical for the maintenance of genetic stability, also has diphosphatase activity on deoxyinosine triphosphate, enriched in cytosol

name: MTC4
description: Protein of unknown function, required for normal growth rate at 15 degrees C, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern and mtc4 is synthetically sick with cdc13-1

name: TRS20
description: Core component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complexes I-III, TRAPPs are multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factors for GTPase Ypt1p, regulating ER-Golgi traffic (TRAPPI), intra-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII), endosome-Golgi traffic (TRAPPII and III) and autophagy (TRAPPIII), mutation leads to defects in endocytic recycling, block in sporulation/meiosis, mutations in S. cerevisiae in human homolog TRAPPC2 cause spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia tarda, TRAPPC2 can complement yeast null mutant

name: ARO3-2
description: 3-deoxy-D-arabino-heptulosonate-7-phosphate (DAHP) synthase, catalyzes the first step in aromatic amino acid biosynthesis and is feedback-inhibited by phenylalanine or high concentration of tyrosine or tryptophan

name: ADH2
description: Unique alchohol dehydrogenase responsible in Pichia pastoris for the consumption of ethanol, glucose-repressible alcohol dehydrogenase II, catalyzes the conversion of ethanol to acetaldehyde, involved in the production of certain carboxylate esters, regulated by ADR1, previously known in Pichia pastoris as ADH3, enriched in cytosol

name: GEF1-1
description: Golgi voltage-gated chloride channel, enriched in Golgi, in S. cerevisiae also found in endosomal system and plasma membrane, and involved in cation homeostasis, highly homologous to vertebrate voltage-gated chloride channels, modulates TBSV model (+) RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

name: PP7435_Chr2-0823
description: Protein with similarity to YEL023C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the expression is increased greatly during sporulation and YEL023C is not an essential gene)

name: RIP1
description: Ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase, a Rieske iron-sulfur protein of the mitochondrial cytochrome bc1 complex, transfers electrons from ubiquinol to cytochrome c1 during respiration, during import, in S. cerevisiae Rip1p is first imported into the mitochondrial matrix where it is processed, acquires its Fe-S cluster, and is folded, then is translocated into the inner membrane by the action of a homo-oligomer of Bcs1p, and finally is delivered by Bcs1p to Complex III for assembly, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: HUL4
description: Protein with similarity to hect domain E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases, in S. cerevisiae not essential for viability, found in association with Trf4 in TRAMP complex

name: CNS1
description: TPR-containing co-chaperone, binds both Hsp82p (Hsp90) and Ssa1p (Hsp70) and stimulates the ATPase activity of SSA1, S. cerevisiae ts mutants reduce Hsp82p function while over expression suppresses the phenotypes of an HSP82 ts allele and a cpr7 deletion, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-0827
description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: CTK1
description: Catalytic (alpha) subunit of C-terminal domain kinase I (CTDK-I), phosphorylates both RNA pol II subunit Rpo21p to affect transcription and pre-mRNA 3' end processing, and ribosomal protein Rps2p to increase translational fidelity, similar to the Drosophila dCDK12 and human CDK12 and probably CDK13, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: MCO8
description: Putative protein of unknown function, originally identified based on homology to Ashbya gossypii and other related yeasts, in S. cerevisiae SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the vacuole, while SWAT-GFP fusion also localizes to the ER

name: TGL4
description: Multifunctional lipase/hydrolase/phospholipase, triacylglycerol lipase, steryl ester hydrolase, and Ca2+-independent phospholipase A2, catalyzes acyl-CoA dependent acylation of LPA to PA, required with Tgl3p for timely bud formation, phosphorylated and activated by Cdc28p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TGL5

name: RTS2
description: Basic zinc-finger protein, similar to human and mouse Kin17 proteins which are chromatin-associated proteins involved in UV response and DNA replication

name: OMA1
description: Metalloendopeptidase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, involved in turnover of membrane-embedded proteins, mediates degradation of Cox1p in S. cerevisiae coa2 mutant cells, member of a family of predicted membrane-bound metallopeptidases in prokaryotes and higher eukaryotes

name: PP7435_Chr2-0833
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved, enriched in microsome

name: MTM1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as part of the mitochondrial carrier family, involved in activating mitochondrial Sod2p probably by facilitating insertion of an essential manganese cofactor

name: PRK1
description: Protein serine/threonine kinase, regulates the organization and function of the actin cytoskeleton and reduces endocytic ability of cell through the phosphorylation of the Pan1p-Sla1p-End3p protein complex, enriched in plasma membrane, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ARK1

name: KOG1
description: Subunit of TORC1, a rapamycin-sensitive complex involved in growth control that contains Tor1p or Tor2p, Lst8p and Tco89p, contains four HEAT repeats and seven WD-40 repeats, may act as a scaffold protein to couple TOR and its effectors, enriched in vacuole

name: PEX20
description: Coreceptor of the PTS2 receptor Pex7, involved with Pex5 on the shuttling and degradation of Pex7

name: SLY41
description: Protein involved in ER-to-Golgi transport

name: NUAM
description: NUAM (75 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, molybdopterin oxidoreductase, formate dehydrogenase/DMSO reductase, domains 1-3, enriched in plasma membrane, Golgi and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: CUS1
description: Protein required for assembly of U2 snRNP into the spliceosome, forms a complex with Hsh49p and Hsh155p

name: EXG1
description: Major exo-1,3-beta-glucanase of the cell wall, involved in cell wall beta-glucan assembly, exists as three differentially glycosylated isoenzymes, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SPR1

name: ALD2
description: Cytoplasmic aldehyde dehydrogenase, involved in ethanol oxidation and beta-alanine biosynthesis, uses NAD+ as the preferred coenzyme, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae expression is stress induced and glucose repressed, very similar to Ald3p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0844
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Afadin- and alpha -actinin-Binding, Tropomyosin)

name: ATP14
description: Subunit h of the F0 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, F1F0 ATP synthase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: YHC1
description: Component of the U1 snRNP complex required for pre-mRNA splicing, putative ortholog of human U1C protein, which is involved in formation of a complex between U1 snRNP and the pre-mRNA 5' splice site

name: GSP1
description: Ran GTPase, GTP binding protein (mammalian Ranp homolog) involved in the maintenance of nuclear organization, RNA processing and transport, regulated by Srm1p, Rna1p, Yrb1p, Yrb2p, Yrp4p, Yrb30p, Cse1p and Kap95p, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GSP2

name: SEC72
description: Non-essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of Sec63 complex (Sec63p, Sec62p, Sec66p and Sec72p), with Sec61 complex, Kar2p/BiP and Lhs1p forms a channel competent for SRP-dependent and post-translational SRP-independent protein targeting and import into the ER, enriched among several compartments

name: ULS1
description: Swi2/Snf2-related translocase, SUMO-Targeted Ubiquitin Ligase (STUbL), required for maintenance of NHEJ inhibition at telomeres, functions at telomeres to translocate and ubiquitinylate poly-sumoylated Rap1p for proteosomal degradation, plays role in antagonizing silencing during mating-type switching, only known STUbL with a translocase activity, contains RING finger domain, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: HRI1
description: Protein of unknown function that interacts with Sec72p and Hrr25p

name: PP7435_Chr2-0851
description: Protein with similarity to YLR278C (Zinc-cluster protein, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus and mutant shows moderate growth defect on caffeine, has a prion-domain like fragment that increases frequency of [URE3], YLR278C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr2-0852
description: Protein with low similarity to RAP1 (putative RAP1-2), essential DNA-binding transcription regulator that binds many loci, involved in transcription activation and repression, chromatin silencing, and telomere length maintenance, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia)

name: RSO55
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to mitochondria, YLR281C is not an essential gene

name: MRPL4
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, homolog of prokaryotic L29 ribosomal protein, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, located in S. cerevisiae at the ribosomal tunnel exit

name: PP7435_Chr2-0855
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PRK05771)

name: SEC39
description: Component of the Dsl1p tethering complex that interacts with ER SNAREs Sec20p and Use1p, proposed to be involved in protein secretion, known in S. cerevisiae as ER and nuclear envelope protein

name: PIF1
description: DNA helicase, potent G-quadruplex DNA binder and unwinder, exists in a nuclear form that acts as a catalytic inhibitor of telomerase, and as a mitochondrial form involved in repair and recombination of mitochondrial DNA, mutations in S. cerevisiae affect zinc and iron homeostasis, regulated by Rad53p-dependent phosphorylation in rho0 cells

name: TDH3
description: Glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase, isozyme 3, involved in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis, tetramer that catalyzes the reaction of glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate to 1,3 bis-phosphoglycerate, enriched in cytosol and in S. cerevisiae detected also in cell wall, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TDH2

name: NAB6
description: Putative RNA-binding protein that associates with mRNAs encoding cell wall proteins in high-throughput studies, S. cerevisiae deletion mutants display increased sensitivity to some cell wall disrupting agents, expression negatively regulated by cAMP

name: TAF8
description: TFIID subunit (65 kDa), involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation

name: FCP1
description: Carboxy-terminal domain (CTD) phosphatase, essential for dephosphorylation of the repeated C-terminal domain of the RNA polymerase II large subunit (Rpo21p), known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RHO3
description: Non-essential small GTPase in S. cerevisiae of the Rho/Rac family of Ras-like proteins, involved in the establishment of cell polarity, GTPase activity positively regulated by the GTPase activating protein (GAP) Rgd1p, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr2-0864
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: LOA1
description: Lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase, involved in triacelglyceride homeostasis and lipid droplet formation, enriched in microsome, known in S. cerevisiae to localize also to lipid droplets, specificity for oleoyl-CoA

name: SEC66
description: Non-essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of Sec63 complex (Sec63p, Sec62p, Sec66p and Sec72p), with Sec61 complex, Kar2p/BiP and Lhs1p forms a channel competent for SRP-dependent and post-translational SRP-independent protein targeting and import into the ER, enriched among several compartments

name: SMY2
description: GYF domain protein, involved in COPII vesicle formation, interacts with the Sec23p/Sec24p subcomplex, overexpression suppresses the temperature sensitivity of a myo2 mutant, similar to S. pombe Mpd2, enriched in plasma membrane, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SMY1

name: UMP1
description: Chaperone required for correct maturation of the 20S proteasome, short-lived chaperone, may inhibit premature dimerization of proteasome half-mers, degraded by proteasome upon completion of its assembly

name: SWD3
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex, which methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in transcriptional silencing near telomeres, WD40 beta propeller superfamily member and ortholog of mammalian WDR5

name: HTB2
description: Histone H2B, core histone protein required for chromatin assembly and chromosome function, nearly identical to HTB1, Rad6p-Bre1p-Lge1p mediated ubiquitination regulates transcriptional activation, meiotic DSB formation and H3 methylation

name: FTH1-1
description: Putative high affinity iron transporter, involved in transport of intravacuolar stores of iron, forms complex with Fet5p, expression is regulated by iron, proposed to play indirect role in endocytosis, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-0873
description: Protein with low similarity to IRC22, putative protein of unknown function, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr2-0874
description: Protein with similarity to YIL001W (Putative protein of unknown function, contains a BTB/POZ domain which generally function in protein interactions, in S. cerevisiae deletion slightly improved competitive fitness in rich media and the the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein is localized to the cytoplasm)

name: INP51
description: Phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase, synaptojanin-like protein with an N-terminal Sac1 domain, plays a role in phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate homeostasis and in endocytosis, null mutation in S. cerevisiae confers cold-tolerant growth

name: WBP1
description: Beta subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) glycoprotein complex, required for N-linked glycosylation of proteins in the ER, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: EPS1
description: ER protein with chaperone and co-chaperone activity, involved in retention of resident ER proteins, enriched in microsome, Golgi and vacuole, has a role in recognizing proteins targeted for ER-associated degradation (ERAD), member of the protein disulfide isomerase family

name: YIA6
description: NAD+ transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, involved in the transport of NAD+ into the mitochondria (see also YEA6), member of the mitochondrial carrier subfamily, disputed role as a pyruvate transporter, has putative mouse and human orthologs, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YEA6

name: HSH155
description: U2-snRNP associated splicing factor that forms extensive associations with the branch site-3' splice site-3' exon region upon prespliceosome formation, similarity to the mammalian U2 snRNP-associated splicing factor SAP155

name: GPI16
description: Subunit of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol transamidase complex, transmembrane protein, adds GPIs to newly synthesized proteins, human PIG-Tp homolog, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: BUB1
description: Protein kinase involved in the cell cycle checkpoint into anaphase, forms complex with Mad1p and Bub3p crucial to preventing cell cycle progression into anaphase in presence of spindle damage, CDC28-mediated phosphorylation at Bub1p-T566 is important for degradation in anaphase and adaptation of checkpoint to prolonged mitotic arrest, associates with centromere DNA via Skp1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MAD3

name: MFM1
description: Magnesium transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, involved in maintenance of mitochondrial magnesium concentrations and membrane potential, indirectly affects splicing of group II introns, functionally and structurally related to Mrs2p

name: LEU4
description: Alpha-isopropylmalate synthase (2-isopropylmalate synthase), the main isozyme responsible for the first step in the leucine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog LEU9

name: SGN1-1
description: RNA-binding protein, contains an RNA recognition motif (RRM), known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, may have a role in mRNA translation, as suggested by genetic interactions with genes encoding proteins involved in translational initiation

name: PP7435_Chr2-0886
description: Protein with similarity to YLR001C, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, predicted to be palmitoylated)

name: YIM1
description: Protein of unknown function, enriched in mitochondria and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae the null mutant displays sensitivity to DNA damaging agents, the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and the protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: IZH3
description: Membrane protein involved in zinc ion homeostasis, member of the four-protein IZH family, in S. cerevisiae expression is induced by zinc deficiency, deletion reduces sensitivity to elevated zinc and shortens lag phase and its overexpression reduces Zap1p activity

name: SDO1
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) for Ria1p, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in ribosome maturation, with Ria1p, promotes release of Tif6p from 60S ribosomal subunits in the cytoplasm so that they can assemble with 40S subunits to generate mature ribosomes, ortholog of the human protein (SBDS) responsible for autosomal recessive Shwachman-Bodian-Diamond Syndrome, highly conserved across archaea and eukaryotes

name: PP7435_Chr2-0890
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YEH2
description: Steryl ester hydrolase, catalyzes steryl ester hydrolysis at the plasma membrane, involved in sterol metabolism, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YEH1

name: HOL1
description: Putative transporter in the major facilitator superfamily, member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family, mutations in S. cerevisiae in membrane-spanning domains permit cation and histidinol upTake

name: PPZ1
description: Serine/threonine protein phosphatase Z, isoform of Ppz2p, involved in regulation of potassium transport, which affects osmotic stability, cell cycle progression, and halotolerance, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PPZ2

name: TRM9
description: tRNA methyltransferase, catalyzes modification of wobble bases in tRNA anticodons to 2, 5-methoxycarbonylmethyluridine and 5-methoxycarbonylmethyl-2-thiouridine, may act as part of a complex with Trm112p, in S. cerevisiae deletion mutation increases translational infidelity, including amino acid misincorporation and -1 frameshifting, and also confers resistance to zymocin, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays activation of stress responses

name: PP7435_Chr2-0895
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MGA1
description: Protein similar to heat shock transcription factor, multicopy suppressor in S. cerevisiae of pseudohyphal growth defects of ammonium permease mutants

name: PFK1
description: Alpha subunit of heterooctameric phosphofructokinase involved in glycolysis, indispensable for anaerobic growth, activated by fructose-2,6-bisphosphate and AMP, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, mutation in S. cerevisiae inhibits glucose induction of cell cycle-related genes, involved in Pichia pastoris in glucose-induced microautophagy

name: YTA7
description: Protein that localizes to chromatin, has a role in regulation of histone gene expression, has a bromodomain-like region that interacts with the N-terminal tail of histone H3, and an ATPase domain, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: HER2
description: Subunit of the trimeric GatFAB AmidoTransferase(AdT) complex, involved in the formation of Q-tRNAQ, required for remodeling of ER caused by Hmg2p overexpression, similar to bacterial GatA glutamyl-tRNA amidotransferase

name: BRE2
description: Subunit of COMPASS (Set1C) complex, COMPASS methylates Lys4 of histone H3 and functions in silencing at telomeres, has a C-terminal Sdc1 Dpy-30 Interaction (SDI) domain that mediates binding to Sdc1p, similar to trithorax-group protein ASH2L

name: YIP1
description: Integral membrane protein required for the biogenesis of ER-derived COPII transport vesicles, interacts with Yif1p and Yos1p, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi, ER, and COPII vesicles protein, homolog of human YIPF4

name: MSM1
description: Methionyl-tRNA synthetase (MetRS), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, functions as a monomer in mitochondrial protein synthesis, functions similarly to cytoplasmic MetRS although the cytoplasmic form contains a zinc-binding domain not found in Msm1p

name: POL31
description: Subunit of DNA polymerase delta (polymerase III), essential for cell viability, involved in DNA replication and DNA repair, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: BRF1
description: TFIIIB B-related factor, one of three subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor TFIIIB, binds TFIIIC and TBP and recruits RNA pol III to promoters, amino-terminal half is homologous to TFIIB

name: URM1
description: Ubiquitin-like protein involved in thiolation of cytoplasmic tRNAs, receives sulfur from the E1-like enzyme Uba4p and transfers it to tRNA, also functions as a protein tag with roles in nutrient sensing and oxidative stress response

name: NAS2
description: Evolutionarily conserved 19S regulatory particle assembly-chaperone, involved in assembly of the base subcomplex of the 19S proteasomal regulatory particle (RP), in S. cerevisiae is a non-essential gene, interacts with Rpn4p, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, ortholog of human p27

name: ERG7
description: Lanosterol synthase, enriched in Golgi, an essential enzyme in S. cerevisiae that catalyzes the cyclization of squalene 2,3-epoxide, a step in ergosterol biosynthesis

name: PP7435_Chr2-0908
description: Protein with low similarity to aminopeptidase 2, enriched in cytosol

name: ATG24
description: Sorting nexin which regulates in Pichia pastoris vacuolar membrane dynamics during pexophagy via binding to phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate, enriched among several compartments, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpATG24

name: TAD2
description: Subunit of tRNA-specific adenosine-34 deaminase, forms a heterodimer with Tad3p that converts adenosine to inosine at the wobble position of several tRNAs

name: PP7435_Chr2-0911
description: Protein with low similarity to RMP1, subunit of RNase MRP, RNase MRP processes pre-rRNA and has a role in cell cycle-regulated degradation of daughter cell-specific mRNAs

name: MCM21
description: Component of the kinetochore sub-complex COMA, COMA (Ctf19p, Okp1p, Mcm21p, Ame1p) bridges kinetochore subunits in contact with centromeric DNA with subunits bound to microtubules during kinetochore assembly, involved in minichromosome maintenance, orthologous to human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-O and fission yeast mal2

name: PP7435_Chr2-0913
description: Protein with low similarity to YFT2, protein required for normal ER membrane biosynthesis

name: MRPS28
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: MET2-2
description: L-homoserine-O-acetyltransferase, catalyzes the conversion of homoserine to O-acetyl homoserine which is the first step of the methionine biosynthetic pathway

name: PP7435_Chr2-0916
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NMD3
description: Protein involved in nuclear export of the large ribosomal subunit, acts as a Crm1p-dependent adapter protein for export of nascent ribosomal subunits through the nuclear pore complex, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SRP101
description: Signal recognition particle (SRP) receptor alpha subunit, contain GTPase domains, involved in SRP-dependent protein targeting, interacts with the beta subunit, Srp102p, enriched in microsome

name: DBP8
description: ATPase, putative RNA helicase of the DEAD-box family, component of 90S preribosome complex involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of 40S small ribosomal subunit, ATPase activity stimulated by association with Esf2p

name: SPC97
description: Component of the microtubule-nucleating Tub4p (gamma-tubulin) complex, interacts with Spc110p at the spindle pole body (SPB) inner plaque and with Spc72p at the SPB outer plaque

name: MTG2
description: Putative GTPase, member of the Obg family, known in S. cerevisiae as peripheral protein of the mitochondrial inner membrane that associates with the large ribosomal subunit, required for mitochondrial translation, possibly via a role in ribosome assembly

name: PP7435_Chr2-0922
description: Putative transfer RNA for Cysteine (tRNA-Cys)

name: EFB1
description: Translation elongation factor 1 beta, stimulates nucleotide exchange to regenerate EF-1 alpha-GTP for the next elongation cycle, part of the EF-1 complex, which facilitates binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosomal A site, enriched among several compartments

name: SFH1
description: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex, in S. cerevisiae essential gene required for cell cycle progression and maintenance of proper ploidy, phosphorylated in the G1 phase of the cell cycle

name: PP7435_Chr2-0925
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TAD3
description: Subunit of tRNA-specific adenosine-34 deaminase, forms a heterodimer with Tad2p that converts adenosine to inosine at the wobble position of several tRNAs

name: EST2
description: Reverse transcriptase subunit of the telomerase holoenzyme, essential in S. cerevisiae for telomerase core catalytic activity, involved in other aspects of telomerase assembly and function, mutations in human homolog are associated with aplastic anemia

name: BUD6
description: Actin- and formin-interacting protein, participates in actin cable assembly and organization as a nucleation-promoting factor for formins Bni1p and Bnr1p, involved in polarized cell growth, isolated in S. cerevisiae as bipolar budding mutant, potential Cdc28p substrate, enriched in plasma membrane and microsome

name: PP7435_Chr2-0929
description: Protein with low similarity to MMS22, subunit of E3 ubiquitin ligase complex involved in replication repair

name: SWC4
description: Component of the Swr1p complex that incorporates Htz1p into chromatin, component of the NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex

name: CUL3
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase, forms a complex with Elc1p that polyubiquitylates monoubiquitylated RNA polymerase II to trigger its proteolysis, cullin family member with similarity to Cdc53p and human CUL3

name: LEU1
description: Isopropylmalate isomerase, catalyzes the second step in the leucine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in Golgi and cytosol

name: BRN1
description: Subunit of the condensin complex, required for chromosome condensation and for clustering of tRNA genes at the nucleolus, may influence multiple aspects of chromosome transmission

name: SLA1
description: Protein required for assembly of the cortical actin cytoskeleton, interacts with proteins regulating actin dynamics and proteins required for endocytosis, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoskeletal protein binding found in the nucleus and cell cortex, has 3 SH3 domains

name: MPO1
description: Protein involved in metabolism of phytosphingosine, in S. cerevisiae YGL010W is not an essential gene

name: IME4
description: mRNA N6-adenosine methyltransferase required for entry into meiosis, mediates N6-adenosine methylation of bulk mRNA during the induction of sporulation which includes the meiotic regulators IME1, IME2 and IME4 itself, in S. cerevisiae repressed in haploids via production of antisense IME4 transcripts, transcribed in diploid cells where antisense transcription is repressed, orthologous to human METTL3 (MT-A70)

name: COX13
description: Subunit VIa of cytochrome c oxidase, present in a subclass of cytochrome c oxidase complexes that may have a role in mimimizing generation of reactive oxygen species, enriched in mitochondria, not essential in S. cerevisiae for cytochrome c oxidase activity but may modulate activity in response to ATP, required for assembly of Rcf2p into cytochrome c oxidase - cytochrome bc1 supercomplexes

name: CDC55
description: Regulatory subunit B of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), in S. cerevisiae Zds1p/2p-dependent localization to cytoplasm promotes mitotic entry, localization to nucleus prevents mitotic exit, required for correct nuclear division, chromosome segregation during achiasmate meiosis, maintains nucleolar sequestration of Cdc14p during early meiosis, limits formation of PP2A-Rts1p holocomplexes to ensure timely dissolution of sister chromosome cohesion, homolog of mammalian B55

name: PP7435_Chr2-0940
description: Protein with similarity to YGL185C, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein with sequence similarity to hydroxyacid dehydrogenases, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm)

name: NUHM
description: NUHM (24 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: STR3
description: Cystathionine beta-lyase, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, converts cystathionine into homocysteine, may be redox regulated by Gto1p

name: YCK3
description: Palmitoylated vacuolar membrane-localized casein kinase I isoform, negatively regulates vacuole fusion during hypertonic stress via phosphorylation of Vps41p, enriched in Golgi and vacuole, in S. cerevisiae shares essential functions with Hrr25p, regulates vesicle fusion in AP-3 pathway

name: EAF3
description: Component of the Rpd3S histone deacetylase complex, Esa1p-associated factor, in S. cerevisiae is a nonessential component of the NuA4 acetyltransferase complex, homologous to Drosophila dosage compensation protein MSL3, plays a role in regulating Ty1 transposition

name: DSE1
description: Daughter cell-specific protein, may regulate cross-talk between the mating and filamentation pathways, in S. cerevisiae deletion affects cell separation after division and sensitivity to alpha-factor and drugs affecting the cell wall and is known as protein of the bud neck that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: RSP5
description: NEDD4 family E3 ubiquitin ligase, regulates processes including: MVB sorting, the heat shock response, transcription, endocytosis and ribosome stability, ubiquitinates Sec23p, Sna3p, Ste4p, Nfi1p, Rpo21p and Sem1p, autoubiquitinates, deubiquitinated by Ubp2p, regulated by SUMO ligase Siz1p, in turn regulates Siz1p SUMO ligase activity, required for efficient Golgi-to-ER trafficking in COPI mutants, enriched among several compartments, S. cerevisiae mutant tolerates aneuploidy, human homolog implicated in Liddle syndrome

name: PP7435_Chr2-0947
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: life-span regulatory factor)

name: MUP1-1
description: High affinity methionine permease, integral membrane protein with 13 putative membrane-spanning regions, also involved in cysteine upTake, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: SPT4
description: Spt4p/5p (DSIF) transcription elongation factor complex subunit, the Spt4/5 complex binds to ssRNA in a sequence-specific manner, and along with RNAP I and II has multiple roles regulating transcriptional elongation, RNA processing, quality control, and transcription-coupled repair, known in S. cerevisiae as protein localized to kinetochores and heterochromatin, influencing chromosomal dynamics and silencing, required for transcription through long trinucleotide repeats in ORFs and non-protein coding regions

name: COX18

name: PP7435_Chr2-0951
description: Protein with low similarity to biofilm-induced proteins

name: BUD32

name: PP7435_Chr2-0954
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: GSF2

description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3844), enriched among several compartments

name: DSC3
description: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex, protein of unknown function known in S. cerevisiae as ER and lumen vacuolar protein whose overexpression affects endocytic protein trafficking, ortholog of fission yeast dsc3

name: PP7435_Chr2-0962
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: mitochondrial 18 KDa protei, MTP18), enriched in mitochondria

name: GBF1
description: Putative G-box binding factor similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis GBF1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0964
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

description: Protein with low similarity to putative mannoprotein of cell wall with role in respons to stress of Candida albicans

name: ZTA1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0972
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: EMC1
description: Member of conserved ER membrane complex, involved in efficient folding of proteins in the ER, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays induction of the unfolded protein response, interacts with Gal80p, homologous to worm H17B01.4/EMC-1, fly CG2943, and human KIAA0090

name: PP7435_Chr2-0974
description: Protein with low similarity to mitochondrial genome required protein 1

name: PP7435_Chr2-0980

name: YNG2

name: SHE4
description: Protein containing a UCS (UNC-45/CRO1/SHE4) domain, binds to myosin motor domains to regulate myosin function, involved in endocytosis, polarization of the actin cytoskeleton, and asymmetric mRNA localization

name: PP7435_Chr2-0983
description: Protein with low similarity to transcription factors

description: Protein with low similarity to MOSC domain-containing proteins, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ECM4

name: KEX2

name: PP7435_Chr2-1003
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: VID30

name: PP7435_Chr2-1005
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-1006
description: Protein with low similarity to increased recombination centers protein 6

name: EMC4

description: Putative transfer RNA for Serine (tRNA-Ser)

name: PRE5

name: VPS55-2

name: PP7435_Chr2-1017
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr2-1023

name: SNQ2

name: TGL3

name: PP7435_Chr2-1028
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Archaeal ATPase, P-loop containing nucleoside triphosphate hydrolase)

name: TOA1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1044
description: Protein with similarity to YCR061W (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern and induced by treatment with 8-methoxypsoralen and UVA irradiation)

description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: CHAP)

name: PP7435_Chr2-1051
description: Protein with low similarity to PH domain-containing proteins, enriched among several compartments

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

description: Protein with low similarity to ser/Thr protein phosphatases, enriched in cytosol

name: NEM1

name: KIP3-2

name: VMA5

name: PP7435_Chr2-1065

name: MDH1

name: MRX8

name: SGN1-2

name: RNA14

name: PP7435_Chr2-1074
description: Protein with similarity to YHR097C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and the nucleus, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PAL1)

name: MRP1

name: PIB2-2

name: RRM3

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: BRCT domain)

name: RPB10

name: NPT1

name: KAP120

name: HRR25

name: PP7435_Chr2-1087
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF883), enriched among several compartments

name: RSM23

name: CBP3
description: Mitochondrial protein required for assembly of cytochrome bc1 complex, forms a complex with Cbp6p that binds to mt ribosomes near the polypeptide tunnel exit and promotes efficient translation of the COB mRNA, Cbp3p-Cbp6p complex also interacts with newly synthesized cytochrome b (Cobp) and Cbp4p to promote assembly of Cobp into the cytochrome bc1 complex, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: ITC1
description: Subunit of ATP-dependent Isw2p-Itc1p chromatin remodeling complex, required for repression of a-specific genes, repression of early meiotic genes during mitotic growth, and repression of INO1, similar to mammalian Acf1p, the regulatory subunit of the mammalian ATP-utilizing chromatin assembly and modifying factor (ACF) complex, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YPL216W

name: GEP3
description: Protein required for mitochondrial ribosome small subunit biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, whose null mutant is defective in respiration and in maturation of 15S rRNA, null mutant interacts synthetically with prohibitin (Phb1p)

name: PMT1
description: Protein O-mannosyltransferase of the ER membrane, suggested to be together with Pmt1 the main transferase of O-glycan to secreted protein in Pichia pastoris, transfers mannose from dolichyl phosphate-D-mannose to protein serine and threonine residues, 1 of 5 related Pichia pastoris proteins involved in O-glycosylation which is essential in S. cerevisiae for cell wall rigidity, involved in ER quality control, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae amino terminus faces in cytoplasm and carboxyl terminus faces ER lumen

name: VPS30
description: Subunit of phosphatidylinositol (PtdIns) 3-kinase complexes I and II, in S. cerevisiae Complex I is essential in autophagy and Complex II is required for vacuolar protein sorting, required for overflow degradation of misfolded proteins when ERAD is saturated, ortholog of the higher eukaryotic gene Beclin 1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1097
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RNR3
description: Minor isoform of large subunit of ribonucleotide-diphosphate reductase, the RNR complex catalyzes rate-limiting step in dNTP synthesis, regulated by DNA replication and DNA damage checkpoint pathways via localization of small subunits, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RNR1

name: MCP1
description: Protein of unknown function involved in lipid homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial integral membrane protein, specifically of the mitochondrial outer membrane, involved in mitochondrial morphology

name: MGM1
description: GTPase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, present in complex with Ugo1p and Fzo1p, required for mitochondrial morphology, fusion, and genome maintenance, exists as long and short form with different distributions, ratio of long to short forms is regulated by Psd1p, homolog of human OPA1 involved in autosomal dominant optic atrophy

name: SPP1
description: Subunit of COMPASS (Set1C), a complex which methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in telomeric transcriptional silencing, interacts with Orc2p, PHD finger domain protein similar to human CGBP, an unmethylated CpG binding protein, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: HAT2-2
description: Subunit of the Hat1p-Hat2p histone acetyltransferase complex, required for high affinity binding of the complex to free histone H4, thereby enhancing Hat1p activity, similar to human RbAp46 and 48, has a role in telomeric silencing, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RNY1
description: Vacuolar RNase of the T(2) family, enriched in vacuole, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes to the cytosol where it cleaves tRNAs upon oxidative or stationary phase stress, promotes apoptosis under stress conditions and this function is independent of its catalytic activity

name: PTP2
description: Phosphotyrosine-specific phosphatase involved in osmosensing, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein involved in the inactivation of mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) during osmolarity sensing, dephosporylates Hog1p MAPK and regulates its localization, with Msg5p co-regulates the calcium signaling pathway

name: SPE2
description: S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase, required for the biosynthesis of spermidine and spermine, cells lacking Spe2p require spermine or spermidine for growth in the presence of oxygen but not when grown anaerobically

name: PP7435_Chr2-1106
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: TMD)

name: UFO1
description: F-box receptor protein, subunit of the Skp1-Cdc53-F-box receptor (SCF) E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, binds to phosphorylated Ho endonuclease, allowing its ubiquitylation by SCF and subsequent degradation

name: PGA3
description: Putative cytochrome b5 reductase, among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, may be involved in regulation of lifespan, required for maturation of Gas1p and Pho8p, proposed to be involved in protein trafficking, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog AIM33

name: JLP1-4
description: Fe(II)-dependent sulfonate/alpha-ketoglutarate dioxygenase, involved in sulfonate catabolism for use as a sulfur source, contains sequence that resembles a J domain (typified by the E. coli DnaJ protein), induced in S. cerevisiae by sulphur starvation

name: ALO1
description: D-Arabinono-1,4-lactone oxidase, catalyzes the final step in biosynthesis of dehydro-D-arabinono-1,4-lactone, which is protective against oxidative stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-1111
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: leucine Rich repeats (2X))

name: RAD10
description: Single-stranded DNA endonuclease (with Rad1p), cleaves single-stranded DNA during nucleotide excision repair and double-strand break repair, subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 1 (NEF1), homolog of human ERCC1 protein

name: GIM5
description: Subunit of the heterohexameric cochaperone prefoldin complex which binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin and transfers target proteins to it

name: RSC9
description: Component of the RSC chromatin remodeling complex, DNA-binding protein involved in the synthesis of rRNA and in transcriptional repression and activation of genes regulated by the Target of Rapamycin (TOR) pathway

name: MSC1
description: Protein of unknown function, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae the mutant is defective in directing meiotic recombination events to homologous chromatids and the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria and is phosphorylated

name: PET18-1
description: Protein of unknown function, has weak similarity to proteins involved in thiamin metabolism, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced in the absence of thiamin

name: PRE8
description: Alpha 2 subunit of the 20S proteasome, enriched in cytosol

name: RRM100
description: Putative RNA recognition motif domain-containing protein

name: TUB1
description: Alpha-tubulin, associates with beta-tubulin (Tub2p) to form tubulin dimer, which polymerizes to form microtubules, relative distribution to nuclear foci increases upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog TUB3

name: RPM2
description: Protein subunit of mitochondrial RNase P, has roles in nuclear transcription, cytoplasmic and mitochondrial RNA processing, and mitochondrial translation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein present in mitochondria, cytoplasmic processing bodies, and the nucleus

name: PP7435_Chr2-1122
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: modifier of rudimentary proteins, the family include the VPS37 subunit of the endosomal sorting complex ESCRT-I)

name: TML25
description: Acyl-protein thioesterase responsible for depalmitoylation of Gpa1p, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

name: VPS28
description: Component of the ESCRT-I complex (Stp22p, Srn2p, Vps28p, and Mvb12p), which is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome, conserved C-terminal domain interacts with ESCRT-III subunit Vps20p

name: DOP1
description: Leucine-zipper domain containing protein, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein, involved in endosome to Golgi transport, organization of the ER, establishing cell polarity, and morphogenesis, detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: MTQ2
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase of the seven beta-strand family, subunit of complex with Trm112p that methylates translation release factor Sup45p (eRF1) in the ternary complex eRF1-eRF3-GTP, similar to E.coli PrmC

name: RUB1
description: Ubiquitin-like protein with similarity to mammalian NEDD8, conjugation (neddylation) substrates include the cullins Cdc53p, Rtt101p, and Cul3p, activated by Ula1p and Uba3p (E1 enzyme pair), conjugation mediated by Ubc12p (E2 enzyme)

name: CFT2
description: Subunit of the mRNA cleavage and polyadenlylation factor (CPF), required for pre-mRNA cleavage, polyadenylation and poly(A) site recognition, 43% similarity with the mammalian CPSF-100 protein

name: NIPM
description: NIPM (15 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: INP53
description: Polyphosphatidylinositol phosphatase, dephosphorylates multiple phosphatidylinositol phosphates, involved in trans Golgi network-to-early endosome pathway, enriched in plasma membrane, in S. cerevisiae hyperosmotic stress causes translocation to actin patches, contains Sac1 and 5-ptase domains, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog INP52

name: PHO4-2
description: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factor of the myc-family, activates in S. cerevisiae transcription cooperatively with Pho2p in response to phosphate limitation, binding to 'CACGTG' motif is regulated by chromatin restriction, competitive binding of Cbf1p to the same DNA binding motif and cooperation with Pho2p, function is regulated by phosphorylation at multiple sites and by phosphate availability

name: CRG1
description: S-AdoMet-dependent methyltransferase involved in lipid homeostasis, mediates resistance to a drug cantharidin

name: CCA1
description: ATP (CTP):tRNA-specific tRNA nucleotidyltransferase, different forms targeted to the nucleus, cytosol, and mitochondrion are generated via the use of multiple transcriptional and translational start sites

name: MET28
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcriptional activator in the Cbf1p-Met4p-Met28p complex, participates in the regulation of sulfur metabolism

name: KEX1
description: Cell death protease essential for hypochlorite-induced apoptosis in S. cerevisiae, involved in the processing of killer toxin and alpha factor precursor, cleaves Lys and Arg residues from the C-terminus of peptides and proteins

name: GPH1
description: Glycogen phosphorylase required for the mobilization of glycogen, non-essential, regulated by cyclic AMP-mediated phosphorylation, phosphorylation by Cdc28p may coordinately regulate carbohydrate metabolism and the cell cycle, expression is regulated by stress-response elements and by the HOG MAP kinase pathway, enriched among several compartments

name: SBT100
description: Putative peptidases S8 or subtilases serine peptidase, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr2-1138
description: Protein with similarity to YGL242C (Putative protein of unknown function, S. cerevisiae deletion mutant is viable)

name: TAD1
description: tRNA-specific adenosine deaminase, deaminates adenosine-37 to inosine in tRNA-Ala

name: FIS1
description: Protein involved in mitochondrial membrane fission and peroxisome abundance, required for localization of Dnm1p and Mdv1p during mitochondrial division, mediates ethanol-induced apoptosis and ethanol-induced mitochondrial fragmentation

name: ARG5,6
description: Acetylglutamate kinase and N-acetyl-gamma-glutamyl-phosphate reductase, N-acetyl-L-glutamate kinase (NAGK) catalyzes the 2nd and N-acetyl-gamma-glutamyl-phosphate reductase (NAGSA), the 3rd step in arginine biosynthesis, synthesized as a precursor which is processed in the mitochondrion to yield mature NAGK and NAGSA, enzymes form a metabolon complex with Arg2p, NAGK C-terminal domain stabilizes the enzymes, slows catalysis and is involved in feed-back inhibition by arginine, enriched in mitochondria

name: NSE4
description: Component of the SMC5-SMC6 complex, this complex plays a key role in the removal of X-shaped DNA structures that arise between sister chromatids during DNA replication and repair

name: QRI7
description: Protein involved in threonylcarbamoyl adenosine biosynthesis, Sua5p and Qri7p are necessary and sufficient for RNA t6A modification in vitro, highly conserved mitochondrial protein, essential in S. cerevisiae for t6A modification of mitochondrial tRNAs that decode ANN codons, similar to Kae1p and E. coli YgjD, both of which are also required for tRNA t6A modification, when directed to the cytoplasm in S. cerevisiae, complements the essential function of Kae1p in the KEOPS complex

name: MME1
description: Transporter for exports magnesium, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, involved in mitochondrial Mg2+ homeostasis, has similarity to human mitochondrial ATP-Mg/Pi carriers

name: MLH1
description: Protein required for mismatch repair in mitosis and meiosis as well as crossing over during meiosis, forms a complex with Pms1p and Msh2p-Msh3p during mismatch repair, human homolog is associated with hereditary non-polyposis colon cancer

name: HUL5
description: Multiubiquitin chain assembly factor (E4), proteasome processivity factor that elongates polyUb chains on substrates, opposing Ubp6p, a branched polyubiquitin protease, required for retrograde transport of misfolded proteins during ERAD

name: POL3
description: Catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase delta, required for chromosomal DNA replication during mitosis and meiosis, intragenic recombination, repair of double strand DNA breaks, and DNA replication during nucleotide excision repair (NER)

name: NIK100
description: Putative histidine kinase involved in a two-component signaling pathway present in both non-pathogenic and pathogenic fungi, homolog of Candida albicans NIK1 in Candida albicans, but not related to S. cerevisiae NIK1, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: GOS1
description: v-SNARE protein involved in Golgi transport, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, homolog of the mammalian protein GOS-28/GS28

name: MET6
description: Cobalamin-independent methionine synthase, involved in Pichia pastoris in the biosynthesis of methionine and adenine, enriched in cytosol, a nuclear localized methionine synthase is required to revert methionine and adenine auxotrophy of Pichia pastoris null mutant

name: UBX1
description: UBX (ubiquitin regulatory X) domain-containing protein that regulates Glc7p phosphatase activity and interacts with Cdc48p, interacts with ubiquitylated proteins in vivo and is required for degradation of a ubiquitylated model substrate, enriched in cytosol

name: TRP2
description: Anthranilate synthase, catalyzes the initial step of tryptophan biosynthesis, forms multifunctional hetero-oligomeric anthranilate synthase:indole-3-glycerol phosphate synthase enzyme complex with Trp3p, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr2-1153
description: Protein with low similarity to DnaJ domain containing proteins

name: NHX1
description: Na+/H+ and K+/H+ exchanger, required for intracellular sequestration of Na+ and K+, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar and late endosomal protein, required for osmotolerance to acute hypertonic shock and for vacuolar fusion

name: NDC1
description: Subunit of the transmembrane ring of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport, NPC biogenesis and spindle pole body duplication, homologous to human NDC1, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: RAD52
description: Protein that stimulates strand exchange by facilitating Rad51p binding to single-stranded DNA, anneals complementary single-stranded DNA, involved in the repair of double-strand breaks in DNA during vegetative growth and meiosis

name: UBA3
description: Protein that acts together with Ula1p to activate Rub1p before its conjugation to proteins (neddylation), which may play a role in protein degradation, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern

name: VRP1
description: Verprolin, proline-rich actin-associated protein, involved in cytoskeletal organization and cytokinesis, promotes actin nucleation and endocytosis, related to mammalian Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein (WASP)-interacting protein (WIP)

name: ERV1
description: Flavin-linked sulfhydryl oxidase of the mitochondrial IMS, N-terminus is an intrinsically disordered domain that in the cytosol helps target Erv1p to mitochondria, and in the intermembrane space oxidizes Mia40p as part of a disulfide relay system that promotes intermembrane space retention of imported proteins, ortholog of human hepatopoietin (ALR)

name: MCM3
description: Protein involved in DNA replication, component of the Mcm2-7 hexameric complex that binds chromatin as a part of the pre-replicative complex

name: HNT2
description: Dinucleoside triphosphate hydrolase, has similarity to the tumor suppressor FHIT and belongs to the histidine triad (HIT) superfamily of nucleotide-binding proteins

name: FYV4
description: Protein of unknown function, required for survival upon exposure to K1 killer toxin, enriched in mitochondria

name: MED6
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, essential in S. cerevisiae for transcriptional regulation, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ISU1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as conserved protein of the mitochondrial matrix, performs a scaffolding function during assembly of iron-sulfur clusters, interacts physically and functionally with yeast frataxin (Yfh1p), S. cerevisiae isu1 isu2 double mutant is inviable, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ISU2

name: TAF9
description: Subunit (17 kDa) of TFIID and SAGA complexes, involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation and in chromatin modification, similar to histone H3

name: BUD7
description: Member of the ChAPs family (Chs5p-Arf1p-binding proteins), members include Bch1p, Bch2p, Bud7p, and Chs6p, ChAPs family proteins form the exomer complex with Chs5p to mediate export of specific cargo proteins, including Chs3p, from the Golgi to the plasma membrane, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog BCH1

name: KAR2
description: ATPase involved in protein import into the ER, also acts as a chaperone to mediate protein folding in the ER and may play a role in ER export of soluble proteins, regulates the unfolded protein response via interaction with Ire1p, enriched among several compartments

name: PET123
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, PET123 exhibits genetic interactions with PET122, which encodes a COX3 mRNA-specific translational activator

name: MTR10
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear import receptor which mediates the nuclear localization of proteins involved in mRNA-nucleus export, promotes dissociation of mRNAs from the nucleus-cytoplasm mRNA shuttling protein Npl3p, required for retrograde import of mature tRNAs, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from cytoplasm to the nuclear periphery upon DNA replication stress

name: PNS1
description: Protein of unknown function, has similarity to Torpedo californica tCTL1p, which is postulated to be a choline transporter, enriched among several compartments, neither null mutation nor overexpression affects in S. cerevisiae choline transport

name: MUS81
description: Subunit of structure-specific Mms4p-Mus81p endonuclease, cleaves branched DNA, involved in DNA repair, replication fork stability, and joint molecule formation/resolution during meiotic recombination, promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs), helix-hairpin-helix protein, phosphorylation of non-catalytic subunit Mms4p by Cdc28p and Cdcp during mitotic cell cycle activates function of Mms4p-Mus81p

name: CCC2-1
description: Cu(+2)-transporting P-type ATPase, required for export of copper from the cytosol into an extracytosolic compartment, enriched in Golgi, has similarity to human proteins involved in Menkes and Wilsons diseases, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, affects TBSV model (+)RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

name: PP7435_Chr2-1173
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF4246)

name: PP7435_Chr2-1174
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF4246)

name: PP7435_Chr2-1175
description: Protein with low similarity to WD40 repeat-like proteins

name: PP7435_Chr2-1176
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: NADH ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit NDUFA12)

name: PP7435_Chr2-1177
description: Protein with low similarity to ESC2, sumo-like domain protein which prevents accumulation of toxic intermediates during replication-associated recombinational repair

name: PUT4-1
description: Proline permease, required for high-affinity transport of proline, also transports the toxic proline analog azetidine-2-carboxylate (AzC), enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, PUT4 transcription is repressed in S. cerevisiae in ammonia-grown cells

name: MRP20
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: RPB2
description: RNA polymerase II second largest subunit B150, part of central core, similar to bacterial beta subunit, enriched in cytosol

name: TRS120
description: Component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complex II, TRAPPII is a multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factor for the GTPase Ypt1p, regulating intra-Golgi and endosome-Golgi traffic

name: ISM1
description: Isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, S. cerevisiae null mutant is deficient in respiratory growth

name: PUP1
description: Beta 2 subunit of the 20S proteasome, endopeptidase with trypsin-like activity that cleaves after basic residues, synthesized as a proprotein before being proteolytically processed for assembly into 20S particle, human homolog is subunit Z, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ADE8
description: Phosphoribosyl-glycinamide transformylase, catalyzes a step in the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway, enriched in cytosol

name: IDH2
description: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase, which catalyzes the oxidation of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate in the TCA cycle, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: UBA2
description: Subunit of a heterodimeric nuclear SUMO activating enzyme (E1) with Aos1p, activates Smt3p (SUMO) before its conjugation to proteins (sumoylation), which may play a role in protein targeting, essential in S. cerevisiae for viability

name: SAC7
description: GTPase activating protein (GAP) for Rho1p, involved in signaling to actin cytoskeleton, null mutations in S. cerevisiae suppress tor2 mutations and temperature sensitive mutations in actin, potential Cdc28p substrate, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog BAG7

name: BAG7
description: Rho GTPase activating protein (RhoGAP), stimulates the intrinsic GTPase activity of Rho1p, which plays a role in actin cytoskeleton organization and control of cell wall synthesis, structurally and functionally related to Sac7p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SAC7

name: RVS167
description: Calmodulin-binding actin-associated protein, roles in endocytic membrane tabulation and constriction, and exocytosis, N-BAR domain protein that interacts with Rvs161p to regulate actin cytoskeleton, endocytosis, and viability following starvation or osmotic stress, recruited to bud tips by Gyl1p and Gyp5p during polarized growth, homolog of mammalian amphiphysin

name: CCP1-2
description: Cytochrome-c peroxidase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, degrades reactive oxygen species in mitochondria, involved in the response to oxidative stress

name: UPC2
description: Sterol regulatory element binding protein, induces transcription of sterol biosynthetic genes and of DAN/TIR gene products, relocates in S. cerevisiae from intracellular membranes to perinuclear foci on sterol depletion, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ECM22

name: TCP1
description: Alpha subunit of chaperonin-containing T-complex, which mediates protein folding in the cytosol, enriched in cytosol, involved in actin cytoskeleton maintenance, overexpression in neurons suppresses formation of pathogenic conformations of huntingtin protein

name: CDC42
description: Small rho-like GTPase, enriched in mitochondria, in S. cerevisiae essential for establishment and maintenance of cell polarity and mutants have defects in the organization of actin and septins

name: PP7435_Chr2-1196
description: Putative transfer RNA for Isoleucine (tRNA-Ile)

name: ADK2
description: Adenylate kinase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, catalyzes the reversible synthesis of GTP and AMP from GDP and ADP, may serve as a back-up for synthesizing GTP or ADP depending on metabolic conditions, 3' sequence of ADK2 varies with strain background

name: FBP26
description: Fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase, required for glucose metabolism, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: FSH3
description: Putative serine hydrolase, likely target of Cyc8p-Tup1p-Rfx1p transcriptional regulation, sequence is similar to S. cerevisiae Fsh1p and Fsh2p and the human C.te tumor suppressor OVCA2, enriched in cytosol

name: FMP42-1
description: Putative protein of unknown function, enriched in vacuole, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, physical interaction with Atg27p suggests a possible role in autophagy

name: PP7435_Chr2-1201
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: UGA1-2
description: Gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA) transaminase, also known as 4-aminobutyrate aminotransferase, involved in the 4-aminobutyrate and glutamate degradation pathways, required for normal oxidative stress tolerance and nitrogen utilization, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MAK32
description: Protein necessary for structural stability of L-A double-stranded RNA-containing particles

name: ARX1
description: Export factor for the ribosomal pre-60S subunit, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, shuttling factor which directly binds FG rich nucleoporins and facilities translocation through the nuclear pore complex, interacts directly with Alb1p, responsible for Tif6p recycling defects in the absence of Rei1, associated with the ribosomal export complex

name: BMH2
description: Pichia pastoris 14-3-3 protein regulates transcriptional activity of the methanol inducible transcription factor Mxr1 by direct interaction, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog BMH1

name: TVP15
description: Integral membrane protein known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the late Golgi vesicles along with the v-SNARE Tlg2p

name: PHO5
description: Inducible acid phosphatase of Pichia pastoris, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PHO1 but not related to S. cerevisiae PHO1, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: CLB2
description: B-type cyclin involved in cell cycle progression, activates Cdc28p to promote the transition from G2 to M phase, accumulates during G2 and M, then targeted via a destruction box motif for ubiquitin-mediated degradation by the proteasome, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CLB1

name: PPX1
description: Exopolyphosphatase, hydrolyzes inorganic polyphosphate (poly P) into Pi residues, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of cytosol, plasma membrane, and mitochondrial matrix

name: DPB4
description: Subunit of DNA pol epsilon and of ISW2 chromatin accessibility complex, involved in both chromosomal DNA replication and inheritance of telomeric silencing, stabilizes the interaction of Pol epsilon with primer-template DNA, positively affecting the processivity of the polymerase and exonuclease activities of Pol epsilon, interacts with extranucleosomal DNA and acts as anchor point for ISW2 complex that retains its position on DNA during nucleosome mobilization

name: PP7435_Chr2-1211
description: Protein with low similarity to NYV1, v-SNARE component of the vacuolar SNARE complex involved in vesicle fusion

name: PAB1
description: Poly(A) binding protein, part of the 3'-end RNA-processing complex, mediates interactions between the 5' cap structure and the 3' mRNA poly(A) tail, involved in control of poly(A) tail length, interacts with translation factor eIF-4G, enriched in cytosol

name: RLI1
description: Iron-sulfur protein required for ribosome biogenesis and translation initiation and termination, facilitates binding of a multifactor complex (MFC) of initiation factors to the small ribosomal subunit, predicted ABC family ATPase, forms a complex with Lto1p and Yae1p that may be involved in protection of the ribosome from damage due to reactive oxygen species, enriched among several compartments, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: CHD1
description: Chromatin remodeler that regulates various aspects of transcription, acts in in conjunction with Isw1b to regulate chromatin structure and maintain chromatin integrity during transcription elongation by RNAP II by preventing trans-histone exchange over coding regions, contains a chromo domain, a helicase domain and a DNA-binding domain, component of both the SAGA and SLIK complexes

name: PP7435_Chr2-1215
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MSH6
description: Protein required for mismatch repair in mitosis and meiosis, forms a complex with Msh2p to repair both single-base & insertion-deletion mispairs, also involved in interstrand cross-link repair, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: PSA1-2
description: GDP-mannose pyrophosphorylase (mannose-1-phosphate guanyltransferase), synthesizes GDP-mannose from GTP and mannose-1-phosphate in cell wall biosynthesis, required for normal cell wall structure, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells

name: PCL1
description: Cyclin, interacts with cyclin-dependent kinase Pho85p, member of the Pcl1,2-like subfamily, involved in the regulation of polarized growth and morphogenesis and progression through the cell cycle, is ubiquitinated by Dma1p, phosphorylation by Pho85p targets it for degradation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein that localizes to sites of polarized growth

name: PP7435_Chr2-1219
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TRM1
description: tRNA methyltransferase, two forms of the protein are made by alternative translation starts, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear and mitochondrial protein required produce the modified base N2,N2-dimethylguanosine in tRNAs in both compartments, not related to the Pichia pastoris Zn(II)2Cys6-type transcription factor which was previously published as PpTRM1

name: KGD1
description: Subunit of the mitochondrial alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase complex, catalyzes a key step in the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle, the oxidative decarboxylation of alpha-ketoglutarate to form succinyl-CoA, enriched in mitochondria

name: DUR8
description: Putative urea transport protein similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis DUR8

name: RPL30
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L30, involved in pre-rRNA processing in the nucleolus, autoregulates splicing of its transcript, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L30, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: RPL24B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L24B, enriched in plasma membrane and Golgi in glucose-grown cells, not essential in S. cerevisiae for translation but may be required for normal translation rate, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L24, no bacterial homolog, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL24A

name: KAE1
description: Highly conserved ATPase of HSP70/DnaK family, component of the EKC/KEOPS complex with Bud32p, Cgi121p, Pcc1p, and Gon7p, EKC/KEOPS complex is required for t6A tRNA modification and may have roles in telomere maintenance and transcription

name: LST7
description: Subunit of the Lst4p-Lst7p GTPase activating protein complex for Gtr2p, stimulates the GTPase activity of Rag family GTPase Gtr2p, within the context of the Gtr1p-Gtr2p heterodimer, after amino acid stimulation, required for activation of TORC1 in response to amino acid stimulation, recruited to the vacuolar membrane during amino acid starvation and released from the membrane by TORC1, required for the transport of amino acid permease Gap1p from the Golgi to the cell surface

name: PP7435_Chr2-1227
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: UV radiation resistance protein and autophagy-related subunit 14)

name: SMC1
description: Subunit of the multiprotein cohesin complex, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential protein in S. cerevisiae involved in chromosome segregation and in double-strand DNA break repair, SMC chromosomal ATPase family member, binds DNA with a preference for DNA with secondary structure

name: PP7435_Chr2-1229
description: Protein with low similarity to SPC34, essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the Dam1 complex (aka DASH complex)

name: MDV1

name: CCT7

name: GPR1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1233
description: Protein with low similarity to taspase, threonine aspartase, 1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1234
description: Protein with low similarity to MDY2, protein involved in inserting tail-anchored proteins into ER membranes, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: SHR5

name: MSB3

name: RIM21

name: OLE1-1

name: YPK3

name: POA1

name: RFC3

name: MID1

name: MON2

name: CHS3

name: PP7435_Chr2-1246
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RPH1

name: RAD24

name: PpHXT2

name: SCW11

name: PP7435_Chr2-1256
description: Protein with low similarity to putative inositol oxygenase

name: STE6-3
description: Plasma membrane ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter required for the export of a-factor, catalyzes ATP hydrolysis coupled to a-factor transport, contains 12 transmembrane domains and two ATP binding domains, expressed in S. cerevisiae only in MATa cells, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments

name: DNF3
description: Aminophospholipid translocase (flippase), type 4 P-type ATPase, involved in phospholipid translocation, contributing to the maintenance of membrane lipid asymmetry in post-Golgi secretory vesicles, role in protein trafficking between the Golgi and endosomal system, enriched in microsome, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the Trans-Golgi network, localized at the shmoo tip where it has a redundant role in the cellular response to mating pheromone

description: Putative ferric reductase with similarity to Fre2p, expression in S. cerevisiae induced by low iron levels

name: FCY1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1262
description: Protein with low similarity to YPR063C, protein of unknown function, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr2-1263
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: survival motor neuron (SMN) interacting protein 1)

name: TFB4
description: Subunit of TFIIH complex, involved in transcription initiation, similar to 34 kDa subunit of human TFIIH, interacts with Ssl1p

name: FES1

name: PP7435_Chr2-1266
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: ERCC4)

name: PP7435_Chr2-1267
description: Protein with similarity to YDR061W (Protein with similarity to ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter family members, lacks predicted membrane-spanning regions, transcriptionally activated by Yrm1p along with genes involved in multidrug resistance)

description: Protein of unknown function, enriched among several compartments, S. cerevisiae null mutant decreases the level of secreted invertase, homolog of human BAP31 protein, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr2-1270
description: Putative transfer RNA for Lysine (tRNA-Lys)

name: NIT1

description: Protein with low similarity to MFG1, regulator of filamentous growth, interacts with FLO11 promoter and regulates FLO11 expression

description: Protein with low similarity to mitochondrial L-2-hydroxyglutarate dehydrogenase, putative FAD-dependent oxidoreductase and NAD dehydrogenase

name: PP7435_Chr2-2595

name: EFT2
description: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT1, catalyzes ribosomal translocation during protein synthesis, contains diphthamide, the unique posttranslationally modified histidine residue specifically ADP-ribosylated by diphtheria toxin, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog EFT1

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RPS26B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S26, no bacterial homolog, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS26A

name: PP7435_Chr3-0001
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0005
description: Protein with low similarity to Hap43p-repressed proteins

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TFC1

name: MRPL36

name: SPS22

name: PP7435_Chr3-0019
description: Protein with similarity to YML018C (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the membrane of the vacuole, physical interaction with Atg27p suggests a possible role in autophagy, YML018C is not an essential gene and relative distribution to the vacuolar membrane decreases upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog THI74)

name: OST6
description: Subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex of the ER lumen, enriched in microsome and Golgi, catalyzes asparagine-linked glycosylation of newly synthesized proteins, similar to and partially functionally redundant with Ost3p

name: PP7435_Chr3-0021
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: DYN2
description: Light chain dynein, microtubule motor protein, proposed to be involved in the assembly of the nuclear pore complex, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: SNX41
description: Sorting nexin, involved in the retrieval of late-Golgi SNAREs from the post-Golgi endosome to the trans-Golgi network, interacts with Snx4p

name: APT1
description: Adenine phosphoribosyltransferase, catalyzes the formation of AMP from adenine and 5-phosphoribosylpyrophosphate, involved in the salvage pathway of purine nucleotide biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog APT2

name: RAD33
description: Protein involved in nucleotide excision repair, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleus

name: ERV25
description: Member of the p24 family involved in ER to Golgi transport, role in misfolded protein quality control, forms in S. cerevisiae a heterotrimeric complex with Erp1, Erp2p, and Emp24, but Pichia pastoris does not have Erp1p and Erp2p, enriched among several compartments

name: SPT5
description: Spt4p/5p (DSIF) transcription elongation factor complex subunit, the Spt4/5 complex binds to ssRNA in a sequence-specific manner, and in concert with RNAP I and II has multiple roles regulating transcriptional elongation, RNA processing, quality control, and transcription-coupled repair, interacts with DNA upstream of RNAPII and the non-template strand of the transcription bubble, Spt5p is the only transcription elongation factor conserved in all domains of life, enriched in cytosol

name: SSN2
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, required for stable association of Srb10p-Srb11p kinase, essential in S. cerevisiae for transcriptional regulation

name: DOT1
description: Histone H3-Lys79 methylase, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleosomal enzyme required for telomeric silencing, meiotic checkpoint control, and DNA damage response

name: BNA3
description: Kynurenine aminotransferase, catalyzes formation of kynurenic acid from kynurenine, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: LAM4

name: SKP1
