name: PP7435_Chr3-0033
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PUP2
description: Alpha 5 subunit of the 20S proteasome involved in ubiquitin-dependent catabolism, human homolog is subunit zeta, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: GCN5
description: Catalytic subunit of ADA and SAGA histone acetyltransferase complexes, acetyltransferase, modifies N-terminal lysines on histones H2B and H3, acetylates Rsc4p, a subunit of the RSC chromatin-remodeling complex, altering replication stress tolerance, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, mutant displays reduced transcription elongation in the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay, greater involvement in repression of RNAPII-dependent transcription than in activativation

name: PSD2
description: Phosphatidylserine decarboxylase known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi and vacuolar membrane protein, converts phosphatidylserine to phosphatidylethanolamine, PSD2 represent the minor PSD activity in Pichia pastoris

name: SOL3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0038
description: Protein with similarity to YGR266W, enriched in mitochondria and among several compartments (Protein of unknown function, predicted to contain a single transmembrane domain, localized in S. cerevisiae to both the mitochondrial outer membrane and the plasma membrane, in S. cerevisiae the mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: RBG2

name: MRPS12

name: ACP1

name: DBP6

name: RSM19

name: PP7435_Chr3-0046
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PMI40

name: NTF2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0049
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF3210)

name: MSY1
description: Mitochondrial tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: GTS1
description: Protein involved in Arf3p regulation and in transcription regulation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein localized to nucleus and endocytic patches, contains an N-terminal Zn-finger and ArfGAP homology domain, a C-terminal glutamine-rich region, and a UBA (ubiquitin associated) domain, in S. cerevisiae gts1 mutations affect budding, cell size, heat tolerance, sporulation, life span, ultradian rhythms, endocytosis and expression oscillates in a pattern similar to metabolic oscillations

name: IZH2
description: Protein involved in zinc homeostasis and osmotin-induced apoptosis, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein whose gene transcription regulated by Zap1p, zinc and fatty acid levels, similar to mammalian adiponectins, in S. cerevisiae deletion increases sensitivity to elevated zinc

name: PP7435_Chr3-0056
description: Protein with similarity to YML020W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: UNG1

name: MRPL11
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: TRM8

name: STL1-3
description: Glycerol proton symporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein subjected to glucose-induced inactivation, strongly but transiently induced when cells are subjected to osmotic shock

name: DCR2

name: PTM1

name: VPH1

name: PAC1

name: HRK1-1

name: PUS7

name: RAD53

name: PEP4
description: Vacuolar aspartyl protease (proteinase A), required for posttranslational precursor maturation of vacuolar proteinases, important for protein turnover after oxidative damage, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, plays a protective role in S. cerevisiae in acetic acid induced apoptosis, synthesized as a zymogen, self-activates

name: PP7435_Chr3-0073
description: Protein with similarity to YMR196W, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and YMR196W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0074
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: VTI1

name: MET5
description: Sulfite reductase beta subunit, involved in amino acid biosynthesis, enriched among several compartments, transcription repressed in S. cerevisiae by methionine

name: PP7435_Chr3-0077
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RPN10
description: Non-ATPase base subunit of the 19S regulatory particle (RP) of the 26S proteasome, N-terminus plays a role in maintaining the structural integrity of the RP, binds selectively to polyubiquitin chains, homolog of the mammalian S5a protein, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0079
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: FOG: GAF domain, signal transduction mechanisms, FhlA)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0080
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: HSH49
description: U2-snRNP associated splicing factor with similarity to the mammalian splicing factor SAP49, proposed to function as a U2-snRNP assembly factor along with Hsh155p and binding partner Cus1p, contains two RNA recognition motifs (RRM)

name: MPC3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0083
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0084
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: STAT)

name: CDC23
description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C), which is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition

name: PRP8
description: Component of the U4/U6-U5 snRNP complex, involved in the second catalytic step of splicing, mutations of human Prp8 cause retinitis pigmentosa, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0087
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Putative zinc-finger domain)

name: STL1-4
description: Glycerol proton symporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein subjected to glucose-induced inactivation, strongly but transiently induced when cells are subjected to osmotic shock

name: ELO100
description: Putative fatty acid elongase, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0090
description: Protein with low similarity to GIS3 (Protein of unknown function)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0091
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PEX3
description: Peroxisomal membrane protein (PMP), enriched in peroxisome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae anchors peroxisome retention factor Inp1p at the peroxisomal membrane and interacts with Pex19p, P. pastoris Pex3 contains additionally to domains implicated in peroxisome biogenesis, also a Atg30-binding domain which affects the phosphorylation status of Atg30 and its interaction with Atg11, suggesting a regulative role of Pex3 in pexophagy, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PAS2

name: LRP1
description: Exosome-associated nucleic acid binding protein, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein involved in RNA processing, surveillance, degradation, tethering, and export, rapidly degraded by the proteasome in the absence of Rrp6p, homolog of mammalian nuclear matrix protein C1D involved in regulation of DNA repair and recombination

name: PP7435_Chr3-0094
description: Protein with low similarity to elongation factor 1-gamma of Ogataea parapolymorpha, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr3-0095
description: Putative transfer RNA for Valine (tRNA-Val)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0096
description: Putative transfer RNA for Serine (tRNA-Ser)

name: NUP84

name: RPN6

name: MRF1
description: Translation release factor, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, involved in stop codon recognition and hydrolysis of the peptidyl-tRNA bond during mitochondrial translation, lack of MRF1 causes mitochondrial genome instability

name: TMA17
description: ATPase dedicated chaperone that adapts proteasome assembly to stress, Tma17p is induced upon stress, interacts with Rpt6p to assist its pairing to Rpt3p and early steps in proteasome biogenesis, associates with ribosomes, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae heterozygous deletion demonstrated increases in chromosome instability in a rad9 deletion background, protein abundance is decreased upon intracellular iron depletion

name: RRP42
description: Exosome non-catalytic core component, involved in 3'-5' RNA processing and degradation in both the nucleus and the cytoplasm, has similarity to E. coli RNase PH and to human hRrp42p (EXOSC7)

name: TRM3
description: 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase, catalyzes the ribose methylation of the guanosine nucleotide at position 18 of tRNAs, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0103
description: Protein with similarity to YML020W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: ROG1
description: Lipase with specificity for monoacylglycerol, preferred substrate is 1-oleoylglycerol, null mutation in S. cerevisiae affects lipid droplet morphology and overexpression causes increased accumulation of reactive oxygen species, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YDL109C

name: PP7435_Chr3-0105
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: RINT-1 / TIP-1 family)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0106
description: Protein with low similarity to Hap43p-repressed proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0108
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0109
description: Protein with similarity to YJR056C (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus and relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress)

name: SUR7
description: Plasma membrane protein that localizes to furrow-like invaginations (MCC patches), component of eisosomes, associated with endocytosis, along with Pil1p and Lsp1p, sporulation and plasma membrane sphingolipid content are altered in S. cerevisiae mutants, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments

name: RPL32
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L32, overexpression in S. cerevisiae disrupts telomeric silencing, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L32, no bacterial homolog

name: ROX3
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme

name: FMP27
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: TIF3
description: Translation initiation factor eIF-4B, contains an RNA recognition motif and binds to single-stranded RNA, has RNA annealing activity, interacts with Rps20p at the head of the 40S ribosomal subunit and alters the structure of the mRNA entry channel, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0115
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: RING-H2 zinc finger)

name: PDP3
description: Component of the NuA3b histone acetyltransferase complex, regulates interaction between NuA3b and H3K36me3 at the transcribed regions of genes, contains PWWP domain, deletion confers sensitivity to 4-(N-(S-glutathionylacetyl)amino) phenylarsenoxide (GSAO), enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RPC17
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C17, physically interacts with C31, C11, and TFIIIB70, may be involved in the recruitment of pol III by the preinitiation complex, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr3-0118
description: Protein with low similarity to predicted ribonuclease P protein subunit p40 isoform X1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0119
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Sds3-like)

name: HYP2
description: Translation elongation factor eIF-5A, may function in translation initiation, structural homolog of bacterial EF-P, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, undergoes in S. cerevisiae an essential hypusination modification, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ANB1

name: APS2
description: Small subunit of the clathrin-associated adaptor complex AP-2, which is involved in protein sorting at the plasma membrane, related to the sigma subunit of the mammalian plasma membrane clathrin-associated protein (AP-2) complex

name: PEX1
description: AAA-peroxin that heterodimerizes with AAA-peroxin Pex6p and participates in the recycling of peroxisomal signal receptor Pex5p from the peroxisomal membrane to the cystosol, induced in S. cerevisiae by oleic acid and upregulated during anaerobiosis, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PAS1

name: GCN20
description: Positive regulator of the Gcn2p kinase activity, forms a complex with Gcn1p, proposed to stimulate Gcn2p activation by an uncharged tRNA, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0124
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Inner centromere protein, ARK binding region)

name: DIS3
description: Exosome core complex catalytic subunit, possesses both endonuclease and 3'-5' exonuclease activity, involved in 3'-5' RNA processing and degradation in both the nucleus and the cytoplasm, has similarity to E. coli RNase R and to human DIS3, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SNU13
description: RNA binding protein, part of U3 snoRNP involved in rRNA processing, part of U4/U6-U5 tri-snRNP involved in mRNA splicing, similar to human 15.5K protein, enriched in cytosol

name: VMA3
description: Proteolipid subunit of the vacuolar H(+)-ATPase V0 sector (subunit c, dicyclohexylcarbodiimide binding subunit), required for vacuolar acidification and important for copper and iron metal ion homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein,

name: NUP85
description: Subunit of the Nup84p subcomplex of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport and NPC biogenesis and is involved in establishment of a normal nucleocytoplasmic concentration gradient of the GTPase Gsp1p, also plays roles in several processes that may require localization of genes or chromosomes at the nuclear periphery, including double-strand break repair, transcription and chromatin silencing, homologous to human NUP85 aka NUP75

name: PP7435_Chr3-0129
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RIB4
description: Lumazine synthase (6,7-dimethyl-8-ribityllumazine synthase, also known as DMRL synthase), catalyzes synthesis of immediate precursor to riboflavin, enriched in microsome and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: NOP8
description: Protein required for 60S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: CTR9
description: Component of the Paf1p complex involved in transcription elongation, binds to and modulates the activity of RNA polymerases I and II, required for expression of a subset of genes, including cyclin genes, involved in SER3 repression by helping to maintain SRG1 transcription-dependent nucleosome occupancy, contains TPR repeats, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0133
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1014)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0134
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0135
description: Protein with low similarity to a Scheffersomyces stipitis d-amino acid oxidase, enriched in cytosol

name: NOB1
description: Protein involved in proteasomal and 40S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, required for cleavage of the 20S pre-rRNA to generate the mature 18S rRNA, cleavage is activated by Fun12p, a GTPase and translation initiation factor, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to nucleolus upon DNA replication stress

name: SIS2
description: Negative regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1 (Ppz1p), also a subunit of phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase (PPCDC, Cab3p, Sis2p, Vhs3p) complex, which catalyzes the third step of coenzyme A biosynthesis, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog VHS3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0138
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: CRT10
description: Protein involved in transcriptional regulation of RNR2 and RNR3, expression of the gene is induced by DNA damage and null mutations in S. cerevisiae confer increased resistance to hydroxyurea, N-terminal region has a leucine repeat and a WD40 repeat

name: FLD
description: Bifunctional alcohol dehydrogenase and formaldehyde dehydrogenase, formaldehyde dehydrogenase activity is glutathione-dependent, functions in formaldehyde detoxification and formation of long chain and complex alcohols, regulated by Hog1p-Sko1p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: NRP1
description: Putative RNA binding protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the stress granules induced by glucose deprivation, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: CSC1-2
description: Calcium permeable gated cation channel, may be involved in detoxification, similar to Arabidopsis CSC1

name: NMT1
description: N-myristoyl transferase, catalyzes the cotranslational, covalent attachment of myristic acid to the N-terminal glycine residue of several proteins involved in cellular growth and signal transduction, enriched among several compartments

name: PWP1
description: Protein with WD-40 repeats involved in rRNA processing, associates with trans-acting ribosome biogenesis factors, similar to beta-transducin superfamily, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: GLT1
description: NAD(+)-dependent glutamate synthase (GOGAT), synthesizes glutamate from glutamine and alpha-ketoglutarate, with Gln1p, forms the secondary pathway for glutamate biosynthesis from ammonia, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by nitrogen source

name: PP7435_Chr3-0146
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3602), enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: HCR1
description: eIF3j component of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3), dual function protein involved in translation initiation as a substoichiometric component (eIF3j) of eIF3, required for 20S pre-rRNA processing, required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition, absence decreases Ty1 Gag:GFP protein levels, binds eIF3 subunits Rpg1p, Prt1p and 18S rRNA, eIF3 also involved in programmed stop codon read through, human homolog EIF3J can complement yeast hcr1 mutant, enriched in cytosol and mitochondria

name: DLD1
description: Major mitochondrial D-lactate dehydrogenase, oxidizes D-lactate to pyruvate, transcription is heme-dependent, repressed by glucose, and derepressed in ethanol or lactate, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells, located in S. cerevisiae in the mitochondrial inner membrane

name: PP7435_Chr3-0149
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Leucine Rich Repeat)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0150
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: CENP-S associating Centromere protein X)

name: DYA4
description: Putative dynactin subunit similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis DYA4

name: HRD3
description: ER membrane protein that plays a central role in ERAD, forms HRD complex with Hrd1p and ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD) determinants that engages in lumen to cytosol communication and coordination of ERAD events, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: ART5
description: Protein proposed to regulate the endocytosis of plasma membrane proteins by recruiting the ubiquitin ligase Rsp5p to its target in the plasma membrane

name: ATG21
description: Phosphoinositide binding protein, required in P. pastoris for pexophagy, lipidation of Atg8 and vesicle formation in the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (CVT), pexophagy in P. pastoris seems to require binding of PI(3)P, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpAtg21

name: MGR2
description: Subunit of the TIM23 translocase complex, acts to couple Tim21p with the core Tim23 translocase, absolutely required for mitochondrial import of presequence-containing proteins at elevated temperature, required for viability of cells lacking the mitochondrial genome (petite-negative phenotype), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: SEC62
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of Sec63 complex (Sec63p, Sec62p, Sec66p and Sec72p), with Sec61 complex, Kar2p/BiP and Lhs1p forms a channel competent for SRP-dependent and post-translational SRP-independent protein targeting and import into the ER, enriched among several compartments

name: FMP30
description: Protein with a role in maintaining mitochondrial morphology, also involved in maintaining normal cardiolipin levels, mitochondrial inner membrane protein, proposed to be involved in N-acylethanolamine metabolism, related to mammalian N-acylPE-specific phospholipase D

name: ECM31
description: Ketopantoate hydroxymethyltransferase, required for pantothenic acid biosynthesis, converts 2-oxoisovalerate into 2-dehydropantoate

name: GLR1
description: Glutathione oxidoreductase, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as both cytoplasmic and mitochondrial glutathione oxidoreductase, converts oxidized glutathione to reduced glutathione, cytosolic Glr1p is the main determinant of the glutathione redox state of the mitochondrial intermembrane space, mitochondrial Glr1p has a role in resistance to hyperoxia, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0160
description: Protein with similarity to YLR149C (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae overexpressioncauses a cell cycle delay or arrest, the null mutation results in a decrease in plasma membrane electron transport and YLR149C is not an essential gene, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0161
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0162
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: BTS1
description: Geranylgeranyl diphosphate synthase, increases the intracellular pool of geranylgeranyl diphosphate, suppressor in S. cerevisiae of bet2 mutation that causes defective geranylgeranylation of small GTP-binding proteins that mediate vesicular traffic

name: NPA3
description: Member of the conserved GPN-loop GTPase family, has a role in transport of RNA polymerase II to the nucleus, exhibits GTP-dependent binding to PolII, has ATPase activity, involved in sister chromatid cohesion, phosphorylated by the Pcl1p-Pho85p kinase complex, human homolog XAB1 interacts with human RNA polymerase II, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0165
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1237), Six-hairpin glycosidases)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0166
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CTS1
description: Endochitinase, required for cell separation after mitosis, transcriptional activation during the G1 phase of the cell cycle is mediated by transcription factor Ace2p

name: NNT1
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase, has a role in rDNA silencing and in lifespan determination

name: TUP1
description: General repressor of transcription, forms complex with Cyc8p, involved in the establishment of repressive chromatin structure through interactions with histones H3 and H4, appears to enhance expression of some genes, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0170
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ALG8
description: Glucosyl transferase, involved in N-linked glycosylation, adds glucose to the dolichol-linked oligosaccharide precursor prior to transfer to protein during lipid-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, similar to Alg6p

name: YNG1
description: Subunit of the NuA3 histone acetyltransferase complex that acetylates histone H3, contains PHD finger domain that interacts with methylated histone H3, has similarity to the human tumor suppressor ING1

name: CYT1
description: Cytochrome c1, component of the mitochondrial respiratory chain, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex

name: CDC21
description: Thymidylate synthase, required for de novo biosynthesis of pyrimidine deoxyribonucleotides, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced at G1/S

name: PP7435_Chr3-0175
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Shugoshin N-terminal coiled-coil region)

name: DAD2
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the Dam1 complex (aka DASH complex), couples kinetochores to the force produced by MT depolymerization thereby aiding in chromosome segregation, is transferred to the kinetochore prior to mitosis

name: NUP133
description: Subunit of Nup84p subcomplex of nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport, NPC biogenesis, is involved in establishment of a normal nucleocytoplasmic concentration gradient of GTPase Gsp1p, also plays roles in several processes that may require localization of genes or chromosomes at nuclear periphery, including double-strand break repair, transcription and chromatin silencing, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytosol in response to hypoxia, homolog of human NUP133

name: RSE1
description: Protein involved in pre-mRNA splicing, component of the pre-spliceosome, associates with U2 snRNA, involved in ER to Golgi transport

name: RPF2
description: Essential protein involved in the processing of pre-rRNA and the assembly of the 60S ribosomal subunit, interacts with ribosomal protein L11, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nucleolus, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles

name: VPS5
description: Nexin-1 homolog, required for localizing membrane proteins from a prevacuolar/late endosomal compartment back to late Golgi, structural component of retromer membrane coat complex, forms a retromer subcomplex with Vps17p, required for recruiting the retromer complex to the endosome membranes, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YKR078W

name: UFE1
description: t-SNARE required for retrograde vesicular traffic and homotypic ER membrane fusion, forms a complex with the SNAREs Sec22p, Sec20p and Use1p to mediate fusion of Golgi-derived vesicles at the ER

name: HBS1
description: GTPase with similarity to translation release factors, together with binding partner Dom34p, facilitates ribosomal subunit dissociation and peptidyl-tRNA release when translation is stalled, genetically implicated in mRNA no-go decay, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SKI7

name: ALD6-2
description: Aldehyde dehydrogenase, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein activated by Mg2+ and utilizes NADP+ as the preferred coenzyme, required for conversion of acetaldehyde to acetate, constitutively expressed, locates in S. cerevisiae to the mitochondrial outer surface upon oxidative stress

name: YJU3
description: Monoglyceride lipase (MGL), functional ortholog of mammalian MGL, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the lipid particles and membranes, also member of the eukaryotic serine hydrolase family

name: PP7435_Chr3-0185
description: Protein with similarity to YDL114W (Putative short-chain dehydrogenase/reductase, in S. cerevisiae YDL114W is not an essential gene)

name: IWR1
description: RNA polymerase II transport factor, conserved from yeast to humans, also has a role in transporting RNA polymerase III into the nucleus, interacts with most of the RNAP II subunits, nucleo-cytoplasmic shuttling protein, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose abundance increases and get relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress and whose deletion causes hypersensitivity to K1 killer toxin

name: PP7435_Chr3-0187
description: Protein with low similarity to RVS167 (putative RVS167-3), actin-associated protein with roles in endocytosis and exocytosis

name: FRE1
description: Ferric reductase and cupric reductase, reduces siderophore-bound iron and oxidized copper prior to upTake by transporters, enriched among several compartments, expression in S. cerevisiae induced by low copper and iron levels

name: PP7435_Chr3-0189
description: Protein with low similarity to likely Ser/Thr protein kinase of Candida albicans

name: PP7435_Chr3-0190
description: Protein with low similarity to ATP-dependent Clp protease proteolytic subunit

name: WHI3
description: RNA binding protein that sequesters CLN3 mRNA in cytoplasmic foci, Tpk1 (PKA) mediated phosphorylation of Whi3 affects the G1/S phase transition by modulating CLN3 transcription, acts as a cytoplasmic retention factor for Cdc28p and associated cyclins, regulates cell fate and dose-dependently regulates the critical cell size required for passage through Start, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog WHI4

name: SHS1
description: Component of the septin ring that is required for cytokinesis, septins are GTP-binding proteins that assemble into rod-like hetero-oligomers that can associate with other rods to form filaments, septin rings at the mother-bud neck act as scaffolds for recruiting cell division factors and as barriers to prevent diffusion of specific proteins, undergoes sumoylation and phosphorylation during mitosis, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: NNR1
description: NADHX epimerase, catalyzes isomerization of (R)- and (S)-NADHX, homologous to AIBP in mammals and the N- terminal domain of YjeF in E.coli, enzyme is widespread in eukaryotes, prokaryotes and archaea, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: SPS19
description: 2,4-dienoyl-CoA reductase, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, auxiliary enzyme of fatty acid beta-oxidation, homodimeric enzyme required for growth and sporulation on petroselineate medium, expression in S. cerevisiae induced during late sporulation and in the presence of oleate

name: GCS1
description: ADP-ribosylation factor GTPase activating protein (ARF GAP), involved in ER-Golgi transport, shares functional similarity with Glo3p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SPS18

name: PP7435_Chr3-0196
description: Protein with low similarity to KRE1, cell wall glycoprotein involved in beta-glucan assembly

name: CDC33
description: mRNA cap binding protein and translation initiation factor eIF4E, the eIF4E-cap complex is responsible for mediating cap-dependent mRNA translation via interactions with translation initiation factor eIF4G (Tif4631p or Tif4632p), enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and mutants are defective for adhesion and pseudohyphal growth

name: SMF1
description: Divalent metal ion transporter with a broad specificity for di-valent and tri-valent metals, post-translationally regulated by levels of metal ions, member of the Nramp family of metal transport proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0199
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TRZ1
description: tRNA 3'-end processing endonuclease tRNase Z, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein and interacts genetically with Rex2 exonuclease, homolog of the human C.te prostate cancer susceptibility gene ELAC2

name: MCM1
description: Transcription factor involved in cell-type-specific transcription and pheromone response, plays a central role in the formation of both repressor and activator complexes, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: IOC4
description: Member of a complex (Isw1b) with Isw1p and Ioc2p, interacts directly with H3K36me3 nucleosomes through its PWWP domain to recruit the Isw1b complex to open reading frames in a Set2p-dependent manner, Isw1b exhibits nucleosome-stimulated ATPase activity and acts within coding regions to coordinate transcription elongation with termination and processing

name: ZRT3
description: Zinc transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar membrane protein which transports zinc from storage in the vacuole to the cytoplasm when needed, transcription is induced in S. cerevisiae under conditions of zinc deficiency

name: GAD1
description: Glutamate decarboxylase, converts glutamate into gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) during glutamate catabolism, involved in S. cerevisiae in response to oxidative stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0206
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: ISY1 domain-like)

name: TPK1
description: cAMP-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit, promotes in S. cerevisiae vegetative growth in response to nutrients via the Ras-cAMP signaling pathway, inhibited by regulatory subunit Bcy1p in the absence of cAMP, regulates Whi3p, partially redundant with Tpk2p and Tpk3p, phosphorylates pre-Tom40p, which impairs its import into mitochondria under non-respiratory conditions, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TPK3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0208
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TRP3
description: Indole-3-glycerol-phosphate synthase, forms bifunctional hetero-oligomeric anthranilate synthase:indole-3-glycerol phosphate synthase enzyme complex with Trp2p, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0210
description: Protein with low similarity to DNA replication factor A subunit Ssb3

name: KRE9
description: Glycoprotein involved in cell wall beta-glucan assembly, null mutation in S. cerevisiae leads to severe growth defects, aberrant multibudded morphology, and mating defects

name: MRPL38
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, appears as two protein spots (YmL34 and YmL38) on two-dimensional SDS gels, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MRP49
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, not essential in S. cerevisiae for mitochondrial translation

name: ERG11
description: Lanosterol 14-alpha-demethylase, catalyzes the C-14 demethylation of lanosterol to form 4,4''-dimethyl cholesta-8,14,24-triene-3-beta-ol in the ergosterol biosynthesis pathway, member of the cytochrome P450 family, associated and coordinately regulated with the P450 reductase Ncp1p, enriched among several compartments

name: RRP45
description: Exosome non-catalytic core component, involved in 3'-5' RNA processing and degradation in both the nucleus and the cytoplasm, has similarity to E. coli RNase PH and to human hRrp45p (PM/SCL-75, EXOSC9), protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: STM2
description: Putative stomatin family protein similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis STM2, with predicted mitochondrial targeting signal, enriched among several compartments,

name: HEM12
description: Uroporphyrinogen decarboxylase, catalyzes the fifth step in the heme biosynthetic pathway, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus and the hem12 mutant has phenotypes similar to patients with porphyria cutanea tarda

name: PFF1
description: Multi-spanning vacuolar membrane protease, glycosylated transmembrane protein bearing homology to the M28 family of metalloproteases, has a lumenal-facing protease domain, proposed role in vacuole physiology, enriched in vacuole and among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr3-0219
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TPI1
description: Triose phosphate isomerase, abundant glycolytic enzyme, mRNA half-life is regulated by iron availability, transcription is controlled by activators Reb1p, Gcr1p, and Rap1p through binding sites in the 5' non-coding region, inhibition of Tpi1p activity by PEP (phosphoenolpyruvate) stimulates redox metabolism in respiring cells, E104D mutation in human TPI causes a rare autosomal disease, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: DET1
description: Acid phosphatase involved in the non-vesicular transport of sterols in both directions between the ER and plasma membrane, in S. cerevisiae deletion confers sensitivity to nickel

name: KRS1
description: Lysyl-tRNA synthetase, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0223
description: Protein with low similarity to translation initiation factor eIF-3 subunits, enriched among several compartments

name: TRM7
description: 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase, methylates the 2'-O-ribose of tRNA-Phe, tRNA-Trp, and tRNA-Leu at positions C32 and N34 of the tRNA anticodon loop, crucial biological role likely modification of tRNA-Phe, interacts with Trm732p and Rtt10p in 2'-O-methylation of C32 and N34 substrate tRNAs, respectively

name: RSM10
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, has similarity to E. coli S10 ribosomal protein, essential in S. cerevisiae for viability, unlike most other mitoribosomal proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0226
description: Protein with similarity to YBR062C (Protein of unknown function that interacts with Msb2p, may play a role in activation of the filamentous growth pathway)

name: ALG14
description: Component of UDP-GlcNAc transferase required for the second step of dolichyl-linked oligosaccharide synthesis, anchors the catalytic subunit Alg13p to the ER membrane, similar to bacterial and human glycosyltransferases

name: NRG1
description: Transcriptional repressor, recruits the Cyc8p-Tup1p complex to promoters, mediates glucose repression and negatively regulates a variety of processes including filamentous growth and alkaline pH response, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NRG2

name: HEM13
description: Coproporphyrinogen III oxidase, an oxygen requiring enzyme that catalyzes the sixth step in the heme biosynthetic pathway, transcription is repressed in S. cerevisiae by oxygen and heme (via Rox1p and Hap1p)

name: RPC11
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C11, mediates pol III RNA cleavage activity and is important for termination of transcription, homologous to TFIIS

name: ORC2
description: Subunit of the origin recognition complex, which directs DNA replication by binding to replication origins and is also involved in transcriptional silencing, interacts with Spp1p and with trimethylated histone H3, phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: AKL1
description: Ser-Thr protein kinase, member (with Ark1p and Prk1p) of the Ark kinase family, involved in endocytosis and actin cytoskeleton organization, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: DES1
description: Delta 4-(E)-sphingolipid desaturase similar to Candida albicans DES1

name: EHD3
description: 3-hydroxyisobutyryl-CoA hydrolase, member of a family of enoyl-CoA hydratase/isomerases, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, phosphorylated, mutation affects fluid-phase endocytosis

name: RRP100
description: Putative membrane associated serine protease of the rhomboid family

name: FDH1
description: NAD(+)-dependent formate dehydrogenase, may protect cells from exogenous formate, previously known in Pichia pastoris as FLD1 but not related to S. cerevisiae FLD1, enriched among several compartments

name: ATG18
description: Phosphoinositide binding protein, required for vesicle formation in autophagy and the cytoplasm-to-vacuole targeting (Cvt) pathway, binds both phosphatidylinositol (3,5)-bisphosphate and phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate, WD-40 repeat protein, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from vacuole to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, has 4 mammalian homologs WIPI1, WIPI2, WIPI3 and WIPI4/WDR45, mutations in human WDR45 cause static encephalopathy of childhood with neurodegeneration in adulthood, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSA12

name: ROG3
description: Alpha-arrestin involved in ubiquitin-dependent endocytosis, contributes to desensitization of agonist-occupied alpha-factor receptor Ste2p by Rsp5p-independent internalization, PPXY motif-mediated binding of the ubiquitin ligase Rsp5p is not required for adaptation, mutation in S. cerevisiae suppresses the temperature sensitivity of an mck1 rim11 double mutant and the SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ROD1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0241
description: Putative transfer RNA for Methionine (tRNA-Met)

name: KRE5-1
description: Protein required for beta-1,6 glucan biosynthesis, enriched among several compartments, mutations in S. cerevisiae result in aberrant morphology and severe growth defects

name: MCX1
description: Non-proteolytic ATPase of the AAA family, stimulates incorporation of the pyridoxal phosphate cofactor into Hem1p (5-aminolevulinic acid synthase), known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the mitochondrial matrix, ortholog of vertebrate CLPX, which promotes erythropoiesis

name: PRP45
description: Protein required for pre-mRNA splicing, associates with the spliceosome and interacts with splicing factors Prp22p and Prp46p, orthologous to human transcriptional coactivator SKIP and can activate transcription of a reporter gene

name: ORC6
description: Subunit of the origin recognition complex, which directs DNA replication by binding to replication origins and is also involved in transcriptional silencing, phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: CAP100
description: Putative p100-like potential TFIIE-interacting transcriptional coactivator similar to Candida albicans CAP100, enriched in cytosol

name: MAC1
description: Copper-sensing transcription factor involved in regulation of genes required for high affinity copper transport

name: FMS1-1
description: Polyamine oxidase, converts spermine to spermidine, which is required in S. cerevisiae for the essential hypusination modification of translation factor eIF-5A, also involved in pantothenic acid biosynthesis

name: PP7435_Chr3-0250
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0251
description: Protein with similarity to YPR089W (Protein of unknown function, exhibits genetic interaction with ERG11 and protein-protein interaction with Hsp82p)

name: FAB1
description: 1-phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate 5-kinase, vacuolar membrane kinase that generates phosphatidylinositol (3,5)P2, which is involved in vacuolar sorting and homeostasis

name: PP7435_Chr3-0253
description: Protein with similarity to YOL019W (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery and vacuole, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DCV1)

name: TLG2
description: Syntaxin-like t-SNARE that forms a complex with Tlg1p and Vti1p and mediates fusion of endosome-derived vesicles with the late Golgi, binds Vps45p, which prevents Tlg2p degradation and also facilitates t-SNARE complex formation, homologous to mammalian SNARE protein syntaxin 16 (Sx16)

name: ARB1-1
description: ATPase of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) family involved in 40S and 60S ribosome biogenesis, has similarity to Gcn20p, shuttles from nucleus to cytoplasm, physically interacts with Tif6p, Lsg1p, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0256
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PRK14949)

name: VRG4
description: Golgi GDP-mannose transporter, co-localize in P. pastoris with Och1, enriched in Golgi and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HVG1

name: BNA6
description: Quinolinate phosphoribosyl transferase, required for the de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by Hst1p

name: ECO1
description: Acetyltransferase, required for establishment of sister chromatid cohesion, acetylates Mps3p to regulate nuclear organization, modifies in S. cerevisiae Smc3p at replication forks and Mcd1p in response to ds DNA breaks, has a C2H2-type zinc finger, mutations in human homolog ESCO2 cause Roberts syndrome, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: STU1
description: Component of the mitotic spindle that binds to interpolar microtubules via its association with beta-tubulin (Tub2p), required for interpolar microtubules to provide an outward force on the spindle poles

name: MRPL3
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, located in close proximity to the polypeptide exit channel of the ribosome, enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein, mutations in human homolog MRPL44 cause childhood cardiomyopathy, human MRPL44 deficiency results in inefficient assembly of the mitochondrial ribosome, and in tissue-specific respiratory chain deficiency, manifesting as either Complex I+Complex IV or Complex IV deficiency, depending on a cell type

name: CMS1
description: Putative subunit of the 90S preribosome processome complex, overexpression in S. cerevisiae rescues supressor mutant of mcm10, S. cerevisiae null mutant is viable, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0263
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Transcription initiation factor TFIID subunit A, Histone-fold)

name: MTO1
description: Protein, forms a heterodimer complex with Mss1p that performs the 5-carboxymethylaminomethyl modification of the wobble uridine base in mitochondrial tRNAs, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein required for respiration in paromomycin-resistant 15S rRNA mutants

name: PRX1-1
description: Mitochondrial peroxiredoxin with thioredoxin peroxidase activity, has a role in reduction of hydroperoxides, reactivation requires Trr2p and glutathione, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, n S. cerevisiae is induced during respiratory growth and oxidative stress, phosphorylated, protein abundance iincreases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SEF1
description: Putative transcription factor, has homolog in Kluyveromyces lactis

name: RAD51
description: Strand exchange protein, forms a helical filament with DNA that searches for homology, involved in the recombinational repair of double-strand breaks in DNA during vegetative growth and meiosis, homolog of Dmc1p and bacterial RecA protein

name: PP7435_Chr3-0268
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: 20S proteasome chaperone)

name: NOP53
description: Protein involved in biogenesis of the 60S subunit of the ribosome, interacts with rRNA processing factors Cbf5p and Nop2p, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, S. cerevisiae null mutant is viable but growth is severely impaired

name: PP7435_Chr3-0270
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0271
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Arrestin (or S-antigen), N-terminal domain)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0272
description: Protein with similarity to YOR238W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm)

name: THR1
description: Homoserine kinase, conserved protein required for threonine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by the GCN4-mediated general amino acid control pathway

name: VMA16
description: Subunit c'' of the vacuolar ATPase, which functions in acidification of the vacuole, one of three proteolipid subunits of the V0 domain, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein

name: RPN1
description: Non-ATPase base subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, may participate in the recognition of several ligands of the proteasome, contains a leucine-rich repeat (LRR) domain, a site for protein-protein interactions, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0276
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Transcription factor AFT)

name: DAP2
description: Dipeptidyl aminopeptidase, synthesized as a glycosylated precursor, known in S. cerevisiae as membrane vacuolar protein, similar to Ste13p

name: SLT2
description: Serine/threonine MAP kinase, involved in regulating maintenance of cell wall integrity, cell cycle progression, and nuclear mRNA retention in heat shock, required for mitophagy and pexophagy, affects recruitment of mitochondria to phagophore assembly site (PAS), plays a role in adaptive response of cells to cold, regulated by the PKC1-mediated signaling pathway, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog KDX1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0279
description: Putative transfer RNA for Alanine (tRNA-Ala)

name: SET5
description: Methyltransferase involved in methylation of histone H4 Lys5, -8, -12, S-adenosylmethionine-dependent, zinc-finger protein, contains one canonical and two unusual fingers in unusual arrangements, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, deletion in S. cerevisiae enhances replication of positive-strand RNA virus

name: SKN7
description: Nuclear response regulator and transcription factor, physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets, part of a branched two-component signaling system, required for optimal induction of heat-shock genes in response to oxidative stress, involved in osmoregulation, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog HMS2

name: SCH9
description: AGC family protein kinase, functional ortholog of mammalian S6 kinase, phosphorylated by Tor1p and required for TORC1-mediated regulation of ribosome biogenesis, translation initiation, and entry into G0 phase, involved in transactivation of osmostress-responsive genes, regulates G1 progression, cAPK activity and nitrogen activation of the FGM pathway, integrates nutrient signals and stress signals from sphingolipids to regulate lifespan, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: MNL1
description: Alpha-1,2-specific exomannosidase known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, in complex with Pdi1p, generates a Man7GlcNac2 oligosaccharide signal on glycoproteins destined for ubiquitin-proteasome degradation

name: PP7435_Chr3-0284
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SAH1
description: S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine hydrolase, catabolizes S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine which is formed after donation of the activated methyl group of S-adenosyl-L-methionine (AdoMet) to an acceptor, regulates cellular lipid homoeostasis by regulating phosphatidylcholine(PC)synthesis and triacylglycerol (TG) levels, enriched in cytosol

name: VPS73
description: Protein, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein whose mutation affects vacuolar protein sorting, putative transporter, member of the sugar porter family, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YBR241C

name: HPT1
description: Dimeric hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase, catalyzes the transfer of the phosphoribosyl portion of 5-phosphoribosyl-alpha-1-pyrophosphate to a purine base (either guanine or hypoxanthine) to form pyrophosphate and a purine nucleotide (either guanosine monophosphate or inosine monophosphate), enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0288
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: UTP5
description: Subunit of U3-containing Small Subunit (SSU) processome complex involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit

name: NCB2
description: Subunit of a heterodimeric NC2 transcription regulator complex with Bur6p, complex binds to TBP and can repress transcription by preventing preinitiation complex assembly or stimulate activated transcription, homologous to human NC2beta

name: SXM1
description: Nuclear transport factor (karyopherin) involved in protein transport between the cytoplasm and nucleoplasm, similar to Nmd5p, Cse1p, Lph2p, and the human cellular apoptosis susceptibility protein, CAS1

name: SMP3
description: Alpha 1,2-mannosyltransferase involved in glycosyl phosphatidyl inositol (GPI) biosynthesis, required for addition of the fourth, side branching mannose to the GPI core structure

name: RPT3
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in the degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, substrate of N-acetyltransferase B, enriched among several compartments

name: SHE9
description: Protein required for normal mitochondrial morphology, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, may be involved in fission of the inner membrane, forms a homo-oligomeric complex

name: PNO1
description: Nucleolar protein required for pre-18S rRNA processing, interacts with Dim1p, an 18S rRNA dimethyltransferase, and also with Nob1p, which is involved in proteasome biogenesis, contains a KH domain, enriched in cytosol, essential in S. cerevisiae for pre-18S rRNA processing

name: UGO1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as outer membrane component of the mitochondrial fusion machinery, binds directly to Fzo1p and Mgm1p and thus links these two GTPases during mitochondrial fusion, involved in fusion of both the outer and inner membranes, facilitates dimerization of Fzo1p during fusion, import into the outer membrane is mediated by Tom70p and Mim1p, has similarity to carrier proteins but is not likely to function as a transmembrane transporter

name: SDC1
description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex, which methylates lysine 4 of histone H3 and is required in chromatin silencing at telomeres, contains a Dpy-30 domain that mediates interaction with Bre2p, similar to C. elegans and human DPY-30

name: SVF1
description: Protein with a potential role in cell survival pathways, required for the diauxic growth shift, expression in mammalian cells increases survival under conditions inducing apoptosis, enriched in cytosol, S. cerevisiae mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance

name: TDA3
description: Putative oxidoreductase involved in late endosome to Golgi transport, physical and genetical interactions with Btn2p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, S. cerevisiae null mutant is viable, has extended S phase, and sensitive to expression of top1-T722A allele, similar to human FOXRED1

name: SAM2
description: S-adenosylmethionine synthetase, catalyzes transfer of the adenosyl group of ATP to the sulfur atom of methionine, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SAM1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0301
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YAK1-2
description: Serine-threonine protein kinase, component of a glucose-sensing system that inhibits growth in response to glucose availability, upon nutrient deprivation Yak1p phosphorylates Pop2p to regulate mRNA deadenylation, the co-repressor Crf1p to inhibit transcription of ribosomal genes, and the stress-responsive transcription factors Hsf1p and Msn2p, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose localization in negatively regulated by the Ras/PKA signaling pathway in the presence of glucose

name: PP7435_Chr3-0304
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: ABC_ATPase superfamily)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0305
description: Protein with low similarity to putative zinc-finger proteins

name: NUP159
description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), also part of the NPC cytoplasmic filaments, contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport, regulates ADP release from the ATP-dependent RNA helicase Dbp5p, forms a stable association with Nup82p, Gle2p and two other FG-nucleoporins (Nsp1p and Nup116p), enriched in cytosol

name: PSA1-1
description: GDP-mannose pyrophosphorylase (mannose-1-phosphate guanyltransferase), synthesizes GDP-mannose from GTP and mannose-1-phosphate in cell wall biosynthesis, required for normal cell wall structure, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0308
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: FBP1
description: Fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase, key regulatory enzyme in the gluconeogenesis pathway, required for glucose metabolism, undergoes either proteasome-mediated or autophagy-mediated degradation depending on growth conditions, glucose starvation results in redistribution to the periplasm, interacts with Vid30p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0310
description: Protein with similarity to YMR295C, enriched in microsome and Golgi in glucose-grown cells (Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery and bud, not an essential gene and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YGR273C)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0311
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: FGH1

name: YPS1-5
description: Aspartic protease, member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance, attached to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MKC7

name: SYP1

name: PYX500
description: Phenylacetate 2-hydroxylase (PYX500 is a a new name)

name: ATG30
description: Autophagy-related protein which controls in Pichia pastoris the selective autophagy of peroxisomes (pexophagy) through the assembly of a receptor protein complex (RPC)

name: RIM1
description: ssDNA-binding protein essential in S. cerevisiae for mitochondrial genome maintenance, involved in mitochondrial DNA replication, stimulates utilization by Mip1p DNA polymerase of RNA primers synthesized by Rpo41p, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: OPI3

name: STE6-1

name: SEC5
description: Essential 107kDa subunit in S. cerevisiae of the exocyst complex, the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion, involved in assembly of the exocyst complex, required with Sec3p for ER inheritance where it promotes anchoring of the cortical ER at the bud tip

name: PP7435_Chr3-0322
description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: FMO1-4
description: Flavin-containing monooxygenase, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cytoplasmic face of the ER membrane, catalyzes oxidation of biological thiols to maintain the ER redox buffer ratio for correct folding of disulfide-bonded proteins

name: MOG1
description: Conserved nuclear protein that interacts with GTP-Gsp1p, which is a Ran homolog of the Ras GTPase family, and stimulates nucleotide release, involved in nuclear protein import, nucleotide release is inhibited by Yrb1p, enriched in cytosol

name: UBA1

name: MAS1
description: Beta subunit of the mitochondrial processing protease (MPP), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial essential processing enzyme in S. cerevisiae that cleaves the N-terminal targeting sequences from mitochondrially imported proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0327
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Alpha/beta hydrolase family)

name: MGP12
description: Putative protein of unknown function, predicted to have thiol-disulfide oxidoreductase active site

name: YUH1
description: Ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase that cleaves ubiquitin-protein fusions to generate monomeric ubiquitin, hydrolyzes the peptide bond at the C-terminus of ubiquitin, also the major processing enzyme for the ubiquitin-like protein Rub1p

name: DPP1-3
description: Diacylglycerol pyrophosphate (DGPP) phosphatase, zinc-regulated vacuolar membrane-associated lipid phosphatase, enriched in microsome, Golgi and vacuole, dephosphorylates DGPP to phosphatidate (PA) and Pi, then PA to diacylglycerol, involved in lipid signaling and cell metabolism

name: PP7435_Chr3-0331
description: Protein with low similarity to ethanolamine kinase

name: MRE11
description: Nuclease subunit of the MRX complex with Rad50p and Xrs2p, complex functions in repair of DNA double-strand breaks and in telomere stability, Mre11p associates with Ser/Thr-rich ORFs in premeiotic phase, nuclease activity required for MRX function, widely conserved, known in S. cerevisiae to form nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: GCN2

name: BBC1
description: Protein possibly involved in assembly of actin patches, interacts with an actin assembly factor Las17p and with the SH3 domains of Type I myosins Myo3p and Myo5p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cortical actin patches

name: SSK1
description: Response regulator, part of a two-component signal transducer that mediates osmosensing via a phosphorelay mechanism, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, required for mitophagy, dephosphorylated form is degraded by the ubiquitin-proteasome system, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: AGP2-2
description: Regulator of polyamine and carnitine transport, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, has similarity to transporters but lacks transport activity, may act as a sensor that transduces environmental signals, has a positive or negative regulatory effect on transcription of many transporter genes

name: PP7435_Chr3-0337
description: Protein with similarity to YKL162C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the mitochondrion)

name: RAT1

name: TAZ1

name: PDR17

name: THI20

name: SST2

name: GCD11

name: TWF1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0347
description: Putative transfer RNA for Isoleucine (tRNA-Ile)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0348
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved, enriched in vacuole and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PpMIT1
description: Transcription factor which mediates methanol signaling and regulates AOX1 promoter in Pichia pastoris, previously published in Pichia pastoris as MIT1, but not related to S. cerevisiae MIT1

name: DAS2
description: Pichia pastoris dihydroxyacetone synthase variant 2, enriched among several compartments

name: RVS161-2
description: Amphiphysin-like lipid raft protein, interacts with Rvs167p and regulates polarization of the actin cytoskeleton, endocytosis, cell polarity, cell fusion and viability following starvation or osmotic stress

name: DAS1
description: Pichia pastoris dihydroxyacetone synthase variant 1, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0353
description: Protein with low similarity to CCM1 mitochondrial group I intron splicing factor of Candida albicans

name: LSC1
description: Alpha subunit of succinyl-CoA ligase, which is a mitochondrial enzyme of the TCA cycle that catalyzes the nucleotide-dependent conversion of succinyl-CoA to succinate, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0355
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0356
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF718)

name: TYW1
description: Iron-sulfer protein required for synthesis of Wybutosine modified tRNA, Wybutosine is a modified guanosine found at the 3'-position adjacent to the anticodon of phenylalanine tRNA which supports reading frame maintenance by stabilizing codon-anticodon interactions, in S. cerevisiae the induction by Yap5p in response to iron provides protection from high iron toxicity and its overexpression results in increased cellular iron

name: PP7435_Chr3-0358
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:Wyosine base formation)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0359
description: Putative transfer RNA for Aspartic acid (tRNA-Asp)

name: GPM1
description: Tetrameric phosphoglycerate mutase, mediates the conversion of 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate during glycolysis and the reverse reaction during gluconeogenesis, enriched in cytosol

name: NSP1
description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), also part of the NPC nuclear basket, contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport and maintenance of the NPC permeability barrier, found in stable complex with Nup82p, Gle2p and two other FG-nucleoporins (Nup159p and Nup116p), also found in stable complex with Nic96p and two other FG-nucleoproteins (Nup49p and Nup57p), forms foci at the nuclear periphery upon DNA replication stress, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0362
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: chaperone_ClpB)

name: COX6
description: Subunit VI of cytochrome c oxidase, which is the terminal member of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, enriched in mitochondria and, additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by oxygen levels

name: MYO1
description: Type II myosin heavy chain, required for wild-type cytokinesis and cell separation, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the actomyosin ring, binds to myosin light chains Mlc1p and Mlc2p through its IQ1 and IQ2 motifs respectively

name: MAS2
description: Alpha subunit of the mitochondrial processing protease (MPP), enriched in mitochondria, essential processing enzyme in S. cerevisiae that cleaves the N-terminal targeting sequences from mitochondrially imported proteins

name: PXA1
description: Subunit of a heterodimeric peroxisomal ATP-binding cassette transporter complex (Pxa1p-Pxa2p), known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, required for import of long-chain fatty acids into peroxisomes, similarity to human adrenoleukodystrophy transporter ABCD1 and ABCD2 and ALD-related proteins, mutations in ABCD1 cause X-linked adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD), a peroxisomal disorder

name: PP7435_Chr3-0367
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ATP20
description: Subunit g of the mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, reversibly phosphorylated on two residues, unphosphorylated form is required for dimerization of the ATP synthase complex, which in turn determines oligomerization of the complex and the shape of inner membrane cristae, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: ROK1
description: RNA-dependent ATPase, involved in pre-rRNA processing at sites A0, A1, and A2, and in control of cell cycle progression, contains two upstream open reading frames (uORFs) in 5' untranslated region which regulate translation, enriched among several compartments

name: MRPL15
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: SPA2
description: Component of the polarisome, functions in actin cytoskeletal organization during polarized growth, acts as a scaffold for Mkk1p and Mpk1p cell wall integrity signaling components, potential Cdc28p substrate, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SPH1

name: VPS70-1
description: Protein of unknown function involved in vacuolar protein sorting, enriched among several compartments

name: RLF2
description: Largest subunit (p90) of the Chromatin Assembly Complex (CAF-1), chromatin assembly by CAF-1 is important for multiple processes including silencing at telomeres, mating type loci, and rDNA, maintenance of kinetochore structure, deactivation of the DNA damage checkpoint after DNA repair, and chromatin dynamics during transcription

name: PP7435_Chr3-0374
description: Protein with low similarity to SLX4, endonuclease involved in processing DANN

name: PP7435_Chr3-0375
description: Putative transfer RNA for Phenylalanine (tRNA-Phe)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0376
description: Protein with low similarity to YNL193W, putative protein of unknown function

name: NUCM
description: NUCM (49 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: MIX17
description: Protein, required for normal oxygen consumption, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial intermembrane space protein, contains twin cysteine-x9-cysteine motifs, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0382
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0383
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Tricorn protease domain 2)

name: MRX10
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, localizesin S. cerevisiae to the inner membrane with the C terminus facing the intermembrane space, ortholog of human RMND1, mutation in which is implicated in infantile encephaloneuromyopathy and defective mitochondrial translation

name: APE1
description: Vacuolar aminopeptidase yscI, zinc metalloproteinase that belongs to the peptidase family M18, often used as a marker protein in studies of autophagy and cytosol to vacuole targeting (CVT) pathway, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to cytoplasmic foci increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0386
description: Hypothetical protein conserved, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr3-0387
description: Putative transfer RNA for Phenylalanine (tRNA-Phe)

name: MDR1
description: GTPase-activating protein for Ypt/Rab transport GTPases Ypt6p, Ypt31p and Sec4p, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, involved in recycling of internalized proteins and regulation of Golgi secretory function

name: PP7435_Chr3-0389

description: Hypothetical protein conserved

description: Putative transfer RNA for Asparagine (tRNA-Asn)

description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1776)

name: MRP51

name: MRM1

name: HIS3

name: MNN2-3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0405
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamine acid (tRNA-Gln)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0406
description: Putative transfer RNA for Lysine (tRNA-Lys)

name: NOP19
description: Ribosome biogenesis factor, nucleolar protein associated with pre-rRNA components of the 90S preribosome, required for cleavage of pre-rRNA at A0, A1 and A2 sites, interacts with RNA helicase Dhr2p and RNA helicase-like protein Utp25p, required for incorporation of Utp25p into preribosomes

name: PP7435_Chr3-0408
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Metalloproteases (zincins), catalytic domain)

name: GLO2

name: UTP13
description: Protein component of the small subunit (SSU) processome containing the U3 snoRNA that is involved in processing of pre-18S rRNA, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: MCP2-2
description: Protein of unknown function involved in lipid homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, integral membrane protein that localizes to the mitochondrial inner membrane, involved in mitochondrial morphology, in S. cerevisiae YLR253W is non-essential gene which interacts genetically with MDM10, and other members of the ERMES complex, transcription is periodic during the metabolic cycle, homologous to human aarF domain containing kinase, ADCK1

name: GSY2
description: Glycogen synthase, expression induced by glucose limitation, nitrogen starvation, heat shock, and stationary phase, activity regulated by cAMP-dependent, Snf1p and Pho85p kinases as well as by the Gac1p-Glc7p phosphatase, enriched in cytosol and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from cytoplasm to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GSY1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0413
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: UBC8
description: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme that negatively regulates gluconeogenesis by mediating the glucose-induced ubiquitination of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase (FBPase), known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic enzyme that catalyzes the ubiquitination of histones in vitro

name: PP7435_Chr3-0415
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Metal binding domain of Ada, DNA repair protein)

name: AIM14
description: NADPH oxidase known in S. cerevisiae as perinuclear ER protein, produces superoxide from NADPH, overexpression in S. cerevisiae causes MCA1 dependent apoptosis, likely involved in superoxide-mediated regulation of the actin cytoskeleton, member of a conserved superfamily of NADPH oxidases (NOX enzymes), has similarity to iron/copper reductases (FRE1-8), particularly Fre8p

name: BLM10

name: NCS6

name: NIP1
description: eIF3c subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3), involved in the assembly of preinitiation complex and start codon selection, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0420
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0421
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MET4
description: Leucine-zipper transcriptional activator, responsible for regulation of sulfur amino acid pathway, requires different combinations of auxiliary factors Cbf1p, Met28p, Met31p and Met32p, feedforward loop exists in the regulation of genes controlled by Met4p and Met32p, can be ubiquitinated by ubiquitin ligase SCF-Met30p, is either degraded or maintained in an inactive state, regulates degradation of its own DNA-binding cofactors by targeting them to SCF-Met30p

name: ADE5,7
description: Enzyme of the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway, contains aminoimidazole ribotide synthetase and glycinamide ribotide synthetase activities, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0424
description: Protein with similarity to YFR045W (Putative mitochondrial transport protein, S. cerevisiae null mutant is viable, exhibits decreased levels of chitin and normal resistance to calcofluor white)

name: SMI1-1
description: Protein involved in the regulation of cell wall synthesis, proposed to be involved in coordinating cell cycle progression with cell wall integrity

name: CSE1
description: Protein that mediates the nuclear export of importin alpha (Srp1p), enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the nuclear envelope, homolog of metazoan CAS protein, required for accurate chromosome segregation

name: DPB2
description: Second largest subunit of DNA polymerase II (DNA polymerase epsilon), required for maintenance of fidelity of chromosomal replication, expression peaks in S. cerevisiae at the G1/S phase boundary, Cdc28p substrate

name: RPS5

name: YAT2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0433

name: LEU3

name: LTE1

name: NOC4

name: TPC1

name: PRP31

name: VAS1

name: DRN1

name: TIF100
description: Putative eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit 7 (eIF-3), enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0447
description: Protein with similarity to YPL162C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the membrane of vacuole with cell cycle-correlated morphology)

name: GRE3

name: NIT3
description: Nit protein, one of two proteins in S. cerevisiae with similarity to the Nit domain of NitFhit from fly and worm and to the mouse and human Nit protein which interacts with the Fhit tumor suppressor, nitrilase superfamily member

name: CLP1

name: OST1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0452
description: Protein with low similarity to SFI1, centrin (Cdc31p)-binding protein required for SPB duplication

name: MEU1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0454
description: Protein with low similarity to nuclear pores, detected at mRNA level, enriched in microsome

name: MLH3
description: Protein involved in DNA mismatch repair and crossing-over during meiotic recombination, forms a complex with Mlh1p, mammalian homolog is implicated mammalian microsatellite instability

name: DRS1

name: TFA2

name: LMO1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0459
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glycine (tRNA-Gly)

name: IPT1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0461
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: LCB2

name: SSB2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0465
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Eukaryotic type KH-domain)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0467
description: Putative transfer RNA for Isoleucine (tRNA-Ile)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0468
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NEW1

description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PXA domain)

name: RPS31

name: PP7435_Chr3-0477
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Afadin- and alpha -actinin-Binding)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0479
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0480
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Histidine phosphatase superfamily (branch 1), Phosphoglycerate mutase-like)

name: GPN3

name: POM152

name: SPT7

name: MTW1

name: RPA43

name: MRS2
description: Mg(2+) channel, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein required for maintenance of intramitochondrial Mg(2+) concentrations at the correct level to support splicing of group II introns

name: PP7435_Chr3-0493
description: Protein with low similarity to GIP4, cytoplasmic protein that regulates protein phosphatase 1 Glc7p

name: VMA4

name: MIP1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0496
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Coiled-coil domain-containing protein 55, DUF2040)

name: SCD5
description: Protein required for normal actin organization and endocytosis, targeting subunit for protein phosphatase type 1, undergoes Crm1p-dependent nuclear-cytoplasmic shuttling, multicopy suppressor of clathrin deficiency

name: BOL3

name: PRT1
