name: PP7435_Chr3-0500
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Micro-tubular organiser MBO1 C-term Mto1-binding region)

name: PRE10
description: Alpha 7 subunit of the 20S proteasome, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: GEM1
description: GTPase, known in S. cerevisiae as outer mitochondrial membrane protein, subunit of the ERMES complex, potential regulatory subunit of the ERMES complex that links the ER to mitochondria and may promote inter-organellar calcium and phospholipid exchange as well as coordinating mitochondrial DNA replication and growth, cells lacking Gem1p contain collapsed, globular, or grape-like mitochondria, ortholog of metazoan Miro GTPases

name: PP7435_Chr3-0503
description: Protein with low similarity to TIP1 cell wall protein (O. angusta)

name: HMS1-2
description: Basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) protein with similarity to myc-family transcription factors, overexpression in S. cerevisiae confers hyperfilamentous growth and suppresses the pseudohyphal filamentation defect of a diploid mep1 mep2 homozygous null mutant

name: GPM3
description: Homolog of Gpm1p phosphoglycerate mutase, converts 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate in glycolysis, may be non-functional, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GPM2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0507
description: Protein with low similarity to bacterial NAD-dependent dehydratase, enriched among several compartments

name: HSP31
description: Methylglyoxalase that converts methylglyoxal to D-lactate, involved in oxidative stress resistance, diauxic shift, and stationary phase survival, has similarity to E. coli Hsp31 and Candida albicans Glx3p, member of the DJ-1/ThiJ/PfpI superfamily, which includes human DJ-1 involved in Parkinson's disease and cancer, exists as a dimer and contains a putative metal-binding site, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0509
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SEC28
description: Epsilon-COP subunit of the coatomer, regulates retrograde Golgi-to-ER protein traffic, stabilizes Cop1p, the alpha-COP and the coatomer complex, in S. cerevisiae is non-essential for cell growth, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RPN4
description: Transcription factor that stimulates expression of proteasome genes, Rpn4p levels are in turn regulated by the 26S proteasome in a negative feedback control mechanism, RPN4 is transcriptionally regulated by various stress responses, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: ATG3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0513
description: Protein with low similarity to molybdenum cofactor biosynthesis protein 1 of Ogataea parapolymorpha

name: NOC3
description: Subunit of a nuclear complex with Noc2p and pre-replicative complexes, the Noc2p-Noc3p complex binds to 66S ribosomal precursors to mediate their maturation and intranuclear transport, binds to chromatin at active replication origins, and is required for pre-RC formation and maintenance during DNA replication licensing, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: UTP23
description: Component of the small subunit processome, involved in 40S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, interacts with snR30 and is required for dissociation of snR30 from large pre-ribosomal particles, has homology to PINc domain protein Fcf1p, although the PINc domain of Utp23p is not required for function, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, essential protein in S. cerevisiae

name: OCA4
description: Protein required for replication of Brome mosaic virus in S. cerevisiae, known as cytoplasmic protein and a model system for studying replication of positive-strand RNA viruses in their natural hosts

name: PP7435_Chr3-0518
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:PAN_3 superfamily)

name: RCF3
description: Putative protein of unknown function, may interact with respiratory chain complexes III (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase) or IV (cytochrome c oxidase), identified by sequence comparison with hemiascomycetous yeast species

name: STS1

name: QRI1

name: ASN2
description: Asparagine synthetase, catalyzes the synthesis of L-asparagine from L-aspartate in the asparagine biosynthetic pathway, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ASN1

name: CUB1

name: DLD2

name: SLG1

name: DHR2
description: Predominantly nucleolar DEAH-box ATP-dependent RNA helicase, required for 18S rRNA synthesis

name: SHE3
description: Putative SWI5-dependent HO expression protein 3, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis SHE3

name: PP7435_Chr3-0528
description: Putative transfer RNA for Alanine (tRNA-Ala)

name: TRX2
description: Thioredoxin isoenzyme, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, part of thioredoxin system which protects cells against oxidative and reductive stress, forms LMA1 complex with Pbi2p, acts as a cofactor for Tsa1p, required for ER-Golgi transport and vacuole inheritance, with Trx1p, facilitates mitochondrial import of small Tims Tim9p, Tim10p, Tim13p by maintaining them in reduced form, abundance increases under DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog TRX1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0530
description: Protein with low similarity to putative C6 transcription factors

name: PP7435_Chr3-0531
description: Protein with low similarity to hydantoinase proteins

name: MRX12
description: Protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, detected in S. cerevisiae in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: MET14
description: Adenylylsulfate kinase, required for sulfate assimilation and involved in methionine metabolism, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: OPY1
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the overproduction blocks cell cycle arrest in the presence of mating pheromone and the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected iin highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: DIB1
description: 17-kDa component of the U4/U6aU5 tri-snRNP, plays in S. cerevisiae an essential role in pre-mRNA splicing, orthologue of hDIM1, the human U5-specific 15-kDa protein

name: CBP6
description: Mitochondrial protein required for translation of the COB mRNA, forms a complex with Cbp3p that binds to mt ribosomes near the polypeptide tunnel exit and promotes efficient translation of the COB mRNA, Cbp3p-Cbp6p complex also interacts with newly synthesized cytochrome b (Cobp) and Cbp4p to promote assembly of Cobp into the cytochrome bc1 complex, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr3-0537
description: Protein with low similarity to MSL1, U2B component of U2 snRNP involved in splicing

name: SIT1-1
description: Ferrioxamine B transporter, member of the ARN family of transporters that specifically recognize siderophore-iron chelates, enriched among several compartments, transcription is induced in S. cerevisiae during iron deprivation and diauxic shift, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: PP7435_Chr3-0539
description: Protein with similarity to YPR084W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: BUD5
description: GTP/GDP exchange factor for Rsr1p (Bud1p) required for both axial and bipolar budding patterns, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit random budding in all cell types

name: ACO2
description: Putative mitochondrial aconitase isozyme, similarity to Aco1p, an aconitase required for the TCA cycle, enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, and additionally enriched in cytosol and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae expression induced during growth on glucose, by amino acid starvation via Gcn4p, and repressed on ethanol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0542
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NAM7
description: ATP-dependent RNA helicase of the SFI superfamily, involved in nonsense mediated mRNA decay, required for efficient translation termination at nonsense codons and targeting of NMD substrates to P-bodies, involved in telomere maintenance, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: BUD2
description: GTPase activating factor for Rsr1p/Bud1p, plays a role in spindle position checkpoint distinct from its role in bud site selection, required for both axial and bipolar budding patterns, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit random budding in all cell types

name: SEC14
description: Phosphatidylinositol/phosphatidylcholine transfer protein, involved in regulating PtdIns, PtdCho, and ceramide metabolism, products of which regulate intracellular transport and UPR, has a role in localization of lipid raft proteins, functionally homologous to mammalian PITPs, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YKL091C

name: CTF18
description: Subunit of a complex with Ctf8p that shares some subunits with Replication Factor C and is required for sister chromatid cohesion, may have overlapping functions with Rad24p in the DNA damage replication checkpoint

name: VTH1
description: Putative membrane glycoprotein with strong similarity to Vth2p and Pep1p/Vps10p, may be involved in vacuolar protein sorting, enriched among several compartments

name: VPS75
description: NAP family histone chaperone, binds to histones and Rtt109p, stimulating histone acetyltransferase activity, possesses nucleosome assembly activity in vitro, proposed role in vacuolar protein sorting and in double-strand break repair, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and gets relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RPA49
description: RNA polymerase I subunit A49, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0550
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: THI7
description: Transporter responsible for the upTake of thiamine, member of the major facilitator superfamily of transporters, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein

name: THI4
description: Thiazole synthase, abundant protein involved in the formation of the thiazole moiety of thiamine during thiamine biosynthesis, acts more as a co-substrate rather than an enzyme by providing the sulphur source for thiazole formation, undergoes a single turnover only, required in S. cerevisiae for mitochondrial genome stability in response to DNA damaging agents

name: FUM1
description: Fumarase, converts fumaric acid to L-malic acid in the TCA cycle, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae cytosolic and mitochondrial distribution is determined by the N-terminal targeting sequence, protein conformation, and status of glyoxylate shunt, phosphorylated in mitochondria

name: PLD1
description: Phospholipase D, catalyzes the hydrolysis of phosphatidylcholine, producing choline and phosphatidic acid, involved in Sec14p-independent secretion, required for meiosis and spore formation, differently regulated in secretion and meiosis, participates in transcription initiation and/or early elongation of specific genes, interacts with foot domain of RNA polymerase II, enriched in microsome, deletion in S. cerevisiae results in abnormal CTD-Ser5 phosphorylation of RNA polymerase II at specific promoter regions

name: PP7435_Chr3-0555
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ABD1
description: Methyltransferase, catalyzes the transfer of a methyl group from S-adenosylmethionine to the GpppN terminus of capped mRNA, the nuclear protein relocalizes in S. cerevisiae to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PRP5
description: RNA helicase in the DEAD-box family, necessary for prespliceosome formation, bridges U1 and U2 snRNPs and enables stable U2 snRNP association with intron RNA

name: VHC1
description: Cation-chloride cotransporter (CCC), known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar membrane protein which likely mediates K+ and Cl- cotransport into the vacuole, has a role in potassium homeostasis and salt tolerance, similar to mammalian electroneutral Na(+)-(K+)-C1- cotransporter family

name: PRP9
description: Subunit of the SF3a splicing factor complex, required for spliceosome assembly, acts after the formation of the U1 snRNP-pre-mRNA complex

name: PTA1
description: Subunit of holo-CPF, a multiprotein complex and functional homolog of mammalian CPSF, required for the cleavage and polyadenylation of mRNA and snoRNA 3' ends, involved in pre-tRNA processing, binds to the phosphorylated CTD of RNAPII

name: TFS1
description: Inhibitor of carboxypeptidase Y (Prc1p), and Ras GAP (Ira2p), phosphatidylethanolamine-binding protein (PEBP) family member and ortholog of hPEBP1/RKIP, a natural metastasis suppressor, targets to vacuolar membranes during stationary phase, acetylated by NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SNX3
description: Sorting nexin required to maintain late-Golgi resident enzymes in their proper location by recycling molecules from the prevacuolar compartment, contains a PX domain and sequence similarity to human Snx3p, enriched among several compartments

name: HAP5
description: Subunit of the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2/3/4/5 CCAAT-binding complex, a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression, required for assembly and DNA binding activity of the complex

name: OPY2
description: Integral membrane protein that acts as a membrane anchor for Ste50p, involved in the signaling branch of the high-osmolarity glycerol (HOG) pathway and as a regulator of the filamentous growth pathway, overproduction in S. cerevisiae blocks cell cycle arrest in the presence of mating pheromone, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein that relocalizes from vacuole to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

name: RAM1
description: Beta subunit of the CAAX farnesyltransferase (FTase) that prenylates the a-factor mating pheromone and Ras proteins, required for the membrane localization of Ras proteins and a-factor, homolog of the mammalian FTase beta subunit

name: RIM13
description: Calpain-like cysteine protease, involved in proteolytic activation of Rim101p in response to alkaline pH, localizes in S. cerevisiae to punctate structures in alkaline conditions and in vps4 mutant, has similarity to A. nidulans palB

name: TRP5-2
description: Tryptophan synthase, catalyzes the last step of tryptophan biosynthesis, regulated by the general control system of amino acid biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0568
description: Protein with similarity to YBR139W, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells (Putative serine type carboxypeptidase with a role in phytochelatin synthesis, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole and expression induced by nitrogen limitation in a GLN3, GAT1-independent manner)

name: MDM20
description: Non-catalytic subunit of the NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase, which catalyzes N-acetylation of proteins with specific N-terminal sequences, involved in mitochondrial inheritance and actin assembly

name: TRM5
description: tRNA(m(1)G37)methyltransferase, methylates a tRNA base adjacent to the anticodon that has a role in prevention of frameshifting, highly conserved across Archaea, Bacteria, and Eukarya

name: HTD2
description: 3-hydroxyacyl-thioester dehydratase involved in fatty acid biosynthesis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, required for respiratory growth and for normal mitochondrial morphology

name: IPK1

name: CHL1
description: Probable DNA helicase, involved in sister-chromatid cohesion and genome integrity and interstrand cross-link repair, interacts with ECO1 and CTF18, S. cerevisiae mutants are defective in silencing, rDNA recombination, aging and the heat shock response, FANCJ-like helicase family member, mutations in the human homolog, DDX11/ChLR1, cause Warsaw breakage syndrome

name: NIC96

name: CRP1

name: WSC4
description: Protein involved in the translocation of soluble secretory proteins and insertion of membrane proteins into the ER membrane, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein

name: RIM101

name: TRL1
description: tRNA ligase, required for tRNA splicing and for both splicing and translation of HAC1 mRNA in the UPR, has phosphodiesterase, polynucleotide kinase, and ligase activities, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the inner nuclear envelope and partially present to polysomes

name: VAC7

name: HOC1

name: NUIM

name: HOS4

name: PP7435_Chr3-0586
description: Protein with similarity to YNL050C (Putative protein of unknown function, YNL050c is not an essential gene in S. cerevisiae)

name: COX5B

name: SEC24

name: VBA5

name: PP7435_Chr3-0591
description: Protein with similarity to YNL010W, enriched in cytosol (Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to phosphoserine phosphatases, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and homozygous diploid mutant shows an increase in glycogen accumulation)

name: SRP1
description: Karyopherin alpha homolog, forms a dimer with karyopherin beta Kap95p to mediate import of nuclear proteins, binds the nuclear localization signal of the substrate during import, may also play a role in regulation of protein degradation, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0593
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0594
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0595
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: GPI-Mannosyltransferase II co-activator)

name: CET1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0598
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: BPH1
description: Protein homologous to Chediak-Higashi syndrome and Beige proteins, both of which are implicated in disease syndromes in human and mouse, respectively, due to defective lysosomal trafficking, S. cerevisiae mutant phenotype and genetic interactions suggest a role in protein sorting

name: UBP12
description: Ubiquitin-specific protease, cleaves ubiquitin from ubiquitinated proteins, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear and cytosolic protein

name: RBK1
description: Putative ribokinase

name: RRP43

name: ELO2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0604
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SNT1
description: Subunit of the Set3C deacetylase complex that interacts directly with the Set3C subunit, Sif2p, putative DNA-binding protein, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia and mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance, in

name: CDC6

name: RPS21A

name: TIF2

name: MET30

name: TRM2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0613
description: Putative transfer RNA for Proline (tRNA-Pro)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0614
description: Protein with low similarity to molybdenum cofactor sulfurases

name: ASP1
description: L-asparaginase, involved in asparagine catabolism, catalyzes hydrolysis of L-asparagine to aspartic acid and ammonia, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein, has an important role in therapy of acute lymphoblastic leukemia, synthesized constitutively

name: TOS8

name: SCP1

name: RPS12
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S12, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol

name: MRS6
description: Rab escort protein, forms a complex with the Ras-like small GTPase Ypt1p that is required for the prenylation of Ypt1p by protein geranylgeranyltransferase type II (Bet2p-Bet4p), sequence similarity to mammalian choroideraemia gene, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol

name: NUKM
description: NUKM (PSST) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr3-0623
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TOM20
description: Component of the TOM (translocase of outer membrane) complex responsible for recognition and initial import steps for all mitochondrially directed proteins, acts as a receptor for incoming precursor proteins, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr3-0625
description: Protein with similarity to YPR097W (Protein that contains a Phox homology (PX) domain and binds phosphoinositides, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: RRP4
description: Exosome non-catalytic core component, involved in 3'-5' RNA processing and degradation in both the nucleus and the cytoplasm, predicted to contain RNA binding domains, has similarity to human hRrp4p (EXOSC2)

name: GUT2

name: PCD1

name: USP1
description: Putative universal stress protein similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis USP1

name: ATP1

name: CCL1
description: Cyclin associated with protein kinase Kin28p, which is the TFIIH-associated carboxy-terminal domain (CTD) kinase involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase II promoters

name: RPC53

name: SAS10

name: CDC123

name: CCT4
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex, related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: CRD1
description: Cardiolipin synthase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, produces cardiolipin, which is a phospholipid of the mitochondrial inner membrane that is required for normal mitochondrial membrane potential and function, also required for normal vacuolar ion homeostasis

name: BPL1

name: RPO21

name: CPR6

name: SER1

name: MEC3

name: TUF1

name: ECM38

name: MSB1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0646
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:INO80 ATPase complex subunit Ies4)

name: GLO3
description: ADP-ribosylation factor GTPase activating protein (ARF GAP), involved in ER-Golgi transport, shares functional similarity with Gcs1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0649
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ROP100
description: Methanol- and biotin-starvation-inducible zinc finger protein of Pichia pastoris, repressor of phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PEPCK and ROP, correspond to S. cerevisiae RSF2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0651
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0652
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0654
description: Protein with similarity to YCR023C, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells (Vacuolar membrane protein of unknown function, member of the multidrug resistance family, in S. cerevisiae YCR023C is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0655
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0656
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CKA1
description: Alpha catalytic subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2), a Ser/Thr protein kinase with roles in cell growth and proliferation, CK2, comprised of CKA1, CKA2, CKB1 and CKB2, has many substrates including transcription factors and all RNA polymerases, regulates Fkh1p-mediated donor preference during mating-type switching

name: CAP2
description: Beta subunit of the capping protein heterodimer (Cap1p and Cap2p), capping protein (CP) binds to the barbed ends of actin filaments preventing further polymerization, known in S. cerevisiae as protein predominantly localyzed to cortical actin patches, the protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from bud neck to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

name: ERG28
description: Protein that may facilitate protein-protein interactions between the Erg26p dehydrogenase and the Erg27p 3-ketoreductase and/or tether these enzymes to the ER, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein that also interacts with Erg6p

name: BCY1

name: IRC5
description: Putative ATPase containing the DEAD/H helicase-related sequence motif, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays increased levels of spontaneous Rad52p foci

name: PP7435_Chr3-0663
description: Protein with low similarity to MDG1, protein involved in G-protein mediated pheromone signaling pathway

name: PP7435_Chr3-0664
description: Protein with low similarity to EMC5, member of conserved ER transmembrane complex

name: IRR1
description: Subunit of the cohesin complex, which is required for sister chromatid cohesion during mitosis and meiosis and interacts with centromeres and chromosome arms, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, essential for viability

name: SSM4
description: Membrane-embedded ubiquitin-protein ligase, known in S. cerevisiae as ER and inner nuclear membrane localized RING-CH domain E3 ligase involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), targets misfolded cytosolic/nucleoplasmic domains of soluble and membrane embedded proteins (ERAD-C) and a transmembrane domain containing substrate (ERAD-M), Sbh2p, C-terminal element (CTE), conserved in human ortholog MARCH10/TEB4, determines substrate selectivity

name: TIM44
description: Component of the Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex), tethers the import motor and regulatory factors (PAM complex) to the translocation channel (Tim23p-Tim17p core complex), enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae is an essential protein

name: PP7435_Chr3-0668
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: TPR-like), enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SCS7
description: Sphingolipid alpha-hydroxylase, functions in the alpha-hydroxylation of sphingolipid-associated very long chain fatty acids, has both cytochrome b5-like and hydroxylase/desaturase domains, in S. cerevisiae is not essential for growth

name: URA5
description: Major orotate phosphoribosyltransferase (OPRTase) isozyme, catalyzes the fifth enzymatic step in de novo biosynthesis of pyrimidines, converting orotate into orotidine-5'-phosphate, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog URA10

name: SEC65
description: Subunit of the signal recognition particle (SRP), involved in protein targeting to the ER, interacts with Srp54p, homolog of mammalian SRP19

name: PP7435_Chr3-0672
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: RNA polymerase I specific transcription initiation)

name: MDM1
description: PtdIns-3-P binding protein that tethers the ER to vacuoles at NVJs, anchored in the ER membrane at nucleus-vacuole junctions and binds phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PtdIns-3-P) in the vacuolar membrane via its Phox homology (PX) domain, expressed predominantly in late G1 to early S phase of the cell cycle, mutation in S. cerevisiae affects nuclear and mitochondrial transmission to daughter buds, similar to 4 human genes, one of which (SNX14) is associated with neurological disease

name: GDI1
description: GDP dissociation inhibitor, regulates vesicle traffic in secretory pathways by regulating the dissociation of GDP from the Sec4/Ypt/rab family of GTP binding proteins, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr3-0675
description: Protein with low similarity to MYB DNA-binding domain-containing proteins

name: MSO1
description: Lipid-interacting protein in SNARE complex assembly machinery, acts at late step in secretion, interacts with membranes through two distinct binding sites, shows genetic and physical interactions with Sec1p, required for prospore membrane formation during sporulation, N-terminus closely associates with plasma membrane, C-terminus colocalizes with Sec4p on intracellular membranes, known in S. cerevisiae as bud neck protein that relocalizes to nucleus upon DNA replication stress

name: LYS9
description: Saccharopine dehydrogenase (NADP+, L-glutamate-forming), catalyzes the formation of saccharopine from alpha-aminoadipate 6-semialdehyde, the seventh step in lysine biosynthesis pathway, exhibits genetic and physical interactions with TRM112, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0678
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF4246), enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0679
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: RTT106
description: Histone chaperone, involved in regulation of chromatin structure in both transcribed and silenced chromosomal regions, affects transcriptional elongation, has a role in regulation of Ty1 transposition

name: PP7435_Chr3-0681
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: PLN02806, complex I subunit)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0682
description: Protein with low similarity to nucleoporins

name: CMR2
description: Putative protein of unknown function, enriched in microsome, in S. cerevisiae deletion causes sensitivity to unfolded protein response-inducing agents

name: PP7435_Chr3-0684
description: Protein with similarity to YNL115C, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to mitochondria and YNL115C is not an essential gene)

name: DMA2
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase (E3), controls septin dynamics and spindle position checkpoint (SPOC) with ligase Dma1p by regulating recruitment of Elm1p to bud neck, regulates levels of eIF2 subunit Gcd11p, as well as abundance, localization, and ubiquitination of Cdk inhibitory kinase Swe1p, ortholog of human RNF8, similar to human Chfr, contains FHA and RING finger domains, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DMA1

name: SWS2
description: Putative ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, has similarity to E. coli S13 ribosomal protein, participates in controlling sporulation efficiency

name: VBA2
description: Permease of basic amino acids, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar membrane protein

name: PP7435_Chr3-0688
description: Protein with similarity to YEL043W, enriched in microsome (Predicted cytoskeleton protein involved in intracellular signalling based on quantitative analysis of protein-protein interaction maps, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification studies, contains fibronectin type III domain fold)

name: ZPS1
description: Putative GPI-anchored protein, transcription is induced in S. cerevisiae under low-zinc conditions, as mediated by the Zap1p transcription factor, and at alkaline pH

name: ZRT1
description: High-affinity zinc transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein responsible for the majority of zinc upTake, whose gene transcription is induced under low-zinc conditions by the Zap1p transcription factor

name: ANP1
description: Subunit of the alpha-1,6 mannosyltransferase complex, type II membrane protein, has a role in retention of glycosyltransferases in the Golgi, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, involved in osmotic sensitivity and resistance to aminonitrophenyl propanediol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0692
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PTZ00108)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0693
description: Protein with low similarity to 26S proteasome regulatory subunits

name: PAH1
description: Mg2+-dependent phosphatidate (PA) phosphatase, dephosphorylates PA to yield diacylglycerol, responsible for de novo lipid synthesis and formation of lipid droplets, phosphorylation by Pho80p-Pho85p decreases catalytic activity and alters Pah1p localization and abundance in S. cerevisiae, phosphorylation by protein kinase A decreases catalytic efficiency, dephosphorylation by Nem1p-Spo7p anchors Pah1p to the membrane increasing substrate catalysis, homologous to mammalian lipins 1 and 2

name: HNM1
description: Transporter for choline, ethanolamine, and carnitine, involved in the uptake of nitrogen mustard and the uptake of glycine betaine during hypersaline stress, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, co-regulated with phospholipid biosynthetic genes and negatively regulated by choline and myo-inositol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0696
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: TMPIT-like protein transmembrane and GDP/GTP exchange factor Sec2p)

name: SRP21
description: Subunit of the signal recognition particle (SRP), SRP functions in protein targeting to the ER membrane, not found in mammalian SRP, forms a pre-SRP structure in the nucleolus that is translocated to the cytoplasm

name: SSH4
description: Specificity factor required for Rsp5p-dependent ubiquitination and sorting of cargo proteins at the multivesicular body, identified in S. cerevisiae as a high-copy suppressor of a SHR3 deletion, increasing steady-state levels of amino acid permeases

name: PP7435_Chr3-0699
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: CASP C terminal, Mitotic arrest deficient-like 1, Mad1)

name: ERG5
description: C-22 sterol desaturase, a cytochrome P450 enzyme that catalyzes the formation of the C-22(23) double bond in the sterol side chain in ergosterol biosynthesis, may be a target of azole antifungal drugs, enriched among several compartments

name: ARO1
description: Pentafunctional arom protein, catalyzes steps 2 through 6 in the biosynthesis of chorismate, which is a precursor to aromatic amino acids, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0702
description: Protein with similarity to YOR338W (Putative protein of unknown function, YOR338W transcription is regulated by Azf1p and its transcript is a specific target of the G protein effector Scp160p, identified in S. cerevisiae as being required for sporulation in a high-throughput mutant screen, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FUN19)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0703
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Topoisomerase II-associated protein PAT1, PAT1)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0704
description: Protein with low similarity to pentamidine resistance factors, enriched in mitochondria

name: ARO80
description: Zinc finger transcriptional activator of the Zn2Cys6 family, activates transcription of aromatic amino acid catabolic genes in the presence of aromatic amino acids

name: PP7435_Chr3-0706
description: Protein with low similarity to ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolases

name: PP7435_Chr3-0707
description: Protein with low similarity to DUF1649 domain-containing proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0708
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: CoA binding domain found in a number of proteins including succinyl CoA synthetases, malate and ATP-citrate ligases), enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0709
description: Protein with low similarity to putative zinc-finger proteins

name: PP7435_Chr3-0710
description: Protein with low similarity to RVS167 (putative RVS167-3), actin-associated protein with roles in endocytosis and exocytosis

name: PP7435_Chr3-0711
description: Protein with low similarity to Hap43p-induced proteins

name: PRP2
description: RNA-dependent ATPase in the DEAH-box family, required for activation of the spliceosome before the first transesterification step in RNA splicing, orthologous to human protein DHX16

name: PHO91
description: Low-affinity phosphate transporter of the vacuolar membrane, enriched in Golgi and vacuole, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae deletion of pho84, pho87, pho89, pho90, and pho91 causes synthetic lethality, its transcription is independent of Pi and Pho4p activity and its overexpression results in vigorous growth

name: PP7435_Chr3-0714
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0715
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: GAL4 and fungal transcription factor regulatory middle homology region)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0716
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0717
description: Putative transfer RNA for Glutamic acid (tRNA-Glu)

name: ARG83
description: Putative transcription factor involved in arginine metabolism similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis ARG83

name: SUL1
description: High affinity sulfate permease of the SulP anion transporter family, sulfate upTake is mediated by specific sulfate transporters Sul1p and Sul2p, which control the concentration of endogenous activated sulfate intermediates

name: BNA5
description: Kynureninase, required for the de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by Hst1p

name: TCB1
description: Lipid-binding ER protein involved in ER-plasma membrane tethering, one of 6 proteins (Ist2p, Scs2p, Scs22p, Tcb1p, Tcb2p, Tcb3p) that connect ER to plasma membrane and regulate PI4P levels by controlling access of Sac1p phosphatase to its substrate PI4P in PM, contains 3 calcium and lipid binding domains, enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein also localizes to mitochondria, C-termini of Tcb1p, Tcb2p and Tcb3p interact, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TCB2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0722
description: Protein with low similarity to cell surface glycoproteins

name: VPS64
description: Protein required for cytoplasm to vacuole targeting of proteins, forms a complex with Far3p and Far7p to Far11p involved in recovery from pheromone-induced cell cycle arrest, S. cerevisiae mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FAR10

name: SDD4-2
description: Putative transcription factor, as suggested by computational analysis, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS, in S. cerevisiae overproduction of a truncation allele suppresses lethality due to expression of the dominant PET9 allele AAC2-A128P

name: TED1
description: GPI-glycan remodelase, conserved phosphoesterase domain-containing protein, acts together with Emp24p/Erv25p in cargo exit from the ER, functional ortholog of mammalian GPI-glycan remodelase PGAP5, deletion in S. cerevisiae confers sensitivity to 4-(N-(S-glutathionylacetyl)amino) phenylarsenoxide (GSAO)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0726
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ALT1
description: Alanine transaminase (glutamic pyruvic transaminase), involved in alanine biosynthesis and catabolism, TOR1-independent role in determining chronological lifespan, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced in the presence of alanine, repression is mediated by Nrg1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ALT2, Alt2p is catalytically inactive

name: XDJ1
description: Chaperone with a role in facilitating mitochondrial protein import, ascomycete-specific member of the DnaJ-like family, closely related to Ydj1p, predicted to be C-terminally prenylated, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: PP7435_Chr3-0729
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0730
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: APC4
description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C), APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition, component of the platform domain of the APC/C, based on structural analysis, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: TMA64
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes, has a putative RNA binding domain, in mammals the corresponding protein, eIF2D, has been shown to possess translation initiation factor activity

name: GPI17
description: Transmembrane protein subunit of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol transamidase complex that adds GPIs to newly synthesized proteins, human PIG-S homolog, enriched among several compartments

name: RPA14
description: RNA polymerase I subunit A14

name: HOM2
description: Aspartic beta semi-aldehyde dehydrogenase, catalyzes the second step in the common pathway for methionine and threonine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by Gcn4p and the general control of amino acid synthesis

name: RKM5
description: Protein lysine methyltransferase, monomethylates Lys-46 of the ribosomal large subunit Rpl1a/Rpl1b, member of the seven beta-strand methyltransferase superfamily, orthologs only found among fungal species

name: STE11
description: Signal transducing MEK kinase, involved in pheromone response and pseudohyphal/invasive growth pathways where it phosphorylates Ste7p, and the high osmolarity response pathway, via phosphorylation of Pbs2p, regulated by Ste20p and Ste50p, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0739
description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: ATP23
description: Putative metalloprotease of the mitochondrial inner membrane, required for processing of Atp6p, has an additional role in assembly of the F0 sector of the F1F0 ATP synthase complex, substrate of the Mia40p-Erv1p disulfide relay system, and folding is assisted by Mia40p

name: ARE2
description: Unique acyl-CoA:sterol acyltransferase in Pichia pastoris, enzyme of the ER that contributes the major sterol esterification activity in the presence of oxygen, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ARE1

name: BUD23
description: Methyltransferase that methylates residue G1575 of 18S rRNA, required for rRNA processing and nuclear export of 40S ribosomal subunits independently of methylation activity, S. cerevisiae diploid mutant displays random budding pattern, functional homolog of human WBSCR22

name: IMG1
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, required for respiration and for maintenance of the mitochondrial genome, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr3-0744
description: Protein with similarity to YNR021W, enriched in microsome and among several compartments (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER and YNR021W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0745
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Serine-threonine protein kinase 19, Stk19)

name: ALA1
description: Alanyl-tRNA synthetase, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as both cytoplasmic and mitochondrial alanyl-tRNA synthase, required for protein synthesis, in S. cerevisiae point mutation (cdc64-1 allele) causes cell cycle arrest at G1 and lethality of null mutation is functionally complemented by human homolog

name: PP7435_Chr3-0747
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: mRNA biogenesis factor, NpwBP)

name: ATP4
description: Subunit b of the stator stalk of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, ATP synthase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis, contributes to the oligomerization of the complex, which in turn determines the shape of inner membrane cristae, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria

name: MPS1
description: Dual-specificity kinase, required for spindle pole body (SPB) duplication and spindle checkpoint function, substrates include SPB proteins Spc42p, Spc110p, and Spc98p, mitotic exit network protein Mob1p, kinetochore protein Cnn1p, and checkpoint protein Mad1p

name: ARP2
description: Component of the Arp2/3 complex, enriched in cytosol, essential component of the complex in S. cerevisiae, highly conserved actin nucleation center required for the motility and integrity of actin patches, involved in endocytosis and membrane growth and polarity

name: HXK2
description: Hexokinase isoenzyme 2, known in S. cerevisiae to catalyze phosphorylation of glucose in the cytosol, predominant hexokinase during growth on glucose, functions in the nucleus to repress expression of HXK1 and GLK1 and to induce expression of its own gene, phosphorylation/dephosphorylation at serine-14 by protein kinase Snf1p and protein phosphatase Glc7p-Reg1p regulates nucleocytoplasmic shuttling of Hxk2p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog HXK1

name: RPN7
description: Essential in S. cerevisiae, non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome, enriched in cytosol, similar to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn5p, as well as to mammalian proteasome subunits

name: MSI1
description: Subunit of chromatin assembly factor I (CAF-1), chromatin assembly by CAF-1 is important for multiple processes including silencing at telomeres, mating type loci, and rDNA, maintenance of kinetochore structure, deactivation of the DNA damage checkpoint after DNA repair, and chromatin dynamics during transcription, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear and cytoplasmic protein, has an independent role as a negative regulator of the RAS/cAMP pathway via sequestration of Npr1p kinase

name: PGI1
description: Glycolytic enzyme phosphoglucose isomerase, catalyzes the interconversion of glucose-6-phosphate and fructose-6-phosphate, required for cell cycle progression and completion of the gluconeogenic events of sporulation, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0755
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: GPI2
description: Protein involved in the synthesis of N-acetylglucosaminyl phosphatidylinositol (GlcNAc-PI), the first intermediate in the synthesis of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchors, homologous to the human PIG-C protein

name: TAF5
description: Subunit (90 kDa) of TFIID and SAGA complexes, involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation and in chromatin modification

name: RTG2
description: Sensor of mitochondrial dysfunction, regulates the subcellular location of Rtg1p and Rtg3p, transcriptional activators of the retrograde (RTG) and TOR pathways, Rtg2p is inhibited by the phosphorylated form of Mks1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: MIM1
description: Protein required for outer membrane protein import, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, cooperates with Tom70p to import the subset of proteins with multiple alpha-helical transmembrane segments, including Ugo1p, Tom20p, and others, present in a complex with Mim2p in the outer membrane that may create a local environment to facilitate membrane insertion of substrate proteins, also has a role in assembly of Tom20p into the TOM complex

name: RPR2
description: Subunit of nuclear RNase P, nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, not shared between RNase MRP and RNase P, in contrast to all other RNase P protein subunits, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PRE6
description: Alpha 4 subunit of the 20S proteasome, may replace alpha 3 subunit (Pre9p) under stress conditions to create a more active proteasomal isoform, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein relocates from cytosol to the mitochondrial surface upon oxidative stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0762
description: Protein with similarity to YDR541C, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells (Aldehyde reductase, substrates are both aromatic and aliphatic aldehydes, uses NADPH as cofactor)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0763
description: Protein with similarity to YDR541C (Aldehyde reductase, substrates are both aromatic and aliphatic aldehydes, uses NADPH as cofactor)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0764
description: Protein with similarity to YDR541C (Aldehyde reductase, substrates are both aromatic and aliphatic aldehydes, uses NADPH as cofactor)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0765
description: Protein with similarity to YDR541C (Aldehyde reductase, substrates are both aromatic and aliphatic aldehydes, uses NADPH as cofactor)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0766
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0767
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1749, alpha/beta-Hydrolases)

name: GCD14
description: Subunit of tRNA (1-methyladenosine) methyltransferase, with Gcd10p, required for the modification of the adenine at position 58 in tRNAs, especially tRNAi-Met, first identified as a negative regulator of GCN4 expression

name: LSM1
description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein, forms heteroheptameric complex (with Lsm2p, Lsm3p, Lsm4p, Lsm5p, Lsm6p, and Lsm7p) involved in degradation of cytoplasmic mRNAs, unlike most Sm-like proteins, Lsm1p requires both its SM-domain and C-terminal domain for RNA-binding, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0770
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved, enriched among several compartments

name: RPE1-1
description: D-ribulose-5-phosphate 3-epimerase, catalyzes a reaction in the non-oxidative part of the pentose-phosphate pathway, S. cerevisiae mutants are sensitive to oxidative stress, enriched in cytosol

name: RPE1-2
description: D-ribulose-5-phosphate 3-epimerase, catalyzes a reaction in the non-oxidative part of the pentose-phosphate pathway, enriched in cytosol, S. cerevisiae mutants are sensitive to oxidative stress, predicted peroxisomal

name: JEN1
description: Monocarboxylate/proton symporter, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein, transport activity is dependent on the pH gradient across the membrane, mediates high-affinity upTake of carbon sources lactate, pyuvate, and acetate, and also of the micronutrient selenite, whose structure mimics that of monocarboxylates, expression and localization in S. cerevisiae are tightly regulated, with transcription repression, mRNA degradation, and protein endocytosis and degradation all occurring in the presence of glucose

name: MPT5
description: mRNA-binding protein of the PUF family, binds to the 3' UTR of specific mRNAs, including those involved in mating type switching, cell wall integrity, chronological lifespan, chromatin modification, and spindle pole body architecture, recruits the CCR4-NOT deadenylase complex to mRNAs along with Dhh1p and Dcp1p to promote deadenylation, decapping, and decay, also interacts with the Caf20p translational initiation repressor, affecting its mRNA target specificity

name: PP7435_Chr3-0775
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: AGC1
description: Mitochondrial amino acid transporter, acts both as a glutamate uniporter and as an aspartate-glutamate exchanger, involved in nitrogen metabolism and nitrogen compound biosynthesis, enriched in vacuole and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr3-0778
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: BUD13
description: Subunit of the RES complex, which is required for nuclear pre-mRNA retention and splicing, involved in bud-site selection, S. cerevisiae diploid mutants display a unipolar budding pattern instead of the wild-type bipolar pattern

name: XRN1
description: Evolutionarily-conserved 5'-3' exonuclease component of cytoplasmic processing (P) bodies involved in mRNA decay, plays a role in microtubule-mediated processes, filamentous growth, ribosomal RNA maturation, and telomere maintenance, activated by the scavenger decapping enzyme Dcs1p, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: NUP49
description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein which contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport and maintenance of the NPC permeability barrier, found in stable complex with Nic96p and two other FG-nucleoproteins (Nsp1p and Nup57p)

name: PP7435_Chr3-0782
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: COX19
description: Protein required for cytochrome c oxidase assembly, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic and mitochondrial intermembrane space protein, putative copper metallochaperone that delivers copper to cytochrome c oxidase, contains twin cysteine-x9-cysteine motifs

name: PP7435_Chr3-0785
description: Putative transfer RNA for Alanine (tRNA-Ala)

name: YHN8
description: Putative G-protein coupled receptor similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis YHN8

name: MHR1
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, also involved in homologous recombination in mitochondria, required for recombination-dependent mtDNA partitioning, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, involved in S. cerevisiae in stimulation of mitochondrial DNA replication in response to oxidative stress

name: SUR2
description: Sphinganine C4-hydroxylase, catalyses the conversion of sphinganine to phytosphingosine in sphingolipid biosyntheis

name: CDC1-2
description: Putative mannose-ethanolamine phosphate phosphodiesterase, involved in GPI-anchor remodeling prior to the attachment of cell wall proteins to beta 1,3-glucan, mutants display elevated Ca2+-dependent signaling resulting in secondary actin polarization and Golgi inheritance defects, enzyme is Mn2+-dependent, S. cerevisiae mutants have cell division cycle defect and fragile cell walls

name: PP7435_Chr3-0791
description: Protein with low similarity to iron/ascorbate family oxidoreductases and clavaminate synthases

name: OSH3
description: Member of an oxysterol-binding protein family with seven members in S. cerevisiae, family members have overlapping, redundant functions in sterol metabolism and collectively perform a function essential for viability

name: PP7435_Chr3-0793
description: Protein with low similarity to HPR1, subunit of THO/TREX complexes which couple transcription elongation with mitotic recombination and with mRNA metabolism and export, subunit of an RNA Pol II complex

name: ECM14
description: Putative metalloprotease with similarity to the zinc carboxypeptidase family, required for normal cell wall assembly

name: ASH1
description: Component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex, zinc-finger inhibitor of HO transcription, mRNA is localized and translated in S. cerevisiae in the distal tip of anaphase cells, resulting in accumulation of Ash1p in daughter cell nuclei and inhibition of HO expression, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: SPE1
description: Ornithine decarboxylase, catalyzes the first step in polyamine biosynthesis, degraded in a proteasome-dependent manner in the presence of excess polyamines, deletion in S. cerevisiae decreases lifespan, and increases necrotic cell death and ROS generation

name: LOT5
description: Protein of unknown function, gene expression increases in cultures shifted to a lower temperature, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0798
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: PRK10263)

name: CMP2
description: Calcineurin A, one isoform (the other is Cna1p) of the catalytic subunit of calcineurin, a Ca++/calmodulin-regulated protein phosphatase which regulates Crz1p (a stress-response transcription factor), the other calcineurin subunit is CNB1, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CNA1

name: TSR2
description: Protein with a potential role in pre-rRNA processing

name: HID1
description: Putative protein involved in cell wall biogenesis and architecture similar to to Scheffersomyces stipitis HID1

name: PP7435_Chr3-0802
description: Protein with low similarity to RNA-binding proteins

name: CAR2
description: L-ornithine transaminase (OTAse), catalyzes the second step of arginine degradation, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the expression is dually-regulated by allophanate induction and a specific arginine induction process, not nitrogen catabolite repression sensitive, and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: NHA1
description: Na+/H+ antiporter involved in sodium and potassium efflux, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein required for alkali cation tolerance at acidic pH

name: AOX100
description: Putative mitochondrial alternative oxidase, member of the ferritin-like diiron-carboxylate superfamily, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis STO1, but not related to S. cerevisiae STO1

name: HAL9
description: Putative transcription factor containing a zinc finger, overexpression in S. cerevisiae increases salt tolerance through increased expression of the ENA1 (Na+/Li+ extrusion pump) gene while gene disruption decreases both salt tolerance and ENA1 expression, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TBS1

name: DAO1
description: D-amino-acid oxidase of Pichia pastoris important flavo-enzyme that catalyzes the oxidative deamination of D-amino acids into the corresponding a-keto acid, ammonia and H2O2, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0808
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-0809
description: Protein with similarity to YKL069W (Methionine-R-sulfoxide reductase, reduces the R enantiomer of free Met-SO, in contrast to Ycl033Cp which reduces Met-R-SO in a peptide linkage, has a role in protection against oxidative stress, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress)

name: ACS2
description: Acetyl-coA synthetase isoform which, along with Acs1p, is the nuclear source of acetyl-coA for histone acetylation, enriched in cytosol, mutants in S. cerevisiae affect global transcription, required for growth on glucose, expressed under anaerobic conditions

name: ECM10
description: Heat shock protein of the Hsp70 family, known in S. cerevisiae as protein located at mitochondrial nucleoids, plays a role in protein translocation, interacts with Mge1p in an ATP-dependent manner, overexpression in S. cerevisiae induces extensive mitochondrial DNA aggregations, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SSC1

name: LCB4
description: Sphingoid long-chain base kinase, responsible for synthesis of long-chain base phosphates, which function as signaling molecules, regulates synthesis of ceramide from exogenous long-chain bases, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi and late endosomal protein, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog LCB5

name: SUP35
description: Translation termination factor eRF3, has a role in mRNA deadenylation and decay, altered protein conformation creates the [PSI(+)] prion that alters translational fidelity and results in a nonsense suppressor phenotype, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0815
description: Protein with low similarity to cyclins

name: SPR28
description: Sporulation-specific homolog of the yeast CDC3/10/11/12 family of bud neck microfilament genes, meiotic septin expressed in S. cerevisiae at high levels during meiotic divisions and ascospore formation

name: PP7435_Chr3-0817
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: TPR-like)

name: RAD9
description: DNA damage-dependent checkpoint protein, required for cell-cycle arrest in G1/S, intra-S, and G2/M, transmits checkpoint signal by activating Rad53p and Chk1p, hyperphosphorylated by Mec1p and Tel1p, multiple cyclin dependent kinase consensus sites and the C-terminal BRCT domain contribute to DNA damage checkpoint activation, Rad9p Chk1 Activating Domain (CAD) is phosphorylated at multiple sites by Cdc28p/Clb2p

name: YPS7
description: Putative GPI-anchored aspartic protease, member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance, located in S. cerevisiae in the cytoplasm and ER, deletion in Pichia pastoris is responsible of aberrant cell wall composition and increased osmotic stress resistance

name: GCD6
description: Catalytic epsilon subunit of the translation initiation factor eIF2B, eIF2B is the guanine-nucleotide exchange factor for eIF2, activity subsequently regulated by phosphorylated eIF2, first identified as a negative regulator of GCN4 expression, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: SCC2
description: Subunit of cohesin loading factor (Scc2p-Scc4p), a complex required for loading of cohesin complexes onto chromosomes, involved in establishing sister chromatid cohesion during DSB repair via histone H2AX, evolutionarily-conserved adherin, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RAV2

name: PP7435_Chr3-0831
description: Protein with low similarity to bromo domain-containing proteins

description: Protein with low similarity to MIS13, kinetochore protein

name: PP7435_Chr3-0841
description: Putative transfer RNA for Arginine (tRNA-Arg)

description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: YaeQ protein)
