description: Steryl ester hydrolase, one of three gene products (Yeh1p, Yeh2p, Tgl1p) responsible for steryl ester hydrolase activity and involved in sterol homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as lipid particle membranes protein

name: MIT1
description: Transcriptional regulator of pseudohyphal growth, Gti1/Pac2 family protein which regulates morphogenic transition in Schizosaccharomyces pombe and Candida albicans

name: SAP30
description: Component of Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex, involved in silencing at telomeres, rDNA, and silent mating-type loci, involved in telomere maintenance

name: PP7435_Chr3-0973
description: Protein with low similarity to coupling of ubiquitin conjugation to ER degradation protein 1, enriched among several compartments

name: CAC2
description: Subunit of chromatin assembly factor I (CAF-1), with Rlf2p and Msi1p, chromatin assembly by CAF-1 is important for multiple processes including silencing at telomeres, mating type loci, and rDNA, maintenance of kinetochore structure, deactivation of the DNA damage checkpoint after DNA repair, and chromatin dynamics during transcription, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr3-0975
description: Protein with low similarity to YMR265C, putative protein of unknown function

name: PFA4
description: Palmitoyltransferase with autoacylation activity, required for palmitoylation of amino acid permeases containing a C-terminal Phe-Trp-Cys site, required for modification of Chs3p, member of the DHHC family of putative palmitoyltransferases

name: SIN3
description: Component of the Sin3p-Rpd3p histone deacetylase complex, involved in transcriptional repression and activation of diverse processes, including mating-type switching and meiosis, involved in the maintenance of chromosomal integrity, enriched in cytosol

name: RPB11
description: RNA polymerase II subunit B12.5, part of central core, similar to Rpc19p and bacterial alpha subunit, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-0979
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TOP1
description: Topoisomerase I, nuclear enzyme that relieves torsional strain in DNA by cleaving and re-sealing the phosphodiester backbone, relaxes both positively and negatively supercoiled DNA, functions in replication, transcription, and recombination

name: PSR1
description: Phosphatase, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein involved in the general stress response, required along with binding partner Whi2p for full activation of STRE-mediated gene expression, possibly through dephosphorylation of Msn2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PSR2

name: SOF1
description: Protein required for biogenesis of 40S (small) ribosomal subunit, has similarity to the beta subunit of trimeric G-proteins and the splicing factor Prp4p, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, essential gene in S. cerevisiae

name: PP7435_Chr3-0983
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Cytochrome c oxidase biogenesis protein Cmc1 like)

name: TFB6
description: Subunit of TFIIH complex, facilities dissociation of the Ssl2p helices from TFIIH, expression levels regulated by Arg5,6p, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus

name: ARC18
description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex, which is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ROM2
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) for Rho1p and Rho2p, mutations are synthetically lethal with mutations in rom1, which also encodes a GEF, enriched in plasma membrane, in S. cerevisiae the localization to the bud surface is dependent on Ack1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ROM1

name: ELO3
description: Elongase, involved in fatty acid and sphingolipid biosynthesis, synthesizes very long chain 20-26-carbon fatty acids from C18-CoA primers, involved in regulation of sphingolipid biosynthesis, enriched in mitochondria

name: STP3
description: Zinc-finger protein of unknown function, possibly involved in pre-tRNA splicing and in upTake of branched-chain amino acids, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog STP4

name: MAK3
description: Catalytic subunit of the NatC type N-terminal acetyltransferase, involved in subcellular targeting of select N-terminally acetylated substrates to the Golgi apparatus (Arl3p and Grh1p) and the inner nuclear membrane (Trm1p), required for replication of dsRNA virus

name: POL30
description: Proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA), functions as the sliding clamp for DNA polymerase delta, may function as a docking site for other proteins required for mitotic and meiotic chromosomal DNA replication and for DNA repair, enriched in cytosol

name: HAA1
description: Transcriptional activator involved in adaptation to weak acid stress, activates transcription of TPO2, YRO2, and other genes encoding membrane stress proteins, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CUP2, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize from cytoplasm to nucleus upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr3-0992
description: Protein with low similarity to glycosyltransferase family 8 protein, enriched in cytosol

name: ACT1
description: Actin, structural protein involved in cell polarization, endocytosis, and other cytoskeletal functions, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: ENV10
description: Protein involved in SRP-independent targeting of substrates to the ER, component of an alternative ER targeting pathway that has partial functional redundancy with the GET pathway, preference for substrates with downstream transmembrane domains, interacts with Snd1p, Pho88p/Snd3p, and Sec61p-translocon subunits, can compensate for loss of SRP, role in the late endosome-vacuole interface, putative role in secretory protein quality control, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: YPT1
description: Rab family GTPase, involved in the ER-to-Golgi step of the secretory pathway, complex formation with the Rab escort protein Mrs6p is required for prenylation of Ypt1p by type II protein geranylgeranyltransferase (Bet2p-Bet4p), binds to unspliced HAC1 mRNA, regulates the unfolded protein response (UPR) by promoting the decay of HAC1 RNA, enriched in Golgi and among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae to be found in early and transitional Golgi, ER membranes, pre-autophagosomal structures, and cytoplasmic vesicle, subjected to geranyl-geranylation of the C-terminus also in Pichia pastoris

name: SSA3
description: ATPase involved in protein folding and the response to stress, plays a role in SRP-dependent cotranslational protein-membrane targeting and translocation, member of the heat shock protein 70 (HSP70) family, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSA4

name: PER33
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae to be in the ER, which associates with the nuclear pore complex and deletion extends chronological lifespan, highly conserved across species, orthologous to human TMEM33, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog POM33, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: HAT1
description: Catalytic subunit of the Hat1p-Hat2p histone acetyltransferase complex that uses the cofactor acetyl coenzyme A, to acetylate free nuclear and cytoplasmic histone H4, involved in telomeric silencing and DNA double-strand break repair

name: LSP1
description: Eisosome core component, eisosomes are large immobile patch structures at the cell cortex associated with endocytosis, phosphorylated on Thr233 upon Pkc1p hyperactivation in a Slt2p MAPK-dependent fashion, enriched among several compartments, S. cerevisiae null mutants show activation of Pkc1p/Ypk1p stress resistance pathways, member of the BAR domain family

name: OSM1
description: Fumarate reductase, catalyzes the reduction of fumarate to succinate, required for the reoxidation of intracellular NADH under anaerobic conditions, mutations in S. cerevisiae cause osmotic sensitivity, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FRD1

name: RAD54
description: DNA-dependent ATPase that stimulates strand exchange, modifies the topology of double-stranded DNA, involved in the recombinational repair of double-strand breaks in DNA during vegetative growth and meiosis, member of the SWI/SNF family, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: SNF8
description: Component of the ESCRT-II complex, which is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome, appears to be functionally related to SNF7, involved in glucose derepression

name: PHS1
description: 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase known in S. cerevisiae as essential ER membrane protein, involved in elongation of very long-chain fatty acids, evolutionarily conserved, similar to mammalian PTPLA and PTPLB, involved in sphingolipid biosynthesis and protein trafficking

name: MRPL49
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria

name: BCK1
description: MAPKKK acting in the protein kinase C signaling pathway, the kinase C signaling pathway controls cell integrity, upon activation by Pkc1p phosphorylates downstream kinases Mkk1p and Mkk2p, MAPKKK is an acronym for mitogen-activated protein (MAP) kinase kinase kinase, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SRS2
description: DNA helicase and DNA-dependent ATPase involved in DNA repair and checkpoint recovery, needed for proper timing of commitment to meiotic recombination and transition from Meiosis I to II, blocks trinucleotide repeat expansion, affects genome stability

name: DGA1
description: Diacylglycerol acyltransferase, catalyzes the terminal step of triacylglycerol formation, in Pichia pastoris is not the major contributor to triacylglycerols synthesis like in S. cerevisiae, where it is localized to lipid particles and ER

name: SIT4
description: Ceramide-activated, type 2A-related serine-threonine phosphatase, functions in G1/S transition of mitotic cycle, controls lifespan, mitochondrial function, cell cycle progression by regulating HXK2 phosphorylation, regulator of COPII coat dephosphorylation, required for ER to Golgi traffic, interacts with Hrr25p kinase, cytoplasmic and nuclear protein that modulates functions mediated by Pkc1p including cell wall and actin cytoskeleton organization, similar to human PP6

name: ARG1
description: Arginosuccinate synthetase, catalyzes the formation of L-argininosuccinate from citrulline and L-aspartate in the arginine biosynthesis pathway, potential Cdc28p substrate, enriched in cytosol

name: KRE2
description: Alpha1,2-mannosyltransferase of the Golgi, involved in protein mannosylation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog KTR6, enriched in microsome, Golgi and vacuole

name: PP7435_Chr3-1014
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PHO85
description: Cyclin-dependent kinase, with ten cyclin partners, involved in regulating the cellular response to nutrient levels and environmental conditions and progression through the cell cycle, enriched in cytosol

name: TRM44
description: tRNA(Ser) Um(44) 2'-O-methyltransferase, involved in maintaining levels of the tRNA-Ser species tS(CGA) and tS(UGA), conserved among metazoans and fungi but there does not appear to be a homolog in plants, in S. cerevisiae YPL030W is a non-essential gene

name: NOP4
description: Protein required for processing and maturation of 27S pre-rRNA and large ribosomal subunit biogenesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as essential nucleolar protein, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, contains four RNA recognition motifs (RRMs)

name: CHL4
description: Outer kinetochore protein required for chromosome stability, involved in new kinetochore assembly and sister chromatid cohesion, peripheral component of the Ctf19 kinetochore complex that interacts with Ctf19p, Ctf3p, Iml3p and Mif2p, orthologous to human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-N and fission yeast mis15

name: VPS16
description: Subunit of the vacuole fusion and protein sorting HOPS complex and the CORVET tethering complex, part of the Class C Vps complex essential in S. cerevisiae for membrane docking and fusion at Golgi-to-endosome and endosome-to-vacuole protein transport stages

name: ELC1
description: Elongin C, conserved among eukaryotes, forms a complex with Cul3p that polyubiquitylates monoubiquitylated RNA polymerase II to trigger its proteolysis, plays a role in global genomic repair

name: BRO1
description: Class E vacuolar protein sorting (VPS) factor that coordinates deubiquitination in the multivesicular body (MVB) pathway by recruiting Doa4p to endosomes, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: RMD5
description: Component of GID Complex that confers ubiquitin ligase (U3) activity, necessary for polyubiquitination and degradation of the gluconeogenic enzyme fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase, forms dimer with Fyv10p that is then recruited to GID Complex by Gid8p, also required for sporulation, conserved protein that has a degenerate RING finger domain

name: PP7435_Chr3-1023
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RRP9
description: Protein involved in pre-rRNA processing, associated with U3 snRNP, component of small ribosomal subunit (SSU) processosome, ortholog of the human U3-55k protein

name: COG2
description: Essential component in S. cerevisiae of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex (Cog1p through Cog8p), known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic tethering complex that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments

name: CTF4
description: Chromatin-associated protein, required for sister chromatid cohesion, interacts with DNA polymerase alpha (Pol1p) and may link DNA synthesis to sister chromatid cohesion

name: FAF1
description: Protein required for pre-rRNA processing and 40S ribosomal subunit assembly

name: VPS9
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF), involved in vesicle-mediated vacuolar transport, including Golgi-endosome trafficking and sorting through the multivesicular body (MVB), specifically stimulates the intrinsic guanine nucleotide exchange activity of Rab family members (Vps21p/Ypt52p/Ypt53p), partially redundant with GEF MUK1, required for localization of the CORVET complex to endosomes, similar to mammalian ras inhibitors, contains a VPS9 domain, binds ubiquitin

name: NGL2
description: Protein involved in 5.8S rRNA processing, Ccr4p-like RNase required for correct 3'-end formation of 5.8S rRNA at site E, similar to Ngl1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NGL3

name: PP7435_Chr3-1030
description: Protein with low similarity to NAB3, RNA-binding protein, subunit of Nrd1 complex (Nrd1p-Nab3p-Sen1p))

name: WSS1
description: SUMO-ligase and SUMO-targeted metalloprotease, involved in DNA repair, removes DNA-protein crosslinks at stalled replication forks during replication of damaged DNA, clears chromatin-bound sumoylated proteins, known in S. cerevisiae to localize at single spot on nuclear periphery of mother cells but not daughters, exhibits in S. cerevisiae vacuolar localization upon genotoxic stress, activated by DNA binding, member of minigluzincins protease family with mammalian DVC1/Spartan

name: PP7435_Chr3-1032
description: Protein with similarity to YML096W (Putative protein with similarity to asparagine synthetases, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, YML096W is not an essential gene and partially overlaps the verified gene RAD10)

name: DPP1-1
description: Diacylglycerol pyrophosphate (DGPP) phosphatase, zinc-regulated vacuolar membrane-associated lipid phosphatase, dephosphorylates DGPP to phosphatidate (PA) and Pi, then PA to diacylglycerol, involved in lipid signaling and cell metabolism

name: GET2
description: Subunit of the GET complex, involved in insertion of proteins into the ER membrane, required for the retrieval of HDEL proteins from the Golgi to the ER in an ERD2 dependent fashion and for meiotic nuclear division

name: PP7435_Chr3-1035
description: Putative transfer RNA for Threonine (tRNA-Thr)

name: CBK1
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase of the the RAM signaling network, Ndr/LATS family member, binds regulatory subunit Mob2p, involved in regulation of cellular morphogenesis, polarized growth, and septum destruction, phosphorylation by Cbk1p regulates localization and activity of Ace2p transcription factor and Ssd1p translational repressor, Cbk1p activity is regulated by both phosphorylation and specific localization, enriched in plasma membrane, relocalizes in S. cerevisiae to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: RPL42B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L42B, required for propagation of the killer toxin-encoding M1 double-stranded RNA satellite of the L-A double-stranded RNA virus, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L36A, no bacterial homolog, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL42A

name: PP7435_Chr3-1038
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-1039
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-1040
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PEX25
description: Peripheral membrane peroxin, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, required for the regulation of peroxisome size and maintenance, recruits GTPase Rho1p to peroxisomes, induced in S. cerevisiae by oleate, interacts with Pex27p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PEX27

name: PDC1
description: Unique pyruvate decarboxylase isozyme in Pichia pastoris, key enzyme in alcoholic fermentation, decarboxylates pyruvate to acetaldehyde, subject to glucose-, ethanol-, and autoregulation, involved in amino acid catabolism, enriched in cytosol

name: TMH11
description: Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS, the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: DSD1
description: D-serine dehydratase (aka D-serine ammonia-lyase), converts D-serine to pyruvate and ammonia by a reaction dependent on pyridoxal 5'-phosphate and zinc, may play a role in D-serine detoxification, L-serine is not a substrate

name: PP7435_Chr3-1045
description: Protein with low similarity to Krueppel-like factor 4

name: PP7435_Chr3-1046
description: Putative transfer RNA for Alanine (tRNA-Ala)

name: GAS4
description: 1,3-beta-glucanosyltransferase, involved with Gas2p in spore wall assembly, has similarity to Gas1p, known in S. cerevisiae as cell wall protein

name: SKP2
description: F-box protein of unknown function predicted to be part of an SCF ubiquitin protease complex, involved in regulating protein levels of sulfur metabolism enzymes, may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments

name: DIP5-2
description: Dicarboxylic amino acid permease, mediates high-affinity and high-capacity transport of L-glutamate and L-aspartate, also a transporter for Gln, Asn, Ser, Ala, and Gly, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein that relocalizes to vacuole upon DNA replication stress

name: MAE1
description: Malic enzyme, catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of malate to pyruvate, which is a key intermediate in sugar metabolism and a precursor for synthesis of several amino acids, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: PP7435_Chr3-1051
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: F-box-like)

name: GTB1
description: Glucosidase II beta subunit, forms a complex with alpha subunit Rot2p, involved in removal of two glucose residues from N-linked glycans during glycoprotein biogenesis in the ER, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from ER to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: TFA1
description: TFIIE large subunit, involved in recruitment of RNA polymerase II to the promoter, activation of TFIIH, and promoter opening

name: CTP1
description: Mitochondrial inner membrane citrate transporter, member of the mitochondrial carrier family, enriched in mitochondria and in microsome, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells

name: BSD2
description: Heavy metal ion homeostasis protein, facilitates trafficking of Smf1p and Smf2p metal transporters to the vacuole where they are degraded, controls metal ion transport, prevents metal hyperaccumulation, functions in copper detoxification

name: SNF5
description: Subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex, involved in transcriptional regulation, functions interdependently in transcriptional activation with Snf2p and Snf6p, relocates in S. cerevisiae to the cytosol under hypoxic conditions

name: CDB4
description: Putative curved DNA-binding protein (42 kDa protein) similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis CDB4, enriched among several compartments

name: RCO1
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the histone deacetylase Rpd3S complex, interacts with Eaf3p

name: PDS5
description: Cohesion maintenance factor, involved in sister chromatid condensation and cohesion, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein which colocalizes with cohesin on chromosomes, performs its cohesin maintenance function in pre-anaphase cells by protecting the integrity of the cohesion complex, also required during meiosis, relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr3-1061
description: Protein with similarity to YHL008C (Putative protein of unknown function, may be involved in the upTake of chloride ions, does not appear to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole)

name: HCH1
description: Heat shock protein regulator, binds to Hsp90p and may stimulate ATPase activity, originally identified as a high-copy number suppressor of a HSP90 loss-of-function mutation, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: VPS72
description: Htz1p-binding component of the SWR1 complex, exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A, may function as a lock that prevents removal of H2AZ from nucleosomes, required for vacuolar protein sorting

name: COQ3
description: O-methyltransferase, catalyzes two different O-methylation steps in ubiquinone (Coenzyme Q) biosynthesis, component of a mitochondrial ubiquinone-synthesizing complex, phosphoprotein, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: VPS60
description: Protein involved in late endosome to vacuole transport, cytoplasmic and vacuolar membrane protein, required in S. cerevisiae for normal filament maturation during pseudohyphal growth, may function in targeting cargo proteins for degradation, interacts with Vta1p

name: RIB3
description: 3,4-dihydroxy-2-butanone-4-phosphate synthase (DHBP synthase), required for riboflavin biosynthesis from ribulose-5-phosphate, also has an unrelated function in mitochondrial respiration, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-1067
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YPS1-2
description: Aspartic protease, member of the yapsin family of proteases involved in cell wall growth and maintenance, attached to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MKC7

name: PP7435_Chr3-1069
description: Protein with similarity to YDR341C, enriched in cytosol (Arginyl-tRNA synthetase, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MSR1)

name: WRS1
description: Cytoplasmic tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase, aminoacylates tryptophanyl-tRNA, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr3-1071
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: TIM-phosphate binding)

name: PKH1
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase, involved in sphingolipid-mediated signaling pathway that controls endocytosis, activates Ypk1p and Ykr2p, components of signaling cascade required for maintenance of cell wall integrity, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae redundant with Pkh2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PKH2

name: IRA1
description: GTPase-activating protein, negatively regulates RAS by converting it from the GTP- to the GDP-bound inactive form, required for reducing cAMP levels under nutrient limiting conditions, mediates membrane association of adenylate cyclase, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog IRA2

name: AVO1
description: Component of a membrane-bound complex containing the Tor2p kinase and other proteins, which may have a role in regulation of cell growth

name: ATP19
description: Putative subunit k of the mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: BRX1
description: Protein constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein, depletion leads to defects in rRNA processing and a block in the assembly of large ribosomal subunits, possesses a sigma(70)-like RNA-binding motif

name: PP7435_Chr3-1077
description: Protein with low similarity to micro-fibrillar-associated protein 1

name: DUF1
description: Ubiquitin-binding protein of unknown function, contains one WD40 repeat in a beta-propeller fold, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, homolog of human WDR48/UAF1, which is involved in regulating the Fanconi anemia pathway, S. cerevisiae deletion mutant is sensitive to various chemicals including phenanthroline, sanguinarine, and nordihydroguaiaretic acid

name: RPB5
description: RNA polymerase subunit ABC27, common to RNA polymerases I, II, and III, contacts DNA and affects transactivation

name: RIB7
description: Diaminohydroxyphoshoribosylaminopyrimidine deaminase, catalyzes the second step of the riboflavin biosynthesis pathway

name: MHF1
description: Component of the heterotetrameric MHF histone-fold complex, in humans the MHF complex interacts with both DNA and Mph1p ortholog FANCM, a Fanconi anemia complementation group protein, to stabilize and remodel blocked replication forks and repair damaged DNA, mhf1 srs2 double mutants are MMS hypersensitive, ortholog of human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-S, also known as MHF1

name: MRPS9
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: NUT2
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, required for transcriptional activation and has a role in basal transcription, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MET16
description: 3'-phosphoadenylsulfate reductase, reduces 3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate to adenosine-3',5'-bisphosphate and free sulfite using reduced thioredoxin as cosubstrate, involved in sulfate assimilation and methionine metabolism

name: RIM15
description: Protein kinase involved in cell proliferation in response to nutrients, glucose-repressible, involved in signal transduction during cell proliferation in response to nutrients, specifically the establishment of stationary phase, identified as a regulator of IME2, phosphorylates Igo1p and Igo2p, substrate of Pho80p-Pho85p kinase

name: TEL2
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling, subunit of the telomere cap complex DNA-binding protein specific to single-stranded yeast telomeric DNA repeats, required for telomere length regulation and telomere position effect, involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1

name: PP7435_Chr3-1090
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MIL1
description: Predicted lipase, binds variant medium clathrin chain Apm2p and contributes to its membrane recruitment, putative integral membrane protein that interacts with Rpp0p component of ribosomal stalk

name: FRS1
description: Beta subunit of cytoplasmic phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase, forms a tetramer with Frs2p to generate active enzyme, able to hydrolyze mis-aminoacylated tRNA-Phe, which could contribute to translational quality control, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SEC4
description: Rab family GTPase, essential for vesicle-mediated exocytic secretion and autophagy, associates with the exocyst component Sec15p and may regulate polarized delivery of transport vesicles to the exocyst at the plasma membrane, subjected to geranyl-geranylation of the C-terminus also in Pichia pastoris, enriched among several compartments

name: PHO84-2
description: High-affinity inorganic phosphate (Pi) transporter and low-affinity manganese transporter, regulated by Pho4p and Spt7p, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, mutation in S. cerevisiae confers resistance to arsenate, exit from the ER during maturation requires Pho86p, cells overexpressing Pho84p accumulate heavy metals but do not develop symptoms of metal toxicity

name: PP7435_Chr3-1096
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: HMX1
description: Heme oxygenase, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, involved in heme degradation during iron starvation and in the oxidative stress response, in S. cerevisiae the expression is regulated by AFT1 and oxidative stress and the protein relocates to the perinuclear region in the presence of oxidants

name: PP7435_Chr3-1098
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr3-1099
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF3210)

name: VMA9
description: Vacuolar H+ ATPase subunit e of the V-ATPase V0 subcomplex, essential in S. cerevisiae for vacuolar acidification, interacts with the V-ATPase assembly factor Vma21p in the ER, involved in V0 biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein

name: STP22
description: Component of the ESCRT-I complex, which is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome, homologous to the mouse and human Tsg101 tumor susceptibility gene, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit a Class E Vps phenotype

name: ACA1
description: ATF/CREB family basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor, binds as a homodimer to the ATF/CREB consensus sequence TGACGTCA, important for carbon source utilization, target genes include GRE2 and COS8, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CST6

name: PP7435_Chr3-1103
description: Protein with low similarity to carbohydrate kinase

name: PP7435_Chr3-1104
description: Protein with low similarity to RSR1, putative RSR1-2, GTP-binding protein of the Ras superfamily, enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells

name: RUP1
description: Protein that regulates Rsp5p, which is a HECT ubiquitin ligase, has a WW domain consensus motif of PPPSY (residues 131-135) that mediates binding of Rsp5p to Ubp2p, contains an UBA domain, in S. cerevisiae relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: FCF1
description: Putative PINc domain nuclease required for early cleavages of 35S pre-rRNA and maturation of 18S rRNA, component of the SSU (small subunit) processome involved in 40S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, copurifies with Faf1p

name: STE14
description: Farnesyl cysteine-carboxyl methyltransferase, mediates the carboxyl methylation step during C-terminal CAAX motif processing of a-factor and RAS proteins in the ER, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein

name: YPK2
description: Protein kinase with similarity to serine/threonine protein kinase Ypk1p, functionally redundant with YPK1 at the genetic level, participates in a signaling pathway required for optimal cell wall integrity, homolog of mammalian kinase SGK, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YPK1

name: PP7435_Chr3-1110
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DUF3166)

name: AMF1
description: Low affinity NH4+ transporter, member of the DHA2 family of drug:H+ anti porters, Pichia pastoris does not have the putative paralog ATR1, but not required for boron tolerance, in S. cerevisiae YOR378W is a non-essential gene

name: ERG1
description: Squalene epoxidase, catalyzes the epoxidation of squalene to 2,3-oxidosqualene, plays in S. cerevisiae an essential role in the ergosterol-biosynthesis pathway and is the specific target of the antifungal drug terbinafine, enriched in microsome and mitochondria

name: CBP4
description: Protein required for assembly of cytochrome bc1 complex, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, interacts with the Cbp3p-Cbp6p complex and newly synthesized cytochrome b (Cobp) to promote assembly of Cobp into the cytochrome bc1 complex

name: APS3

description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

description: Protein with low similarity to molybdenum cofactor biosynthesis protein C

name: PLC2
description: Phosphatidylinositol-specific phospholipase C similar to Candida albicans PLC2

name: RPB7
description: RNA polymerase II subunit B16, forms two subunit dissociable complex with Rpb4p, involved in recruitment of 3'-end processing factors to transcribing RNA polymerase II complex and in export of mRNA to cytoplasm under stress conditions, also involved in translation initiation, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: MRPL23
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: MRPL37
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: DPB11
description: DNA replication initiation protein, loads DNA pol epsilon onto pre-replication complexes at origins, checkpoint sensor recruited to stalled replication forks by the checkpoint clamp complex where it activates Mec1p, along with Rfa1p, binds to ultrafine anaphase bridges in mitotic cells and prevents accumulation of chromatin bridges by stimulating the Mec1p kinase and suppressing homologous recombination

name: PAF1
description: Component of the Paf1p complex involved in transcription elongation, binds to and modulates the activity of RNA polymerases I and II, required for expression of a subset of genes, including cell cycle-regulated genes, involved in SER3 repression by helping to maintain SRG1 transcription-dependent nucleosome occupancy, homolog of human PD2/hPAF1, enriched in cytosol

name: RRP15
description: Protein constituent of pre-60S ribosomal particles, required for proper processing of the 27S pre-rRNA at the A3 and B1 sites to yield mature 5.8S and 25S rRNAs, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: KAR3
description: Minus-end-directed microtubule motor that functions in mitosis and meiosis, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the spindle pole body whose localization is dependent on functional Cik1p, required for nuclear fusion during mating, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: YPT7
description: Rab family GTPase, GTP-binding protein of the rab family, required for homotypic fusion event in vacuole inheritance, for endosome-endosome fusion, enriched in vacuole and among several compartments, localizes in S. cerevisiae to sites of contact between the vacuole and mitochondria (vCLAMPs), interacts with the cargo selection/retromer complex for retrograde sorting, similar to mammalian Rab7, in Pichia pastoris Ccz1, Mon1 and Ypz7 are also required for the degradration of methanol-induced peroxisomes by micro- and macro-pexophagy

name: PHO80
description: Cyclin, interacts with cyclin-dependent kinase Pho85p, regulates the response to nutrient levels and environmental conditions, including the response to phosphate limitation and stress-dependent calcium signaling

name: PP7435_Chr4-0054
description: Protein with low similarity to MRX3, protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome

name: ZRC1
description: Vacuolar membrane zinc transporter, transports zinc from cytosol to vacuole for storage, also has role in resistance to zinc shock resulting from sudden influx of zinc into cytoplasm, enriched in Golgi, vacuole and mitochondria, human ortholog SLC30A10 functions as a Mn transporter and mutations in SLC30A10 cause neurotoxic accumulation of Mn in liver and brain, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog COT1

name: MRPL35
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria

name: NMD2
description: Protein involved in the nonsense-mediated mRNA decay (NMD) pathway, interacts with Nam7p and Upf3p, involved in telomere maintenance, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PTC7
description: Type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C), alternatively spliced in S. cerevisiae to create two mRNA isoforms with different localization

name: TIM11
description: Subunit e of mitochondrial F1F0-ATPase, ATPase is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis, enriched in mitochondria, andadditionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae for the dimeric and oligomeric state of ATP synthase, which in turn determines the shape of inner membrane cristae

name: MCM7
description: Component of the heterohexameric MCM2-7 complex, which primes origins of DNA replication in G1 and becomes an active ATP-dependent helicase that promotes DNA melting and elongation in S-phase, forms an Mcm4p-6p-7p subcomplex

name: PP7435_Chr4-0063
description: Protein with low similarity to putative phosphosugar binding proteins

name: YME1
description: Catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial inner membrane i-AAA protease complex, which is responsible for degradation of unfolded or misfolded mitochondrial gene products, also has a role in intermembrane space protein folding, enriched in mitochondria, mutation in S. cerevisiae causes an elevated rate of mitochondrial turnover

name: PP7435_Chr4-0065
description: Protein with low similarity to DFG16, probable multiple transmembrane protein involved in diploid invasive and pseudohyphal growth upon nitrogen starvation

name: PP7435_Chr4-0066
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: PRK13335)

name: CIN5-2
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor of the yAP-1 family, physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets, mediates pleiotropic drug resistance and salt tolerance, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein under oxidative stress and sequestered in the cytoplasm by Lot6p under reducing conditions, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YAP6

name: RBA50
description: Protein involved in transcription, interacts with RNA polymerase II subunits Rpb2p, Rpb3, and Rpb11p, has similarity to human RPAP1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0069
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CWC25-2
description: Splicing factor required for the first step of pre-mRNA splicing, binding to the spliceosome requires Prp2p and Yju2p, heat-stable protein, has similarity to S. pombe Cwf25p

name: SUI1-2
description: Translation initiation factor eIF1, component of a complex involved in recognition of the initiator codon, modulates translation accuracy at the initiation phase

name: SLA2-1
description: Adaptor protein that links actin to clathrin and endocytosis, involved in membrane cytoskeleton assembly and cell polarization, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in microsome in methanol-grown cells, present in the actin cortical patch of the emerging bud tip, dimer in vivo

name: MATalpha1
description: Mating-type protein alpha1, transcription factor regulating mating in Pichia pastoris, P. pastoris does not have the silent copy HMLalpha1 present in S. cerevisiae

name: DIC1-2
description: Mitochondrial dicarboxylate carrier, integral membrane protein, catalyzes a dicarboxylate-phosphate exchange across the inner mitochondrial membrane, transports cytoplasmic dicarboxylates into the mitochondrial matrix

name: ASA1
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling, telomere length regulator involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1

name: SPC3
description: Subunit of signal peptidase complex (Spc1p, Spc2p, Spc3p, Sec11p), which catalyzes cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences of proteins targeted to the secretory pathway, homologous to mammalian SPC22/23, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: PET309
description: Specific translational activator for the COX1 mRNA, also influences stability of intron-containing COX1 primary transcripts, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane protein, contains seven pentatricopeptide repeats (PPRs)

name: FYV7
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for maturation of 18S rRNA, required for survival upon exposure to K1 killer toxin

name: PP7435_Chr4-0079
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: MMS1_N, WD40 repeat-like)

name: EMI1
description: Non-essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for transcriptional induction of the early meiotic-specific transcription factor IME1, also required for sporulation, contains twin cysteine-x9-cysteine motifs

name: GRH1
description: Cis-Golgi protein required for the organization of the secretory compartments, involved in ER to Golgi transport, homolog of human GRASP65

name: PP7435_Chr4-0082
description: Protein with low similarity to kinetochore proteins

name: ISC1
description: Inositol phosphosphingolipid phospholipase C, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial membrane protein, hydrolyzes complex sphingolipids to produce ceramide, activates genes required for non-fermentable carbon source metabolism during diauxic shift, activated by phosphatidylserine, cardiolipin, and phosphatidylglycerol, mediates Na+ and Li+ halotolerance, ortholog of mammalian neutral sphingomyelinase type 2

name: MET2-1
description: L-homoserine-O-acetyltransferase, catalyzes the conversion of homoserine to O-acetyl homoserine which is the first step of the methionine biosynthetic pathway

name: NUC1
description: Nuclease with RNAse and DNA endo- and exonucleolytic activities, known in S. cerevisiae as major mitochondrial nuclease with roles in mitochondrial recombination, apoptosis and maintenance of polyploidy

name: PP7435_Chr4-0086
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0087
description: Protein with low similarity to ECM25, protein of unknown function

name: RCY1
description: F-box protein involved in recycling plasma membrane proteins internalized by endocytosis, known in S. cerevisiae as protein localized to sites of polarized growth

name: PP7435_Chr4-0089
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0090
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: MDL1
description: Half-type ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial inner membrane that mediates export of peptides generated upon proteolysis of mitochondrial proteins, plays a role in the regulation of cellular resistance to oxidative stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0092
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Mediator complex subunit Med5)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0093
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: GAL4)

name: AFG3
description: Inner membrane m-AAA protease component, mediates degradation of misfolded or unassembled proteins, also required for correct assembly of mitochondrial enzyme complexes, involved in cytoplasmic mRNA translation and aging, expression of human homolog AFG3L2 can complement yeast yta12 afg3 double mutant, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: BIM1
description: Microtubule plus end-tracking protein, together with Kar9p makes up the cortical microtubule capture site and delays the exit from mitosis when the spindle is oriented abnormally, homolog of human end binding protein 1 (EB1)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0097
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: C2H2 Zn finger)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0098
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: DUF2458)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0099
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: HMGB-UBF_HMG-box, class II and III members of the HMG-box superfamily of DNA-binding proteins), enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: APM1
description: Mu1-like medium subunit of the clathrin-associated protein complex (AP-1), binds clathrin, involved in clathrin-dependent Golgi protein sorting, enriched in Golgi

name: PP7435_Chr4-0101
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CUE2
description: Protein of unknown function, has two CUE domains that bind ubiquitin, which may facilitate intramolecular monoubiquitination

name: GID7
description: Subunit of GID Complex that binds directly to central component Vid30p, GID complex is involved in proteasome-dependent catabolite inactivation of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase, Gid7p contains six WD40 repeats, computational analysis suggests that Gid7p and Moh1p have similar functions

name: GLG1
description: Glycogenin glucosyltransferase, self-glucosylating initiator of glycogen synthesis, also glucosylates n-dodecyl-beta-D-maltoside, similar to mammalian glycogenin, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GLG2

name: CDC10
description: Component of the septin ring, required for cytokinesis, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria, septins are GTP-binding proteins that assemble into rod-like hetero-oligomers that can associate to form filaments, septin rings at the mother-bud neck act as scaffolds for recruiting cell division factors and as barriers to prevent diffusion of specific proteins between mother and daughter cells, N-terminus interacts with phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases under DNA damage stress

name: MRPL32
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PDI1
description: Protein disulfide isomerase, multifunctional protein of the ER lumen, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae for formation of disulfide bonds in secretory and cell-surface proteins, unscrambles non-native disulfide bonds, key regulator of Ero1p, forms complex with Mnl1p that has exomannosidase activity, processing unfolded protein-bound Man8GlcNAc2 oligosaccharides to Man7GlcNAc2, promoting degradation in unfolded protein response, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EUG1

name: MXR2-2
description: Methionine-S-sulfoxide reductase, involved in the response to oxidative stress, protects iron-sulfur clusters from oxidative inactivation along with the Methionine-S-sulfoxide reductase MXR1, involved in the regulation of lifespan

name: GLO1
description: Monomeric glyoxalase I, catalyzes the detoxification of methylglyoxal (a by-product of glycolysis) via condensation with glutathione to produce S-D-lactoylglutathione, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by methylglyoxal levels and osmotic stress

name: LSB5
description: Protein involved in membrane-trafficking events at plasma membrane, interacts with actin regulators Sla1p and Las17p, ubiquitin, Arf3p to couple actin dynamics to membrane trafficking processes, similar structure to GGA family of proteins with N-terminal VHS domain and GAT domain, binds Las17p, which is homolog of human Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome protein involved in actin patch assembly, actin polymerization, may mediate disassembly of Pan1 complex from endocytic coat, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: GRX2
description: Glutaredoxin, thioltransferase, glutathione-dependent disulfide oxidoreductase involved in maintaining redox state of target proteins, also exhibits glutathione peroxidase activity, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein whose expression is induced in response to stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GRX1

name: GAL10
description: UDP-glucose-4-epimerase, catalyzes the interconversion of UDP-galactose and UDP-D-glucose in galactose metabolism, also catalyzes the conversion of alpha-D-glucose or alpha-D-galactose to their beta-anomers

name: PP7435_Chr4-0113
description: Protein with low similarity to DUF602 domain-containing proteins

name: TPO4
description: Polyamine transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, member of the 12-spanner drug:H(+) antiporter DHA1 family, recognizes spermine, putrescine, and spermidine, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein

name: PET18-2
description: Protein of unknown function, has weak similarity to proteins involved in thiamin metabolism, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced in the absence of thiamin

name: RCE1
description: Type II CAAX prenyl protease involved in the proteolysis and maturation of Ras and the a-factor mating pheromone

name: ZDS1
description: Protein with a role in regulating Swe1p-dependent polarized growth, involved in maintaining Cdc55p in the cytoplasm where it promotes mitotic entry, involved in mitotic exit through Cdc14p regulation, interacts with silencing proteins at telomeres, has a role in Bcy1p localization, implicated in mRNA nuclear export, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ZDS2

name: YLH47
description: Protein exposed to the mitochondrial matrix, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane which associates with mitochondrial ribosomes, NOT required for respiratory growth, homolog of human Letm1, a protein implicated in Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome

name: PDR12
description: ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, weak-acid-inducible multidrug transporter required for weak organic acid resistance, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein induced by sorbate and benzoate and regulated by War1p, S. cerevisiae mutants exhibit sorbate hypersensitivity

name: UTP22
description: Component of the small-subunit processome, required for nuclear export of tRNAs, may facilitate binding of Utp8p to aminoacylated tRNAs and their delivery to Los1p for export, conserved from yeast to mammals, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: BNA4
description: Kynurenine 3-mono oxygenase, required for the de novo biosynthesis of NAD from tryptophan via kynurenine, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by Hst1p, putative therapeutic target for Huntington disease, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in vacuole methanol-grown cells

name: MRX3
description: Protein that associates with mitochondrial ribosome, likely functions in cristae junction formation, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: ITR100
description: Putative sugar transporter, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr4-0125
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: COG5022)

name: RPC40
description: RNA polymerase subunit AC40, common to RNA polymerase I and III, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0127
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1746)

name: COS111
description: Protein required for resistance to the antifungal drug ciclopirox olamine, not related to the subtelomerically-encoded COS family, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: FMS1-2
description: Polyamine oxidase, converts spermine to spermidine, which is required for the essential hypusination modification of translation factor eIF-5A, also involved in pantothenic acid biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: AOX1
description: Pichia pastoris alcohol oxidase, enriched in cytosol

name: GFD2
description: Protein of unknown function, identified in S. cerevisiae as a high-copy suppressor of a dbp5 mutation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YDR514C

name: COQ1
description: Hexaprenyl pyrophosphate synthetase, catalyzes the first step in ubiquinone (coenzyme Q) biosynthesis

name: RER2
description: Cis-prenyltransferase involved in dolichol synthesis, known in S. cerevisiae as major enzyme of polyprenol synthesis in both the ER and in lipid droplets

name: YRB1
description: Ran GTPase binding protein, involved in nuclear protein import and RNA export, ubiquitin-mediated protein degradation during the cell cycle, shuttles between the nucleus and cytoplasm, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae YRB1 is essential, homolog of human RanBP1

name: NTH1
description: Neutral trehalase, degrades trehalose, required for thermotolerance and may mediate resistance to other cellular stresses, may be phosphorylated by Cdc28p, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NTH2

name: MDH3
description: Malate dehydrogenase, catalyzes interconversion of malate and oxaloacetate, involved in the glyoxylate cycle, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in peroxisome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein

name: RPL25
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L25, primary rRNA-binding ribosomal protein component of large ribosomal subunit, binds to 25S rRNA via a conserved C-terminal motif, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L23A and bacterial L23, enriched among several compartments

name: MRPS18
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the small subunit, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae for viability, unlike most other mitoribosomal proteins

name: MCK1
description: Dual-specificity ser/thr and tyrosine protein kinase, roles in chromosome segregation, meiotic entry, genome stability, phosphorylation-dependent protein degradation (Rcn1p and Cdc6p), inhibition of protein kinase A, transcriptional regulation, inhibition of RNA pol III, calcium stress and inhibition of Clb2p-Cdc28p after nuclear division, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YGK3

name: PP7435_Chr4-0141
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF4210, Chromosome segregation)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0143
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Mpv17 / PMP22 family)

name: NCP1
description: NADP-cytochrome P450 reductase, involved in ergosterol biosynthesis, associated and coordinately regulated with Erg11p, enriched among several compartments

name: PRP42
description: U1 snRNP protein involved in splicing, required for U1 snRNP biogenesis, contains multiple tetriatricopeptide repeats

name: PP7435_Chr4-0146
description: Protein with low similarity to FMC1, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix protein required for assembly or stability at high temperature of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase

name: RPF1
description: Protein involved in assembly and export of the large ribosomal subunit, nucleolar protein, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, contains a sigma(70)-like motif, which is thought to bind RNA

name: PP7435_Chr4-0148
description: Protein with similarity to YDL206W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae YDL206W is not an essential protein)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0149
description: Protein with similarity to YPR114W, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: FMN1
description: Riboflavin kinase, produces riboflavin monophosphate (FMN), FMN is a necessary cofactor for many enzymes, known in in S. cerevisiae to the microsomal fraction and also found in the mitochondrial inner membrane

name: GLE1
description: Nucleoporin required for polyadenylated mRNA export, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, contains a nuclear export signal, when bound to inositol hexakisphosphate (IP6), functions as an activator for the Dbp5p ATPase activity at the nuclear pore complex during mRNA export, mediates translation initiation, required for efficient translation termination

name: MRPL7
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, MRPL7 produces both YmL5 and YmL7, which are two different modified forms of the same protein, enriched in mitochondria

name: SEC26
description: Essential beta-coat protein, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the COPI coatomer, involved in ER-to-Golgi protein trafficking and maintenance of normal ER morphology, shares 43% sequence identity with mammalian beta-coat protein (beta-COP)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0154
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NHP2
description: Protein related to mammalian high mobility group (HMG) proteins, nuclear protein, essential in S. cerevisiae for function of H/ACA-type snoRNPs, which are involved in 18S rRNA processing

name: LYS4
description: Homoaconitase, catalyzes the conversion of homocitrate to homoisocitrate, which is a step in the lysine biosynthesis pathway, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: PEX14
description: Component of the peroxisomal importomer complex, PTS-receptor docking complex component, interacts with many peroxins like Pex3p, Pex5p, Pex7p, Pex13p and Pex17p, enriched in peroxisome, microsome and Golgi

name: PP7435_Chr4-0158
description: Protein with low similarity to L-aminoadipate-semialdehyde dehydrogenases

name: HEM25
description: Glycine transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, required for the transport of glycine into mitochondria for initiation of heme biosynthesis, with YMC1 acting as a secondary transporter, homolog of human SLC25A38, a mitochondrial glycine transporter associated with nonsyndromic autosomal recessive congenital sideroblastic anemia, human SLC25A38 can complement the heme deficiency associated with the S. cerevisiae null mutant, in S. cerevisiae GFP-fusion protein is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS

name: CDC43
description: Beta subunit of geranylgeranyltransferase type I, catalyzes geranylgeranylation to the cysteine residue in proteins containing a C-terminal CaaX sequence ending in Leu or Phe, has substrates important for morphogenesis

name: AMS1
description: Vacuolar alpha mannosidase, involved in free oligosaccharide (fOS) degradation, delivered to the vacuole in a novel pathway separate from the secretory pathway, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: PBI2
description: Cytosolic inhibitor of vacuolar proteinase B (PRB1), required for efficient vacuole inheritance, with thioredoxin forms protein complex LMA1, which assists in priming SNARE molecules and promotes vacuole fusion, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress (NCBI: Subtilisin E), enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0163
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: URA7
description: Major CTP synthase isozyme (see also URA8), catalyzes the ATP-dependent transfer of the amide nitrogen from glutamine to UTP, forming CTP, the final step in de novo biosynthesis of pyrimidines, involved in phospholipid biosynthesis, capable of forming cytoplasmic filaments termed cytoophidium, especially during conditions of glucose depletion, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog URA8

name: VPS25
description: Component of the ESCRT-II complex, which is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome

name: PP7435_Chr4-0166
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Centromere protein H, CENP-H)

name: RSM26
description: Ribosomal protein of the small subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: AIM25
description: Protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, interacts genetically with TOR1 to regulate chronological lifespan, and the response to both heat shock and oxidative stress, involved in maintaining the integrity of the mitochondrial network, negative regulator of mitophagy flux, in S. cerevisiae the non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, null mutant is viable and displays an elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss, similar to murine NOR1

name: SOD1
description: Cytosolic copper-zinc superoxide dismutase, detoxifies superoxide and is involved in repressing respiration in the presence of glucose, via stabilization of Yck1p and Yck2p kinases, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, some mutations in S. cerevisiae are analogous to those that cause ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis) in humans, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and in response to prolonged exposure to boric acid

name: GLN1
description: Glutamine synthetase (GS), synthesizes glutamine from glutamate and ammonia, with Glt1p, forms the secondary pathway for glutamate biosynthesis from ammonia, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein whose expression is regulated by nitrogen source and by amino acid limitation and the protein relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: AQY3
description: Putative channel-like protein, similar to Fps1p, mediates passive diffusion of glycerol in the presence of ethanol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0172
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: GUT1
description: Glycerol kinase, converts glycerol to glycerol-3-phosphate, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, glucose repression of expression in S. cerevisiae is mediated by Adr1p and Ino2p-Ino4p, derepression of expression on non-fermentable carbon sources is mediated by Opi1p and Rsf1p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0174
description: Protein with low similarity to pre-mRNA-splicing factor 38A of Ogataea parapolymorpha

name: SMD1
description: Core Sm protein Sm D1, part of heteroheptameric complex (with Smb1p, Smd2p, Smd3p, Sme1p, Smx3p, and Smx2p) that is part of the spliceosomal U1, U2, U4, and U5 snRNPs, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, homolog of human Sm D1, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: TSC13
description: Enoyl reductase, catalyzes the last step in each cycle of very long chain fatty acid elongation, enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae highly enriched in a structure marking nuclear-vacuolar junctions, coimmunoprecipitates with elongases Fen1p and Sur4p, and protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to ER foci increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0177
description: Protein with similarity to YOR389W (Putative protein of unknown function, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by copper levels)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0178
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: translation initiation factor IF-2, infB)

name: ELP2
description: Subunit of Elongator complex, which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA, target of Kluyveromyces lactis zymocin, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PMT6
description: Protein O-mannosyltransferase, transfers mannose from dolichyl phosphate-D-mannose to protein serine/threonine residues of secretory proteins, reaction is essential in S. cerevisiae for cell wall rigidity, member of a family of mannosyltransferases, enriched among several compartments

name: PRE7
description: Beta 6 subunit of the 20S proteasome, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: ERD2
description: HDEL receptor, known in S. cerevisiae as ER integral membrane protein, binds to the HDEL motif in proteins destined for retention in the ER, has a role in maintenance of normal levels of ER-resident proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0183
description: Protein with low similarity to protein disulfide isomerases

name: PP7435_Chr4-0184
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0185
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: modifier of rudimentary (Mod(r)) proteins, include the Vps37 subunit of the endosomal sorting complex ESCRT-I)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0186
description: Protein with similarity to YJR084W (Protein that forms a complex with Thp3p, may have a role in transcription elongation and/or mRNA splicing, identified as a COP9 signalosome component but phenotype and interactions suggest it may not be involved with the signalosome)

name: TIF5
description: Translation initiation factor eIF5, functions both as a GTPase-activating protein to mediate hydrolysis of ribosome-bound GTP and as a GDP dissociation inhibitor to prevent recycling of eIF2, enriched in cytosol

name: VMA13
description: Subunit H of the eight-subunit V1 peripheral membrane domain of the vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase), an electrogenic proton pump found throughout the endomembrane system, serves as an activator or a structural stabilizer of the V-ATPase, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi and vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: BIR1
description: Subunit of chromosomal passenger complex (CPC), CPC is comprised of Ipl1p-Sli15p-Bir1p-Nbl1p and regulates chromosome segregation, required for chromosome bi-orientation and for spindle assembly checkpoint activation upon reduced sister kinetochore tension, relative distribution to shortened microtubules increases upon DNA replication stress

name: GRR1
description: F-box protein component of an SCF ubiquitin-ligase complex, modular substrate specificity factor which associates with core SCF (Cdc53p, Skp1p and Hrt1p/Rbx1p) to form the SCF(Grr1) complex, SCF(Grr1) acts as a ubiquitin-protein ligase directing ubiquitination of substrates such as: Gic2p, Mks1p, Mth1p, Cln1p, Cln2p and Cln3p, involved in carbon catabolite repression, glucose-dependent divalent cation transport, glucose transport, morphogenesis, and sulfite detoxification

name: JSN1
description: Member of the Puf family of RNA-binding proteins, interacts with mRNAs encoding membrane-associated proteins, involved in localizing the Arp2/3 complex to mitochondria, overexpression in S. cerevisiae causes increased sensitivity to benomyl, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PUF2

name: PP7435_Chr4-0192
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: STE18
description: G protein gamma subunit, forms a dimer with Ste4p to activate the mating signaling pathway, forms a heterotrimer with Gpa1p and Ste4p to dampen signaling, C-terminus is palmitoylated and farnesylated, which are required for normal signaling

name: EMC2
description: Member of conserved ER transmembrane complex, required for efficient folding of proteins in the ER, enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays induction of the unfolded protein response, homologous to worm Y57G7A.10/EMC-2, fly CG17556, human TTC35

name: PRP19
description: Splicing factor associated with the spliceosome, contains a U-box, a motif found in a class of ubiquitin ligases, and a WD40 domain, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: ENT4
description: Protein of unknown function, contains an N-terminal epsin-like domain, proposed to be involved in the trafficking of Arn1p in the absence of ferrichrome

name: UBI4
description: Ubiquitin, becomes conjugated to proteins, marking them for selective degradation via the ubiquitin-26S proteasome system, in S. cerevisiae essential for the cellular stress response, encoded as a polyubiquitin precursor comprised of 5 head-to-tail repeats and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ECM29
description: Scaffold protein, assists in association of the proteasome core particle with the regulatory particle, degraded by the mature proteasome after assembly, contains HEAT-like repeats, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that increases in abundance and relocalizes to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: RRN3
description: Protein required for transcription of rDNA by RNA polymerase I, transcription factor independent of DNA template, involved in recruitment of RNA polymerase I to rDNA, structure reveals unique HEAT repeat fold and a surface serine patch, phosphorylation of serine patch impairs cell growth and reduces RNA polymerase I binding in vitro and RNA polymerase I recruitment to the rDNA gene in vivo

name: PEX12
description: C3HC4-type RING-finger peroxin and E3 ubiquitin ligase, required for peroxisome biogenesis and peroxisomal matrix protein import, forms translocation subcomplex with Pex2p and Pex10p, mutations in human homolog cause peroxisomal disorder

name: TVP38
description: Integral membrane protein known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the late Golgi vesicles along with the v-SNARE Tlg2p, required for asymmetric localization of Kar9p during mitosis, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm in a punctate pattern

name: PXL1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as protein that localizes to sites of polarized growth, required for selection and/or maintenance of polarized growth sites, may modulate signaling by the GTPases Cdc42p and Rho1p, contains LIM domains and has similarity to metazoan paxillin, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0203
description: Protein with similarity to YNL134C (Protein of unknown function, similar to dehydrogenases from other model organisms, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and nucleus and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: PKP1-3
description: Kinase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein involved in negative regulation of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex activity by phosphorylating the ser-133 residue of the Pda1p subunit, acts in concert with kinase Pkp2p and phosphatases Ptc5p and Ptc6p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0205
description: Protein with low similarity to mitochondrial proteins

name: SOU1-2
description: Dehydrogenase of unknown substrate specificity, similar to SOU1 of Candida albicans which convert L-sorbose to D-sorbitol but Pichia pastoris can not grow on sorbose, enriched in cytosol

name: SOU1-1
description: Dehydrogenase of unknown substrate specificity, similar to SOU1 of Candida albicans which convert L-sorbose to D-sorbitol but Pichia pastoris can not grow on sorbose, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0208
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SLD2
description: Single-stranded DNA origin-binding and annealing protein, required for the initiation of DNA replication, phosphorylated in S phase by cyclin-dependent kinases (Cdks), promoting origin binding, DNA replication and Dpb11p complex formation, component of the preloading complex, unphosphorylated or CDK-phosphorylated Sld2p binds to the MCM2-7 complex, required for the S phase checkpoint, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: YKU80
description: Subunit of the telomeric Ku complex (Yku70p-Yku80p), involved in telomere length maintenance, structure and telomere position effect, relocates to sites of double-strand cleavage to promote nonhomologous end joining during DSB repair

name: PP7435_Chr4-0211
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ATX2
description: Membrane protein involved in manganese homeostasis, known in S. cerevisiae as Golgi protein whose overproduction suppresses the sod1 (copper, zinc superoxide dismutase) null mutation

name: DAD4
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the Dam1 complex (aka DASH complex), couples kinetochores to the force produced by MT depolymerization thereby aiding in chromosome segregation, is transferred to the kinetochore prior to mitosis

name: SWA2
description: Auxilin-like protein involved in vesicular transport, clathrin-binding protein required for uncoating of clathrin-coated vesicles

name: TFB1
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes, required for nucleotide excision repair, target for transcriptional activators, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: COA1
description: Mitochondrial inner membrane protein required for assembly of the cytochrome c oxidase complex (complex IV), interacts with complex IV assembly factor Shy1p during the early stages of assembly, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: ODE2
description: Omega-3 fatty acid desaturase of Pichia pastoris, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, previously known in Pichia pastoris as FAD3

name: NOP9
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of U3-containing 90S preribosome involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit, also part of pre-40S ribosome and required for its export into cytoplasm, binds RNA and contains pumilio domain, enriched in cytosol

name: BET4
description: Alpha subunit of Type II geranylgeranyltransferase required for vesicular transport between the ER and the Golgi, provides a membrane attachment moiety to Rab-like proteins Ypt1p and Sec4p

name: CTK2
description: Beta subunit of C-terminal domain kinase I (CTDK-I), which phosphorylates both RNA pol II subunit Rpo21p to affect transcription and pre-mRNA 3' end processing, and ribosomal protein Rps2p to increase translational fidelity, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: MRP8
description: Protein of unknown function, undergoes sumoylation, transcription induced under cell wall stress, protein levels are reduced under anaerobic conditions, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, originally thought to be a mitochondrial ribosomal protein based on sequence analysis

name: NNR2
description: Widely-conserved NADHX dehydratase, converts (S)-NADHX to NADH in ATP-dependent manner, YKL151C promoter contains STREs (stress response elements) and expression is induced in S. cerevisiae by heat shock or methyl methanesulfonate, downstream intergenic region drives antisense expression and mediates coordinated regulation of YKL151C and GPM1 phosphoglycerate mutase, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, homolog of Carkd in mammals and C-terminus of YjeF in E.coli

name: MCR1
description: NADH-cytochrome b5 reductase, involved in ergosterol biosynthesis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: DBR1
description: RNA lariat debranching enzyme, involved in intron turnover, required for efficient Ty1 transposition

name: RPT1
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of six ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in the degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, required for optimal CDC20 transcription, interacts with Rpn12p and Ubr1p, enriched among several compartments, S. cerevisiae mutant has aneuploidy tolerance

name: RPC25
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C25, required for transcription initiation, forms a heterodimer with Rpc17p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPB7

name: PUF6
description: Pumilio-homology domain protein that binds the 3' UTR of ASH1 mRNA and represses its translation, resulting in proper asymmetric localization of ASH1 mRNA, also co-sediments with the 60S ribosomal subunit and is required for its biogenesis, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SDH1
description: Flavoprotein subunit of succinate dehydrogenase, couples the oxidation of succinate to the transfer of electrons to ubiquinone as part of the TCA cycle and the mitochondrial respiratory chain, FAD binding to Sdh1p is required for the assembly of the succinate dehydrogenase subunits, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YJL045W

name: CCC2-2
description: Cu(+2)-transporting P-type ATPase, required for export of copper from the cytosol into an extracytosolic compartment, has similarity to human proteins involved in Menkes and Wilsons diseases, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, affects TBSV model (+)RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

name: PTC1
description: Type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C), dephosphorylates Hog1p, inactivating osmosensing MAPK cascade, involved in Fus3p activation during pheromone response, in S. cerevisiae deletion affects precursor tRNA splicing, mitochondrial inheritance, and sporulation

name: RPT2
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of six ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in the degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, required for normal peptide hydrolysis by the core 20S particle, N-myristoylation of Rpt2p at Gly2 is involved in regulating the proper intracellular distribution of proteasome activity by controlling the nuclear localization of the 26S proteasome, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: INM2
description: Inositol monophosphatase, involved in biosynthesis of inositol, enzymatic activity requires magnesium ions and is inhibited by lithium and sodium ions, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, S. cerevisiae inm1 inm2 double mutant lacks inositol auxotrophy

name: BMT2
description: S-adenosylmethionine-dependent rRNA methyltransferase, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein that methylates adenine (m1A) of the large subunit (LSU) rRNA at position 2142, belongs to Rossmann fold superfamily, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleolus and YBR141C is not an essential gene

name: MAK5
description: Nucleolar protein, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae, putative DEAD-box RNA helicase required for maintenance of M1 dsRNA virus, involved in biogenesis of large (60S) ribosomal subunits

name: SUP45
description: Polypeptide release factor (eRF1) in translation termination, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol, S. cerevisiae mutant form acts as a recessive omnipotent suppressor, methylated by Mtq2p-Trm112p in ternary complex eRF1-eRF3-GTP, mutation of methylation site confers resistance to zymocin, has a role in cytokinesis through interaction with Mlc1p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0236
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: F-box-like, RNI-like)

name: BXI1
