description: Protein involved in apoptosis, variously described as containing a BCL-2 homology (BH3) domain or as a member of the BAX inhibitor family, reported to promote apoptosis under some conditions and to inhibit it in others, known in S. cerevisiae as ER and vacuolar protein, may link the unfolded protein response to apoptosis via regulation of calcium-mediated signaling, translocates to mitochondria under apoptosis-inducing conditions in a process involving Mir1p and Cor1p

name: TRX3
description: Mitochondrial thioredoxin, highly conserved oxidoreductase required to maintain the redox homeostasis of the cell, forms the mitochondrial thioredoxin system with Trr2p, redox state is maintained by both Trr2p and Glr1p, enriched in mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr4-0239
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0240
description: Hypothetical protein conserved, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: YDB2
description: Putative RNA-binding protein, partial similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis YDB2

name: TRS65
description: Component of transport protein particle (TRAPP) complex II, TRAPPII is a multimeric guanine nucleotide-exchange factor for the GTPase Ypt1p, regulating intra-Golgi and endosome-Golgi traffic, role in cell wall beta-glucan biosynthesis and the stress response

name: MBF1
description: Transcriptional coactivator, bridges the DNA-binding region of Gcn4p and TATA-binding protein Spt15p, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, suppressor in S. cerevisiae of frameshift mutations, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: RNA1
description: GTPase activating protein (GAP) for Gsp1p, involved in nuclear transport, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0245
description: Protein with low similarity to MUM3, protein of unknown function involved in outer spore wall organization

name: MRD1
description: Conserved small ribosomal subunit (40s) synthesis factor, component of the 90S preribosome, required for production of 18S rRNA and small ribosomal subunit, contains five consensus RNA-binding domains and binds to the pre-rRNA at two sites within the 18S region, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: NOP7
description: Component of several different pre-ribosomal particles, forms a complex with Ytm1p and Erb1p that is required for maturation of the large ribosomal subunit, required for exit from G<sub>0</sub> and the initiation of cell proliferation, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: GTF1
description: Subunit of the trimeric GatFAB AmidoTransferase(AdT) complex, involved in the formation of Q-tRNAQ, in S. cerevisiae the transposon insertion mutant is salt sensitive, the null mutant has growth defects and the non-tagged protein is detected in purified mitochondria

name: PCP1
description: Serine protease known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein required for the processing of various mitochondrial proteins and maintenance of mitochondrial DNA and morphology, belongs to the rhomboid-GlpG superfamily of intramembrane peptidases

name: PP7435_Chr4-0250
description: Protein with low similarity to mediator of RNA polymerase II transcription subunit 18

name: ALG3
description: Dolichol-P-Man dependent alpha(1-3) mannosyltransferase, involved in the synthesis of dolichol-linked oligosaccharide donor for N-linked glycosylation of proteins

name: FLO8
description: Transcription factor required for flocculation, diploid filamentous growth, and haploid invasive growth, genome reference strain S288C and most S. cerevisiae laboratory strains have a nonsense mutation in this gene

name: GLE2
description: RNA export factor associated with the nuclear pore complex (NPC), associates with NUP116p, required for polyadenylated RNA export but not for protein import, homologous to S. pombe Rae1p and human RAE1, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: ILS1
description: Cytoplasmic isoleucine-tRNA synthetase, target of the G1-specific inhibitor reveromycin A, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0255
description: Protein with low similarity to tRNA(Ile)-lysidine synthetase

name: AAR2
description: Component of the U5 snRNP, required for splicing of U3 precursors, originally described as a splicing factor specifically required for splicing pre-mRNA of the MATa1 cistron

name: PET112
description: Subunit of the trimeric GatFAB AmidoTransferase(AdT) complex, involved in the formation of Q-tRNAQ, mutation in S. cerevisiae is functionally complemented by the bacterial GatB ortholog

name: ATG8
description: Component of autophagosomes and Cvt vesicles, ubiquitin-like protein, its phosphatidylethanolamine (PE) conjugated form is anchored to the autophagosomal membrane during autophagy, in P. pastoris is responsible for the vacuolar fusion during adaptation to methanol and its lipidation status seems required for vacuolar fusion but not for autophagy

name: HIS7
description: Imidazole glycerol phosphate synthase (glutamine amidotransferase:cyclase), catalyzes the fifth step of histidine biosynthesis and also produces 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribotide (AICAR), a purine precursor, enriched in cytosol

name: SRM1
description: Nucleotide exchange factor for Gsp1p, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, required for nucleocytoplasmic trafficking of macromolecules, suppressor of the pheromone response pathway, potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p

name: ENP1
description: Protein associated with U3 and U14 snoRNAs, required for pre-rRNA processing and 40S ribosomal subunit synthesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, specifically concentrated in the nucleolus

name: PLC1
description: Phospholipase C, hydrolyzes phosphatidylinositol 4,5-biphosphate (PIP2) to generate the signaling molecules inositol 1,4,5-triphosphate (IP3) and 1,2-diacylglycerol (DAG), involved in regulating many cellular processes

name: PP7435_Chr4-0263
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0264
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: RPC34
description: RNA polymerase III subunit C34, interacts with TFIIIB70 and is a key determinant in pol III recruitment by the preinitiation complex

name: PP7435_Chr4-0266
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0267
description: Protein with low similarity to late-stage biofilm-induced proteins

name: EXO70
description: Subunit of the exocyst complex, the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis prior to SNARE-mediated fusion, PtdIns[4,5]P2-binding protein that localizes to exocytic sites in an actin-independent manner, targeting and anchoring the exocyst with Sec3p, involved in exocyst assembly, direct downstream effector of Rho3p and Cdc42p, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the bud neck that relocalizes fo cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: ALY2
description: Alpha arrestin that controls nutrient-mediated intracellular sorting of permease Gap1p, interacts with AP-1 subunit Apl4p, phosphorylated by Npr1p and also by cyclin-CDK complex Pcl7p-Pho85p, promotes endocytosis of plasma membrane proteins, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ALY1

name: VPS51
description: Component of the GARP (Golgi-associated retrograde protein) complex, Vps51p-Vps52p-Vps53p-Vps54p, which is required for the recycling of proteins from endosomes to the late Golgi, links the (VFT/GARP) complex to the SNARE Tlg1p

name: SPR1
description: Sporulation-specific exo-1,3-beta-glucanase, contributes to ascospore thermoresistance, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog EXG1

name: AIM22
description: Putative lipoate-protein ligase, required along with Lip2 and Lip5 for lipoylation of Lat1p and Kgd2p, similar to E. coli LplA, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays reduced frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: POP4
description: Subunit of both RNase MRP and nuclear RNase P, RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, while nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, binds to the RPR1 RNA subunit in RNase P

name: PP7435_Chr4-0274
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RKM1
description: SET-domain lysine-N-methyltransferase, catalyzes the formation of dimethyllysine residues on the large ribsomal subunit proteins L23a (Rpl23Ap and Rpl23Bp) and L18 (Rps18Ap and Rps18Bp), enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells

name: RPP1B
description: Ribosomal protein P1 beta, component of the ribosomal stalk, which is involved in interaction of translational elongation factors with ribosome, accumulation is regulated by phosphorylation and interaction with the P2 stalk component, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SFC1
description: Mitochondrial succinate-fumarate transporter, transports succinate into and fumarate out of the mitochondrion, required for ethanol and acetate utilization, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane and microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0278
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0279
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CPS1
description: Carboxypeptidase S, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein whose expression is induced under low-nitrogen conditions

name: CAR1-2
description: Arginase, responsible for arginine degradation, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae responds to both induction by arginine and nitrogen catabolite repression, disruption enhances freeze tolerance

name: RGD1
description: GTPase-activating protein (RhoGAP) for Rho3p and Rho4p, possibly involved in control of actin cytoskeleton organization, enriched among several compartments

name: RAS1
description: GTPase involved in G-protein signaling in adenylate cyclase activation, plays a role in cell proliferation, enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae localized to the plasma membrane, homolog of mammalian RAS proto-oncogenes, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RAS2

name: PHO23
description: Component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex, involved in transcriptional regulation of PHO5, affects termination of snoRNAs and cryptic unstable transcripts (CUTs), C-terminus shares significant sequence identity with the human candidate tumor suppressor p33-ING1 and its isoform ING3

name: ACK1
description: Protein that functions upstream of Pkc1p in the cell wall integrity pathway, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein expression is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS and non-tagged Ack1p is detected in purified mitochondria

name: PP7435_Chr4-0289
description: Protein with similarity to YGR017W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the nucleus and the cytoplasm)

name: UGA1-1
description: Gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA) transaminase, also known as 4-aminobutyrate aminotransferase, involved in the 4-aminobutyrate and glutamate degradation pathways, required for normal oxidative stress tolerance and nitrogen utilization, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiaee increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0291
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Esterase/lipase, involved in lipid metabolism)

name: CHS5
description: Component of the exomer complex, which also contains Csh6p, Bch1p, Bch2p, and Bud7p and is involved in export of selected proteins, such as chitin synthase Chs3p, from the Golgi to the plasma membrane, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: VMA7
description: Subunit F of the eight-subunit V1 peripheral membrane domain of vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase), an electrogenic proton pump found throughout the endomembrane system, required for the V1 domain to assemble onto the vacuolar membrane, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: DPC29
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: MIN8
description: Putative protein of unknown function, enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae SWAT-GFP, seamless-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cytosol, conserved among Saccharomyces sensu stricto species

name: PP7435_Chr4-0296
description: Protein with similarity to YPR011C (Transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, major substrates are adenosine 5'-phosphosulfate (APS) and 3'-phospho-adenosine 5'-phosphosulfate (PAPS), member of the mitochondrial carrier family, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0297
description: Putative transfer RNA for Leucine (tRNA-Leu)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0298
description: Protein with low similarity to pre-mRNA-splicing factors

name: RPL11B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L11B, in S. cerevisiae expressed at half the level of Rpl11Ap, involved in ribosomal assembly and depletion causes degradation of 60S proteins and RNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L11 and bacterial L5, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL11A

name: PRE2
description: Beta 5 subunit of the 20S proteasome, responsible for the chymotryptic activity of the proteasome, enriched in cytosol

name: FHL1
description: Regulator of ribosomal protein (RP) transcription, has forkhead associated domain that binds phosphorylated proteins, recruits coactivator Ifh1p or corepressor Crf1p to RP gene promoters, also has forkhead DNA-binding domain though in vitro DNA binding assays give inconsistent results, computational analyses suggest it binds DNA directly at highly active RP genes and indirectly through Rap1p motifs at others, in S. cerevisiae suppresses RNA pol III and splicing factor prp4 mutants

name: UTP14
description: Subunit of U3-containing Small Subunit (SSU) processome complex involved in production of 18S rRNA and assembly of small ribosomal subunit

name: ISR1
description: Predicted protein kinase, overexpression in S. cerevisiae causes sensitivity to staurosporine, which is a potent inhibitor of protein kinase C

name: PRO2
description: Gamma-glutamyl phosphate reductase, catalyzes the second step in proline biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: SAM4
description: S-adenosylmethionine-homocysteine methyltransferase, functions along with Mht1p in the conversion of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet) to methionine to control the methionine/AdoMet ratio, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YMR321C

name: PP7435_Chr4-0306
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: DRS2
description: Trans-Golgi network aminophospholipid translocase (flippase), maintains membrane lipid asymmetry in post-Golgi secretory vesicles, contributes to clathrin-coated vesicle formation, endocytosis, protein trafficking between the Golgi and endosomal system and the cellular response to mating pheromone, autoinhibited by its C-terminal tail, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in methanol-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to the trans-Golgi network, mutations in human homolog ATP8B1 result in liver disease

name: MAK16
description: Essential nuclear protein in S. cerevisiae, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, required for maturation of 25S and 5.8S rRNAs, required for maintenance of M1 satellite double-stranded RNA of the L-A virus

name: PP7435_Chr4-0309
description: Protein with low similarity to biofilm-induced proteins (Candida sp)

name: SRB2
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, general transcription factor involved in telomere maintenance

name: NUR1
description: Protein involved in regulation of mitotic exit, dephosphorylation target of Cdc14p in anaphase, which promotes timely rDNA segregation and allows mitotic progression, interacts with Csm1p, Lrs4p, required for rDNA repeat stability, in S. cerevisiae the GFP-fusion protein localizes to the nuclear periphery, possible Cdc28p substrate and the null mutant causes increase in unequal sister-chromatid exchange

name: NUP53
description: FG-nucleoporin component of central core of nuclear pore complex (NPC), enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in microsome in methanol-grown cellsknown in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, also part of the NPC nuclear basket, contributes directly to nucleocytoplasmic transport, involved in regulation of transcription and mitosis, induces membrane tubulation, which may contribute to nuclear pore assembly, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ASM4

name: PP7435_Chr4-0313
description: Protein with similarity to YMR155W, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, identified as interacting with Hsp82p in a high-throughput two-hybrid screen)

name: NSE3
description: Component of the SMC5-SMC6 complex, this complex plays a key role in the removal of X-shaped DNA structures that arise between sister chromatids during DNA replication and repair, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MSN5
description: Karyopherin, involved in nuclear import and export of proteins, including import of replication protein A and export of Far1p and transcription factors Swi6p, Msn2p, and Pho4p, required for re-export of mature tRNAs after their retrograde import from the cytoplasm

name: OMS1
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as integral protein of the mitochondrial membrane, has a conserved methyltransferase motif, multicopy suppressor in S. cerevisiae of respiratory defects caused by OXA1 mutations

name: GPI11
description: Protein involved in a late step of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor assembly, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein involved in the addition of phosphoethanolamine to the multiply mannosylated GPI intermediate, human PIG-Fp is a functional homolog

name: PP7435_Chr4-0318
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF124, TRAP-like), enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SRP14
description: Signal recognition particle (SRP) subunit, interacts with the RNA component of SRP to form the Alu domain, which is the region of SRP responsible for arrest of nascent chain elongation during membrane targeting, homolog of mammalian SRP14, enriched in cytosol

name: UBX3
description: Clathrin-coated vesicle component, regulator of endocytosis, copurifies with the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex, UBX (ubiquitin regulatory X) domain-containing protein that interacts with Cdc48p, required for efficient clathrin-mediated endocytosis, ortholog of fission yeast Ucp10

name: SPE4
description: Spermine synthase, required for the biosynthesis of spermine and also involved in biosynthesis of pantothenic acid, enriched in cytosol

name: VNX1
description: Calcium/H+ antiporter, enriched in vacuole, known in S. cerevisiae as ER membrane protein, member of the calcium exchanger (CAX) family, potential Cdc28p substrate

name: ARG8
description: Acetylornithine aminotransferase, catalyzes the fourth step in the biosynthesis of the arginine precursor ornithine, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in methanol-grown cells

name: MRPL25
description: Ribosomal protein of the large subunit, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, mutation in S. cerevisiae confers increased replicative lifespan

name: RCE3
description: Endo-glucanase similar to R. oryzae RCE3 but Pichia pastoris sequence have 3 Fungal cellulose binding domains

name: PP7435_Chr4-0327
description: Protein with similarity to YNL320W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies)

name: MCD1
description: Essential alpha-kleisin subunit in S. cerevisiae of the cohesin complex, required for sister chromatid cohesion in mitosis and meiosis, apoptosis induces cleavage and translocation of a C-terminal fragment to mitochondria, expression peaks in S phase

name: NUP189
description: Putative nuclear pore complex subunit similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis NUP189

name: HAP3-2
description: Subunit of the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex, a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression, contains sequences contributing to both complex assembly and DNA binding

name: PP7435_Chr4-0331
description: Protein with low similarity to E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases

name: BNI1
description: Formin, nucleates the formation of linear actin filaments, involved in cell processes such as budding and mitotic spindle orientation which require the formation of polarized actin cables, functionally redundant with BNR1

name: VTA1
description: Multivesicular body (MVB) protein involved in endosomal protein sorting, regulates Vps4p activity by promoting its oligomerization, has an N-terminal Vps60- and Did2- binding domain, a linker region, and a C-terminal Vps4p binding domain

name: SWI6
description: Transcription cofactor, forms complexes with Swi4p and Mbp1p to regulate transcription at the G1/S transition, involved in meiotic gene expression, also binds Stb1p to regulate transcription at START, in S. cerevisiae cell wall stress induces phosphorylation by Mpk1p, which regulates Swi6p localization, required for the unfolded protein response, independently of its known transcriptional coactivators

name: SKG3
description: Protein of unknown function, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in microsome in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery, cytoplasm, bud, and bud neck, potential Cdc28p substrate, similar to Skg4p, relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CAF120

name: PP7435_Chr4-0336
description: Protein with low similarity to FUS1, membrane protein required for cell fusion

name: PP7435_Chr4-0337
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0338
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0339
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Rdx superfamily involved in quality control of protein folding)

name: RGD2
description: GTPase-activating protein (RhoGAP) for Cdc42p and Rho5p, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0341
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: HSP12
description: Membrane protein involved in maintaining membrane organization in stress conditions, induced by heat shock, oxidative stress, osmostress, stationary phase, glucose depletion, oleate and alcohol, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress and dietary restriction, regulated by the HOG and Ras-Pka pathways, required for dietary restriction-induced lifespan extension

name: GAT1
description: Transcriptional activator of genes involved in nitrogen catabolite repression, contains a GATA-1-type zinc finger DNA-binding motif, activity and localization in S. cerevisiae regulated by nitrogen limitation and Ure2p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0344
description: Protein with low similarity to OSW2, protein of unknown function reputedly involved in spore wall assembly

name: GLK1
description: Glucokinase, catalyzes the phosphorylation of glucose at C6 in the first irreversible step of glucose metabolism, one of three glucose phosphorylating enzymes, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by non-fermentable carbon sources, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EMI2

name: TUB3
description: Alpha-tubulin, associates with beta-tubulin (Tub2p) to form tubulin dimer, which polymerizes to form microtubules, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, expressed in S. cerevisiae at lower level than Tub1p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog TUB1

name: PEX17
description: Membrane peroxin, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein required for import of both peroxisome membrane and lumenal proteins, interacts with Pex19 and the peroxisome targeting signal-receptor docking complex, required for peroxisome biogenesis

name: AOC1-2
description: Lysyl oxidase of Pichia pastoris, previously published in Pichia pastoris as PPLO, similar to human amine oxidase copper-containing AOC1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0350
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: T5orf172)

name: FTH1-2
description: Putative high affinity iron transporter, involved in transport of intravacuolar stores of iron, forms complex with Fet5p, expression is regulated by iron, proposed to play indirect role in endocytosis, enriched in vacuole, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MYO3
description: One of two type I myosins, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cortical actin patches and deletion of MYO3 has little effect on growth, but myo3 myo5 double deletion causes severe defects in growth and actin cytoskeleton organization, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MYO5

name: KIP3-4
description: Kinesin-related motor protein involved in mitotic spindle positioning

name: YRB2
description: Protein of unknown function, involved in nuclear processes of the Ran-GTPase cycle, involved in nuclear protein export, contains Ran Binding Domain and FxFG repeats, interacts with Srm1p, GTP-Gsp1p, Rna1p and Crm1p, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, not essential for viability

name: EFM4
description: Lysine methyltransferase, involved in the dimethylation of eEF1A (Tef1p/Tef2p) at lysine 316, sequence similarity to S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferases of the seven beta-strand family, role in vesicular transport

name: CCZ1
description: Subunit of a heterodimeric guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF), subunit of the Mon1-Ccz1 GEF complex, which stimulates nucleotide exchange and activation of Ypt7p, a Rab family GTPase involved in membrane tethering and fusion events at the late endosome and vacuole, GEF activity is stimulated by membrane association and anionic phospholipids, involved in localizing Ypt7p to the vacuolar membrane, required for macroautophagy, the CVT pathway and mitophagy, in Pichia pastoris Ccz1, Mon1 and Ypz7 are also required for the degradration of methanol-induced peroxisomes by micro- and macro-pexophagy

name: ADE12
description: Adenylosuccinate synthase, catalyzes the first step in synthesis of adenosine monophosphate from inosine 5'monophosphate during purine nucleotide biosynthesis, exhibits binding to single-stranded autonomously replicating (ARS) core sequence, enriched in cytosol

name: MSS2
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as peripherally bound inner membrane protein of the mitochondrial matrix, involved in membrane insertion of C-terminus of Cox2p, interacts genetically and physically with Cox18p

name: OST3
description: Gamma subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex, enriched in Golgi and mitochondria, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the ER lumen, which catalyzes asparagine-linked glycosylation of newly synthesized proteins, Ost3p is important for N-glycosylation of a subset of proteins

name: MKT1
description: Protein that forms a complex with Pbp1p, complex may mediate posttranscriptional regulation of HO, involved in propagation of M2 dsRNA satellite of L-A virus, allelic variation affects mitochondrial genome stability, drug resistance, and more, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: RHP16
description: ATP-dependent helicase involved in global genome repair similar to S. pombe RHP16

name: PP7435_Chr4-0363
description: Protein with similarity to YPR170W-B (Putative protein of unknown function, conserved in fungi)

name: SEC12
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF), activates Sar1p by catalyzing the exchange of GDP for GTP, required for the initiation of COPII vesicle formation in ER to Golgi transport, glycosylated integral membrane protein of the ER, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi and mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SED4

name: PP7435_Chr4-0365
description: Protein with similarity to YCR051W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus and YCR051W is not an essential gene, contains ankyrin (Ank) repeats,)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0366
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: CLB4
description: B-type cyclin involved in cell cycle progression, activates Cdc28p to promote the G2/M transition, may be involved in DNA replication and spindle assembly, accumulates during S phase and G2, then targeted for ubiquitin-mediated degradation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CLB3

name: MAM33
description: Specific translational activator for the mitochondrial COX1 mRNA, acidic protein of the mitochondrial matrix, related to the human complement receptor gC1q-R, enriched in mitochondria

name: ATG37
description: Acyl-CoA binding protein which acts as autophagy receptor: controls the selective autophagy of peroxisomes (pexophagy) through the assembly of a receptor protein complex (RPC), enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: YAP1
description: Basic leucine zipper (bZIP) transcription factor, required for oxidative stress tolerance, activated by H2O2 through the multistep formation of disulfide bonds and transit from the cytoplasm to the nucleus, Yap1p is degraded in the nucleus after the oxidative stress has passed, mediates resistance to cadmium, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CAD1, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpYAP1

name: SEC23
description: GTPase-activating protein, stimulates the GTPase activity of Sar1p, component of the Sec23p-Sec24p heterodimer of the COPII vesicle coat, involved in ER to Golgi transport, substrate of Ubp3/Bre5 complex, ubiquitylated by Ub-ligase Rsp5p, proteasome-mediated degradation of Sec23p is regulated by Cdc48p, enriched among several compartments

name: HDA2
description: Subunit of the HDA1 histone deacetylase complex, possibly tetrameric trichostatin A-sensitive class II histone deacetylase complex contains Hda1p homodimer and an Hda2p-Hda3p heterodimer, involved in telomere maintenance, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: DPL1
description: Dihydrosphingosine phosphate lyase, regulates intracellular levels of sphingolipid long-chain base phosphates (LCBPs), degrades phosphorylated long chain bases, prefers C16 dihydrosphingosine-l-phosphate as a substrate, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr4-0374
description: Protein with low similarity to the glycolytic genes transcriptional activators

name: PP7435_Chr4-0375
description: Protein with similarity to YKR051W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0376
description: Protein with similarity to YJL132W (Putative protein of unknown function, known in S. cerevisiae as membrane protein, possible Zap1p-regulated target gene induced by zinc deficiency and is a non-essential gene)

name: AIM23
description: Ttranslation initiation factor 3 (IF3, mIF3), known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein evolutionarily conserved, binds to E. coli ribosomes in vitro, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays severe respiratory growth defect and elevated frequency of mitochondrial genome loss

name: GOR1
description: Glyoxylate reductase, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae the null mutation results in increased biomass after diauxic shift, the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: MRS4
description: Iron transporter of the mitochondrial carrier family, mediates Fe2+ transport across the inner mitochondrial membrane, active under low-iron conditions, may transport other cations, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, enriched in mitochondria, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MRS3

name: PP7435_Chr4-0380
description: Protein with low similarity to peptide-N4-(N-acetyl-beta- glucosaminyl)asparagine amidase A, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0381
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0382
description: Protein with low similarity to regulator of G protein signaling domain proteins

name: SHM1
description: Mitochondrial serine hydroxymethyltransferase, converts serine to glycine plus 5,10 methylenetetrahydrofolate, involved in generating precursors for purine, pyrimidine, amino acid, and lipid biosynthesis, reverse reaction generates serine, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0384
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: CHK1
description: Serine/threonine kinase and DNA damage checkpoint effector, mediates cell cycle arrest via phosphorylation of Pds1p, phosphorylated by checkpoint signal transducer Mec1p, homolog of S. pombe and mammalian Chk1 checkpoint kinase

name: SAN1
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase, involved in the proteasome-dependent degradation of aberrant nuclear proteins, targets substrates with regions of exposed hydrophobicity containing 5 or more contiguous hydrophobic residues, contains intrinsically disordered regions that contribute to substrate recognition

name: YPS1-1
description: Aspartic protease, hyperglycosylated member of the yapsin family of proteases, attached to the plasma membrane via a glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, involved in nutrient limitation-induced cleavage of the extracellular inhibitory domain of signaling mucin Msb2p, resulting in activation of the filamentous growth MAPK pathway, involved with other yapsins in the cell wall integrity response, role in KEX2-independent processing of the alpha factor precursor, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog MKC7, previously known in Pichia pastoris as YPS1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0388
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: Fungal Zn(2)-Cys(6) binuclear cluster domain)

name: BMT5
description: Methyltransferase required for m3U2634 methylation of the 25S rRNA, S-adenosylmethionine-dependent, associates with precursors of the 60S ribosomal subunit, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: FYV10
description: Subunit of GID complex, involved in proteasome-dependent catabolite inactivation of gluconeogenic enzymes FBPase, PEPCK, and c-MDH, forms dimer with Rmd5p that is then recruited to GID Complex by Gid8p, contains a degenerate RING finger motif needed for GID complex ubiquitin ligase activity in vivo, as well as CTLH and CRA domains, plays role in anti-apoptosis, required for survival upon exposure to K1 killer toxin

name: IDH1
description: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase, which catalyzes the oxidation of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate in the TCA cycle, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: SGA1
description: Intracellular sporulation-specific glucoamylase involved in glycogen degradation, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, induced in S. cerevisiae during starvation of a/a diploids late in sporulation, but dispensable for sporulation

name: NCE103
description: Carbonic anhydrase, metalloenzyme that catalyzes CO2 hydration to bicarbonate, which is an important metabolic substrate, and protons, not expressed under conditions of high CO2, such as inside a growing colony, but in S. cerevisiae transcription is induced in response to low CO2 levels, such as on the colony surface in ambient air, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae is poorly transcribed under aerobic conditions and at an undetectable level under anaerobic conditions and abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: DAP500
description: Putative dihydrodipicolinate synthetase, member of the class I aldolases, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis DAP1 but not related to S. cerevisiae DAP1

name: ADH6
description: NADPH-dependent medium chain alcohol dehydrogenase, has broad substrate specificity, member of the cinnamyl family of alcohol dehydrogenases, may be involved in fusel alcohol synthesis or in aldehyde tolerance, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0396
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: RING), similar to PAS_chr2-2_0223

name: PP7435_Chr4-0397
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0398
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: LGD1
description: L-galactonate dehydratase similar to T. reesei LGD1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0400
description: Protein with low similarity to NAD dependent epimerase/dehydratase family protein and dihydroflavonol-4-reductases

name: STL1-2
description: Glycerol proton symporter known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein subjected to glucose-induced inactivation and strongly but transiently induced when cells are subjected to osmotic shock

name: PHO86
description: Protein required for ER exit of the high-affinity phosphate transporter Pho84p, specifically required for packaging of Pho84p into COPII vesicles, enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as ER resident protein, whose abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0403
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: YCK2
description: Palmitoylated plasma membrane-bound casein kinase I isoform, enriched in plasma membrane, microsome and mitochondria, shares redundant functions with Yck1p in morphogenesis, proper septin assembly, endocytic trafficking, and glucose sensing, stabilized by Sod1p binding in the presence of glucose and oxygen, causing glucose repression of respiratory metabolism, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YKC1

name: CUZ1
description: Protein with a role in the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway, interacts with ubiquitinated protein, Cdc48p and the proteasomal regulatory particle, may protect cells from trivalent metalloid induced proteotoxicity, contains a PACE promoter element and is co-regulated with proteasome subunit genes

name: RPP1
description: Subunit of both RNase MRP and nuclear RNase P, RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, while nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: PP7435_Chr4-0407
description: Protein with low similarity to ELA1, elongin A required for ubiquitin-dependent degradation of the RNA Polymerase II subunit Rpo21p

name: PDR16
description: Phosphatidylinositol transfer protein (PITP), controlled by the multiple drug resistance regulator Pdr1p, known in S. cerevisiae as lipid particles and microsomal protein, controls levels of various lipids, may regulate lipid synthesis, homologous to Pdr17p, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: CSL4
description: Exosome non-catalytic core component, involved in 3'-5' RNA processing and degradation in both the nucleus and the cytoplasm, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein, predicted to contain an S1 RNA binding domain, has similarity to human hCsl4p (EXOSC1)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0410
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: BNI4
description: Targeting subunit for Glc7p protein phosphatase, known in S. cerevisiae as proein of the bud neck, required for localization of chitin synthase III to the bud neck via interaction with the chitin synthase III regulatory subunit Skt5p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0412
description: Protein with similarity to YNL234W (Protein of unknown function with similarity to globins, has a functional heme-binding domain, S. cerevisiae mutant has aneuploidy tolerance, transcription induced by stress conditions, may be involved in glucose signaling or metabolism, regulated by Rgt1)

name: TIM13
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial intermembrane space protein, that forms a complex with Tim8p that delivers a subset of hydrophobic proteins to the TIM22 complex for insertion into the inner membrane

name: SPO75
description: Meiosis-specific protein of unknown function, required for spore wall formation during sporulation, dispensable for both nuclear divisions during meiosis

name: CRH1
description: Chitin transglycosylase that functions in the transfer of chitin to beta(1-6) and beta(1-3) glucans in the cell wall, similar and functionally redundant to Utr2, enriched in plasma membrane and microsome in glucose-grown cells, localizes in S. cerevisiae to sites of polarized growth, expression induced by cell wall stress

name: IKI1
description: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex, which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA, iki1 mutations in S. cerevisiae confer resistance to the Kluyveromyces lactis toxin zymocin

name: MMM1
description: Integral membrane protein, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein, component of the ERMES complex that links the ER to mitochondria and may promote inter-organellar calcium and phospholipid exchange as well as coordinating mitochondrial DNA replication and growth

name: PP7435_Chr4-0418
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: RAD2
description: Single-stranded DNA endonuclease, cleaves single-stranded DNA during nucleotide excision repair to excise damaged DNA, subunit of Nucleotide Excision Repair Factor 3 (NEF3), homolog of human XPG protein

name: YCH1
description: Phosphatase with sequence similarity to Cdc25p, Arr2p and Mih1p, member of the single-domain rhodanese homology superfamily, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus

name: PP7435_Chr4-0421
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: F-box domain)

name: SSA1
description: ATPase involved in protein folding and NLS-directed nuclear transport, member of HSP70 family, forms chaperone complex with Ydj1p, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae to be also in the nucleus and cell wall, 98% identical with paralog Ssa2p, but subtle differences between the two proteins provide functional specificity with respect to propagation of yeast [URE3] prions and vacuolar-mediated degradations of gluconeogenesis enzymes, general targeting factor of Hsp104p to prion fibrils, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SSA2

name: POM33
description: Transmembrane nucleoporin, involved in nuclear pore complex (NPC) distribution, assembly or stabilization, highly conserved across species, orthologous to human TMEM33, enriched among several compartments, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PER33

name: PP7435_Chr4-0424
description: Protein with similarity to YPR127W, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells (Putative pyridoxine 4-dehydrogenase, in S. cerevisiae differentially expressed during alcoholic fermentation, expression activated by transcription factor YRM1/YOR172W and green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0425
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: SHNi-TPR, TPR-like)

name: CDC3
description: Component of the septin ring that is required for cytokinesis, septins are GTP-binding proteins that assemble with other septins into rod-like complexes that can associate with other rods to form filament polymers, septin rings at the mother-bud neck act as scaffolds for recruiting factors needed for cell division and as barriers to prevent diffusion of specific proteins between mother and daughter cells, enriched in plasma membrane and mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0427
description: Protein with low similarity to RSA3, protein with a putative role in ribosomal maturation

name: SDD3
description: Putative metalloprotease, in S. cerevisiae the overproduction suppresses lethality due to expression of the dominant PET9 allele AAC2-A128P

name: CPR2
description: Peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (cyclophilin), catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of peptide bonds N-terminal to proline residues, has a potential role in the secretory pathway, enriched in microsome and Golgi, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog CPR5

name: ALG12
description: Alpha-1,6-mannosyltransferase localized to the ER, responsible for the addition of the alpha-1,6 mannose to dolichol-linked Man7GlcNAc2, acts in the dolichol pathway for N-glycosylation, enriched in microsome

name: PP7435_Chr4-0431
description: Protein with similarity to YNR029C, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells (Putative protein of unknown function, deletion in S. cerevisiae confers reduced fitness in saline)

name: BCH2
description: Member of the ChAPs (Chs5p-Arf1p-binding proteins) family, part of the exomer complex with Chs5p to mediate export of specific cargo proteins, including Chs3p, from the Golgi to the plasma membrane, enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog CHS6

name: SAP190
description: Protein that forms a complex with the Sit4p protein phosphatase, required for Sit4p function, member of a family of similar proteins including Sap4p, Sap155p, and Sap185p, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SAP185

name: CAT8-2
description: Zinc cluster transcriptional activator, necessary for derepression of a variety of genes under non-fermentative growth conditions, active after diauxic shift, binds carbon source responsive elements, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0435
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: LrgB-like family)

name: PRP6
description: Splicing factor, component of the U4/U6-U5 snRNP complex

name: RRB1
description: Specific chaperone for ribosomal protein Rpl3p, binds to nascent Rpl3p during translation, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential gene in S. cerevisiae

name: PP7435_Chr4-0438
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PQ loop repeat)

name: NB4M
description: NB4M (B14) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0440
description: Protein with low similarity to guanine nucleotide exchange factors

name: TUB2
description: Beta-tubulin, associates with alpha-tubulin (Tub1p and Tub3p) to form tubulin dimer, which polymerizes to form microtubules, enriched in cytosol

name: VBA1-2
description: Permease of basic amino acids in the vacuolar membrane, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: ASI1
description: Subunit of the nuclear inner membrane Asi ubiquitin ligase complex, Asi complex targets both misfolded proteins and regulators of sterol biosynthesis for ubiquitin-mediated degradation, acts with Asi2p and Asi3p to ensure the fidelity of SPS-sensor signalling by targeting latent unprocessed forms of Stp1p and Stp2p and maintains the repressed state of gene expression in the absence of inducing amino acids, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ASI3

name: PP7435_Chr4-0444
description: Protein with similarity to YLR352W (Putative protein of unknown function with similarity to F-box proteins, interacts with Skp1p and Cdc53p, in S. cerevisiae YLR352W is not an essential gene)

name: KSS1
description: Mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) involved in signal transduction pathways that control filamentous growth and pheromone response, the KSS1 gene is nonfunctional in S288C strains and functional in W303 strains

name: PP7435_Chr4-0447
description: Protein with low similarity to ERG29, protein of unknown function involved in ergosterol biosynthesis

name: TIP1
description: Major cell wall mannoprotein with possible lipase activity, transcription is induced in S. cerevisiae by heat- and cold-shock, member of the Srp1p/Tip1p family of serine-alanine-rich proteins

name: MTR2
description: mRNA transport regulator, essential nuclear protein in S. cerevisiae, Mex67p and Mtr2p form a mRNA export complex which binds to RNA

name: SMA2
description: Meiosis-specific prospore membrane protein, required to produce bending force necessary for proper assembly of the prospore membrane during sporulation

name: ECM7
description: Putative integral membrane protein with a role in calcium uptake, S. cerevisiae non-essential protein, mutant has cell wall defects and Ca+ uptake deficiencies, transcription is induced under conditions of zinc deficiency

name: ORC1
description: Largest subunit of the origin recognition complex, involved in directing DNA replication by binding to replication origins, also involved in transcriptional silencing, exhibits ATPase activity, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SIR3

name: RPS1B
description: Ribosomal protein 10 (rp10) of the small (40S) subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S3A, no bacterial homolog, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS1A

name: IMD3
description: Inosine monophosphate dehydrogenase, catalyzes the first step of GMP biosynthesis, member of a four-gene family in S. cerevisiae, constitutively expressed, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog IMD4

name: TYS1
description: Cytoplasmic tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase, required for cytoplasmic protein synthesis, interacts with positions 34 and 35 of the tRNATyr anticodon, mutations in human ortholog YARS are associated with Charcot-Marie-Tooth (CMT) neuropathies, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: UBR2
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase (E3), known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein, required for ubiquitylation of Rpn4p, mediates formation of a Mub1p-Ubr2p-Rad6p complex

name: QCR9
description: Subunit 9 of the ubiquinol cytochrome-c reductase complex, which is a component of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, required for electron transfer at the ubiquinol oxidase site of the complex, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein

name: HGH1
description: Non-essential protein of unknown function, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm, similar to mammalian BRP16 (Brain protein 16), relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: TFG1
description: TFIIF (Transcription Factor II) largest subunit, involved in both transcription initiation and elongation of RNA polymerase II, homologous to human RAP74

name: ZRT2
description: Low-affinity zinc transporter, enriched in mitochondria, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein which transcription is induced under low-zinc conditions by the Zap1p transcription factor

name: PP7435_Chr4-0462
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: FCY2
description: Purine-cytosine permease, mediates purine (adenine, guanine, and hypoxanthine) and cytosine accumulation, relative distribution to the vacuole increases upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0464
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Tricorn protease domain 2)

name: CCT6
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex, related to Tcp1p, enriched in cytosol, essential protein in S. cerevisiae that is required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo, contains an ATP-binding motif

name: NOP14
description: Protein which forms a complex with Noc4p that mediates maturation and nuclear export of 40S ribosomal subunits, also present in the small subunit processome complex, which is required for processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nucleolar protein

name: CEM1
description: Beta-keto-acyl synthase with possible role in fatty acid synthesis, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, required for mitochondrial respiration

name: ATG9
description: Integral membrane protein of Pichia pastoris that traffics to vacuolar membranes and sequester peroxisomes during pexophagy, previously known in Pichia pastoris as GSA14 and PpATG9

name: KRE6
description: Type II integral membrane protein, required for beta-1,6 glucan biosynthesis, putative beta-glucan synthase, known in S. cerevisiae to localize to ER, plasma membrane, sites of polarized growth and secretory vesicles, functionally redundant with Skn1p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SKN1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0470
description: Protein with low similarity to FF domain proteins

name: PRE9
description: Alpha 3 subunit of the 20S proteasome, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, the only non-essential 20S subunit in S. cerevisiae, may be replaced by the alpha 4 subunit (Pre6p) under stress conditions to create a more active proteasomal isoform

name: PHB1
description: Subunit of the prohibitin complex (Phb1p-Phb2p), a 1.2 MDa ring-shaped inner mitochondrial membrane chaperone that stabilizes newly synthesized proteins, determinant of replicative life span, involved in mitochondrial segregation, enriched in mitochondria

name: NCE102
description: Protein of unknown function, contains transmembrane domains, involved in secretion of proteins that lack classical secretory signal sequences, component of the detergent-insoluble glycolipid-enriched complexes (DIGs), enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FHN1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0474
description: Protein with low similarity to sentrin-specific protease 2

name: NCA2
description: Protein involved in regulation of mitochondrial expression of subunits 6 (Atp6p) and 8 (Atp8p) of the Fo-F1 ATP synthase, functions with Nca3p, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: PIN3
description: Negative regulator of actin nucleation-promoting factor activity, interacts with Las17p, a homolog of human Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome protein (WASP), via an N-terminal SH3 domain, and along with LSB1 cooperatively inhibits the nucleation of actin filaments, induces the appearance of the [PIN+] prion when overproduced, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog LSB1

name: CAF130
description: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional regulatory complex, CCR4-NOT complex is evolutionarily-conserved and involved in controlling mRNA initiation, elongation, and degradation

name: RSB1
description: Putative sphingoid long-chain base (LCB) efflux transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as integral plasma membrane transporter and may transport long chain bases (LCBs) from the cytoplasmic side toward the extracytoplasmic side of the membrane, role in glycerophospholipid translocation, suppressor in S. cerevisiae of the sphingoid LCB sensitivity of an LCB-lyase mutation

name: GIP2
description: Putative regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase Glc7p, involved in glycogen metabolism, contains a conserved motif (GVNK motif) that is also found in Gac1p, Pig1p, and Pig2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PIG2

name: PP7435_Chr4-0480
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Mitochondrial protein Pet20)

name: PEX4
description: Ubiquitin conjugating enzyme required for peroxisomal matrix protein import and peroxisome biogenesis, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PAS4

name: PEX26
description: Peroxisomal membrane protein, enriched in peroxisome

name: PP7435_Chr4-0483
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: TPD3
description: Regulatory subunit A of the heterotrimeric protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), which also contains regulatory subunit Cdc55p and either catalytic subunit Pph21p or Pph22p, required for cell morphogenesis and transcription by RNA polymerase III, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PMU1
description: Putative phosphomutase, contains a region homologous to the active site of phosphomutases, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the overexpression suppresses the histidine auxotrophy of an ade3 ade16 ade17 triple mutant and the temperature sensitivity of a tps2 mutant

name: CCR4
description: Component of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional complex, which is involved in regulation of gene expression, known in S. cerevisiae as component of the major cytoplasmic deadenylase, which is involved in mRNA poly(A) tail shortening

name: PP7435_Chr4-0488
description: Protein with similarity to YGL108C, enriched in microsome (Protein of unknown function, predicted to be palmitoylated, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cell periphery, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: PIC2
description: Phosphate carrier known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, imports inorganic phosphate into mitochondria, functionally redundant with Mir1p but less abundant than Mir1p under normal conditions, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced at high temperature

name: ADR1
description: Transcription factor known as methanol expression regulator, essential in Pichia pastoris for the utilization of amino acids as unique carbon source, which regulates the synthesis of several key enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and promotes the expression of Aox1 by repressing glycerol transporter, previously published in Pichia pastoris as Mxr1 but not related to S. cerevisiae Mxr1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0491
description: Protein with low similarity to GRF zinc finger domain containing proteins

name: EXO1
description: 5'-3' exonuclease and flap-endonuclease, involved in recombination, double-strand break repair and DNA mismatch repair, member of the Rad2p nuclease family, with conserved N and I nuclease domains, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DIN7

name: SFB3
description: Component of the Sec23p-Sfb3p heterodimer of the COPII vesicle coat, required for cargo selection during vesicle formation in ER to Golgi transport, homologous to Sec24p and Sfb2p, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the COPII vesicle coat

name: CSC1-1
description: Calcium permeable gated cation channel, may be involved in detoxification, similar to Arabidopsis CSC1, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells

name: EBS1
description: Protein involved in translation inhibition and nonsense-mediated decay, interacts with cap binding protein Cdc33p and with Nam7p, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the P-bodies upon glucose starvation, mRNA abundance regulated by mRNA decay factors, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EST1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0496
description: Protein with low similarity to UME6, transcriptional regulatory protein

name: PP7435_Chr4-0497
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: VPS34
description: Phosphatidylinositol (PI) 3-kinase that synthesizes PI-3-phosphate, forms membrane-associated signal transduction complex with Vps15p to regulate protein sorting, activated by the GTP-bound form of Gpa1p, a fraction is known in S. cerevisiae to localize to nuclear pores at nucleus-vacuole junctions with Vps15p, and may facilitate transcription elongation for genes positioned at the nuclear periphery

name: CAB5
description: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC), subunits of this complex are: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, Cab5p, Sis2p and Vhs3p, probable dephospho-CoA kinase (DPCK) that catalyzes the last step in coenzyme A biosynthesis, in S. cerevisiae the protein is detected in purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies, but is also localized to lipid droplets and the null mutant lethality is complemented by human homolog DCAKD and by E. coli coaE (encoding DPCK)

name: RKM2
description: Ribosomal protein lysine methyltransferase, responsible for trimethylation of the lysine residue at position 3 of Rpl12Ap and Rpl12Bp, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PAN5
description: 2-dehydropantoate 2-reductase, part of the pantothenic acid pathway, structurally homologous to E. coli panE

name: RVB1
description: ATP-dependent DNA helicase, also known as pontin, member of the AAA+ and RuvB-like protein families, similar to Rvb2p, conserved component of multiple complexes including the INO80 complex, the Swr1 complex, and the R2TP complex (Rvb1-Rvb2-Tah1-Pih1), involved in multiple processes such as chromatin remodeling, box C/D snoRNP assembly, and RNA polymerase II assembly, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: HST4
description: NAD(+)-dependent protein deacetylase, deacetylation targets are primarily mitochondrial proteins, involved along with Hst3p in silencing at telomeres, cell cycle progression, radiation resistance, genomic stability and short-chain fatty acid metabolism, accumulates in S. cerevisiae in mitochondria in response to biotin starvation and may link biotin metabolism with energy homeostasis, member of the Sir2 family and may be the functional equivalent of human SIRT3

name: DBP9
description: DEAD-box protein required for 27S rRNA processing, exhibits DNA, RNA and DNA/RNA helicase activities, ATPase activity shows preference for DNA over RNA, DNA helicase activity abolished by mutation in RNA-binding domain, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: CXF1
description: Putative cation efflux family protein, enriched in Golgi and vacuole

name: PpBMT4
description: Beta-mannosyltransferase 4 of Pichia pastoris, not related to S. cerevisiae BMT4, enriched among several compartments

name: ALD100
description: Putative NAD-dependent aldehyde dehydrogenase, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0511
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: KAR4
description: Transcription factor required in S. cerevisiae for gene regulation in response to pheromones, also required during meiosis, exists in two forms, a slower-migrating form more abundant during vegetative growth and a faster-migrating form induced by pheromone

name: PP7435_Chr4-0513
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: GEF1-3
description: Voltage-gated chloride channel localized in S. cerevisiae to the Golgi, the endosomal system, and plasma membrane, and involved in cation homeostasis, highly homologous to vertebrate voltage-gated chloride channels, modulates TBSV model (+) RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

name: LMT1
description: Putative S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferases class I, enriched among several compartments

name: SPB1
description: AdoMet-dependent methyltransferase involved in rRNA processing and 60S ribosomal subunit maturation, methylates G2922 in the tRNA docking site of the large subunit rRNA and in the absence of snR52, U2921, enriched among several compartments, suppressor of S. cerevisiae PAB1 mutants

name: PBN1
description: Component of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-mannosyltransferase I, essential component, required for the autocatalytic post-translational processing of the protease B precursor Prb1p, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae localizes to ER in lumenal orientation, homolog of mammalian PIG-X

name: PP7435_Chr4-0518
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0519
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ABP140
description: AdoMet-dependent tRNA methyltransferase and actin binding protein, C-terminal domain is responsible for 3-methylcytidine modification of residue 32 of the tRNA anticodon loop of tRNA-Thr and tRNA-Ser and contains an S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet) binding motif, N-terminal actin binding sequence interacts with actin filaments and is known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the actin patches and cables, N- and C-terminal domains are encoded in separate ORFs that are translated into one protein via a +1 frameshift

name: ATG5
description: Conserved protein involved in autophagy and the Cvt pathway, undergoes conjugation with Atg12p to form a complex involved in Atg8p lipidation, conjugated Atg12p also forms a complex with Atg16p that is essentialin S. cerevisiae for autophagosome formation

name: PP7435_Chr4-0522
description: Protein with low similarity to SGT1 domain-containing proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0523
description: Protein with similarity to YPL150W (Protein kinase of unknown cellular role, binds phosphatidylinositols and cardiolipin in a large-scale study)

name: RPS13
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S13 and bacterial S15, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0525
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0526
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RTR1
description: CTD phosphatase, dephosphorylates S5-P in the C-terminal domain of Rpo21p, has a cysteine-rich motif required for function and conserved in eukaryotes, known in S. cerevisiae to shuttle between the nucleus and cytoplasm, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RTR2

name: EMP65
description: Protein known in S. cerevisiae as ER integral membrane protein, forms an ER-membrane associated protein complex with Slp1p, identified in S. cerevisiae along with SLP1 in a screen for mutants defective in the unfolded protein response (UPR), proposed to function in the folding of integral membrane proteins, interacts genetically with MPS3, the authentic, in S. cerevisiae non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: PpBMT1
description: Beta-mannosyltransferase 1 of Pichia pastoris, not related to S. cerevisiae BMT1, enriched among several compartments

name: PpBMT2
description: Beta-mannosyltransferase 2 of Pichia pastoris, not related to S. cerevisiae BMT2, enriched in microsome and Golgi

name: COX15
description: Protein required for the hydroxylation of heme O to form heme A, which is an essential prosthetic group for cytochrome c oxidase

name: LSM2
description: Lsm (Like Sm) protein, part of heteroheptameric complexes (Lsm2p-7p and either Lsm1p or 8p): cytoplasmic Lsm1p complex involved in mRNA decay, nuclear Lsm8p complex part of U6 snRNP and possibly involved in processing tRNA, snoRNA, and rRNA, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein that relocalizes to cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0533
description: Protein with low similarity to YER137C, putative protein of unknown function

name: PP7435_Chr4-0534
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: UAF complex subunit Rrn10)

name: NCL1
description: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent tRNA: m5C-methyltransferase, methylates cytosine to m5C at several positions in tRNAs and intron-containing pre-tRNAs, enriched in cytosol, increases in S. cerevisiae proportion of tRNALeu(CAA) with m5C at wobble position in response to hydrogen peroxide, causing selective translation of mRNA from genes enriched in TTG codon, loss of NCL1 confers hypersensitivity to oxidative stress, similar to Nop2p and human proliferation associated nucleolar protein p120

name: HRD1-2
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase, required for ER-associated degradation (ERAD) of misfolded proteins, genetically linked to the unfolded protein response (UPR), regulated through association with Hrd3p, contains an H2 ring finger, likely plays a general role in targeting proteins that persistently associate with and potentially obstruct the ER-localized translocon

name: RFT1
description: Membrane protein required for translocation of Man5GlcNac2-PP-Dol, required for translocation of Man5GlcNac2-PP-Dol from the cytoplasmic side to the lumenal side of the ER membrane but is not the flippase, mutation in S. cerevisiae is suppressed by expression of human p53 protein, essential gene

name: HAP3-1
description: Subunit of the heme-activated, glucose-repressed Hap2p/3p/4p/5p CCAAT-binding complex, a transcriptional activator and global regulator of respiratory gene expression, contains sequences contributing to both complex assembly and DNA binding

name: PIM1-1
description: ATP-dependent Lon protease, involved in degradation of misfolded proteins in mitochondria, required for biogenesis and maintenance of mitochondria, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PIM1, enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0540
description: Protein with low similarity to putative E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase

name: MKS1
description: Pleiotropic negative transcriptional regulator involved in Ras-CAMP and lysine biosynthetic pathways and nitrogen regulation, involved in retrograde (RTG) mitochondria-to-nucleus signaling

name: DUR3-3
description: Transporter for both urea and polyamines, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein whose expression is highly sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression and induced by allophanate, the last intermediate of the allantoin degradative pathway

name: ZIM17
description: Protein co-chaperone with a zinc finger motif, essential in S. cerevisiae for protein import into mitochondria, may act with Pam18p to facilitate recognition and folding of imported proteins by Ssc1p (mtHSP70) in the mitochondrial matrix, required for the maintenance of Ssc1p solubility and assists in the functional interaction of Ssc1p with substrate proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0544
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DEAD/DEAH box helicase, P-loop containing nucleoside triphosphate hydrolase)

name: PHA2
description: Prephenate dehydratase, catalyzes the conversion of prephanate to phenylpyruvate, which is a step in the phenylalanine biosynthesis pathway

name: HRT1
description: RING-H2 domain core subunit of multiple ubiquitin ligase complexes, subunit of Skp1-Cullin-F-box (SCF) that tethers the Cdc34p (E2) and Cdc53p (cullin) SCF subunits, and is required for degradation of Gic2p, Far1p, Sic1p and Cln2p, subunit of the Rtt101p-Mms1p-Mms22p ubiquitin ligase that stabilizes replication forks after DNA lesions, subunit of the Cul3p-Elc1p-Ela1p ubiquitin ligase involved in Rpb1p degradation as part of transcription-coupled repair

name: MED7
description: Subunit of the RNA polymerase II mediator complex, associates with core polymerase subunits to form the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, essential in S. cerevisiae for transcriptional regulation

name: TIF35
description: eIF3g subunit of the core complex of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3), enriched in vacuole and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, which is essential in S. cerevisiae for translation, stimulates resumption of ribosomal scanning during translation reinitiation

name: PP7435_Chr4-0551
description: Protein with similarity to YDL124W, enriched in cytosol (NADPH-dependent alpha-keto amide reductase, reduces aromatic alpha-keto amides, aliphatic alpha-keto esters, and aromatic alpha-keto esters, member of the aldo-keto reductase (AKR) family, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress)

name: EMP47
description: Integral membrane component of ER-derived COPII-coated vesicles, functions in ER to Golgi transport, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the COPII vesicle coat, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog EMP46

name: CDC39
description: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT1 core complex, this complex has multiple roles in the regulation of mRNA levels including regulation of transcription and destabilization of mRNA by deadenylation, basal transcription factor that increases initiation and elongation, activates the ATPase activity of Dhh1p, resulting in processing body disassembly, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: CDC50
description: Protein that interacts with phospholipid flippase Drs2p, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as endosomal protein where its interaction with Drs2 is essential for Drs2p catalytic activity and mutations affect cell polarity and polarized growth, similar to Lem3p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YNR048W

name: UBC1
description: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme, mediates selective degradation of short-lived and abnormal proteins, plays a role in vesicle biogenesis and ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), component of the cellular stress response, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: NESM
description: NESM (ESSS) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0558
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Mitotic checkpoint protein)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0559
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: RING-H2 zinc finger)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0560
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: C-terminal proteasome-interacting domain of thiored, Galactose-binding domain-like)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0562
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Alba)

name: COX12
description: Subunit VIb of cytochrome c oxidase, cytochrome c oxidase is also known as respiratory Complex IV and is the terminal member of the mitochondrial inner membrane electron transport chain, required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase but not required for activity after assembly, phosphorylated, easily released from the intermembrane space, suggesting a loose association with Complex IV, enriched in mitochondria

name: GRC3
description: Polynucleotide kinase present on rDNA, required for efficient transcription termination by RNA polymerase I, functions with Las1p in a conserved mechanism to modulate rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis, required for cell growth, mRNA is cell-cycle regulated

name: VPS20
description: Myristoylated subunit of ESCRTIII, the endosomal sorting complex required for transport of transmembrane proteins into the multivesicular body pathway to the lysosomal/vacuolar lumen, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic protein recruited to endosomal membranes

name: RIX7
description: Putative ATPase of the AAA family, required for export of pre-ribosomal large subunits from the nucleus, distributed between the nucleolus, nucleoplasm, and nuclear periphery depending on growth conditions

name: HEM2
description: Aminolevulinate dehydratase, a homo-octameric enzyme, catalyzes the conversion of 5-aminolevulinate to porphobilinogen, the second step in heme biosynthesis, enzymatic activity is zinc-dependent, known in S. cerevisiae as cytoplasmic and nuclear protein

name: PP7435_Chr4-0568
description: Protein with low similarity to DnaJ-like protein of Candida albicans

name: AGX1
description: Alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase (AGT), catalyzes the synthesis of glycine from glyoxylate, which is one of three pathways for glycine biosynthesis in yeast, has similarity to mammalian and plant alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferases, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SHM2
description: Cytosolic serine hydroxymethyltransferase, converts serine to glycine plus 5,10 methylenetetrahydrofolate, major isoform involved in generating precursors for purine, pyrimidine, amino acid, and lipid biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: RPS16B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S16 and bacterial S9, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS16A

name: RPL13B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L13B, not essential in S. cerevisiae for viability, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L13, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL13A

name: RPP1A
description: Ribosomal stalk protein P1 alpha, involved in the interaction between translational elongation factors and the ribosome, accumulation of P1 in the cytoplasm is regulated by phosphorylation and interaction with the P2 stalk component

name: SIP5
description: Protein of unknown function, interacts with both the Reg1p/Glc7p phosphatase and the Snf1p kinase, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0575
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0576
description: Protein with similarity to YLR326W (Putative protein of unknown function, predicted to be palmitoylated)

name: ECT1
description: Ethanolamine-phosphate cytidylyltransferase, catalyzes the second step of phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthesis, involved in the maintenance of plasma membrane, similar to mammalian CTP: phosphocholine cytidylyl-transferases

name: TMA10
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog STF2

name: PP7435_Chr4-0579
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: GET3
description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor for Gpa1p, amplifies G protein signaling, subunit of the GET complex, which is involved in Golgi to ER trafficking and insertion of proteins into the ER membrane, has low-level ATPase activity, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ALK2
description: Protein kinase, accumulation and phosphorylation are periodic during the cell cycle, phosphorylated in response to DNA damage, contains in S. cerevisiae characteristic motifs for degradation via the APC pathway, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog ALK1, similar to mammalian haspins

name: GET1
