description: Subunit of the GET complex, involved in insertion of proteins into the ER membrane, required for the retrieval of HDEL proteins from the Golgi to the ER in an ERD2 dependent fashion and for normal mitochondrial morphology and inheritance, enriched among several compartments

name: CKB1
description: Beta regulatory subunit of casein kinase 2 (CK2), a Ser/Thr protein kinase with roles in cell growth and proliferation, CK2, comprised of CKA1, CKA2, CKB1 and CKB2, has many substrates including transcription factors and all RNA polymerases

name: ATE1
description: Arginyl-tRNA-protein transferase, catalyzes post-translational conjugation of arginine to the amino termini of acceptor proteins which are then subject to degradation via the N-end rule pathway

name: FRE2-1
description: Ferric reductase and cupric reductase, reduces siderophore-bound iron and oxidized copper prior to upTake by transporters, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae induced by low iron levels but not by low copper levels

name: PRO3
description: Delta 1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase, catalyzes the last step in proline biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells and in Golgi in methanol-grown cells

name: ILM1
description: Protein of unknown function, may be involved in mitochondrial DNA maintenance, required for slowed DNA synthesis-induced filamentous growth

name: DAP1
description: Heme-binding protein involved in regulation of cytochrome P450 protein Erg11p, damage response protein, related to mammalian membrane progesterone receptors, mutations in S. cerevisiae lead to defects in telomeres, mitochondria, and sterol synthesis

name: PP7435_Chr4-0590
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: NAT_SF, N-Acyltransferase superfamily), enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SEC63
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of Sec63 complex (Sec63p, Sec62p, Sec66p and Sec72p), with Sec61 complex, Kar2p/BiP and Lhs1p forms a channel competent for SRP-dependent and post-translational SRP-independent protein targeting and import into the ER, enriched among several compartments

name: MEX67
description: Poly(A)RNA binding protein involved in nuclear mRNA export, component of the nuclear pore, ortholog of human TAP

name: CDC60
description: Cytosolic leucyl tRNA synthetase, ligates leucine to the appropriate tRNA, enriched in cytosol

name: ENV9
description: Protein proposed to be involved in vacuolar functions, S. cerevisiae mutant shows defect in CPY processing and defects in vacuolar morphology, has similarity to oxidoreductases, found in lipid particles, required for replication of Brome mosaic virus in S. cerevisiae, a model system for studying replication of positive-strand RNA viruses in their natural hosts

name: PP7435_Chr4-0595
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: RNA polymerase II transcription mediator complex)

name: TOM40
description: Component of the TOM (translocase of outer membrane) complex, responsible for recognition and initial import steps for all mitochondrially directed proteins, constitutes the core element of the protein conducting pore, pre-Tom40p is phosphorylated by PKA, which impairs its import into mitochondria under non-respiratory conditions, enriched in vacuole, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: INP1
description: Membrane protein, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, involved in peroxisomal inheritance, recruitment to peroxisomes is mediated by interaction with Pex3p at the peroxisomal membrane

name: NIP100
description: Large subunit of the dynactin complex, which is involved in partitioning the mitotic spindle between mother and daughter cells, putative ortholog of mammalian p150(glued)

name: CDC31
description: Calcium-binding component of the spindle pole body (SPB) half-bridge, required for SPB duplication in mitosis and meiosis II, homolog of mammalian centrin, binds multiubiquitinated proteins and is involved in proteasomal protein degradation

name: MRPL40
description: Mitochondrial ribosomal protein of the large subunit, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: RPT4
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of six ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, contributes preferentially to ERAD, required for spindle pole body duplication, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein

name: GCD1
description: Gamma subunit of the translation initiation factor eIF2B, the guanine-nucleotide exchange factor for eIF2, activity subsequently regulated by phosphorylated eIF2, first identified as a negative regulator of GCN4 expression

name: PP7435_Chr4-0604
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0605
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0606
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: EXO5
description: 5'-3' exonuclease and sliding exonuclease, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein required for mitochondrial genome maintenance, distantly related to the RecB nuclease domain of bacterial RecBCD recombinases, may be regulated by the transcription factor Ace2

name: AIM11
description: Protein of unknown function, S. cerevisiae null mutant is viable but shows increased loss of mitochondrial genome and synthetic interaction with prohibitin (phb1) and contains an intron, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YBL059W

name: PP7435_Chr4-0609
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: TSC11
description: Subunit of TORC2 (Tor2p-Lst8p-Avo1-Avo2-Tsc11p-Bit61p), a membrane-associated complex that regulates actin cytoskeletal dynamics during polarized growth and cell wall integrity, involved in sphingolipid metabolism, contains a RasGEFN domain

name: YTP1
description: Probable type-III integral membrane protein of unknown function, has regions of similarity to mitochondrial electron transport proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0612
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF2009)

name: CYB5-1
description: Cytochrome b5, involved in the sterol and lipid biosynthesis pathways, acts as an electron donor to support sterol C5-6 desaturation, enriched in microsome

name: PP7435_Chr4-0614
description: Protein with low similarity to NOP15, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, enriched in Golgi and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0615
description: Protein with similarity to YOR111W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: TFC7
description: RNA pol III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC) subunit, part of the TauA globular domain of TFIIIC that binds DNA at the BoxA promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YOR110W

name: YAF9
description: Subunit of both the NuA4 histone H4 acetyltransferase complex and the SWR1 complex, may function to antagonize silencing near telomeres, interacts directly with Swc4p, has homology to human leukemogenic protein AF9, contains a YEATS domain

name: PP7435_Chr4-0618
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: alkyl hydroperoxide reductase and thiol specific antioxidant, AhpC/TSA family)

name: RPL8A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L8A, mutation in S. cerevisiae results in decreased amounts of free 60S subunits, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L7A, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPL8B

name: IES6
description: Component of the INO80 chromatin remodeling complex, critical for INO80 function, involved in regulation of chromosome segregation and maintenance of normal centromeric chromatin structure, human ortholog INO80C is a member of the human INO80 complex, implicated in DNA repair based on genetic interactions with RAD52 epistasis genes

name: PP7435_Chr4-0623
description: Protein with low similarity to molybdenum cofactor sulfurase protein-like proteins

name: MET10
description: Subunit alpha of assimilatory sulfite reductase, which converts sulfite into sulfide, enriched in cytosol

name: CDC28
description: Cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) catalytic subunit, master regulator of mitotic and meiotic cell cycles, alternately associates with G1 (CLNs), S and G2/M (CLBs) phase cyclins, which provide substrate specificity, regulates cell cycle transcriptional programs, basal transcription, chromosome duplication and segregation, spindle dynamics, lipid biosynthesis, membrane trafficking, polarized cell growth, and morphogenesis, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, abundance increases in S. cerevisiae in response to DNA replication stress

name: IFA38
description: Beta-keto-reductase, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in microsome in methanol-grown cells, contains oleate response element (ORE) sequence in the promoter region, known in S. cerevisiae as microsomal protein, mutants exhibit reduced VLCFA synthesis, accumulate high levels of dihydrosphingosine, phytosphingosine and medium-chain ceramides

name: PP7435_Chr4-0627
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Transcriptional regulatory protein LGE1)

name: AMN1
description: Protein required for daughter cell separation, multiple mitotic checkpoints, and chromosome stability, contains 12 degenerate leucine-rich repeat motifs, expression in S. cerevisiae is induced by the Mitotic Exit Network (MEN)

name: CYR1

name: NUPM
description: NUPM (PGIV) Subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: NUP57

name: PP7435_Chr4-0640
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: JAC1
description: Specialized J-protein that functions with Hsp70 in Fe-S cluster biogenesis in mitochondria, involved in iron metabolism, contains a J domain typical to J-type chaperones, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial matrix protein

name: FAA2
description: Medium chain fatty acyl-CoA synthetase, activates imported fatty acids, accepts a wide range of fatty acid chain lengths with a preference for medium chains, C9:0-C13:0, localized in S. cerevisiae to the peroxisome

name: PP7435_Chr4-0643
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: SPN1
description: Protein involved in RNA polymerase II transcription, interacts genetically or physically with RNAP II, TBP, TFIIS, and chromatin remodelling factors, central domain highly conserved throughout eukaryotes,, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells mutations in S. cerevisiae confer an Spt- phenotype

name: RPS23A
description: Ribosomal protein 28 (rp28) of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, required for translational accuracy, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S23 and bacterial S12, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, deletion in S. cerevisiae of both RPS23A and RPS23B is lethal, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS23B

name: PP7435_Chr4-0646
description: Protein with low similarity to YGR117C, putative protein of unknown function

name: ANT1
description: Adenine nucleotide transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as peroxisomal protein, involved in beta-oxidation of medium-chain fatty acid, required for peroxisome proliferation

name: NAT3
description: Catalytic subunit of the NatB N-terminal acetyltransferase, which catalyzes acetylation of the amino-terminal methionine residues of all proteins beginning with Met-Asp or Met-Glu and of some proteins beginning with Met-Asn or Met-Met

name: SCD6
description: Repressor of translation initiation, binds eIF4G through its RGG domain and inhibits recruitment of the preinitiation complex, also contains an Lsm domain, may have a role in RNA processing, overproduction in S. cerevisiae suppresses null mutation in clathrin heavy chain gene CHC1, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress

name: RPB3
description: RNA polymerase II third largest subunit B44, part of central core, similar to prokaryotic alpha subunit

name: HIS6
description: Enzyme that catalyzes the fourth step in the histidine pathway, Phosphoribosylformimino-5-aminoimidazole carboxamide ribotide isomerase, mutations in S. cerevisiae cause histidine auxotrophy and sensitivity to Cu, Co, and Ni salts

name: ATH1
description: Acid trehalase required for utilization of extracellular trehalose

name: LRA4
description: L-KDR aldolase strictly activated in the presence of rhamnose and almost completely repressed by glucose in Pichia pastoris, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis LRA4

name: TRC1
description: Transcription factor suggested to involved in the regulation of LRA genes of the rhamnose metabolism in Pichia pastoris, similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis TRC1

name: LRA2
description: L-rhamnono-y-lactonase similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis LRA2, without targeting signal

name: LRA1
description: L-rhamnose-1-dehydrogenase similar to Scheffersomyces stipitis DHG2

name: PHO84-1
description: High-affinity inorganic phosphate (Pi) transporter and low-affinity manganese transporter, regulated by Pho4p and Spt7p, mutation in S. cerevisiae confers resistance to arsenate, exit from the ER during maturation requires Pho86p, cells overexpressing Pho84p accumulate heavy metals but do not develop symptoms of metal toxicity

name: PP7435_Chr4-0658
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3112), enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr4-0659
description: Protein with similarity to YDR541C (Aldehyde reductase, substrates are both aromatic and aliphatic aldehydes, uses NADPH as cofactor)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0660
description: Protein with low similarity to 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase (Penicillum and Aspergillus sp)

name: MIG1-1
description: Transcription factor involved in glucose repression, sequence specific DNA binding protein containing two Cys2His2 zinc finger motifs, regulated by the SNF1 kinase and the GLC7 phosphatase, regulates in S. cerevisiae filamentous growth along with Mig2p in response to glucose depletion

name: PP7435_Chr4-0662
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0663
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0664
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Membrane-associating domain, contains signalpeptide and 2 TMDs)

name: MET17
description: O-acetyl homoserine-O-acetyl serine sulfhydrylase, required for Methionine and cysteine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol

name: CTH1
description: Member of the CCCH zinc finger family, similar to mammalian Tis11 protein, which activates transcription and also has a role in mRNA degradation, may function with Tis11p in iron homeostasis, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TIS11

name: GCN1
description: Positive regulator of the Gcn2p kinase activity, forms a complex with Gcn20p, proposed to stimulate Gcn2p activation by an uncharged tRNA, enriched among several compartments

name: PHD1
description: Transcriptional activator that enhances pseudohyphal growth, physically interacts with the Tup1-Cyc8 complex and recruits Tup1p to its targets, regulates expression of FLO11, an adhesin required for pseudohyphal filament formation, similar to StuA, an A. nidulans developmental regulator, potential Cdc28p substrate, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog SOK2

name: PRI1
description: Subunit of DNA primase, which is required for DNA synthesis and double-strand break repair

name: SRP54
description: Signal recognition particle (SRP) subunit (homolog of mammalian SRP54), contains the signal sequence-binding activity of SRP, interacts with the SRP RNA, and mediates binding of SRP to signal receptor, contains GTPase domain, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: EGH1
description: Steryl-beta-glucosidase with broad specificity for aglycones, has a role in ergosteryl-beta-glucoside catabolism, required for normal vacuolar morphology, has similarity to the C. neoformans ergosteryl-beta-glucosidase EGCrP2, known in S. cerevisiae as cytosolic protein

name: PP7435_Chr4-0673
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF3812), enriched among several compartments

name: SLI1
description: N-acetyltransferase, confers resistance to the sphingolipid biosynthesis inhibitor myriocin (ISP-1) by converting it into N-acetyl-myriocin, co-operates with Ypk1p in mediating resistance to myriocin

name: AVT2
description: Putative transporter, member of a family of seven S. cerevisiae genes (AVT1-7) related to vesicular GABA-glycine transporters

name: PP7435_Chr4-0676
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: PPR repeat), enriched in mitochondria

name: MCM10
description: Essential chromatin-associated protein in S. cerevisiae, involved in the initiation of DNA replication, required for the association of the MCM2-7 complex with replication origins, required to stabilize the catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase-alpha

name: MLP1
description: Myosin-like protein associated with the nuclear envelope, connects the nuclear pore complex with the nuclear interior, involved with Tel1p in telomere length control, involved with Pml1p and Pml39p in nuclear retention of unspliced mRNAs, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog MLP2

name: SLN1
description: Transmembrane histidine phosphotransfer kinase and osmosensor, regulates MAP kinase cascade, transmembrane protein with an intracellular kinase domain that signals to Ypd1p and Ssk1p, thereby forming a phosphorelay system similar to bacterial two-component regulators

name: PP7435_Chr4-0680
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: ARO10-2
description: Phenylpyruvate decarboxylase, catalyzes decarboxylation of phenylpyruvate to phenylacetaldehyde, which is the first specific step in the Ehrlich pathway, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: CLA4
description: Cdc42p-activated signal transducing kinase, member of the PAK (p21-activated kinase) family, along with Ste20p and Skm1p, involved in septin ring assembly, vacuole inheritance, cytokinesis, sterol upTake regulation, phosphorylates Cdc3p and Cdc10p, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SKM1

name: TPT1
description: tRNA 2'-phosphotransferase, catalyzes the final step in yeast tRNA splicing: the transfer of the 2'-PO(4) from the splice junction to NAD(+) to form ADP-ribose 1''-2''cyclic phosphate and nicotinamide

name: PP7435_Chr4-0685
description: Protein with similarity to YPR147C (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS)

name: PFK300
description: Gamma subunit of Pichia pastoris 6-phosphofructokinase, which might contribute to adaptation to energy resources, subunit not existing in S. cerevisiae, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpPfk

name: PP7435_Chr4-0687
description: Protein with low similarity to SYF2-domain-containing proteins

name: SPT6
description: Nucleosome remodeling protein, functions in various aspects of transcription, chromatin maintenance, and RNA processing, required for the maintenance of chromatin structure during transcription in order to inhibit transcription from promoters within the coding region, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein

name: PP7435_Chr4-0690
description: Protein with similarity to YMR244W (Putative protein of unknown function)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0691
description: Protein with similarity to YDR338C (Putative protein of unknown function, member of the multi-drug and toxin extrusion (MATE) family of the multidrug/oligosaccharidyl-lipid/polysaccharide (MOP) exporter superfamily)

name: PIR2
description: Cell wall protein of Pichia pastoris with internal repeats, suggested to be in S. cerevisiae O-glycosylated and important for cell wall stability, previously known in Pichia pastoris as PpPIR2, homolog of S. cerevisiae Pir1-5p proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0693
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Apc13, anaphase-promoting complex)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0694
description: Protein with similarity to YDR262W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole, is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS and gene expression increases in response to Zymoliase treatment)

name: RPO31
description: RNA polymerase III largest subunit C160, part of core enzyme, similar to bacterial beta-prime subunit and to RPA190 and RPO21, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: CDC40
description: Pre-mRNA splicing factor, important for catalytic step II of pre-mRNA splicing and plays a role in cell cycle progression, required for DNA synthesis during mitosis and meiosis, has WD repeats

name: BCP1
description: Protein involved in nuclear export of Mss4p, which is a lipid kinase that generates phosphatidylinositol 4,5-biphosphate and plays a role in actin cytoskeleton organization and vesicular transport, enriched in microsome and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae

name: RPT5
description: ATPase of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome, one of six ATPases of the regulatory particle, involved in the degradation of ubiquitinated substrates, recruited to the GAL1-10 promoter region upon induction of transcription, similar to human TBP1, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: SEM1
description: 19S proteasome regulatory particle lid subcomplex component, role in Ub-dependent proteolysis and proteasome stability, involved in TREX-2 mediated mRNA export, and in the prevention of transcription-associated genome instability, ubiquitinated by Nedd4-like E3-ligase, Rsp5p, human ortholog DSS1, a BRCA1 binding protein implicated in cancer, complements the yeast null, drives trinucleotide repeat expansion, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PEX31
description: Peroxisomal integral membrane protein containing a dysferlin domain, required in Pichia pastoris with Pex30p for normal peroxisome number and size, Pichia pastoris Pex30p and Pex31p are suggested to be in the ER and peroxisome, respectively, genetic interactions in S. cerevisiae suggest their action at a step downstream of steps mediated by Pex28p and Pex29, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog PEX30

name: EAF1
description: Component of the NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex, acts as a platform for assembly of NuA4 subunits into the native complex, required for initiation of pre-meiotic DNA replication, likely due to its requirement for expression of IME1

name: GGA2
description: Protein that regulates Arf1p and Arf2p to facilitate Golgi trafficking, binds phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate, which plays a role in TGN localization, enriched among several compartments, has homology to gamma-adaptin, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog GGA1

name: CLN1
description: G1 cyclin involved in regulation of the cell cycle, activates Cdc28p kinase to promote the G1 to S phase transition, late G1 specific expression in S. cerevisiae depends on transcription factor complexes, MBF (Swi6p-Mbp1p) and SBF (Swi6p-Swi4p), Pichia pastoris has also the paralog CLN2

name: PP7435_Chr4-0704
description: Protein with low similarity to early endosome antigen 1 of Ogataea parapolymorpha, enriched in microsome

name: TRP4
description: Anthranilate phosphoribosyl transferase of the tryptophan biosynthetic pathway, catalyzes the phosphoribosylation of anthranilate, subject to the general control system of amino acid biosynthesis

name: CDC12
description: Component of the septin ring that is required for cytokinesis, septins are GTP-binding proteins that assemble into rod-like hetero-oligomers that can associate with other rods to form filaments, septin rings at the mother-bud neck act as scaffolds for recruiting cell division factors and as barriers to prevent diffusion of specific proteins between mother and daughter cells, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RPS24A
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S24, no bacterial homolog, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS24B

name: PBP1
description: Component of glucose deprivation induced stress granules, involved in P-body-dependent granule assembly, similar to human ataxin-2, interacts with Pab1p to regulate mRNA polyadenylation, interacts with Mkt1p to regulate HO translation, protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: DIP5-1
description: Dicarboxylic amino acid permease of the plasma membrane, mediates high-affinity and high-capacity transport of L-glutamate and L-aspartate, also a transporter for Gln, Asn, Ser, Ala, and Gly, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes from plasma membrane to vacuole upon DNA replication stress

name: RRN7
description: Component of the core factor (CF) rDNA transcription factor complex, CF is required for transcription of 35S rRNA genes by RNA polymerase I and is composed of Rrn6p, Rrn7p, and Rrn11p

name: SER2
description: Phosphoserine phosphatase of the phosphoglycerate pathway, involved in serine and glycine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae is regulated by the available nitrogen source

name: ABZ2
description: Aminodeoxychorismate lyase (4-amino-4-deoxychorismate lyase), catalyzes the third step in para-aminobenzoic acid biosynthesis, involved in folic acid biosynthesis

name: TRX1
description: Cytoplasmic thioredoxin isoenzyme, part of thioredoxin system which protects cells against oxidative and reductive stress, forms LMA1 complex with Pbi2p, acts as a cofactor for Tsa1p, required for ER-Golgi transport and vacuole inheritance, with Trx2p, facilitates mitochondrial import of small Tims Tim9p, Tim10p, Tim13p by maintaining them in reduced form, abundance increases iunder DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog TRX2

name: NUXM
description: NUXM subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria

name: CIR1
description: Mitochondrial protein that interacts with frataxin (Yfh1p), putative ortholog of mammalian electron transfer flavoprotein complex subunit ETF-beta, may have a role in oxidative stress response, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells and in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: TDA10
description: ATP-binding protein of unknown function, crystal structure resembles that of E.coli pantothenate kinase and other small kinases, S. cerevisiae null mutant is sensitive to expression of the top1-T722A allele

name: PP7435_Chr4-0719
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: PP7435_Chr4-0720
description: Protein with low similarity to LSM domain-containing proteins

name: MDE1
description: 5'-methylthioribulose-1-phosphate dehydratase, acts in the methionine salvage pathway, potential Smt3p sumoylation substrate, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the expression downregulated by caspofungin and deletion mutant is caspofungin resistant

name: DNA2
description: Tripartite DNA replication factor, has single-stranded DNA-dependent ATPase, ATP-dependent nuclease, and helicase activities, tracking protein for flap cleavage during Okazaki fragment maturation, involved in DNA repair and processing of meiotic DNA double strand breaks, required for normal life span, component of telomeric chromatin, with cell-cycle dependent localization in S. cerevisiae, required for telomerase-dependent telomere synthesis, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: NOP58
description: Protein involved in pre-rRNA processing, 18S rRNA synthesis, and snoRNA synthesis, component of the small subunit processome complex, which is required for processing of pre-18S rRNA, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0724
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: STB6
description: Protein that binds Sin3p in a two-hybrid assay, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog STB2

name: FRS2
description: Alpha subunit of cytoplasmic phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase, forms a tetramer with Frs1p to form active enzyme, evolutionarily distant from mitochondrial phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase based on protein sequence, but substrate binding is similar, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0727
description: Protein with low similarity to ribosomal biogenesis protein GAR2 and RIM101

name: FCF2
description: Protein involved in the early steps of 35S rRNA processing, interacts with Faf1p, member of a transcriptionally co-regulated set of genes called the RRB regulon, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein, it is an essential gene in S. cerevisiae

name: PP7435_Chr4-0729
description: Protein with low similarity to MTH1, negative regulator of the glucose-sensing signal transduction pathway

name: CYB2
description: Cytochrome b2 (L-lactate cytochrome-c oxidoreductase), known in S. cerevisiae as component of the mitochondrial intermembrane space, required for lactate utilization, whose expression is repressed by glucose and anaerobic conditions

name: GAT2
description: Protein containing GATA family zinc finger motifs, similar to Gln3p and Dal80p, expression repressed in S. cerevisiae by leucine

name: MSP1
description: Highly-conserved N-terminally anchored AAA-ATPase, distributed in the mitochondrial outer membrane and peroxisomes, involved in mitochondrial protein sorting, functions as an extraction engine in local organelle surveillance to remove and initiate degradation of mistargeted proteins, ensuring fidelity of organelle-specific localization of tail-anchored proteins, contains an N-terminal transmembrane domain and C-terminal cytoplasmic ATPase domain

name: SGD1
description: Essential nuclear protein in S. cerevisiae, required for biogenesis of the small ribosomal subunit, has a possible role in the osmoregulatory glycerol response, putative homolog of human NOM1 which is implicated in acute myeloid leukemia

name: PP7435_Chr4-0734
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: RPL26B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L26B, binds to 5.8S rRNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L26 and bacterial L24, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL26A

name: PP7435_Chr4-0736
description: Protein with similarity to YLR345W, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells (Similar to 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase/fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase enzymes responsible for the metabolism of fructoso-2,6-bisphosphate, mRNA expression is repressed by the Rfx1p-Tup1p-Ssn6p repressor complex, in S. cerevisiae YLR345W is not an essential gene)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0737
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: CAX4
description: Dolichyl pyrophosphate (Dol-P-P) phosphatase with a luminally oriented active site in the ER, cleaves the anhydride linkage in Dol-P-P, required for Dol-P-P-linked oligosaccharide intermediate synthesis and protein N-glycosylation

name: KAP95
description: Karyopherin beta, forms a complex with Srp1p/Kap60p, interacts with nucleoporins to mediate nuclear import of NLS-containing cargo proteins via the nuclear pore complex, regulates PC biosynthesis, GDP-to-GTP exchange factor for Gsp1p, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: CIN4
description: GTP-binding protein involved in beta-tubulin (Tub2p) folding, isolated in S. cerevisiae as mutant with increased chromosome loss and sensitivity to benomyl, regulated by the GTPase-activating protein, Cin2p, the human retinitis pigmentosa 2 (RP2) homolog

name: GPI8
description: Membrane glycoprotein subunit of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol transamidase complex that adds glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchors to newly synthesized proteins, known in S. cerevisiae ER protein, human PIG-K protein is a functional homolog

name: KSP1
description: Serine/threonine protein kinase, associates with TORC1 and likely involved in TOR signaling cascades, negative regulator of autophagy, nuclear translocation required for haploid filamentous growth, regulates filamentous growth induced nuclear translocation of Bcy1p, Fus3p, and Sks1, overproduction in S. cerevisiae causes allele-specific suppression of prp20-10, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: OLE1-2
description: Delta(9) fatty acid desaturase, required for monounsaturated fatty acid synthesis and for normal distribution of mitochondria, previously known in Pichia pastoris also as Fad9

name: BRL1
description: Essential nuclear envelope integral membrane protein identified as a suppressor in S. cerevisiae of a conditional mutation in the major karyopherin, CRM1, homologous to and interacts with Brr6p, a nuclear envelope protein involved in nuclear export

name: IPI1
description: Component of the Rix1 complex and possibly pre-replicative complexes (pre-RCs), required for processing of ITS2 sequences from 35S pre-rRNA, component of the pre-60S ribosomal particle with the dynein-related AAA-type ATPase Mdn1p, required for pre-RC formation and maintenance during DNA replication licensing, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, essential gene

name: RQC1
description: Component of the ribosome quality control complex (RQC), RQC (Rqc1p-Rkr1p-Tae2p-Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p) is a ribosome-bound complex required for the degradation of polypeptides arising from stalled translation, required along with Rkr1p for recruitment of the Cdc48p-Npl4p-Ufd1p AAA ATPase complex to the RQC

name: BCD1
description: Essential protein in S. cerevisiae required for the accumulation of box C/D snoRNA

name: VMA10
description: Subunit G of the eight-subunit V1 peripheral membrane domain of the vacuolar H+-ATPase (V-ATPase), known in S. cerevisiae as vacuolar protein, an electrogenic proton pump found throughout the endomembrane system, involved in vacuolar acidification

name: MSC7
description: Protein of unknown function, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER and msc7 mutants are defective in directing meiotic recombination events to homologous chromatids

name: RRF1
description: Ribosome recycling factor, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as essential mitochondrial protein for mitochondrial protein synthesis and for the maintenance of the respiratory function of mitochondria

name: CZF1
description: Zinc cluster transcription factor similar to Candida albicans CZF1

name: SLY1
description: Hydrophilic protein involved in vesicle trafficking between the ER and Golgi, SM (Sec1/Munc-18) family protein that binds the tSNARE Sed5p and stimulates its assembly into a trans-SNARE membrane-protein complex, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: MSS116
description: Mitochondrial transcription elongation factor, DEAD-box protein, required for efficient splicing of mitochondrial Group I and II introns, non-polar RNA helicase that also facilities strand annealing, promotes RNA folding by stabilizing an early assembly intermediate, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: PCC1
description: Component of the EKC/KEOPS protein complex with Kae1p, Gon7p, Bud32p, and Cgi121p, EKC/KEOPS complex is required for t6A tRNA modification and may have roles in telomere maintenance and transcription

name: BAT1
description: Branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) aminotransferase, preferentially involved in BCAA biosynthesis, homolog of murine ECA39, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mtochondrial protein highly expressed during logarithmic phase and repressed during stationary phase, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog BAT2

name: FAU1
description: 5,10-methenyltetrahydrofolate synthetase, involved in folic acid biosynthesis

name: FMP10
description: Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the authentic non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies

name: RPS4B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S4, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS4A

name: PP7435_Chr4-0760
description: Protein with similarity to YHR202W (Putative protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green the fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the vacuole, while HA-tagged protein is found in the soluble fraction, suggesting cytoplasmic localization in S. cerevisiae)

name: NUJM
description: NUJM (B14.7) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells

name: CSM3
description: Replication fork associated factor, required for stable replication fork pausing, component of the DNA replication checkpoint pathway, required for accurate chromosome segregation during meiosis, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress

name: TPA1
description: Fe(II)/2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase family member, catalyzes the repair of methyl-base lesions in both ss and dsDNA by oxidative demethylation, Poly(rA)-binding protein involved in mRNA poly(A) tail length and mRNA stability, role in translation termination efficiency, interacts with Sup45p (eRF1), Sup35p (eRF3) and Pab1p, similar to human prolyl 4-hydroxylase OGFOD1, binds Fe(II) and 2-oxoglutarate

name: CAJ1
description: Type II J heat shock protein of the E. coli dnaJ family, contains a leucine zipper-like motif, binds to non-native substrates for presentation to Ssa3p, may function during protein translocation, assembly and disassembly, enriched in plasma membrane, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein

name: SAP1
description: Putative ATPase of the AAA family, interacts with the Sin1p transcriptional repressor in the two-hybrid system

name: FRE3
description: Ferric reductase, reduces siderophore-bound iron prior to upTake by transporters, enriched among several compartments, expression in S. cerevisiae induced by low iron levels

name: RET1
description: Second-largest subunit of RNA polymerase III, which is responsible for the transcription of tRNA and 5S RNA genes, and other low molecular weight RNAs, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: TFB2
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes, involved in transcription initiation, required for nucleotide excision repair, similar to 52 kDa subunit of human TFIIH

name: MIS1-3
description: C1-tetrahydrofolate synthase, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in methanol-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, involved in interconversion between different oxidation states of tetrahydrofolate (THF), provides activities of formyl-THF synthetase, methenyl-THF cyclohydrolase, and methylene-THF dehydrogenase

name: MIS1-2
description: C1-tetrahydrofolate synthase, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein, involved in interconversion between different oxidation states of tetrahydrofolate (THF), provides activities of formyl-THF synthetase, methenyl-THF cyclohydrolase, and methylene-THF dehydrogenase

name: PP7435_Chr4-0772
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: DEP domain (important for membrane association of the signaling proteins in which it is present))

name: QNS1
description: Glutamine-dependent NAD(+) synthetase, enriched in cytosol, essential in S. cerevisiae for the formation of NAD(+) from nicotinic acid adenine dinucleotide

name: PPE1
description: Protein with carboxyl methyl esterase activity that may have a role in demethylation of the phosphoprotein phosphatase catalytic subunit, also identified as a small subunit mitochondrial ribosomal protein

name: HCA4
description: DEAD box RNA helicase, enriched in cytosol, in S. cerevisiae high-copy number suppression of a U14 snoRNA processing mutant suggests an involvement in 18S rRNA synthesis

name: PML1
description: Subunit of the RES complex, which is required for nuclear retention of unspliced pre-mRNAs, acts in the same pathway as Pml39p and Mlp1p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0777
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: TRF5
description: Non-canonical poly(A) polymerase, involved in nuclear RNA degradation as a component of the TRAMP complex, catalyzes polyadenylation of hypomodified tRNAs, and snoRNA and rRNA precursors, overlapping but non-redundant functions with Pap2p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PAP2

name: SCO1
description: Copper-binding protein of mitochondrial inner membrane, required for cytochrome c oxidase activity and respiration, may function to deliver copper to cytochrome c oxidase, similar to thioredoxins, enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog SCO2

name: OLA1
description: P-loop ATPase with similarity to human OLA1 and bacterial YchF, identified as specifically interacting with the proteasome, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to hydrogen peroxide and to DNA replication stress

name: CUS2
description: Putative checkpoint factor in transcription, binds to U2 snRNA and Prp11p, regulates toggling of the U2 snRNA stem II region between different structures, contains two RNA recognition motifs (RRMs)

name: SEC21
description: Gamma subunit of coatomer, a heptameric protein complex that together with Arf1p forms the COPI coat, involved in ER to Golgi transport of selective cargo, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: CAF40
description: Component of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional complex, evolutionarily conserved, involved in controlling mRNA initiation, elongation, and degradation, binds Cdc39p

name: MCM2
description: Protein involved in DNA replication, component of the Mcm2-7 hexameric complex that binds chromatin as a part of the pre-replicative complex, relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress

name: RHO2
description: Small GTPase of the Rho/Rac family of Ras-like proteins, enriched in microsome, non-essential in S. cerevisiae, involved in the establishment of cell polarity and in microtubule assembly

name: NST1
description: Protein of unknown function, mediates sensitivity to salt stress, interacts in S. cerevisiae physically with the splicing factor Msl1p and also displays genetic interaction with MSL1

name: YVC1
description: Vacuolar cation channel, enriched in Golgi, vacuole and mitochondria, mediates in S. cerevisiae the release of Ca(2+) from the vacuole in response to hyperosmotic shock

name: PP7435_Chr4-0789
description: Protein with similarity to YNL092W (S-adenosylmethionine-dependent protein methyltransferase, capable of automethylation, member of the seven beta-strand family, in S. cerevisiae YNL092W is not an essential gene)

name: VPS21
description: Rab family GTPase, required for endocytic transport and sorting of vacuolar hydrolases, enriched among several compartments, known in S. cerevisiae as endosomal protein required for endosomal localization of the CORVET complex, required with YPT52 for MVB biogenesis and sorting, involved in autophagy and ionic stress tolerance, geranylgeranylation required for membrane association, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, mammalian Rab5 homolog, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YPT53

name: PTC5
description: Type 2C protein phosphatase (PP2C) involved in regulation of pyruvate dehydrogenase activity by dephosphorylating the serine 133 of the Pda1p subunit, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein of intermembrane space, imported via the presequence pathway and processed by the inner membrane protease (Imp1p-Imp2p), acts in concert with kinases Pkp1p and Pkp2p and phosphatase Ptc6p

name: TMA46
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with translating ribosomes, interacts with GTPase Rbg1p, enriched among several compartments

name: APP1
description: Phosphatidate phosphatase, converts phosphatidate to diacylglycerol, App1p, Pah1p, Dpp1p, and Lpp1p are responsible for all the phosphatidate phosphatase activity, component of cortical actin patches, interacts with components of endocytic pathway

name: ECM3
description: Non-essential protein of unknown function, involved in signal transduction and the genotoxic response, induced rapidly in response to treatment with 8-methoxypsoralen and UVA irradiation, known in S. cerevisiae as ER protein that relocalizes from ER to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog YNL095C

name: BZZ1
description: SH3 domain protein implicated in the regulation of actin polymerization, able to recruit actin polymerization machinery through its SH3 domains, enriched in microsome, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the cortical actin patches which colocalizes with Las17p, interacts with type I myosins

name: ARF3
description: Glucose-repressible ADP-ribosylation factor, GTPase of the Ras superfamily involved in development of polarity, also has mRNA binding activity

name: RPS7B
description: Protein component of the small (40S) ribosomal subunit, interacts with Kti11p, deletion in S. cerevisiae causes hypersensitivity to zymocin and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein S7, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPS8A

name: RPL16A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L16A, N-terminally acetylated, binds 5.8 S rRNA, transcriptionally regulated by Rap1p, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L13A and bacterial L13, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL16B

name: PP7435_Chr4-0801
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Reca_like, bacterial enzyme which has roles in homologous recombination)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0802
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Ubiquitin-like)

name: FKH2
description: Forkhead family transcription factor, plays a major role in the expression of G2/M phase genes, positively regulates transcriptional elongation, negative role in chromatin silencing at HML and HMR, substrate of the Cdc28p/Clb5p kinase, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog FKH1

name: TFB3
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes, involved in transcription initiation, required for nucleotide excision repair, ring finger protein similar to mammalian CAK and TFIIH subunit

name: PpTRM1
description: Zn(II)2Cys6-type transcription factor, essential for the transcriptional activation of genes of methanol utilization pathway in Pichia pastoris, not related to S. cerevisiae TRM1, enriched in plasma membrane

name: AZF1
description: Zinc-finger transcription factor, in the presence of glucose, activates transcription of genes involved in growth and carbon metabolism, in nonfermentable carbon sources, activates transcription of genes involved in maintenance of cell wall integrity, in S. cerevisiae relocalizes  to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: RPC19
description: RNA polymerase subunit AC19, common to RNA polymerases I and III

name: DBP2
description: ATP-dependent RNA helicase of the DEAD-box protein family, has a strong preference for dsRNA, interacts with YRA1, required for the assembly of Yra1p, Nab2p and Mex67p onto mRNA and formation of nuclear mRNP, involved in mRNA decay and rRNA processing, may be involved in suppression of transcription from cryptic initiation sites, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: CEX1
description: Component of nuclear aminoacylation-dependent tRNA export pathway, cytoplasmic, interacts with nuclear pore component Nup116p, copurifies with tRNA export receptors Los1p and Msn5p, as well as eIF-1a, required for activation of RAN GTPase Gsp1p and dissociation of receptor-tRNA-Gsp1p export complex, recruits Rna1p from cytoplasm to NPC, facilitates Rna1p activation of Gsp1p GTPase activity by enabling Rna1p to gain access to Gsp1p-GTP bound to export receptor tRNA complex

name: ERG2
description: C-8 sterol isomerase, catalyzes the isomerization of the delta-8 double bond to the delta-7 position at an intermediate step in ergosterol biosynthesis, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: RNR2
description: Ribonucleotide-diphosphate reductase (RNR), small subunit, the RNR complex catalyzes the rate-limiting step in dNTP synthesis and is regulated by DNA replication and DNA damage checkpoint pathways via localization of the small subunits, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in methanol-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RNR4

name: MET7
description: Folylpolyglutamate synthetase, catalyzes extension of the glutamate chains of the folate coenzymes, required for methionine synthesis and for maintenance of mitochondrial DNA, enriched in cytosol, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: AIM7
description: Protein that interacts with Arp2/3 complex to stimulate actin filament debranching and inhibit actin nucleation, has similarity to Cof1p and also to human glia maturation factor (GMF), S. cerevisiae null mutant displays elevated mitochondrial genome loss

name: RIO2
description: Essential serine kinase in S. cerevisiae involved in the processing of the 20S pre-rRNA into mature 18S rRNA, has similarity to Rio1p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0815
description: 8S ribosomal RNA

name: DCP2
description: Catalytic subunit of the Dcp1p-Dcp2p decapping enzyme complex, removes the 5' cap structure from mRNAs prior to their degradation, nudix hydrolase family member, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol

name: PP7435_Chr4-0817
description: Protein with low similarity to possible thiamine biosynthesis enzyme of Candida albicans, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: FMO1-5
description: Flavin-containing monooxygenase, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae to localize to the cytoplasmic face of the ER membrane, catalyzes oxidation of biological thiols to maintain the ER redox buffer ratio for correct folding of disulfide-bonded proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0819
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: MLS1
description: Malate synthase, enzyme of the glyoxylate cycle, involved in utilization of non-fermentable carbon sources, in S. cerevisiae expression is subject to carbon catabolite repression and localizes in peroxisomes during growth on oleic acid, otherwise cytosolic, can accept butyryl-CoA as acyl-CoA donor in addition to traditional substrate acetyl-CoA

name: PP7435_Chr4-0821
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: RAD4 domains and SID (Septation initiation and the subsequent termination of mitosis))

name: CLG1
description: Cyclin-like protein that interacts with Pho85p, has sequence similarity to G1 cyclins PCL1 and PCL2

name: YOR1-2
description: ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, multidrug transporter mediates export of many different organic anions including oligomycin, known in S. cerevisiae as plasma membrane protein similar to human cystic fibrosis transmembrane receptor (CFTR)

name: YOR1-1
description: Plasma membrane ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter, multidrug transporter mediates export of many different organic anions including oligomycin, similar to human cystic fibrosis transmembrane receptor (CFTR), enriched in microsome and mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: NSR1
description: Protein that binds nuclear localization sequences, required for pre-rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein

name: RIM8
description: Protein involved in proteolytic activation of Rim101p in response to alkaline pH, interacts with ESCRT-1 subunits Stp22p and Vps28p, essential in S. cerevisiae for anaerobic growth, member of the arrestin-related trafficking adaptor family

name: PP7435_Chr4-0827
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved

name: GVP36
description: BAR domain-containing protein, enriched in cytosol, known in S. cerevisiae as early and late Golgi protein, required for adaptation to varying nutrient concentrations, fluid-phase endocytosis, polarization of the actin cytoskeleton, and vacuole biogenesis

name: CTR1
description: High-affinity copper transporter of the plasma membrane, mediates nearly all copper upTake under low copper conditions, transcriptionally induced at low copper levels and degraded at high copper levels, enriched in plasma membrane and among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae the protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from nucleus to plasma membrane upon DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0830
description: Protein with low similarity to RXT3, component of the Rpd3L histone deacetylase complex

name: RPL31B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L31B, associates with karyopherin Sxm1p, loss of both Rpl31p and Rpl39p confers lethality, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L31, no bacterial homolog, enriched in plasma membrane and cytosol in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RPL31A

name: DUS4
description: Dihydrouridine synthase, member of a widespread family of conserved proteins including Smm1p, Dus1p, and Dus3p

name: DUS3
description: Dihydrouridine synthase, member of a widespread family of conserved proteins including Smm1p, Dus1p, and Dus4p, contains a consensus oleate response element (ORE) in its promoter region, forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-0834
description: Protein with similarity to YNL095C (Putative protein of unknown function, predicted to contain a transmembrane domain, in S. cerevisiae YNL095C is not an essential gene, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog ECM3)

name: IAH1
description: Isoamyl acetate-hydrolyzing esterase, required in balance with alcohol acetyltransferase to maintain optimal amounts of isoamyl acetate, which is particularly important in sake brewing

name: PP7435_Chr4-0836
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: HMG (high mobility group) box)

name: IRC21
description: Protein of unknown function, may be involved in resistance to carboplatin and cisplatin, S. cerevisiae null mutant displays increase in spontaneous Rad52p foci, contains a lipid-binding domain and binds cardiolipin in a large-scale study

name: UBP16
description: Deubiquitinating enzyme anchored to the outer mitochondrial membrane, probably not important for general mitochondrial functioning, but may perform a more specialized function at mitochondria

name: DUR1,2
description: Urea amidolyase, contains both urea carboxylase and allophanate hydrolase activities, degrades urea to CO2 and NH3, expression sensitive to nitrogen catabolite repression and induced by allophanate, an intermediate in allantoin degradation, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-0840
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:RING)

name: BRE1
description: E3 ubiquitin ligase, forms heterodimer with Rad6p to monoubiquinate histone H2B-K123, which is required for the subsequent methylation of histone H3-K4 and H3-K79, required for DSBR, transcription, silencing, and checkpoint control

name: PP7435_Chr4-0842
description: Hypothetical protein conserved (domain: DUF1765)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0843
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Putative adipose-regulatory protein Seipin)

name: SFP1
description: Regulates transcription of ribosomal protein and biogenesis genes, regulates response to nutrients and stress, G2/M transitions during mitotic cell cycle and DNA-damage response, and modulates cell size, regulated by TORC1 and Mrs6p, sequence of zinc finger, ChIP localization data, and protein-binding microarray (PBM) data, and computational analyses suggest it binds DNA directly at highly active RP genes and indirectly through Rap1p at others, can form the [ISP+] prion

name: SDD2
description: Protein with homology to human PDCD5, PDCD5 is involved in programmed cell death, N-terminal region forms a conserved triple-helix bundle structure, in S. cerevisiae overproduction suppresses lethality due to expression of the dominant PET9 allele AAC2-A128P, overexpression promotes H2O2-induced apoptosis YMR074C is not an essential gene and protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: LRG1
description: GTPase-activating protein (GAP), contains Rho1p-specific GAP activity, interacting with activated forms of Rho1p, functions along with Sac7p as a negative regulator of the Pkc1p-mediated cell wall integrity signaling pathway, negative regulator of cell wall 1,3-beta-glucan biosynthesis, required for efficient cell fusion, contains a RhoGAP domain and three Lin-11-Isl1-Mec-3 (LIM) domains

name: PP7435_Chr4-0848
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: ATG26
description: UDP-glucose:sterol glucosyltransferase, conserved enzyme involved in synthesis of sterol glucoside membrane lipids, in contrast to ATG26 from S.cerevisiae, Pichia pastoris ATG26 is involved in autophagy, previously known in Pichia pastoris as UGT51

name: USV1
description: Putative transcription factor containing a C2H2 zinc finger, mutation in S. cerevisiae affects transcriptional regulation of genes involved in growth on non-fermentable carbon sources, response to salt stress and cell wall biosynthesis, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog RGM1

name: NUP157
description: Subunit of the inner ring of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), contributes to NPC assembly and tethering of DNA to the nuclear periphery, both Nup170p and NUP157p are similar to human Nup155p, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog NUP170

name: GEF1-2
description: Voltage-gated chloride channel, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells, localized in S. cerevisiae to Golgi, endosomal system and plasma membrane, and involved in cation homeostasis, highly homologous to vertebrate voltage-gated chloride channels, modulates TBSV model (+) RNA virus replication by regulating copper metabolism

name: PP7435_Chr4-0854
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: FAR1 DNA-binding domain)

name: PP7435_Chr4-0855
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: KIP1
description: Kinesin-related motor protein required for mitotic spindle assembly, chromosome segregation, and 2 micron plasmid partitioning, functionally redundant with Cin8p for chromosomal but not plasmid functions

name: NPR2
description: Subunit of SEA (Seh1-associated), Npr2/3, and Iml1p complexes, Npr2/3 complex mediates downregulation of TORC1 activity upon amino acid limitation, SEA complex is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole, Iml1p complex (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) is required for non-nitrogen-starvation (NNS)-induced autophagy, Iml1p interacts primarily with phosphorylated Npr2p, homolog of human NPRL2, target of Grr1p, required for growth on urea and proline

name: HRD1-1
description: Ubiquitin-protein ligase, required for ER-associated degradation (ERAD) of misfolded proteins, genetically linked to the unfolded protein response (UPR), regulated through association with Hrd3p, contains an H2 ring finger, likely plays a general role in targeting proteins that persistently associate with and potentially obstruct the ER-localized translocon

name: PP7435_Chr4-0860
description: Protein with low similarity to OPA3 like proteins

name: PP7435_Chr4-0861
description: Protein with low similarity to RRN11, component of the core factor (CF) rDNA transcription factor complex

name: PLB3
description: Phospholipase B (lysophospholipase) involved in lipid metabolism, hydrolyzes phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylserine and displays transacylase activity in vitro, enriched in plasma membrane, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog PLB1

name: AOX2
description: Alcohol oxidase of Pichia pastoris, expressed at much lower level than alcohol oxidase AOX1, enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: FLO400
description: Putative lectin-like protein, contains flocculin type 3 repeat

name: HOM3
description: Aspartate kinase (L-aspartate 4-P-transferase), cytoplasmic enzyme that catalyzes the first step in the common pathway for methionine and threonine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, expression in S. cerevisiae regulated by Gcn4p and the general control of amino acid synthesis

name: CBR1
description: Cytochrome b reductase, enriched in microsome and Golgi, and additionally enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells, and but also in S. cerevisiae not essential for viability and also detected in mitochondria, mutation in conserved NADH binding domain of the human ortholog results in type I methemoglobinemia

name: TUB4
description: Gamma-tubulin, involved in nucleating microtubules from both the cytoplasmic and nuclear faces of the spindle pole body, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: ARO9
description: Aromatic aminotransferase II, catalyzes the first step of tryptophan, phenylalanine, and tyrosine catabolism, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells

name: CSD100
description: Putative cysteine desulfurase

name: PP7435_Chr4-0871
description: Hypothetical protein conserved

name: SWR1
description: Swi2/Snf2-related ATPase that is the structural component of the SWR1 complex, which exchanges histone variant H2AZ (Htz1p) for chromatin-bound histone H2A, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: NIAM
description: NIAM (ASHI) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris, enriched in mitochondria and among several compartments

name: NAM8
description: RNA binding protein, component of the U1 snRNP protein, S. cerevisiae mutants are defective in meiotic recombination and in formation of viable spores, involved in the formation of DSBs through meiosis-specific splicing of REC107 pre-mRNA, Nam8p regulon embraces the meiotic pre-mRNAs of REC107, HFM1, AMA1 SPO22 and PCH2, the putative RNA binding domains RRM2 and RRM3 are required for Nam8p meiotic function

name: DED1
description: ATP-dependent DEAD (Asp-Glu-Ala-Asp)-box RNA helicase, required for translation initiation of all yeast mRNAs, mutations in human DEAD-box DBY are a frequent cause of male infertility, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog DBP1

name: RPL3
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L3, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L3 and bacterial L3, involved in the replication and maintenance of killer double stranded RNA virus, enriched among several compartments

name: CPA1
description: Small subunit of carbamoyl phosphate synthetase, which catalyzes a step in the synthesis of citrulline, an arginine precursor, translationally regulated by an attenuator peptide encoded by YOR302W within the CPA1 mRNA 5'-leader, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: PBY1
description: Putative tubulin tyrosine ligase associated with P-bodies, forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress, enriched in cytosol

name: RXT2
description: Component of the histone deacetylase Rpd3L complex, possibly involved in cell fusion and invasive growth, known in S. cerevisiae to relocalize to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

name: ACF2-1
description: Intracellular beta-1,3-endoglucanase, expression is induced during sporulation, may have a role in cortical actin cytoskeleton assembly, protein abundance in S. cerevisiae increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: SEC1
description: Sm-like protein involved in docking and fusion of exocytic vesicles, binds to assembled SNARE complexes at the membrane and stimulates membrane fusion, localization in S. cerevisiae to sites of secretion (bud neck and bud tip) is dependent on SNARE function

name: PP7435_Chr4-0882
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: DPH6
description: Diphthamide synthetase, catalyzes the last amidation step of diphthamide biosynthesis using ammonium and ATP, evolutionarily conserved in eukaryotes, S. cerevisiae dph6 mutants exhibit diphthine accumulation and resistance to sordarin, which is indicative of defects in diphthamide formation on EF2, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-tagged protein localizes to the cytoplasm, DPH6/YLR143W is not an essential gene

name: RPL6B
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L6B, binds 5.8S rRNA, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L6, no bacterial homolog, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPL6A

name: PP7435_Chr4-0885
description: Protein with similarity to YDR132C (Protein of unknown function, protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog YLR108C)

name: DAM1
description: Essential subunit in S. cerevisiae of the Dam1 complex (aka DASH complex), couples kinetochores to the force produced by MT depolymerization thereby aiding in chromosome segregation, Ipl1p target for regulating kinetochore-MT attachments

name: ISW2
description: ATP-dependent DNA translocase involved in chromatin remodeling, ATPase component that, with Itc1p, forms a complex required for repression of a-specific genes, INO1, and early meiotic genes during mitotic growth, the Isw2 complex exhibits basal levels of chromatin binding throughout the genome as well as target-specific chromatin interactions

name: RNT1
description: DsRNA-specific ribonuclease (RNase III), known in S. cerevisiae as nuclear protein involved in rDNA transcription, rRNA processing and U2 snRNA 3' end formation by cleavage of a stem-loop structure at the 3' end of U2 snRNA, involved in polyadenylation-independent transcription termination, involved in the cell wall stress response, regulating the degradation of cell wall integrity and morphogenesis checkpoint genes

name: SNU66
description: Component of the U4/U6.U5 snRNP complex involved in pre-mRNA splicing via spliceosome, also required for pre-5S rRNA processing and may act in concert with Rnh70p, has homology to human SART-1

name: REV7
description: Accessory subunit of DNA polymerase zeta, involved in translesion synthesis during post-replication repair, required for mutagenesis induced by DNA damage, involved in double-strand break repair

name: PMS1
description: ATP-binding protein required for mismatch repair in mitosis and meiosis, functions as a heterodimer with Mlh1p, binds double- and single-stranded DNA via its N-terminal domain, similar to E. coli MutL

name: STE2
description: Receptor for alpha-factor pheromone, seven transmembrane-domain GPCR that interacts with both pheromone and a heterotrimeric G protein to initiate the signaling response that leads to mating between haploid a and alpha cells

name: SAL1
description: ADP/ATP transporter, known in S. cerevisiae as member of the Ca2+-binding subfamily of mitochondrial carriers, with two EF-hand motifs, transport activity of either Sal1p or Pet9p is critical for viability, polymorphic in different S. cerevisiae strains

name: CCT2
description: Subunit beta of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex, related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: NUGM
description: NUGM (30 kDa) subunit of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase (complex I) of Pichia pastoris

name: END3
description: EH domain-containing protein involved in endocytosis, actin cytoskeletal organization and cell wall morphogenesis, forms a complex with Sla1p and Pan1p, enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells

name: TAO3
description: Component of the RAM signaling network that is involved in regulation of Ace2p activity and cellular morphogenesis, interacts with protein kinase Cbk1p and also with Kic1p

name: MET18
description: Component of cytosolic iron-sulfur protein assembly (CIA) machinery, acts at a late step of Fe-S cluster assembly, forms the CIA targeting complex with Cia1p and Cia2p that directs Fe-S cluster incorporation into a subset of proteins involved in methionine biosynthesis, DNA replication and repair, transcription, and telomere maintenance, ortholog of human MMS19, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: RRT14
description: Putative protein of unknown function, identified in S. cerevisiae in a screen for mutants with decreased levels of rDNA transcription, the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the nucleolus, predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis

name: EOS1
description: Protein involved in N-glycosylation, in S. cerevisiae deletion mutation confers sensitivity to exidative stress and shows synthetic lethality with mutations in the spindle checkpoint genes BUB3 and MAD1, YNL080C is not an essential gene

name: TPM2
description: Minor isoform of tropomyosin, binds to and stabilizes actin cables and filaments, which direct polarized cell growth and the distribution of several organelles, appears to have distinct and also overlapping functions with Tpm1p, enriched in cytosol, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog TPM1

name: PP7435_Chr4-0903
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain:RNA recognition motif (RRM) superfamily)

name: TMA108
description: Ribosome-associated, nascent chain binding factor, binds N-terminal region of nascent peptides during translation, recognizes target proteins via its putative metallopeptidase peptide-binding pocket, enriched among several compartments

name: GLY1
description: Threonine aldolase, catalyzes the cleavage of L-allo-threonine and L-threonine to glycine, involved in glycine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol, and additionally enriched in Golgi in glucose-grown cells

name: MUP3-2
description: Low affinity methionine permease, similar to Mup1p

name: SMC2
description: Subunit of the condensin complex, essential SMC chromosomal ATPase family member in S. cerevisiae that forms a complex with Smc4p to form the active ATPase, Smc2p/Smc4p complex binds DNA, required for clustering of tRNA genes at the nucleolus

name: PP7435_Chr4-0908
description: Protein with low similarity to Hap43p-induced proteins

name: RPL2A
description: Ribosomal 60S subunit protein L2A, homologous to mammalian ribosomal protein L2 and bacterial L2, enriched among several compartments, Pichia pastoris has also the paralog RPL2B

name: PP7435_Chr4-0910
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: NOG1
description: Putative GTPase that associates with free 60S ribosomal subunits in the nucleolus and is required for 60S ribosomal subunit biogenesis, constituent of 66S pre-ribosomal particles, member of the ODN family of nucleolar G-proteins, enriched among several compartments

name: LEE1
description: Zinc-finger protein of unknown function

name: MNN9
description: Subunit of Golgi mannosyltransferase complex also containing Anp1p, Mnn10p, Mnn11p, and Hoc1p that mediates elongation of the polysaccharide mannan backbone, forms a separate complex with Van1p that is also involved in backbone elongation, enriched in Golgi, and additionally enriched in microsome in glucose-grown cells

name: TEF4
description: Gamma subunit of translational elongation factor eEF1B, stimulates the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA (AA-tRNA) to ribosomes by releasing eEF1A (Tef1p/Tef2p) from the ribosomal complex, enriched in cytosol

name: MSD1
description: Aspartyl-tRNA synthetase, known in S. cerevisiae as mitochondrial protein required for acylation of aspartyl-tRNA, yeast and bacterial aspartyl-, asparaginyl-, and lysyl-tRNA synthetases contain regions with high sequence similarity, suggesting a common ancestral gene

name: EPL1
description: Subunit of NuA4, an essential histone H4/H2A acetyltransferase complex in S. cerevisiae, conserved region at N-terminus is essential in S. cerevisiae for interaction with the NPC (nucleosome core particle), required for autophagy, homologous to Drosophila Enhancer of Polycomb

name: PP7435_Chr4-0917
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: Topoisomerase II-associated protein PAT1)

name: ELP3
description: Subunit of Elongator complex, which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA, exhibits histone acetyltransferase activity that is directed to histones H3 and H4, disruption confers resistance to Kluyveromyces lactis zymotoxin, enriched in cytosol in glucose-grown cells

name: SEC16
description: COPII vesicle coat protein required for ER transport vesicle budding, essential factor in S. cerevisiae in ER exit site (ERES) formation, as well as in COPII-mediated ER-to-Golgi traffic, known in S. cerevisiae as protein bound to periphery of ER membranes and may act to stabilize initial COPII complexes, interacts with Sec23p, Sec24p and Sec31p

name: PP7435_Chr4-0920
description: Hypothetical protein not well conserved (domain: WD40 repeat-like)

name: PRP21
description: Subunit of the SF3a splicing factor complex, required for spliceosome assembly

name: RPS6A

description: Component of the sorting and assembly machinery (SAM) complex, the SAM (or TOB) complex is known in S. cerevisiae to be localized at the mitochondrial outer membrane, the complex binds precursors of beta-barrel proteins and facilitates their insertion into the outer membrane

name: SVP26
description: Integral membrane protein known in S. cerevisiae as protein of the early Golgi and ER, involved in COP II vesicle transport, may also function to promote retention of proteins in the early Golgi compartment

name: ILV2
description: Acetolactate synthase of the mitochondria, catalyses the first common step in isoleucine and valine biosynthesis and is the target of several classes of inhibitors, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in plasma membrane in glucose-grown cells, expression in S. cerevisiae is under general amino acid control

name: NOC2
description: Protein that forms a nucleolar complex with Mak21p that binds to 90S and 66S pre-ribosomes, as well as a nuclear complex with Noc3p that binds to 66S pre-ribosomes, both complexes mediate intranuclear transport of ribosomal precursors

name: RKI1-1
description: Ribose-5-phosphate ketol-isomerase, catalyzes the interconversion of ribose 5-phosphate and ribulose 5-phosphate in the pentose phosphate pathway, participates in pyridoxine biosynthesis

name: RKI1-2
description: Ribose-5-phosphate ketol-isomerase, catalyzes the interconversion of ribose 5-phosphate and ribulose 5-phosphate in the pentose phosphate pathway, participates in pyridoxine biosynthesis, enriched in cytosol in methanol-grown cells

name: PP7435_Chr4-1818
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved (domain: Adenylation_DNA_ligase sup)

name: PET9
description: Major ADP/ATP carrier of the mitochondrial inner membrane, exchanges cytosolic ADP for mitochondrially synthesized ATP, also imports heme and ATP, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria, and additionally enriched in vacuole in glucose-grown cells, required for viability in many S. cerevisiae lab strains that carry a sal1 mutation, Pichia pastoris does not have the paralog AAC3

name: YPT6
description: Rab family GTPase, Ras-like GTP binding protein involved in the secretory pathway, required for fusion of endosome-derived vesicles with the late Golgi, maturation of the vacuolar carboxypeptidase Y, has similarity to the human GTPase, Rab6, enriched among several compartments

name: TMA7
description: Protein of unknown function that associates with ribosomes, enriched among several compartments, in S. cerevisiae null mutant exhibits translation defects, altered polyribosome profiles, and resistance to the translation inhibitor anisomcyin, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: HSP60
description: Tetradecameric mitochondrial chaperonin required for ATP-dependent folding of precursor polypeptides and complex assembly, prevents aggregation and mediates protein refolding after heat shock, role in mtDNA transmission, phosphorylated, enriched in mitochondria in glucose-grown cells

name: HTZ1
description: Histone variant H2AZ, exchanged for histone H2A in nucleosomes by the SWR1 complex, involved in transcriptional regulation through prevention of the spread of silent heterochromatin, enriched among several compartments

name: PP7435_Chr4-1884
description: Hypothetical protein not conserved

name: ISD11
description: Cysteine desulfurase (Nfs1p) activator, in S. cerevisiae essential for the formation of the persulfide intermediate at the desulfurase active site during pyridoxal phosphate-dependent desulfuration of cysteine, required for mitochondrial iron-sulfur cluster biosynthesis, exclusive to eukaryotes, implicated as eukaryotic supplement to the bacterium-derived Fe-S cluster (ISC) assembly apparatus, involved in regulation of iron metabolism, member of the LYR protein family

name: PP7435_Chr4-1950
description: Protein with low similarity to tRNA pseudouridine synthase B

name: PEP8
description: Vacuolar protein component of the retromer, forms part of the multimeric membrane-associated retromer complex involved in vacuolar protein sorting along with Vps35p, Vps29p, Vps17p, and Vps5p, enriched in vacuole in methanol-grown cells, essential in S. cerevisiae for endosome-to-Golgi retrograde protein transport, interacts with Ypt7p, protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

name: PP7435_Chr4-1972
description: Protein with similarity to YBR287W (Protein of unknown function, in S. cerevisiae the green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the ER and YBR287W is not an essential gene)

name: APE4
description: Cytoplasmic aspartyl aminopeptidase that may also function in the vacuole, CVT pathway cargo protein, cleaves unblocked N-terminal acidic amino acids from peptide substrates, forms a 12-subunit homo-oligomer, M18 metalloprotease family, enriched in cytosol

name: RCK2
